Title: Sales Director, Fruits and Vegetables
Description: Who we are:     Wikifarmer is a global platform with the mission of empowering farmers by educating them and offering them access to the open market to sell their products at fair prices.     The Problem We Are Solving:     Most farmers in the world still cultivate their fields with techniques learned from experience or taught by their ancestors, leading to non-optimum practices in terms of yield and regard to the environmental impact. Farmers produce the most valuable part of the food supply chain, but they are the ones getting the least value out of it.     How we are fixing this:     Wikifarmer is building both an educational platform and a digital Marketplace. On one side of our Platform, producers can tap into and update their agricultural knowledge and practices and on the other side they can upload their products for free, gaining immediate and direct access to domestic and international markets.     What we are looking for:     Having recently secured a new round of funding from Point Nine (Revolut, Delivery Hero, Typeform) we are starting to build our core team - central to those hires will be a Sales Director for our Marketplace, managing B2B sales of Fruit and Vegetables to Food Production Units and Wholesalers. This senior hire will form part of our leadership team reporting directly to our CEO and have people managing responsibilities.     Job Duties and Responsibilities:     Sell the platform's food and agricultural products to customers in the food sector (Food Processing Units, Food Wholesalers, Major Retailers) Developing new business opportunities both in your local region (Spain or Italy) and further afield in Europe and globally Manage your own local P&L, trying to maximise profitability, growth and target achievement Acquire new accounts, by sourcing new products on demand Develop strong relationships with customers (owners, supply and purchasing directors) in order to upsell and cross sell Build partnerships with agricultural co-operatives and independent producers, contributing to the supply side strategy of the company Utilise our CRM (Hubspot) to effectively manage and activate incoming leads Grow the market for Wikifarmer to a stage where a local sales and business development team will be built and managed Travel up to 25% of the time.     Key requirements:     You have a significant amount of sales experience and a successful commercial track record within the Food Wholesale or Export industry, specifically selling Fruit and Vegetables You have a strong network of decision-making Food and Beverage Buyers You have financial and business acumen, being very literate in calculating margins and profitability You have impactful communication and presentation skills You are comfortable in negotiating with a long term relationship mindset You're an entrepreneur at heart and you're not afraid to build everything from scratch Excellent knowledge of the Spanish or Italian and English language You need to be based in Spain or Italy     What we can offer you:     Fixed salary plus commission (€100k - €120k depending on location and experience) Car Allowance Equity in the business Private Medical Insurance L&D budget We are an early startup which is going places and you can make an immediate impact Transparency and Collaboration please submit your CV in English

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description: Hi, we're Fever     We're excited you are checking out this job offer.     We are the leading global live-entertainment discovery tech platform with a clear mission: to democratize access to culture and entertainment.     How do we achieve our mission? Fever has developed a proprietary technology that inspires a global community of over 125M people through personalized and curated experiences in their local city whilst empowering entertainment and event creators to reach new audiences and enhance their experience.     Sounds amazing, right?     Behind the user-friendly iOS and Android apps and webpage that work across the world is the engineering team. We are in charge of creating, developing, improving, and maintaining all Fever services so that more people can have an amazing experience.     About The Role     Sitting at the intersection of business and engineering, Data Scientists work in several different capacities to improve the overall decision making capabilities at the company and connect people to the best and most relevant experiences. Some examples include working hand-on-hand with business teams to answer critical questions or contributing to core personalization technologies for our product and communications. Data Scientists contribute to the full life-cycle of a project, from ideation to production. You will understand complex business problems, build and validate hypotheses, devise analytical and computational solutions, build the technology required for those solutions, identify valuable internal and external data sources, … Data Scientists also form a tight-knit group constantly looking to upskill and learn from each other, share best practices and learnt lessons and generally foster a culture of excellence. As one of our first hires in the Data Science org, this is a highly visible role with a lot of potential to define the scope and strategy for this extremely important function. You'll play a key role in taking Fever's already vibrant data culture to the next level     On your first month in Fever:     You'll be fully integrated into the team and you will meet some key partners on the engineering and business sides You'll be able to navigate our data assets You'll get familiar with Fever's tech stack and frameworks You'll attend some of the Fever Original's experiences like Candlelight     After 3 months in Fever:     You'll understand the full business context at Fever and will be able to identify key challenges where your skills can eventually make a difference You'll have already contributed significantly to advance a challenging Data Science project You'll participate in some of the hackdays or hackathons we organize with other teams     On your 6th month in Fever:     You'll have established yourself as a sought-after collaborator by our business and engineering partners You'll be mentoring other new joiners to the team and be an active contributor to the data science and analytics community at Fever, promoting best practices and fresh ideas to make the whole community more efficient You'll have significant input in the planning of the Data Science org and will also be able to influence our partners' roadmaps     About You     You have solid math, statistics and Machine Learning fundamentals (typically MSc or PhD level) so you Understand the theory behind the algorithms Can make informed and reasonable modeling choices Can rigorously evaluate the performance and failure modes of your proposals You can turn your ideas into reality, meaning that you Are a master of common data and ML tools (e.g. SQL, Pandas, Numpy, …) Can build both quick prototypes and robust analysis and modeling pipelines Can work effectively with data engineers, analysts, software engineers, etc. You have a scientific mindset, a problem-first attitude and are highly self-critical so you Can translate complex problems into mathematical formulations Start simple and construct solid baselines Know when it's necessary to introduce extra complexity and when simple is better Don't reinvent the wheel You have an entrepreneurial spirit, get stuff done and thrive in a fast paced environment so you Take ownership of your work Communicate early and often Take controlled risks Leave things better than you found them You are comfortable with software engineering best practices and write robust, reproducible and maintainable code, but can also build quick prototypes to validate ideas and enable new analysis. You have excellent communication skills and are proficient in business English     It would be a plus if you...     Have significant expertise in technical areas such as Bayesian modeling, causal inference, real-world recommendation systems, … Have relevant work experience in marketing or internet tech companies Identify yourself as both a scientist and a hacker Have experience with current ML and scientific computing frameworks such as Pytorch, JAX, etc.     Benefits & Perks     Attractive compensation package consisting of base salary and the potential to earn a significant bonus for top performance. Stock options. Opportunity to have a real impact in a high-growth global category leader 40% discount on all Fever events and experiences Home office friendly Responsibility from day one and professional and personal growth Great work environment with a young, international team of talented people to work with! Health insurance and other benefits such as Flexible remuneration with a 100% tax exemption through Cobee. English Lessons Gympass Membership Possibility to receive in advance part of your salary by Payflow.     Thank you for considering joining Fever. We cannot wait to learn more about you!     If you want to learn more about us: Fever's Blog | Tech.Eu | TechCrunch     Fever is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workspace where everyone's background and ideas count. Our main goal is to find the best possible talent regardless of place of birth, racial or ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, religion, opinion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age or caring responsibilities. Title: Customer Success Manager
Description: VAMI is a global verification provider aiming to make verification processes simple, friendly, and secure for businesses and their users. Our all-in-one verification platform secures every step of the customer journey. More than 2000 global companies use this platform to verify users, businesses, and transactions, orchestrate their verification processes, welcome more customers worldwide, speed up onboarding, reduce costs and steer clear of digital fraud.     The Role     Your Responsibilities Will Include     Managing clients on all levels: technical, business, and product, and helping them succeed in their goals. Managing and growing relationships with Key Clients (stakeholders). Identifying opportunities and potential challenges. Providing Clients with training and webinars. Introducing clients to new features and handling new feature releases. Providing client feedback internally. Collaborating with Sales, Solution Architects, Partners, Product Management, Legal, and Marketing teams as the client’s representative.     Ideal Profile     Skills Required     You have prior experience as a Customer Success Manager, Account Manager, Business Developer Manager, and Project Manager in the Crypto, Fintech, and Banking spheres. You have a basic understanding of KYB, KYC, and KYT will be a big plus. You have advanced English, the notion of any other language is a big plus. You have proficiency in Google Sheets / MS Excel. You have strong analytical skills and a proactive approach.     What's on Offer?     Work in a company with a solid track record of performance Work alongside & learn from best in class talent

Title: Project Manager
Description: Project Manager – Remote – Spain  We are currently seeking a dynamic, customer-oriented project manager to join our Professional Services team at ASE Global. You will have an active involvement with real customers and projects from day one. This position will suit project managers with at least 3 years of experience in software delivery projects who are looking for a hands-on role working within a challenging and rewarding technical environment.  Here is a little window into our company: ASE Global, focused on the automotive industry, the combination of ASE’s industry-recognized software, tools, and local industry expertise allows for the provision of global data services, performance improvement consultancy, and profit optimization services tailored to the business requirements of brands and their dealer networks. ASE’s business intelligence dashboard tools, combined with human validation, provide in-depth analysis of business performance, and brands are given the confidence to manage change and drive the performance needed to face market challenges head-on. ASE Global was acquired by Valsoft and is currently part of Aspire Software. Our new home provides ASE Global with a unique opportunity to grow the company and serve a truly global client base within the Automotive management sector.  The successful candidate can be based anywhere in Spain. This position can be remote or work from any of our offices in Spain.  What your day will look like:  As part of our customer-facing project teams, you will be involved in a wide variety of activities, including:  Portfolio Management  Manage a portfolio of customer engagements from kick-off to close Ensure a backlog of engagements is fully scheduled and resourced  Customer Engagement  Develop and maintain ongoing customer relationships Act as the primary point of contact for customers throughout engagements Actively manage stakeholder expectations throughout engagement delivery Travel to customer sites internationally (if required)  Engagement Delivery  Ensure engagements are delivered to a high level of customer satisfaction, meeting agreed contractual requirements Prepare and maintain project deliverables including: schedules, risk registers, etc Schedule project resources to ensure high quality, on time delivery Track project progress and effort, resolving issues such as slippage Report project progress to both the customer and internal management Manage changes to project scope, schedule and cost Manage the financial aspects of engagements in line with agreed project P&L Actively manage the contractual completion of projects Contribute to the ongoing improvement of methods, processes and deliverables  Service Improvement  Contribute to the ongoing improvement of methods, processes and deliverables    About You:  3 years of experience managing customer-facing software projects is essential  Prince2 training and experience Demonstrable experience of financial project management and change control At least a bachelor’s degree in a Technical discipline or similar is highly desirable A strong understanding of project methodologies and processes The desire and ability to learn quickly and apply complex new technologies An attention to detail and a desire to deliver high-quality work A passion for customer satisfaction and excellent communication skills Excellent presentation, verbal communication and written English skills Fluent in Spanish and English languages, both written and verbal is essential  Legally authorised to work in Spain  For further information about ASE Global, you can visit our websites at: www.ase-global.com  We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Function: Gestión y Tecnología de la información

Title: Area Sales Representative / Merchandiser DIY Stores
Description: Located in Belgium, DUMAPLAST is one of the major manufacturers of wall and ceiling coverings as well as sustainable floorings and they offer a range of high quality products for interior embellishment. With several factories in Europe, the firm DUMAPLAST can capitalize with engaged teams and innovative technologies to respond to clients expectations. DUMAPLAST is a subsidiary of the group GERFLOR, one of the worldwide leaders of resilient floorings.  Joining our teams is the choice of an expanding french manufacturing group who is highlighting the innovation, creativity, sustainable development and continuous performance improvement.  For more information please visit our homepage : www.dumaplast.com/fr/revetement-pvc  Position:  Following our successful international growth strategy, we have an exciting and challenging opportunity for a dynamic and hands-on  Area Sales Repräsentative / Merchandiser DIY Stores  - home-office based in Central Spain -  DUMAPLAST is listed in one of the biggest DIY chains in Spain & Portugal. The focus of this job is to execute the roll-out of the merchandising and POS plan within the DIY shops and to generate additional sales through cross- and upselling.  Your role  Manage the existing customer base in Spain (Portugal optional) and train the sales teams in the DIY stores on the wide range of our waterproof wall covering solutions Support the customers in the roll-out of our products to their stores across Iberia Make sure, that the Point-of-Sales (POS) layout is in line with the DUMAPLAST merchandising strategy (incl. pricing policy) Provide technical trainings and implement show case Identify and capitalize on cross- and upselling opportunities on store-level Provide frequent feedback from the field and weekly reports to the sales management Closely cooperate with the Belgian sales management and marketing team  Requirements:  2+ years of practical experience in Sales or Merchandising in the building materials industry, ideally with knowledge of the DIY segment A high level of independence, self-starter attitude and the desire to learn Strong hands-on approach, technical understanding and good presentation skills Pro-active sales mentality and a structured self-organisation Good command of MS-Office tools Business fluent in Spanish and good English (mandatory), Portuguese would be a great plus The willingness to travel across Spain and Portugal (± 3 hotel nights per week)  Other information:  Our offer  An exciting and challenging job opportunity at an internationally successful group Attractive prospects for personal development Competitive salary package and company car

Title: Publishing Manager, Mobile Games
Description: About Tamatem     We are the leading mobile game publishers in the MENA region. We partner with renowned developers from all over the world to bring the best-localized games and entertainment to the Arabic-speaking market. With over 50 released titles, 100 million downloads, and 7 million monthly active users, our experience in localization and publishing is unparalleled and will place any game at the top of the charts.     About Tamatem+     Tamatem Plus is a one-stop platform that offers access to a massive network of popular alternative payment methods, from direct carrier billing to e-wallets, card and cash payments for the benefit of both the developer and user. The platform supports developers in unlocking new revenue streams and expanding their reach within the MENA region.     Brief     Tamatem is seeking a dynamic individual to lead our expansion efforts in the mobile gaming market.     As a Publishing Manager you will have the exciting opportunity to identify and pursue new business opportunities, build valuable partnerships, and nurture relationships with key stakeholders. Your strategic thinking and planning skills will be put to the test as you develop and execute plans to increase our presence in the mobile gaming market.     The Role     Your role within Tamatem's world will include:     Build and manage partnerships with key stakeholders, such as mobile gaming developers and publishers Develop and implement sale and marketing strategies to target new clients and partners Lead on negotiating contracts and partnerships with potential clients and partners Managing budgets and resources to support business development efforts Collaborate with internal teams, such as product development and marketing, to ensure alignment and support for business development initiatives Lead on closing deals, and working with internal teams to ensure successful delivery of agreed-upon solutions Develops relationships with prospective new partners and maintain an effective relationship with existing customers to ensure retention Meeting with clients to discuss their needs, desires, and concerns, then presenting solutions to meet those needs Actively contribute to the product roadmap by coming up with new solutions that would boost partner satisfaction and increase game sales Coordinate with the internal teams to ensure partners needs are being addressed in a timely manner Providing regular updates on progress and performance Monitor and analyze market trends and competitive landscape to identify opportunities for growth Lead and manage a team of professionals to achieve common goals, including delegating tasks, setting clear expectations and providing support guidance to team members     Requirements     You Have: Bachelor degree in business, marketing, or any other related field. 5+ years of experience in business development, preferably in the mobile gaming industry     Required Skills and Competencies :     Demonstrated success in driving business growth and achieving business objectives Proven track record of successfully identifying and pursuing new business opportunities Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills, with the ability to identify and pursue new business opportunities Leveraging their existing network of game developers & publishers to identify new business opportunities Experience with CRM software and tools to track and manage sales and client relationships Experience managing budgets and resources effectively Strong leadership and team management skills Excellent negotiation skills Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders Excellent written and verbal communication skills Superior project management skills Natural tendency to be curious, positive and creative     Benefits     Our team members appreciate :     Our vibrant and fun working environment. We are a curious, hard-working, and energetic group ready to take over the world Our emphasis on a culture that promotes inclusivity, diversity, creativity, and adaptable working setups We are a results-oriented company that offers ample career advancement opportunities, and competitive compensation The continuous learning and development growth

Title: Assistant Professor
Description: Position  Positions are open at five distinct ranks: Postdoctoral Fellow,Assistant Professor, Associate Professor, Full Professor, and Chair Professor.  Responsibilities and Duties  Applicants will have extensive teaching experience, have published high quality papers in their area of expertise, have been successful in obtaining research grants, and have substantial experience in the supervision of research students. The successful candidate, in addition to teaching typically two modules/courses per year (i.e. one per semester), will provide leadership in curriculum development and enhancing our research profile at the international level. They are expected to assume administrative responsibilities based on their experience.  Personal Attributes  Self-motivated and being able to motivate others;  Strong leadership and interpersonal skills;  Strong team player;  Proactive and flexible but with good respect for deadlines;  Able to work in an environment where diversity and inclusiveness is appreciated.  Essential Qualifications/Experiences  A PhD in a closely aligned area and PG Cert HE or equivalent;  Ideally few years of teaching/research experience at a university or equivalent after completion of PhD degree;  PhD supervision capacity;  Strong publications record in an area of expertise;  Evidence of success in obtaining research grants;  Fluency in English.  Desirable Qualifications And Experience  Professional memberships such as BCS, IET, ACM, IEE and HEA;  Strong knowledge / experience in international higher education.  Compensation Package  Range Of Annual Base Pay  Lecturer: 280k-320k RMB  Assistant Professor: 360k-400k RMB  Associate Professor: 450k-490k RMB  Senior Associate Professor: 540k-580k RMB  Professor: Above 622k RMB, negotiable  Members of Academic Staff are entitled to subsidies for accommodation, travel, and children's educational, medical insurance, and a one-time relocation allowance is provided. Overseas staff may receive a tax "holiday", depending on nationality and personal circumstances.
Industry: Fabricación de electrodomésticos, equipamiento eléctrico y electrónica

Title: Scrum Master
Description: What Is Exoticca     Exoticca was founded in 2013 by a team of travel visionaries with deep knowledge in the creation and online distribution of multi-day tour packages. Our mission is to offer our clients the possibility to visit the most beautiful and stimulating places on our planet, through the best holiday packages, at unbelievable prices. Our customers can find out more about our trips and book them instantly in a matter of minutes through our website, avoiding the usual long exchanges of email, meetings, or calls required by more traditional travel agencies, which makes us the most convenient way of booking a multi-day tour package.     At Exoticca we are looking for people who want to offer their best to create unforgettable experiences for our customers. We are a young, dynamic, multicultural team of around +350 people, in rapid international growth, seeking for new partners to help us create the best and most forward-thinking travel company of our generation.     We are a highly ambitious and well-balanced start-up, backed by top national and international investors that have also participated in the growth of other success stories, such as Skype, Wallapop, Glovo, Wix, Idealista, among others.     What is our proposal?     We are looking for tech-heroes with the desire to contribute to our mission, who admire different world cultures and have huge respect for the environment, who moreover feel energized with challenges and love being part of our company growth.     As a Scrum Master, you will be responsible for facilitating the Agile development process and ensuring that the Scrum framework is implemented effectively. You will help the development team to be self-organized and cross-functional, and help to remove any obstacles that may impede their progress.     What will you do?     Facilitate the Agile development process, including daily stand-up meetings, sprint planning meetings, sprint reviews, and sprint retrospectives Coach the development team on Agile principles and practices, and help them to apply these principles effectively Ensure that the Scrum framework is implemented effectively and that all team members understand their roles and responsibilities Remove any impediments that may be blocking the development team's progress, and escalate any issues to management as necessary Work with the Product Owner to prioritize the product backlog and ensure that the team is working on the highest-priority items Help the team to estimate work items accurately and to deliver work on time Encourage the team to continuously improve their processes and practices Foster a culture of collaboration, open communication, and continuous learning     Requirements     Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field Certification as a Scrum Master (CSM) or equivalent At least 3 years of experience as a Scrum Master or Agile Coach Experience working in a software development environment, preferably with a focus on web applications or SaaS products Excellent communication and collaboration skills Strong leadership skills and the ability to lead by example Excellent problem-solving skills Experience working with Jira or other Agile project management tools     Benefits     Competitive compensation package in line with job responsibilities and experience Individual Training Budget Additionally, we propose the use of flexible compensation management for diet, transportation, private health insurance with Cobee 100% remote model (inside Spain) Permanent contract from the start Travel packages at reduced prices! Referral bonus, if you bring people as talented as you Team lunches, English/Spanish lessons, bi-anual company parties And last but not least, becoming part of a fun and motivated multicultural team at an agile and rapid growing organization!     Exoticca is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusiveness are our core. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under European, country, or local law.

Title: Face to Face English Coach - MADRID BASED (m/f/d)
Description: Fast-track your way into teaching with Speexx and make an immediate difference in the lives of our diverse international business community of users. Develop and broaden your teaching skills as opportunities arise within the Speexx global network.     Job description: Deliver top quality virtual 1:1 sessions using the Speexx interface and issue professional written reports. Be available to provide face to face training on site at our clients' offices in Madrid, Spain.     Benefits     Competitve rates Opportunities to add additional tasks and responsibilities to your work Paid initial and future training Paid and fair cancellation policies 100% remote and complete autonomy over your work schedule Access to a global network of support and coaches, who care! "Learn while you earn" - Free access to Speexx language learning solutions     Requirements     WHAT YOU BRING TO SPEEXX     Can you answer “Yes!” to ALL of the following questions?     Are you located in Madrid, Spain? Are you a proficient speaker (CEFR C2) of the language you teach? Have you earned an official certificate to teach your C2 language? Do you have a bachelor’s degree or equivalent? Do you speak at least one other language at a B2 level? Are you currently teaching online? Can you offer 25 hours minimum per month? Do you meet the technical requirements (see below)?     Technical Requirements     CPU benchmark score minimum 2000     RAM: Min 8 GB Windows 10 or Mac OS Mac OS X 10.8, 10.9, 10.10     Minimum bandwidth 30 MBit/s download and 10 MBit/s upload     Latest Chrome, Edge, Firefox or Safari browsers     Benefits     Apply for this job

Title: Head of Growth, Games
Description: Carry1st is Africa’s leading publisher of mobile games and digital content. Operating at the intersection of games, fintech, and web3, we scale awesome content in frontier markets by solving hard problems. We develop, license, and publish games and monetize them effectively with our proprietary platform. We are backed by blue-chip investors like: Andreessen Horowitz, Google, Riot Games, Bitkraft, and Nas.     Reporting to the COO, the Head of Growth, Games, will be responsible for defining and executing against the publishing strategy for the company’s new and third-party games. You will inform the ways in which we test concepts, prototypes, and games in soft launch - as well as lead our efforts to scale our partner’s games in Africa. More specifically, in this role you will…     Define and codify our strategy for branding, marketing, and monetizing in-development and established games to drive positive ROI Partner with product, UA, and data teams to test and optimize art style, creative strategy, and ASO for games in development Lead the end-to-end publishing of owned and third-party games coordinating across UA, Community, and Product teams Recruit, align, and coach a team of growth leads for individual games     Requirements     What makes you a great candidate?     Experience in a senior product marketing role for a top 100 grossing F2P mobile game Demonstrated creative approach to multifaceted product marketing Ability to collaborate with product teams and inform / influence product strategy Highly skilled operator, experience building and enforcing clear processes and plans Strong written and verbal communication skills, with ability to synthesize and communicate complex ideas to both executives and team members Ambitious, hard-working, entrepreneurial mindset, with an orientation toward problem-solving and a strong desire to win Experience recruiting and managing cross-functional teams Demonstrated interest / experience in serving emerging markets     Benefits     Carry1st is a fast-paced and dynamic place to work. Our team is diverse and global as we operate fully-remotely across 25+ countries. At Carry1st, you will have the opportunity to…     Develop, launch, and scale industry-defining games in innovative ways Make a difference, serving a large underserved player base across Africa and global frontier Become a leader in an emerging VC-backed startup with strong prospects Own shares in the company, enabling you to benefit from the value you help create Work from anywhere in the world (time zone permitting) with immense personal flexibility     We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. Join us!     Learn more about Carry1st…     Andreessen Horowitz shared why they invested in Carry1st VentureBeat announced that Carry1st raised $27 million to scale mobile games in Africa Remerge hosted Cordel on a podcast to discuss the Carry1st and the African gaming market

Title: Quality Assurance Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: At Speexx, we are building the future of learning - Speexx is the digital coaching platform for language training, business coaching and skills assessment in large international organizations. We use groundbreaking AI and a global network of certified top coaches to help large organizations bring out the best in their people.     We strive every day to offer our employees a workplace environment that fosters inclusion and a sense of belonging, where everyone feels recognized, valued, and respected. And we are looking for curious and motivated individuals to join the team and grow with us. If this sounds like you – what are you waiting for? Apply now for the position of     Quality Assurance Engineer (m/f/d) - remote     The ideal candidate will be working closely with the Product Management and Product Development teams to assure that new products and releases demonstrate readiness and meet requirements and specifications.     We are looking for someone who can be flexible to work in different product lines and support various parts of the business. This is a highly dynamic role as it requires handling the pressure of multi-tasking and working on some of the most challenging projects.     What you will do at Speexx     Assure the quality of the products within an agile development environment Contribute to continuous improvement of the products and tools Participate through the whole product life cycle, from specification to deployment Prepare and execute test plans and test cases for new features and products Support root cause analysis and the implementation of corrective actions Become an expert on the product and act as a consultant in the team     What We Look For     University degree in Software Engineering or similar qualification At least two years of working experience in a similar role Special attention to details, perfectionist and logical mindset Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions Eager to work in a lively multicultural team where people are passionate about technology and learning Fluency in Spanish and strong English skills Previous working experience with SQL and programming skills     What you can expect at Speexx:     A highly international and agile environment in which you collaborate with amazing team members from offices and locations around the globe, including Munich, Madrid, Milan, Paris, Sao Paulo and Shanghai. Rooted in an environment of curiosity and learning, you would be joining a leading company that is proud to be shaping the future of digital learning and is undoubtedly one of the best places to work in the industry!     In addition you will experience:     Flat hierarchies and short decision-making paths Flexible working hours and home office options for a good work-life balance An open feedback culture as well as freedom paired with taking over responsibility from an early stage Free access to the best language courses in the world! Modern hardware and software for hassle-free work     Interested? Just hit the apply button and we´ll take it from there. We are looking forward to hearing from you!     For additional questions, send an email to: jobs@speexx.com

Title: Senior Talent Acquisition Partner - Freelance, Remote
Description: Workfully is building a new category of Talent Acquisition products. Our decentralized recruitment and technical onboarding platform enable innovation-led companies to hire for potential and tech skills later and scale faster in global markets.     Our vision is to give everyone unprecedented access to a fulfilling career.     We enable a growing community of independent recruiters to do more, by building technology that makes them more efficient and providing commercial partnerships with serious clients.     To Discover More About What We're Building. Click Here.     We are building a strong, distributed community of independent recruiters to work with Europe and US's most innovative companies.     As a Senior Talent Acquisition Partner, we will work remotely in a global team of talented recruiters managing requisitions for post-funding scale-up companies, Web3 companies, Biotech, and Enterprises.     What You Will Do     Deliver global recruitment services to venture-backed scale-up, through flexible sourcing and headhunting; Deal with our existing client portfolio of hyper-growth worldwide startup companies; Enhancing the talent acquisition delivery in several countries through effective sourcing strategies. Building and Nurturing your own talent pool and helping build the underline technology to streamline your work.     What We Look For     At least 3+ years of recruitment experience (in-house or external) of ideally Tech or Business related roles; Advanced sourcing capabilities, espacially in boolean search International talent-hiring delivery and client handling background; Europe and/or US Talent Market in-depth knowledge; LinkedIn Recruiter; Native or Professional English level;     Nice to have     Familiarity with demanding, fast-paced work environments.     What We Offer     Tons flexibility & and above-market monthly commissions; The possibility to help us build the recruitment platform of the future; World-class talent attraction experience, with career growth opportunities; Full remote working with yearly company trips.

Title: Associate Director for International Student Recruitment
Description: Global University Systems (GUS) is focused on becoming one of the world’s most dynamic, inclusive, and diverse education organisations. GUS is an international network of higher education institutions, brought together by a shared passion for accessible, industry-relevant qualifications. GUS delivers a wide variety of programmes, including bachelor’s degree programmes, master’s degree programmes, professional training, English Language training, and corporate & executive education. When someone chooses to study at one of our institutions– whether on campus in Europe, North America, or even in their own home – they’re joining a network of 100,000 students worldwide. When you decide to work with GUS, you will be joining an industry leading, global organisation that has a reach in over 150 different countries.  Position:  This high-profile new role represents an unparalleled opportunity to make a significant and lasting impact in a high growth business. The Associate Director will bring strategic vision, focus and innovation to enable future growth in a competitive market.  The Associate Director is mainly responsible for dealing with prospective student enrolments through international student recruitment from Agents. Dealing with direct student recruitment is expected once general inquiries or initial applications are made via Agents. Associate Directors are addition  ally responsible for identifying new business opportunities in existing and new markets. As such, they are responsible for finding ways to explore new markets and bring in revenue, and/or develop new revenue streams.  Associate Directors primarily engage in sales and marketing activities and should have a solid understanding of industry trends, to inform upon strategic planning and forecasting. They must be able to prioritize the opportunities that are the most likely to generate a profit. The role centrally involves identifying new business opportunities, as well as liaising with high-profile clients, and managing both students’ and agents’ expectations in line with deliverable  Requirements:  Minimum of a Bachelor's Degree, or equivalent, is required Considerable experience of working in education sector; specifically Colleges and Universities Should have experience of preparing strategies to acquire business in new regions and to develop business in existing regions Experience working with B2B Education Agent partnerships. Previous experience in direct International Student Recruitment  Other information:  Please note this role is offered on a Consultancy Agreement.  We acknowledge receipt of your resume for a position at Global University Systems and sincerely appreciate your interest in our company.  We will screen all applicants and select candidates whose qualifications meet our requirements. We will carefully consider your application during the initial screening and will contact you if you are selected to continue for the next stage of the recruitment process. We wish you every success.  GUS is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, or religion or belief.

Title: ChatGPT & AI Consultant (Part Time)
Description: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced ChatGPT Consultant. As a ChatGPT Consultant, you will play a crucial role in enhancing our internal operations through the utilization of ChatGPT. Your expertise in NLP, conversational AI, and marketing strategy will be instrumental in driving innovation and improving our agency's efficiency and effectiveness.     🌟Responsibilities:     💡 Collaborate with internal teams to identify areas where ChatGPT can optimize processes, enhance productivity, and streamline operations 📋 Provide strategic guidance and recommendations on effectively integrating ChatGPT within our internal workflows and systems 📊 Conduct thorough research and analysis to identify opportunities for utilizing ChatGPT to improve internal communication, knowledge management, and information retrieval ✍️ Develop and refine conversational scripts and templates for internal use, ensuring clarity, accuracy, and alignment with our agency's objectives 🔄 Train and fine-tune the ChatGPT model to ensure it delivers contextually appropriate and valuable responses for internal inquiries and support requests 🧪 Test and evaluate the performance of ChatGPT in various internal scenarios, making adjustments and refinements to optimize its effectiveness 🚀 Stay updated with the latest advancements and best practices in NLP, conversational AI, and marketing technology, applying this knowledge to enhance internal operations     Requirements     🤖 Proven experience working with NLP and conversational AI technologies, particularly with GPT-based models such as ChatGPT 📚 Strong understanding of marketing principles and strategies, with experience in optimizing internal processes and workflows 💻 Familiarity with ML techniques and frameworks used in NLP, such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Hugging Face 🚀 Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and experience with NLP libraries (e.g., NLTK, spaCy) and conversational AI platforms     Benefits     🏡 Fully remote     ✨ Friendly work environment     💎 Growth opportunities at a fast-growing startup     With any questions, reach out to: jobs@tiktal.co

Title: Head of Affiliates based in Barcelona or REMOTE
Description: As a leader of the affiliate department, you will play a crucial role in driving quality traffic. You will develop strategic marketing initiatives for key accounts and recruit and train new affiliate managers. Additionally, you will teach, mentor, and lead junior level team members on affiliate marketing to encourage maximum performance and dedication.     Oversee the successful management of top accounts Develop and implement effective affiliate management strategies Attend industry events around the world and provide valuable insights on market and creative trends Regularly evaluate and report on department performance and implement new processes for optimisation Manage business negotiations and close deals with top partners Build strong internal networks for collaboration and knowledge sharing across the company. 2+ years of experience and track record in the affiliate marketing, mobile marketing or lead generation industry Outstanding people management skills (leading by example) Strong technical understanding and strategical mindset KPI driven Business level English Based in or willing to move to Barcelona     On offer is a comprehensive benefits package to support and enhance your work experience, including:     Private health insurance to ensure that you and your loved ones have access to the best medical care Flexible food and transportation benefits to help you save time and money on your daily commute A company MacBook to help you stay connected and productive while on the go Quarterly bonuses based on your performance and key performance indicators A brand new office with breathtaking views to inspire you and promote a positive work-life balance Complimentary coffee and snacks to keep you fuelled throughout the day Flexible working hours in a hybrid or remote model to accommodate your unique needs and schedule.

Title: Junior Development Engineer
Description: About Us     We are Openbravo, a dynamic and modern enterprise software company, certified Great Place to Work in both Spain and France, and member of the DL Software Group.     Openbravo helps retail and restaurant chains to be more competitive through the adoption of a flexible mobile and cloud-based unified commerce platform.     If you want to take part in a company known for its inclusive and supportive workplace culture and where you can grow professionally along with our product, then please read on, as we can’t wait to tell you more about the position!     Position Overview     We are looking for a Junior Development Engineer aiming to become part of an international Product organization delivering best-in-class projects to our clients and partners. The position can be either fully remote (Spain) or hybrid based in Barcelona or Pamplona.     Position Responsibilities     The function of the Junior Development Engineer has the following key areas of responsibility:     Design and develop new complex POS/WMS systems or components with high degree of autonomy Enhance existing POS/WMS application systems or components of high complexity Resolve product defects detected by customers, community and/or internal testers Analyze, evaluate and improve business related requirements of different functional areas of our products Test and roll-out new functionalities ensuring quality, and document new/modifications to existing functionalities Work closely with other members of the development, product and technology team Work with internal business clients to understand their requirements and translate into value-generating technical solutions     Position Requirements     BS or MS in Computer Science, Industrial Engineering or Telecommunications. Data Base Knowledge/experience, POS/Retail and/or business software applications related experience is a plus. 1 year Knowledge/experience in software development with the following technologies is a valuable plus: Front-End development with Javascript, IndexedDB, React/Redux, etc... Java Platform and/or all tiers of an enterprise web application. SQL, PostgreSQL and Oracle. Good written and oral communication skills in English is a must. French is a strong plus. Analytical thinking & detail-oriented. Initiative, flexibility, and adaptability.     What We Offer     Above competitive salary & benefits package. Possibility to work fully from home or hybrid (if based in Barcelona or Pamplona). Flexibility in schedule. Free training (English/French/Spanish lessons + adapted training based on your professional needs and interests). Continuous performance feedback with an annual review so you can keep grow professionally. Fresh fruit, drinks and loads of snacks every day. Fantastic colleagues from all over the world. Referral bonus. A career in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial business environment. An opportunity to accelerate your professional development.     How To Apply     If you are interested in becoming part of our amazing team, you can write us an email with your resume attached to careers@openbravo.com. 🚀 Please put "Junior Development Engineer" in the subject line of your mail. Thanks for your interest in Openbravo and hope to see you soon!

Title: IT KAM
Description: ¿Lo tuyo es la gestión de proyectos? ¿Te has formado y preparado en técnicas de project management? ¿Te encanta desplegar, controlar imprevistos, ordenar y tarear? En resumen, si te sientes cómoda gestionando proyectos donde los demás nos sentimos agobiados, te estamos buscando. En datasocial, buscamos un perfil de Project Manager para la dirección de los proyectos de producción.     Qué Ofrecemos     Un puesto de trabajo en uno de los partners HubSpot más importantes de España. Trabajo 100% remoto. Horario flexible, sólo te pediremos que cumplas unas horas/semana, y de Lunes a Viernes. Contrato indefinido con 6 meses de periodo de prueba. El día de tu cumple no trabajas. Desarrollo profesional a largo plazo. Formar parte de un equipo multidisciplinar y en crecimiento. Trabajar con grandes marcas nacionales e internacionales. Aprender y trabajar con metodologías ágiles. Salario de partida 25.000 € brutos anuales, abiertos a negociarlo.     Qué Esperamos Que Sepas     Experiencia previa en gestión de proyectos/clientes IT; también haber gestionado un volumen alto de proyectos simultáneos (>15). Familiarizada/o con el manejo de apps de gestión de proyectos (Teamwork, Monday, Trello, o similar) Formación en gestión de proyectos (PMP, Agile/Scrum o similar) y experiencia en trabajar con metodologías ágiles. Inglés b2     ¿Qué buscamos? Buscamos personas que tengan:     Habilidades de comunicación. Asertividad. Empatía Compromiso Capacidad para decir NO y ofrecer alternativas win-win Orientación clara a trabajar en equipo Capacidad de delegar y empoderar al equipo Pensamiento analítico Agilidad y Determinación en la toma de decisiones Organizado y metódico Visión. Capacidad de planificación, previsión y anticipación     ¿Qué valoraremos positivamente?     Formación técnica Que tengas la capacidad de trabajar en remoto Que seas proactiva/o y no tengas reticencias a aprender equivocándote

Title: Beca en el área de IT
Description: ¡Hola!     Esto que estás leyendo es nuestra oferta siempre abierta para prácticas! Tenemos la suerte de que muchos estudiantes nos eligen para hacer sus prácticas o TFG, TFM... y ¡nos encanta!     Colaboramos con muchas universidades y centros de estudios y siempre estamos abiertos a establecer nuevos convenios.     Si te animas a hacer prácticas con nosotros, te aseguro que te sentirás parte del equipo desde el primer momento, asistiendo a reuniones virtuales, a las presenciales que hacemos cada trimestre e incluso si te coincide a final de año..., al fiestón que organizamos en diciembre.     El área de tecnología es la más grande de toda la compañía así que tendrás muchos compañerxs de lxs que tirar cuando necesites ayuda.     A continuación tienes un formulario para que me dejes tus datos. Necesito, entre otras cosas, la fecha en la que querrías hacer las prácticas, además de su duración. Te contactaré lo antes posible para conocernos en una reunión cortita.     ¡Muchas gracias por leerme!     Teresa

Title: BDR
Description: Algunas De Las Tareas Específicas Que Realizarás Incluyen     Como BDR (Business Development Representative), tendrás la importante tarea de impulsar el crecimiento de nuestro negocio identificando y prospectando nuevos clientes potenciales.     Investigar y identificar clientes potenciales: Utilizarás diversas fuentes para investigar y descubrir nuevas oportunidades de negocio. Analizarás los datos de la industria y del mercado para identificar los clientes potenciales más adecuados. Establecer contacto con los clientes potenciales: Una vez identificados, establecerás contacto con los clientes potenciales a través de diferentes canales de comunicación, como correo electrónico, llamadas telefónicas y redes sociales. Nutrir y desarrollar relaciones con los clientes potenciales: Después de establecer el primer contacto, trabajarás en la construcción de relaciones duraderas con los clientes potenciales. Te asegurarás de que estén informados sobre los productos y servicios que ofrecemos, y responderás a cualquier pregunta que puedan tener. Programar reuniones de ventas: Trabajarás en estrecha colaboración con el equipo de ventas para programar reuniones con los clientes potenciales interesados. Te asegurarás de que el equipo de ventas esté bien preparado para la reunión y que los clientes potenciales reciban la información que necesitan. Actualización del CRM: Mantendrás nuestro sistema de gestión de relaciones con los clientes (CRM) actualizado y proporcionarás informes detallados sobre tus actividades de ventas. Colaboración con el equipo de marketing: Trabajarás en estrecha colaboración con el equipo de marketing para desarrollar estrategias de generación de demanda y asegurarte de que nuestros mensajes de marketing lleguen a los clientes potenciales adecuados. Análisis de datos: Utilizarás las herramientas de análisis de datos para evaluar el éxito de tus actividades de ventas y para identificar oportunidades adicionales para el crecimiento de nuestro negocio.     En resumen, como BDR en Datasocial, tendrás la tarea de identificar y prospectar nuevos clientes potenciales y trabajar en estrecha colaboración con el equipo de ventas y marketing para impulsar el crecimiento de nuestro negocio. Tu trabajo será fundamental para el éxito de nuestra empresa.     Qué Esperamos Que Sepas     Experiencia previa imprescindible Conocimiento exhaustivo de HubSpot Inglés C1     ¿Qué buscamos?     Buscamos Personas Que Tengan     Habilidades de comunicación.     Empatía     Compromiso     Orientación clara a trabajar en equipo.     ¿Qué valoraremos positivamente?     Que tengas la capacidad de trabajar en remoto Que seas proactiva/o y no tengas reticencias a aprender equivocándote La Empresa se compromete a impulsar y a favorecer de forma activa la creación de un ambiente de trabajo integrador y respetuoso, que cumpla fielmente con toda la legislación actual existente sobre la prevención de la discriminación y del acoso, ya sea por razones de género, raza, religión, discapacidad, estado civil, edad, ideología, embarazo, identidad o lugar de residencia, o por cualquier otro motivo relacionado con los anteriores. La empresa valorará positivamente por parte de los candidatos el respeto al medio ambiente y el compromiso social.

Title: Global Talent Partner
Description: ¿Creees que el talento es el activo más importante para las empresas?  ¿Quieres emprender tu propio proyecto profesional?  ¿Ya eres emprendedor pero te sientes abrumado en las tareas que desempeñas?  Esta propuesta es para tí.  Como emprendedores somos conscientes de la dificultad a la hora de poner en marcha un proyecto de forma autónoma, así que queremos establecer contigo un modelo de colaboración donde tú te puedas centrar en hacer negocio (captar y fidelizar tu propia cartera de clientes) y ofrecer el mejor servicio; y nosotros proveerte de todo lo necesario para que puedas hacerlo con el mínimo coste para ti y contando con todos los medios más innovadores y con unos procesos ágiles y precisos que contribuirán a que tengas éxito.  ¡Nunca estarás solo!  Todo el equipo de Brandty estará a tu lado para que, juntos, consigamos volar muy alto.  ¿Qué te ofrecemos?  Mucha formación para que puedas emprender tu proyecto con los conocimientos necesarios; comercial, ventas, servicios, proceso de selección por valores, social recruitment, etc.   ¡Te mantendremos siempre actualizado para que puedas ofrecer el mejor servicio a tus clientes!  Acceso a todas las herramientas tecnológicas de Brandty; CRM de clientes, ATS para la gestión de ofertas, software propio para la elaboración de informes y pruebas, plataforma e-learning para tu propia formación, etc. Reconocimiento de la marca “Brandty” en todas tus acciones de visibilidad. Apoyo para darte a conocer a través de nuestras redes sociales en todas nuestras campañas de e-mail marketing. Apoyo por parte del equipo de recruiters interno de Brandty. Un montón de cosas más que queremos contarte cara a cara.   Requisitos:  ¿A quién buscamos?  Personas dentro del territorio Español. Personas que sueñan con emprender su propio proyecto profesional y gozar de la libertad de ser tu propio líder, en el área de reclutamiento y selección. Personas con espíritu comercial y con vocación de servicio. Personas perseverantes, que se fijan metas y se esfuerzan cada día por lograrlas. Personas formadas y con experiencia en el ámbito de los recursos humanos, especialmente en la selección de talento. Que compartan nuestros valores; alegría, iniciativa, profesionalidad, compromiso y confianza.

Title: Sales Development Representative
Description: About Us     Culture is one of the most powerful concepts in the world. A common belief can move entire countries and that’s why the most successful companies in the world are investing a lot in their own cultures.     Nailted is a tech company based in Madrid and our mission is to help organizations cultivate a culture in which everyone is truly aligned. We believe technology can change habits, and with our web-based solution, we can modify a company’s culture for the better by setting up the proper feedback workflows enabling both people and companies, to better understand each other.     If you like to change the way companies are operating, come and join us!     About The Role     Nailted is on the hunt for an exceptional team member to supercharge our sales operations and spearhead our expansion into international markets. We are seeking a highly skilled and driven individual with a proven track record in SaaS sales. Our ideal candidate possesses 2-3 years of experience in similar roles and thrives in a fast-paced startup environment.     The main goal of the Sales Development Representative role is to qualify leads and turn them into Opportunities. It will require confidence in managing customer relationships, perseverance, negotiation skills, and strategic prioritization. We’re looking for a very hands-on role.     Responsibilities     Prospect Outreach: Initiate contact with potential customers through various channels, such as cold calling, email campaigns, and social media, to generate interest and establish communication. Opportunity Conversion: Convert qualified leads into sales opportunities by effectively communicating the value proposition of Nailted's SaaS offerings and addressing customer needs. Customer Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with prospects, providing them with relevant information, addressing their concerns, and nurturing them through the sales pipeline. Your primary focus will be to schedule and coordinate high-value meetings with our Account Executive.     Required Skills     At least 2 years of experience selling B2B SaaS An eager learning mindset Very fluent in Spanish and English (very important since you will be dealing with international leads) Excellent communication and presentation skills, both written and spoken Proficiency with CRMs, Office Suite, and Cloud software in general Winning attitude, competitive drive, ambition, and passion.     What We Offer     Being part of a fast-growing startup, with the possibility to model the whole sales process from scratch, in a young company you can grow with. Fixed salary based on experience + commission scheme Work on the Google Campus if you feel like it Full-time contract Flexible schedule Possibility to work 100% remotely if needed

Title: Middle Data Analyst - Python (Incorporación en septiembre)
Description: Teralco Group nace en 2002 en Alicante y, desde entonces, hemos estado comprometidos con ayudar a las empresas a mejorar su rendimiento y eficiencia a través del uso de tecnología innovadora. Con nuestros más de 20 años de experiencia, hemos ayudado a numerosas compañías a implementar soluciones tecnológicas.    En Teralco Group Tú sumas con tu experiencia y habilidades, Tú importas en nuestra toma de decisiones y Tú eliges el camino para tu desarrollo profesional.    ¿Cómo es un día en Teralco?  Eliges cuándo comienza tu jornada laboral y acabas cuando quieras.    Si haces tiempo de más un día o sales antes por necesidades personales, lo compensas otro día sin problemas. Elige si vas a la oficina o no, porque tienes 100% #flexibilidad para ello.    En caso de ir, tienes café gratis, caramelos y un futbolín disponibles para que te relajes.    Si te pasa algo durante tu jornada laboral, tienes seguro médico disponible. Así que, tranquilo/a, que estás cubierto.    En los siguientes meses podrás acudir a los eventos que hacemos en la oficina (día de cerveza gratis, gamefest, etc), en la montaña, en jornadas lúdicas (2 al año), jugando al pádel y un montón de cosas más.    Podrás disfrutar las vacaciones cuando quieras, y tendrás siempre un gran equipo de personas contigo. La #cercanía es uno de nuestros valores.    En el futuro queremos que crezcas con nosotros, así que, tendrás una carrera profesional amplia y variada con lo que busques y se te pagarán las certificaciones que necesites. Tenemos clases de inglés incluidas y formaciones. ¿Y si quieres cambiar de tecnología? Estamos orgullosos de poder decir que lo vemos como algo positivo y te acompañaremos en el cambio. Las posibilidades de #formación las eliges tú.    Todo esto forma parte de nuestra filosofía y lo que llamamos #TeralcoLife. ¿Te apuntas?    Requisitos  Participarás en un proyecto para el sector aéreo, llevando a cabo la comunicación con los responsables del producto interno, realizando el análisis de los datos colaborando con el equipo de Data Engineers.    Tu principal labor es traducir las necesidades reales de negocio a un diseño de datos. Se trata de idear un diseño de flujo de datos el cual mantenga una coherencia interna y, además flexibilidad para que pueda acomodar peticiones de negocio futuras.      Se requiere experiencia previa de, al menos, 3 años en:     Desarrollo de los procesos ETL. Manipulación y tratamiento de cadenas de texto para adecuarlas al proceso ETL. Python y su ecosistema (Numpy, Pandas, ScikitLearn, SciPy, Matplotlib, Pyplot, Jupyter, etc..). Limpieza de los datos. Exportación de los datos tratados a Snowflake de forma automática. Conocimientos en Cloud. Preferentemente AWS. Conocimientos en PowerBI. Nivel de inglés B2, se hará prueba.  La incorporación será en septiembre. Conócenos en el siguiente vídeoIgualdad de Oportunidades en el Empleo En Teralco Group, estamos comprometidos con la igualdad de oportunidades de empleo independientemente de la raza, nacionalidad, etnia, color de piel, la religión, el sexo, la orientación sexual, la edad, la ciudadanía, el estado civil, la discapacidad, el género, la identidad o expresión de género o la condición de veterano.
Function: Gestión y Tecnología de la información
Industry: Servicios de TI y consultoría de TI

Title: Técnico Comercial - Sector Construcción
Description: Estamos realizando un proceso de selección de un puesto de Técnico Comercial para una empresa del sector de la construcción especializada en encofrados de hormigón para la zona del campo de Gibraltar.     ¿QUÉ SE OFRECE?     Contrato indefinido Incorporación inmediata a una empresa internacional líder en el sector Salario fijo + variable entre 30.000 - 50.000 euros brutos anuales en función de la experiencia aportada por el candidato/a Pago del kilometraje a 0,30 € / kilómetro Horario flexible y teletrabajo     ¿QUÉ FUNCIONES REALIZARÁS?     Trabajar estrechamente con los clientes para identificar sus necesidades, sobre todo, encofradores, jefes de obra y direcciones facultativas. Búsqueda de soluciones y asesoramiento técnico ante las necesidades del cliente. Asegurar la aplicación de los procesos de aprobación de ofertas comerciales. Labores de desarrollo de negocio: prospección y búsqueda de posibles clientes, evaluando posibilidades de negocio y promocionando los servicios de la empresa. Gestión de estrategia comercial: negociación de propuestas comerciales y cierre de ventas.     ¿QUÉ REQUISITOS DEBES CUMPLIR?     Experiencia comercial Disponibilidad para viajar por la zona Formación como Ingeniero Técnico, Arquitecto, formación profesional o similar. Coche propio Valorable conocimientos de AutoCAD

Title: IT Project Manager (Madrid, híbrido)
Description: ¿Quiénes somos? / About us     Somos un equipo de desarrollo tecnológico, formado por más de 40 profesionales comprometidos con la calidad del software, productos y servicios que ofrecemos a nuestros clientes.     Si estás buscando un proyecto o equipo centrado en la calidad de software, buenas prácticas, con un ambiente de trabajo genial, y compañeros de los que poder aprender, divertirte y trabajar codo con codo, ¡has encontrado la oferta perfecta para ti!     Nos puedes encontrar en: www.Secture.com     Nuestro equipo y cultura / Our crew & culture     Todos venimos de entornos y backgrounds tecnológicos, por lo tanto estamos acostumbrados a trabajar con metodologías ágiles, asíncronas y con la libertad y flexibilidad que eso supone.     Trabajamos en remoto desde distintas partes del país, pero fomentamos mucho nuestra cultura, desde nuestras dailies (con“ruinas” incluidas), nuestros random coffees, charlas, formaciones, eventos en persona y mejor no hablamos de nuestros canales de discord…     En definitiva, en Secture cuidamos mucho a nuestro equipo, ambiente y cultura, por lo tanto, buscamos compañer@s que busquen lo mismo que nosotros fomentamos activamente.     ¿Qué harás en esta posición? / What’ll you be doing     1er mes | Onboarding     Nos sentaremos contigo para explicarte el negocio, el proyecto, presentarte al equipo, mostrarte cómo trabajamos, las herramientas qué utilizamos y ofrecerte todo lo que necesites en los primeros días de tu incorporación.     Conocerás a todos los miembros del equipo, al cliente y todo el contexto necesario para entender el proyecto y el entorno en el que trabajarás.     Seguramente entres a mitad de algún sprint. Arrancamos todos los días con una daily muy distendida de compañía a las 10am, para contar brevemente cómo avanzamos cada uno en nuestros proyectos, y posteriormente cada equipo asiste a sus dailies propias.     En este primer mes tanto tus compañeros de proyecto como el resto del equipo te acompañarán y darán soporte con todo lo que necesites para el proyecto en el que vayas a trabajar.     Nos comunicamos principalmente por Discord, documentamos en Drive y Notion y utilizamos meets para las reuniones. También solemos trabajar con Monday, Trello y Jira, en función del proyecto.     Durante los siguientes meses     A medida que te vayas familiarizando con el proyecto, el equipo, y las necesidades del cliente podrás ayudar a estimar las tareas, proponer mejoras y desarrollos que nos ayuden a priorizar.     En los sprints, como project manager ayudarás a estimar, gestionar y coordinar distintas partes del proyecto. Serás una pieza fundamental en el éxito y desarrollo de las necesidades del cliente.     Fomentamos activamente que nuestros compañer@s aporten propuestas y que si tienen una idea la compartan sin miedo, ya sean mejoras para desarrollos existentes, como nuevas funcionalidades que puedan impactar de forma positiva en los proyectos en los que trabajarás.     Como comentábamos más arriba, valoramos la capacidad de trabajar en equipo, la buena comunicación, la calidad del software y las buenas prácticas.     En Secture no paramos de crecer, por lo tanto, queremos que te conviertas en un pilar del equipo y nos ayudes a seguir construyendo nuestros proyectos, equipo y cultura.     ¿Qué esperamos de ti? Qué hayas trabajado al menos 4 años en entornos tecnológicos como Project Manager o Product Manager. Experiencia tanto en el área tecnológica/técnica como en el área de negocio. Facilidad para tratar con diferentes stakeholders y departamentos (tech, negocio, marketing, finanzas..) dentro de Secture y en el cliente. Buenas dotes de comunicación y liderazgo son fundamentales para esta posición. Experiencia sólida en el manejo de Wordpress & HTML. Extra points: Manejo de hubspot y trello. Experiencia elaborando presupuestos. Que disfrutes trabajando de manera híbrida (2-3 días oficina de cliente, resto remoto), acostumbrado a una comunicación fluida a través de nuestros canales internos de compañía. Capacidad para trabajar en equipo, así como para ayudar a otros compañer@s cuando lo necesiten. Qué busques un proyecto enfocado en la calidad de los proyectos y la calidad humana.     ¿Qué harás?     Coordinar todas las necesidades de nuestro cliente, ya sean de negocio y/o tecnológicas. Llevar a cabo los proyectos de manera exitosa en los timings acordados. Ayudarás a crear, optimizar y documentar procesos para asegurar que los proyectos se desarrollen según el roadmap indicado. Actuarás como enlace entre distintos equipos y clientes con ayuda y soporte del resto del equipo. Gestionarás la presencia y activos digitales (webs, hositings, apps..) del proyecto designado     ¿Qué te ofrecemos?     Banda salarial acorde a tu experiencia Trabajo híbrido. 2-3 días oficina Madrid (cliente), resto remoto. Flexibilidad horaria. Los viernes tenemos jornada reducida. 24 días de vacaciones laborales al año. Día de tu cumpleaños libre. Si tienes hij@s, tarde libre el día de su cumpleaños para que lo celebréis en familia. Seguro médico privado con Sanitas. Eventos, charlas, juegos, dinámicas de equipo. Trabajar en un ambiente sano, colaborativo, donde cuidamos a las personas y la cultura. Te podrás integrar, aprender y trabajar con grandes personas y profesionales. Clases de inglés a través de profesores nativos en remoto. Formaciones internas INDYA plan nutricionales personalizados. Tarjeta Cobee, dietas, transporte y guardería. Presupuesto para hardware y software.     Si has llegado hasta aquí y quieres conocernos, ¿Cómo será el proceso?     Envíanos un email a: people@secture.com contándonos un poco sobre ti. Puedes compartirnos tu Linkedin,, blog CV, … cualquier cosa que consideres que debamos ver antes de conocernos :)     Te escribiremos para conocernos y el proceso de manera muy resumida será así:     Charla por meets con People Charla por meets con alguno de nuestros Product/proyect Manager para explicarte el proyecto. Charla con nuestro CEO. Por último te daremos feedback y si todo ha ido bien te haremos una propuesta para que te puedas incorporar con nosotros.     Si todas las disponibilidades cuadran, no deberíamos tardar más de dos semanas desde que nos escribas hasta que tomemos una decisión por nuestra parte.     Muchas gracias por leernos, y si tienes cualquier pregunta, no dudes en escribirnos con lo que necesites. people@secture.com

Title: Programador KNX (Full Remote)
Description: Estamos buscando un programador de KNX para trabajar en oficina técnica, para empresa especializada en instalaciones y servicios de ingenieria especializada en electricidad, electrónica, automatización, y domótica a nivel nacional, con la posibilidad de trabajar en remoto.     ¿QUÉ SE OFRECE?     Horario de 9 a 13:30h y de 14:30 a 18:30h (con flexibilidad y tarde del viernes libre) Salario entre 23.000 - 28.000 euros/brutos anuales en función de la experiencia aportada al puesto Teletrabajo Contrato Indefinido     ¿QUÉ FUNCIONES REALIZARÁS?     Redacción de documentación técnica (memorias, presupuestos) Elaboración de planos de instalaciones en Autocad Programación de sistemas de automatización y domótica de KNX (ETS 5 o 6)     ¿QUÉ REQUISITOS DEBES CUMPLIR?     Formación en Ingenieria o ingeneiria técnica electrica, electrónica, industrial o similar Experiencia y manejo de Autocad Experiencia y manejo con los programas de KNX (ETS 5 o 6)     REQUISITOS VALORABLES     Conocimiento en los softwares de Omron y Siemens

Title: Middle Data Analyst - Python (Incorporación en septiembre)
Description: Teralco Group nace en 2002 en Alicante y, desde entonces, hemos estado comprometidos con ayudar a las empresas a mejorar su rendimiento y eficiencia a través del uso de tecnología innovadora. Con nuestros más de 20 años de experiencia, hemos ayudado a numerosas compañías a implementar soluciones tecnológicas.    En Teralco Group Tú sumas con tu experiencia y habilidades, Tú importas en nuestra toma de decisiones y Tú eliges el camino para tu desarrollo profesional.    ¿Cómo es un día en Teralco?  Eliges cuándo comienza tu jornada laboral y acabas cuando quieras.    Si haces tiempo de más un día o sales antes por necesidades personales, lo compensas otro día sin problemas. Elige si vas a la oficina o no, porque tienes 100% #flexibilidad para ello.    En caso de ir, tienes café gratis, caramelos y un futbolín disponibles para que te relajes.    Si te pasa algo durante tu jornada laboral, tienes seguro médico disponible. Así que, tranquilo/a, que estás cubierto.    En los siguientes meses podrás acudir a los eventos que hacemos en la oficina (día de cerveza gratis, gamefest, etc), en la montaña, en jornadas lúdicas (2 al año), jugando al pádel y un montón de cosas más.    Podrás disfrutar las vacaciones cuando quieras, y tendrás siempre un gran equipo de personas contigo. La #cercanía es uno de nuestros valores.    En el futuro queremos que crezcas con nosotros, así que, tendrás una carrera profesional amplia y variada con lo que busques y se te pagarán las certificaciones que necesites. Tenemos clases de inglés incluidas y formaciones. ¿Y si quieres cambiar de tecnología? Estamos orgullosos de poder decir que lo vemos como algo positivo y te acompañaremos en el cambio. Las posibilidades de #formación las eliges tú.    Todo esto forma parte de nuestra filosofía y lo que llamamos #TeralcoLife. ¿Te apuntas?    Requisitos  Participarás en un proyecto para el sector aéreo, llevando a cabo la comunicación con los responsables del producto interno, realizando el análisis de los datos colaborando con el equipo de Data Engineers.    Tu principal labor es traducir las necesidades reales de negocio a un diseño de datos. Se trata de idear un diseño de flujo de datos el cual mantenga una coherencia interna y, además flexibilidad para que pueda acomodar peticiones de negocio futuras.      Se requiere experiencia previa de, al menos, 3 años en:     Desarrollo de los procesos ETL. Manipulación y tratamiento de cadenas de texto para adecuarlas al proceso ETL. Python y su ecosistema (Numpy, Pandas, ScikitLearn, SciPy, Matplotlib, Pyplot, Jupyter, etc..). Limpieza de los datos. Exportación de los datos tratados a Snowflake de forma automática. Conocimientos en Cloud. Preferentemente AWS. Conocimientos en PowerBI. Nivel de inglés B2, se hará prueba.  La incorporación será en septiembre. Conócenos en el siguiente vídeoIgualdad de Oportunidades en el Empleo En Teralco Group, estamos comprometidos con la igualdad de oportunidades de empleo independientemente de la raza, nacionalidad, etnia, color de piel, la religión, el sexo, la orientación sexual, la edad, la ciudadanía, el estado civil, la discapacidad, el género, la identidad o expresión de género o la condición de veterano.
Function: Gestión y Tecnología de la información
Industry: Servicios de TI y consultoría de TI

Title: Programador KNX (Full Remote)
Description: Director of Communications: the person who will redefine the perception of open source in the enterprise. Canonical, the publisher of Ubuntu and a leader in open source solutions and services, is writing the next chapter of its growth story: offering the widest open source portfolio, redefining its corporate image and becoming a public company. We are looking for an exceptional storyteller, tech enthusiast and writer to drive Canonical brands and influence along this journey.Ubuntu is used by millions of developers from Calcutta to California, a name associated with productivity, security and ease of use. Our communications team is crafting the narrative for the Canonical brand and its portfolio of products, shaping our responses to industry events and trends, providing strategic input to executives on a range of industry and public relations topics. This role reports to the VP of marketing and manages a team of press relations, analyst relations and social media professionals.Location: In this role, you can work remotely from any country across EMEA.Key responsibilities:Define Canonical's corporate and product portfolio narrativeLead a team of professionals and agencies to bring this story to lifeOrchestrate message across channels (AR, PR, social…) to drive awarenessBuild credibility and relevance across the business and enterpriseFoster passion and engagement across developer and open source communities We value:Experience of leadership and mentoring in a multi-channel comms teamStory telling that weaves corporate and product portfolio narrativesThe ability to motivate and influence at all levels of the organisationPersonal engagement with journalists, analysts, investors and executivesThe vision to lead on brand awareness and thought leadershipPassion for technology and technology evangelismExcellent academic results, with Bachelor's or equivalent in Communications, Humanities, or STEMCommitment to continuous learning, feedback and improvementEngagement with the latest innovations in communications The communications team operates across technologies, verticals and regions, from operating systems to SAAS, from telco to automotive, from silicon vendors to systems Integrators. They build brand awareness and thought leadership while maintaining cohesion and consistency in messaging and tone of voice across channels.What We OfferAn opportunity to shape an iconic brand, company and productsInfluence in the open source communityAn inclusive work environmentFlexibility to work remotely from homePersonal learning and development budgetAnnual compensation reviewRecognition rewardsAnnual leaveParental LeaveEmployee Assistance ProgramPriority Pass for for International travelCanonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world's best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.
