Title: Técnico Comercial - Sector Construcción
Description: Estamos realizando un proceso de selección de un puesto de Técnico Comercial para una empresa del sector de la construcción especializada en encofrados de hormigón para la zona del campo de Gibraltar.     ¿QUÉ SE OFRECE?     Contrato indefinido Incorporación inmediata a una empresa internacional líder en el sector Salario fijo + variable entre 30.000 - 50.000 euros brutos anuales en función de la experiencia aportada por el candidato/a Pago del kilometraje a 0,30 € / kilómetro Horario flexible y teletrabajo     ¿QUÉ FUNCIONES REALIZARÁS?     Trabajar estrechamente con los clientes para identificar sus necesidades, sobre todo, encofradores, jefes de obra y direcciones facultativas. Búsqueda de soluciones y asesoramiento técnico ante las necesidades del cliente. Asegurar la aplicación de los procesos de aprobación de ofertas comerciales. Labores de desarrollo de negocio: prospección y búsqueda de posibles clientes, evaluando posibilidades de negocio y promocionando los servicios de la empresa. Gestión de estrategia comercial: negociación de propuestas comerciales y cierre de ventas.     ¿QUÉ REQUISITOS DEBES CUMPLIR?     Experiencia comercial Disponibilidad para viajar por la zona Formación como Ingeniero Técnico, Arquitecto, formación profesional o similar. Coche propio Valorable conocimientos de AutoCAD

Redacción de documentación técnica (memorias, presupuestos) Elaboración de planos de instalaciones en Autocad Programación de sistemas de automatización y domótica de KNX (ETS 5 o 6)     ¿QUÉ REQUISITOS DEBES CUMPLIR?     Formación en Ingenieria o ingeneiria técnica electrica, electrónica, industrial o similar Experiencia y manejo de Autocad Experiencia y manejo con los programas de KNX (ETS 5 o 6)     REQUISITOS VALORABLES     Conocimiento en los softwares de Omron y Siemens

Title: PROYECTISTA MECÁNICO SENIOR CON SOLIDWORKS.
Description: En ADYD Group seguimos creciendo y apostando por el mejor talento dentro del ámbito de la ingeniería.  Somos oportunidad y talento, una empresa de Ingeniería dedicada a ofrecer servicios de diseño, Ingeniería de Proyectos, Outsourcing y Formación.  Buscamos PROYECTISTA MECÁNICO SENIOR CON SOLIDWORKS.  Funciones:  Diseñar procesos productivos de nuestro porfolio, así como nuevos procesos. Elaboración de implantaciones generales. Realización de planos de despiece para fabricación. Control de fabricaciones en taller. Mejorar los productos y procesos existentes Mantener los registros documentales elaborados Encontrar soluciones de diseño para los problemas Asistencia en obra en la fase de montaje.   Ubicación: Madrid (Getafe) Lunes a viernes de 7 a 15h  Se ofrece:  Trabajar en una empresa en pleno crecimiento, con equipos multidisciplinares y altamente cualificados. Proyectos nacionales e internacionales de gran envergadura, con la última tecnología del mercado. Posibilidad de desarrollo profesional y mejora continua, seguimos creciendo en todos nuestros departamentos. Cercanía, buen ambiente y compañerismo.   Requisitos:  Requisitos:  Experiencia demostrable en el uso de software SolidWorks; se valorará el conocimiento y manejo de software CAD. Se valorará conocimientos en cálculo aeráulico (cálculo de velocidades, perdidas de presión). Se valorará conocimientos básicos de cálculo estructural. Se alorará conocimientos de Inglés y otros idiomas (francés, alemán, italiano…) Disponibilidad para viajar.

Detectar nuevos clientes y oportunidades de negocio.   Requisitos:  Experiencia en puestos de comercial del sector equipamiento para colectividades  Capacidad de comunicación y negociación

Title: Key Account Manager, Iberia
Description: MISSION    Mirum Pharmaceuticals is a biopharmaceutical company dedicated to transforming the treatment of rare liver diseases affecting children and adults. Propelled by our passion for patients and their families, we’re focused on turning possibilities into realities. Using data and meaningful evidence, our goal is to transform scientific discoveries into therapies that are poised to positively impact the treatment of rare liver diseases. We are collaborative, creative, and experienced professionals and we’re looking to augment our team with other individuals who embody our values: care, be real, get it done, and have fun, seriously. Learn more about our work, our culture, and what it’s like to be a part of our team: www.mirumpharma.com.    POSITION SUMMARY    We are looking for patient-inspired, passionate project managers, with demonstrated experience in rare diseases, preferably in pediatric hepatology.    These client-focused project managers will possess experience in business ownership, leadership, analytics, and the implementation of innovative solutions to improve the patient pathway.    The Key Account Manager (KAM) will develop an effective plan, aiming at depicting the patient pathway for the patients with this disease (identifying the HCPs in charge of the management of the disease, from early identification, to diagnosis, disease and symptom management), and propose an effective plan to ensure patients in need are appropriately diagnosed and managed.    JOB FUNCTIONS/RESPONSIBILITES:    As a KAM you will be assigned one region and you have the responsibility for : mapping key stakeholders involved in the management of these patients identifying blockage, problems, issues in the patient pathway which prevent patients from benefiting from the best possible care, within the region proposing solutions to support an optimal patient pathway, and identify the relevant stakeholders to conduct those actions with establishing strong relationships with key thought leaders and customers and demonstrate ability to recognize and devote the necessary time and resources needed to engage with HCP’s Possessan entrepreneurial approach with a focus on ownership and accountability to maximize/exceed individual and company goals Employ strong organizational and analytical skills to analyze business data to develop strategic and actionable regional plans Develop and maintain strong partnerships across commercial, compliance, medical affairs functions. Drive change through influence and innovation  QUALIFICATIONS    Education/Experience:    5+ years of science or business experience in healthcare or biotech industry, inclusive of 4 years of field-based experience. Successful biotech/pharma product launch experience in rare or niche markets with a documented track record of exceeding goals Bachelor in science degree or higher Solid business relationships in GI/hepatology desired Pediatric experience or orphan experience welcomed Competitive marketplace experience preferred Proven experience working within Hospitals, Academic Institutions, and clinics calling on interdisciplinary care teams Proven record of success through teamwork and execution Track record of operating in accordance with all regulations as well as company policy and procedures Demonstrates high ethical and performance standards with all scientific and business contacts Approximately 80% travel is required including overnight travel as needed Some travel and attendance on evenings and weekends for regional and national meetings, conferences and advocacy support events  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:    Motivational and interpersonal communication Strong presentation and management skills Scientific acumen and proficiency in highly specialized and complex diseases Detail oriented and precision while able to see “big picture”. Assertiveness, pro-activity, professionalism, and confidence. Extraordinary commitment to customer experience and standards of excellence Excellent organizational skills. Self-motivated and ability to deal with ambiguity and problem solve

Title: Agente Comercial /Sales Representative - Trabajo en remoto
Description: vLex es una compañía de alta tecnología en la que valoramos el talento, el compromiso, la innovación, el espíritu emprendedor y la orientación a resultados, todo ello en un entorno flexible que fomenta el desarrollo personal y la diversidad cultural.     Nuestra misión es obtener y ofrecer la colección más completa y confiable de conocimientos jurídicos globales y locales, para los profesionales e investigadores de derecho. Proporcionamos una de las mayores colecciones de información jurídica del mundo en una plataforma de inteligencia artificial que entiende el derecho y aprende contigo.     Las personas que forman vLex valoran:     Buen ambiente de trabajo. Trabajo en remoto. Facilidades en la conciliación de la vida personal y profesional. Plan Variable con excelentes comisiones.     SALES REPRESENTATIVE - SERVICIOS TECNOLÓGICOS     La persona seleccionada se encargará de vender en el mercado español nuestro portfolio de productos editoriales combinados con la más innovadora tecnología para abogados y otros profesionales jurídicos, siguiendo un avanzado y productivo método de ventas.     El comercial deberá realizar demostraciones online de los productos y servicios, recopilar necesidades del cliente, evaluar la propuesta a presentar, realizar la presentación de la misma de manera eficaz, negociando con los clientes para llegar al cierre de la venta.     También será responsable de recoger inquietudes y nuevas ideas que los clientes proporcionen ya que todas nuestras soluciones están en continua evolución.     Buscamos a un profesional orientado al cliente, un gran comunicador, con clara experiencia en negociación y cierre de la venta y con capacidad de conseguir los objetivos marcados. Valoramos en este perfil, la perseverancia, el compromiso y la pasión por el mundo de las ventas y la tecnología.     Si te sientes identificado y además te apasiona el mundo de las ventas y la tecnología. ¡Queremos conocerte!     Requisitos mínimos:     Orientación a resultados. Experiencia mínima de 1 año en ventas, siendo un plus experiencia en telemarketing/demostraciones online. Experiencia profesional y alta capacidad de negociación y de cierre de la venta. Acostumbrada a trabajar con objetivos de venta. Excelente comunicador. Perseverancia y capacidad de entender rápidamente las necesidades de clientes. Compromiso y motivación. Facilidad para el aprendizaje. Organización y planificación de tareas.     ¿Qué ofrecemos?     Incorporación estable inmediata. Salario fijo + Elevadas comisiones. Formación Inicial y continuada. Excelente clima laboral. Trabajo en remoto. Horarios: L-J: 8:30-14:30 -16:00-19:00 V: 8:30-13:30 Jornada intensiva los días viernes y Jornada intensiva en verano. Otros beneficios sociales para conciliar vida profesional y personal.

Title: Ingeniero/a Diseño y Cálculo de Estructuras Industriales - 100% remoto
Description: En BESIDE apostamos por el mejor talento dentro del sector tecnológico. Contamos con una unidad de Selección Especializada en perfiles de Ingeniería para incorporarse en la plantilla de nuestros clientes. Trabajamos con un amplio rango de empresas, que nos permitirá encontrarte el puesto que más se ajuste a tus necesidades e intereses profesionales. Te podrás incorporar en las empresas más innovadoras, ofreciéndote proyectos punteros dentro de las ramas de I+D, automoción, pharma, diseño de maquinaria, desarrollo de producto, etc.  Seleccionamos un/a Ingeniero/a Diseño y Cálculo de Estructuras Industriales para incorporarse en el equipo de uno de nuestros principales clientes, especializado en el diseño y cálculo de estructuras, equipos a presión y tanques atmosféricos y diseño mecánico y térmico de intercambiadores de calor. También están especializados en el diseño y cálculo de recipientes a presión tipo depósito o tanques tipo API para el almacenamiento de sales (Molten Salts Tanks) para plantas CSP o para el almacenamiento térmico para proyectos de todo tipo.  Su ámbito de actuación es Cataluña (Barcelona y su área metropolitana, Tarragona y Lleida).  ¿Qué haré? Estas serán tus funciones principales:  Diseño y cálculo de estructuras metálicas, de hormigón armado, cimentaciones para obra pública, sector industrial y edificación. Simulación numérica de estructuras singulares, desde las fases iniciales del proyecto hasta su construcción. Redacción de proyectos de obra civil, estructuras. Gestión y seguimiento de proyectos. Cálculo de estructuras de otros técnicos, seguimiento diseñadores 3D, planos, etc. Redacción de informes/memorias de cálculo. Preparar requisiciones de oferta, preparar mediciones. Colaborar con diseñadores 3D y delineantes 2D del equipo.   Beneficios que tendrás en tu lugar de trabajo:  Contratación directa y de carácter indefinido por parte de la Compañía. Teletrabajo 100% (con disponibilidad para visitar las obras cuando sea necesario en el ámbito de Cataluña). Horario: 9h a 18h con posibilidad de jornada intensiva los viernes. Vehículo propio. Salario a convenir según expertise aportada por el/la candidato/a.   Requisitos:  Imprescindible:  Formación: Ingeniería de Caminos o Ingeniería Civil (especialidad Estructuras)/Ingeniería Industrial (especialidad Estructuras). Más de 10 años de experiencia desarrollando las funciones descritas. Experiencia previa en redacción de proyectos de estructuras y cimentaciones para plantas industriales (hormigón armado, pretensado, estructura metálica). Inglés nivel técnico. Manejo de software de análisis estructural (CYPE, SAP2000). Disponibilidad para viajar de manera puntual.   Muy valorable:  Experiencia en cálculo de estructuras para edificación. Manejo de Robot.

Title: Country Lead, Iberia
Description: MISSION    Mirum Pharmaceuticals is a biopharmaceutical company dedicated to transforming the treatment of rare liver diseases affecting children and adults. Propelled by our passion for patients and their families, we’re focused on turning possibilities into realities. Using data and meaningful evidence, our goal is to transform scientific discoveries into therapies that are poised to positively impact the treatment of rare liver diseases. We are collaborative, creative, and experienced professionals and we’re looking to augment our team with other individuals who embody our values:care, be real, get it done,andhave fun, seriously.    POSTION SUMMARY    Mirum is expanding its commercial operations in South Europe. Reporting to the General Manager Italy & South Europe, the Country Lead, Iberia will build and lead Mirum’s local presence in both Spain and Portugal. This individual will develop local plans for world-class launches and will lead and execute, in collaboration with the South European GM, the Medical Lead and the International Team, local pricing and market access, launch preparation and commercial activities both in Spain & Portugal.    JOB FUNCTIONS/RESPONSIBILITIES    Lead the development of Mirum's organization and business in Spain and Portugal with overall responsibility for local business planning and cross-functional leadership and overall country P&L. Create and maintain trust-based relationships with policymakers, payors and regulators, KOLs and patient advocacy groups to advance business priorities. Develop and implement reimbursement strategy in Spain & Portugal, lead pricing negotiations with local payors. Lead launch readiness, development and execute of local launch plans in line with global strategy. Contribute to the organization’s overall strategy and provide timely input on opportunities and risks, and adjust country plans as needed. Collaborate with Southern European and International Team Help build the Mirum International culture and play a highly integrative role with the global organization. Ensure adherence to all relevant regulatory, quality, legal and healthcare compliance requirements, corporate policies and procedures, and drive this culture in the local organization  QUALIFICATIONS    Education/Experience:    Solid understanding of the pharmaceutical/biotech commercial operations At least 10 years of relevant experience, including a 3+ years as commercial lead or market access director in Spain& Portugal,developing and executing launches Successful experience in market access (price and reimbursement) negotiations in Spain will be considered an important plus Rare or ultra-rare, pediatric, disease experience preferred Experience with building and maintaining strong relationships with government stakeholders, payors, policymakers, agencies, KOLs and patient associations Commercial acumen and financially savvy Good understanding of IP and regulatory process Undergraduate degree required, MBA and/or relevant post graduate qualifications preferred  Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:    A good communicator with business partnering skills. Ability to work collaboratively and cross-functionally in a fast-paced ever-changing, global working environment. Able to drive initiatives and lead new projects in a lean organization by working cross functionally and using key stakeholders’ areas of expertise. Enjoy building and creating and is a self-starter. Highly organized and comfortable managing multiple work streams at once. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills. Great attention to detail and self-motivation.
Function: Gestión y Tecnología de la información

Title: Tour Leader (CEO) - Western Europe
Description: About Us     G Adventures is the world’s largest small-group adventure travel company and we’ve been making epic travel memories happen on all seven continents for over 30 years.     Our mission is simple: to change lives through travel. And not just our travelers’ either. Since day one, our tours have been built to establish meaningful relationships with local communities, directly benefiting the people and places we visit at every step of our tours.     With the demand for travel coming back strong, we are set up and excited for this next chapter in our company’s story — and we’d love for you to be a part of it.     Our DNA revolves around building, nurturing, and developing a diverse culture of people and a true sense of belonging, where everyone is encouraged to bring their authentic self to work each and every day. You’ll have the opportunity to grow your career, and yourself, alongside a passionate, talented, and welcoming community that works hard to spread goodness around the world.     If all that sounds like your kind of thing, well, we can’t wait for you to join us.     Thinking of travelling the world as a G Adventures Tour Leader (CEO)?     Do you have amazing travel experiences to share with others? Are you well organized, flexible, out-going, with a good sense of humour? Is dealing with people enjoyable for you? Are you young at heart and ready to work with passion and purpose?     If you answered yes to the above questions, we may have the adventure job that you've been looking for! At G Adventures we call our Tour Leaders, Chief Experience Officers or CEOs. The owner of the company sacrificed his title because he truly believed in the front line of the business. Becoming a CEO means that you will need to be more than just a tour leader ? we ask that our CEOs do not merely focus on the logistics of the tour, but create a unique and unforgettable experience for all our travelers.     You will need to be able to lead tours in some or all of the following countries:     France, Italy, Spain and Portugal Some combination tours might also require you to lead tours in a couple of countries outside of this list in another part of Europe.     Responsibilities     During the contract, a CEO will:     Consistently deliver a high level of customer service and traveller satisfaction. Provide leadership for our travellers and be responsible for their well-being. Continually increase your knowledge about the visited country, its culture, religion, current affairs, environment, etc. Have detailed knowledge of hotels, sights, restaurants, transport, souvenirs, prices, etc. Develop a series of information sources and contacts that can be of assistance when required. Maintain a valid passport and visa. It is the responsibility of the Leader to stay up to date on any travel restrictions based on his/her nationality. Keep vaccinations and preventive medication up to date. Be mindful of potential opportunities for G Adventures, such as new destinations, new CEOs, new markets or ways to improve itineraries.     On each departure, a CEO will:     Act as day-to-day guide, interpreter and manager of the group. Deal directly with your traveller's issues and concerns, ensuring that passenger satisfaction is effectively achieved. Maintain the established travel itinerary as closely as possible, making changes only when necessary. Make or reconfirm reservations for accommodation, transportation and activities as required. Assist and accompany travellers during optional activities and meals. Advise travellers on suitable restaurants, additional transport requirements, purchase of souvenirs, etc. Maintain daily expenditure accounts, retain receipts and keep expenses within the trip budget provided. Provide a report for each trip, in the requested format. Keep the Trip notes updated in the standardized format. Train new Leaders as required, passing on as much trip-related information as possible. Provide assistance to the regional offices when requested by their Managers or by the Toronto office     Requirements     A Love for Adventure Travel: We are the Adventure specialists and we only hire CEOs who have a genuine passion for travelling to vibrant, exciting areas of the world. Our CEOs come from very diverse backgrounds, but this is one thing that they all have in common. Previous experience living, travelling, studying or working abroad is an essential requirement for this position. Language skills: All of G Adventures tours are operated in English so a good command of the English language is mandatory. The region specific language is also very important. This helps ensure we maintain excellent relations between the company, the people we meet and work with in the field and the travellers on our trips. Excellent Leadership and Communication Skills: We look for people who have experience in leadership roles, with a proven ability to communicate effectively in a wide range of contexts. Resourcefulness: We need CEOs who have a good head on their shoulders, who can remain calm and collected under unpredictable and stressful circumstances. Our CEOs need to be able to take decisive action to resolve problems as they arise. Awareness of and Commitment to Sustainable Tourism: Our CEOs need to be committed to environmentally and culturally responsible tourism, and be an inspiring example to the travelers. Good Health and High Energy Level: It may seem obvious but we need CEOs who can always handle the daily stresses, both mental and physical, of long and tiring days. Be it a 13-hour bus ride, a long day's trek with a difficult group of travellers, or an included rafting adventure, you need to be the friendly, happy, helpful face of G Adventures. First Aid/CPR Certification: CEOs must be prepared to act in case of emergency. Standard First Aid Certification and CPR are required at the start of a contract to ensure your ability to assist with injuries, illness, or emergency in remote locations. Background in basic accounting/budgeting: Experience working with budgets or developing a personal budget is an asset. Computer literacy: A working knowledge of the Internet, E-mail, Microsoft Word, and Microsoft Excel is essential. Able to travel across Europe     G Adventures is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment. We consider all qualified applicants.
Function: Gestión y Tecnología de la información

Title: Medical Science Liaison (MSL), Europe - EU
Description: Who are we?     We are here to improve the lives of patients through innovative technologies. We're a rapidly growing multi-disciplinary scientific and medical team of professionals devoted to developing game changing technologies that transform healthcare and impact patients' lives. We are addressing one of today's most critical global health concerns –the rise of antibiotic resistant bacteria (www.me-med.com).     Who are we looking for?     We are seeking a highly exceptional professional to join our medical team as an Medical Science Liaison (MSL) for the European Market to support MeMed's licensing partners and distributors in strategic markets.     We seek a talented individual, with passion for innovation and research, that enjoys working in a dynamic and creative environment. One with superb communication skills, that knows how to engage others and work in a collaborative way. High execution skills, and a track record within medical/scientific affairs in the diagnostics field (Preferred) or Medical device/ Pharma.     Primary Job Responsibilities:     As Medical Science Liaison (MSL), you will coordinate all Medical related activities between MeMed and MeMed's strategic partners (i.e., both licensing partners and regional distributors). The role encompasses three major areas of activities which are defined within the European Medical Affairs Strategic Plan:     Education: to internal and external stakeholders. Key Opinion Leader management. Strategic leadership managing the Medical relationship of any collaboration.     In these areas, primary job responsibilities will focus on:     The primary focus of the role is to establish a close working relationship, and co-travel, with Medical leads from MeMed's strategic partners to support their commercial progress, answer customer demands and to establish a 'culture of sharing' in the strategic partnership. Co-design and maintain of a Medical training program for MeMed's strategic partners in collaboration with the regional medical team. Such a training program will encompass a subsection dedicated to onboard of new medical people from MeMed's strategic partners, as well as an implementation of a continuous training module to promote the high medical and educational value of our products. Establish good cross-functional internal team relationship at MeMed that can support day-to-day execution of supporting strategic partnerships. Define and track metrics to assess proper medical and commercial traction with MeMed's strategic partners. Support and co-develop a broad Key Opinion Leader network across Europe with MeMed's strategic partners and ensure proper communication & rules of engagement between both MeMed and its strategic partners. Develop an internal process at MeMed to manage the medical information transfer from MeMed's strategic partners to MeMed, and vice versa.     Beside the core responsibilities, it is anticipated that the Medical Lead Strategic Partnerships will:     Represent MeMed and its proprietary host-response technology as Medical Lead in support of the commercial efforts of a leading IVD diagnostic company with whom MeMed has an ongoing strategic collaboration. Comprehend customers' medical needs, translate those needs in simple solutions and thus leading complex collaboration project successfully and creating genuine win-win solutions. Provide timely, accurate and balanced answers to unsolicited medical enquiries. Continuously screen, review and analyze scientific literature with the aid of the Global Medical Affairs team with the aim to become a subject matter expert on host-response technology. Co-develop, support and participate in Scientific Conferences, symposia and webinars.     Skills and Competencies:     The Medical Science Liaison (MSL) is expected to have a diverse background and skillset to navigate the complex relationship of our strategic partnerships. Concretely, the Medical Science Liaison (MSL):     Have excellent organizational and communication skills to drive the Medical side of the strategic partnerships into a successful collaboration with a 'culture of sharing' information in mind. Have excellent planning and project management skills to handle the different stakeholders involved in the strategic partnerships and to deliver content and value for all involved. Be able to multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced and dynamic environment with a start-up company. Excellent interpersonal and presentation skills. Passionate team player. "Get the job done" attitude. Self-starter.     Education, Experience, and Training Requirements:     MD, Pharm D, PhD or other strong Life Science qualification, background in Infection disease, Emergency department or Immunology – an advantage. Fluent in English – must, and at least one other European language (preferably German, or Italian) Background in Medical or Scientific Affairs helpful, preferably in diagnostics, or medical Device/Pharma. Good knowledge of the international and local health care market, able to identify healthcare trends and related commercial opportunities. Excellent skills in oral and written communication Experience with clinical research, publication activities, congress presentations, and public speaking     Location & Travel:     Based in any of the European countries. The position involves significant international travel.

Title: BUSINESS ANALYST ZENDESK - 100% TELETRABAJO
Description: Sebastián Consultores selecciona para importante Partner de Software, especializado en CRM y herramientas de Gestión empresarial, un BUSINESS ANALYST o CONSULTOR FUNCIONAL Zendesk para ampliar el equipo de consultoría sobre dicha herramienta.     La persona seleccionada se encargará de participar en todas las fases del proyecto de implantación del software incluyendo:     – Toma de requisitos y consultoría de valor añadido sobre proyectos de implantación del software.     – Análisis funcional de la herramienta respecto a los requisitos del proyecto.     – Administración y parametrización general de Zendesk respecto las necesidades del cliente.     – Canalización de incidencias y detección de necesidades.     – Mentoring sobre el uso del software al usuario final.     – Control sobre el rendimiento de la herramienta y la calidad del dato.     – Formación y soporte funcional al usuario.     – Elaboración de reportes específicos para usuarios.     Se ofrece:     ﻿     – Contratación indefinida en importante empresa puntera en su sector.     – Formación sobre la herramienta Zendesk si todavía no se conoce.     – Desarrollo profesional.     – Posibilidad de flexibilidad horaria.     – Teletrabajo 100% a corto y medio plazo.     – Trabajar en un equipo multinacional.     Requisitos:     El perfil que buscamos:     Formación Académica: Grado y titulados universitarios. – Experiencia y conocimientos funcionales de Software CRM enfocados a Gestión empresarial y/o Costumer Service/Experience. como Zendesk, o en su defecto, Freshdesk, Kustomer, Zoho, Pegasystems…     – Experiencia en proyectos de implantación de Zendesk o herramientas similares.     – Conocimientos funcionales de tecnología y procesos.     – Interés por el análisis funcional y experiencia en el soporte de la herramienta de gestión con el usuario.     – Se valorará nivel de inglés alto (leído, escrito y hablado)

Title: Data Engineer
Description: What Is Exoticca?     Do you like traveling? Do you enjoy the exotic? Do you like challenges? If the answer is YES, welcome to Exoticca!     Exoticca is a company that started in 2013 by professionals specialized in the creation and online distribution of trips. Our mission is to offer our clients the possibility to visit the most beautiful and stimulating places on our planet, though the best holiday packages, at unbelievable prices. We are a highly ambitious and well-funded start-up, backed by top national and international investors that have also participated in the growth of other success stories, such as Glovo, SinDelantal.com, or Idealista, among others.     At Exoticca we are looking for people who want to offer their best to create unforgettable experiences for our customers. We are a young, dynamic, multicultural team in rapid international growth, seeking for new partners to help us create the best and most forward-thinking travel company of our generation.     What about the Data team?     At Exoticca, the Data team is the main responsible of making data essential in key decision making across the whole organization. We capture vasts amount of data from multiple customer touch points, spanning from consideration and booking, to pre-travel, travel, and post-travel. Combined with our customer-centric approach, we believe that our data-driven culture is the key to deliver unparalleled product & services, that wow our customers and create unforgettable experiences to be remembered for a lifetime.     Join us as a Data Engineer in order to achieve such ambitious goals, our Data team works together with other departments, such as Marketing, Flight Product, Travel Product, Sales or Customer Experience, to uncover the most valuable insights our data can deliver and convert them into actual company initiatives, business decisions, or product features. There are a myriad of opportunities for using data to learn more about our customers, to grow sales, increase customer satisfaction, optimize & automate processes, and much more. We can’t wait to have you on board!     Which will be your main responsibilities?     Be part of a team that takes end-to-end responsibility for designing, building, and maintaining batch & real-time data pipelines and data solutions Create solutions to enable diagnostic and predictive analytics capabilities Research, evaluate, and propose different data solutions in an agnostic way Select, setup and manage tools & technologies to build and support a robust data infrastructure Propose and help decide on the data modeling and schema design of our data stores     Requirements     2+ years of work experience in a similar role as a Data Engineer Experience working with Python. Experience with relational databases , data warehouses, data lakes and data marts Familiarity with cloud-based, distributed systems and orchestrated ETL processes (AWS is preferred) Experience in data management, integrating and transforming data from multiple sources, including internal DBs and APIs Fluency in English     Benefits     Competitive compensation package in line with job responsibilities and experience Additionally, we propose the use of flexible compensation management for diet, transportation, private health insurance, and personal training purposes Hybrid work model/full remote: you can work from home or the office at your convenience. Offices in the heart of Barcelona (right next to Plaça Catalunya) Permanent contract from the start Travel packages at reduced prices! Referral bonus, if you bring people as talented as you Unlimited coffee, team lunches, English lessons And last but not least, becoming part of a fun and motivated multicultural team at an agile and rapid growing organization!     Exoticca is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusiveness are our core. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under European, country, or local law.
Function: Gestión y Tecnología de la información

Title: HQ - VP of Product (EMEA Remote)
Description: Join us to work on the future of work: your next adventure awaits!     The position     We're hiring for a VP of Product to lead our platform development. You'll define and execute product vision, manage a team of Product Managers, and build relationships with key stakeholders across the business.     Responsibilities     Defining and executing the Product vision: Define and execute the long-term product vision and strategy to align with the company's overall business objectives Leading the Product team: Build and lead a team of Product Managers, ensuring alignment with the company's goals, and fostering motivation to deliver high quality results Building and maintaining relationships with key stakeholders: Establish and maintain relationships with key stakeholders to ensure that the product is meeting their needs and driving value Developing product roadmap and strategy: Create and maintain a product roadmap and communicate that roadmap to stakeholders to ensure alignment and buy-in Establishing and managing Product metrics: Establish and manage Product metrics to measure the success of the product, and utilize those metrics to make data-driven decisions Managing cross-functional teams: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, marketing, and sales, to ensure that the product is delivered on time, within budget, and to a high level of quality Staying up-to-date with market trends and competition: Stay up-to-date with market trends and competition, and use that knowledge to inform Product decisions and stay ahead of the curve     Requirements     10+ years of experience in Product Management, having built outstanding UX products for individuals and/or businesses Excellent at managing complex and interconnected project deadlines A champion for the user experience, informed by qualitative and quantitative data, as well as a strong sense of Product intuition Experienced managing multiple stakeholders and exercising influence indirectly across various teams and seniority levels Experienced in working with KPIs, performance, and projects lead Demonstrated experience in effectively navigating challenging situations Demonstrated highly autonomous, determined, and proactive mindset Possesses exceptional problem-solving skills and a proven ability to effectively structure complex problems while generating innovative solutions Fluent in English     What We’re About     At Job&Talent, we're revolutionising the employment market globally. Our mission is simple and clear. We’re empowering the people who do essential work - from delivery drivers and warehouse workers, to cooks and cleaners - to get work and get paid on their terms.     We match these people with companies we’ve verified through our powerful tech platform. Apps, AI, web-based tools, innovative matching solutions and more. We create seriously smart technology, made for humans, by humans.     And the numbers show we're doing things right. 340,000 people got work with over 2,500 companies globally last year, with clients spanning industries from logistics to retail, hospitality and more. We generated €1.9 billion in revenue in 2022. And we’re grateful to our top tier investors at Atomico, Kinnevik and Softbank.     We're headquartered in sunny Madrid, but we're a remote-first company operating in 10 countries across Europe, the United States and Latin America.     But there’s a missing piece. You.     Join our community     If you’re looking for a company that values innovation, high standards and data, you’ve found it. We’re also good listeners, because everyone’s voice is heard at Job&Talent. These values help us make good decisions and keep momentum. That’s how we operate. Standard.     When it comes to our people, we’re all uniquely different. And it’s that difference that makes us stronger.     We encourage everyone to bring their true selves to work. Being real and empathic means we can build better products, services and workplaces for our workers and our clients. And dare we say it, we think that makes us all happier humans.     What’s In It For You     We're building the world’s leading digital marketplace for essential work. You’ll hear 10x experience, AI, technology and human-centred design quite a lot. We strive for that across the entire company, from finance, to supply, to product.     Make an impact through extreme ownership of the work you do. You create something and you help drive it forward. At Job&Talent, you’ll make an impact across borders with cross-functional teams, wherever you are.     Be rewarded financially. It’s ingrained into our company philosophy. We offer our employees competitive salaries and benefits. Our Talent team can tell you a lot more about the perks in your region.     Grow professionally by doing, not just watching or talking. We’re completely hands-on and we’re bootstrappers, making the most of our resources. And don’t be surprised to find yourself on a call with one of our founders. They like the details as much as the big picture.     Proud to champion equality     At Job&Talent we value diversity and we're an Equal Opportunities employer. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified people regardless of race, disability, religious beliefs or sexual orientation. Come join us. We look forward to your application.

Title: Product Research & Innovation - Associate Manager
Description: At Clarity AI, we are committed to bringing social impact to markets. We are a tech company started in 2017, leveraging AI and machine learning technologies to ensure environmental, social and governance dimensions are the focal point of decision making within financial markets.     We are now a team of more than 300 highly passionate individuals coming from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading startup backed by investors and strategic partners such as SoftBank, BlackRock, and Deutsche Börse who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, Portugal, the UK, and the US this year so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading! Your work will be shaping and guide the sustainable decisions of consumers and investors throughout the world.     We are looking for an Associate Manager to join our Product Research & Innovation chapter. Your work will be shaping and guiding the sustainable decisions of consumers and investors throughout the world.     Position Overview     We are looking for an individual to oversee a team working on the creation of new methodologies and features for the Raw Data used at Clarity AI (e.g, CO2 emissions, energy consumption, gender pay gap, and others). Said Raw Data is used across all products and it also constitutes a newly created product we offer to our clientsThe position is related to ensuring the competitiveness of our Raw Data across all relevant dimensions (e.g., quality, coverage and freshness). In particular, the focus of this position will be:     Defining and owning processes within Clarity AI related to the governance and quality of our Raw Data, data validation at different stages, and overall data journey within Clarity AI Coordinating activities of 6+ metric owners within the Raw Data Team to ensure that they work on the most relevant quality, coverage and freshness needs for our clients by, for example, developing new methodologies or performing quantitative analysis Coordinate with relevant stakeholders (e.g., Product Managers, Data Science) raw data related issues such as data incidents or new data developments (e.g., machine learning models for estimation of data points) that improve the competitiveness of or Raw Data Supporting the commercial aspect of our Raw Data, such as answering client requests, RFPs and defining a competitive Raw Data product Supervise, coordinate and streamline the data validation processes that occur on an ongoing basis as part of our data collection and data release processes     LOCATION: This role can be performed remotely, but European timezone is preferred. We also have offices in several European cities as well.     Key Responsibilities     The role will include, but not be limited to, the following activities:     Define and manage multiple work streams related to the product development, ensuring we achieve our deadlines Empower team members to solve the problems we face, enabling them to achieve their potential while providing coaching and mentoring to ensure their growth Foster an environment of effective collaboration and coordination across chapters (e.g., product management, data engineering, data science, business development, marketing) to deliver end-to-end products that address client needs Assess trade-offs between different methodological options and propose the most appropriate solution for our clients Identify and propose continuous improvements and refinements to the product functionalities and methodologies Prepare analysis and presentations that document insights and findings to drive the decision making process and communicate results to stakeholders and clients     Requirements     Qualifications     Deeply passionate about sustainability Intellectual curiosity and sense of humor Outstanding quantitative, critical thinking and problem solving skills Self-starter who will thrive in a start-up setting by taking ownership and initiative Decisive and action oriented who can get things done, make rapid decisions even when short of information, and has a high level of energy and stamina Advanced degree in economics, econometrics, statistics, math, or other applied quantitative fields.Candidates with a Bachelor’s degree and a strong record of success doing similar work will be considered Experience identifying, analyzing, and interpreting patterns and trends in complex data sets. Knowledge of tools such as Python or R are a must. SQL is a plus 2+ years of management experience in data-driven projects 5+ years of relevant work experience (e.g., working on data governance or data quality projects) are preferred Complete fluency in English (minimum C1)     Benefits     Our people are our main asset. We have built a unique team and we all share 3 differential aspects: Excellence, Passion and Values:     Our team comprises professionals from leading tech, consulting and banking firms, entrepreneurs, PhDs from top research institutions, and MBA graduates from top business schools Clarity’s Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur who has been recognized as one of the most distinguished leaders under the age of 40 by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum. Rebeca is joined by an excellent leadership team coming from diverse backgrounds, countries and experiences     We are different. We work hard to become the best place to work and pride ourselves on our culture:     Fact based: Promoting objective, fact-based and solution-oriented discussions Diverse: Encouraging diversity of personalities, cultures and experiences Transparent: Communicating feedback transparently, constructively and in real-time Meritocratic: Striving for excellence and rewarding the best Flexible: Working flexibly in the broadest sense (schedule, location, vacation, styles)     Clarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. Thats why we created our own ERG groups.     Our own ERG groups act as a voluntary employee resource group, they commit to promoting these values and creating a safe and supportive community for all employees. They are committed to creating a workplace that champions sustainability, diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI).     To do this, they will advocate for sustainability initiatives, host and participate in events, workshops, provide a safe space for employees to share their experiences, ideas, and solutions, and collaborate with other departments and employee groups to improve the company's sustainability goals.     By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.     We care about our employees and think they deserve the best.     ESOP/ Phantom stock: We want our employees to really feel part of Clarity. That’s why we give them the opportunity to participate in our success with ESOP or phantom stock options Training budget: Continued learning is important to us so we provide everyone with a yearly training budget Additional benefits are available depending on your location     We are a US company with a UK and Spanish subsidiary. We have offices in New York City, London and Madrid and have possibilities for remote working for many of our roles.     Clarity has received several awards:     Fast Company - Most Innovative Companies 2023 WEF, Young Global Leader - Rebeca Minguela Forrester New Wave Leader 2022 European Commission | EU Seal of Excellence 2020 World Economic Forum - Technology Pioneer 2020     Privacy Policy     Responsibility: Clarity AI Inc. 160 Greentree Drive, Suite 101, City of Dover, County of Kent, Delaware 19904, United States.     Purpose: management of selection processes for new employees.     Legitimation: necessary processing for contract execution.     Recipients: company of the Clarity Group in the country that would carry out the contract or where position is being offered.     Rights: the interested party may exercise the rights of access, rectification, opposition, limitation, suppression, portability and not to be the object of automated decisions according to the Privacy Policy.     More info: to consult the privacy policy in detail, click on the following link (Privacy Policy)

Title: HQ - VP of Data (EMEA Remote)
Description: Join us to work on the future of work: your next adventure awaits!     We are looking for a strong Data leader that will help us define and execute our Data Strategy, as we pivot from being an operations driven company to a technology driven one. This is a great opportunity if you are looking for a challenging and inspiring new role, which will pivotal in helpings us improve the lives of essential workers globally.     Responsabilities     Develop and implement the overall Data strategy for the company, working closely with the CTO and other tech and business unit leaders Oversee and coordinate the work of Data Analytics, Engineering, and Science teams, ensuring that all projects are delivered on time, within budget and meet quality standards Lead the implementation of the company Data Governance infrastructure, creating and maintaining policies, procedures, and best practices that govern Data acquisition, storage, management, monitoring, analysis and dissemination Lead the analytical Data aArchitecture from a strategic and technical perspective, and promote a strong data culture within the company Lead the Data Science initiatives that make Jobandtalent a unique and extremely powerful product Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in the Data space, and make recommendations for how the company can leverage these trends to improve its Data capabilities     You have     15+ years of experience in Data Engineering roles, including 6+ years in a senior leadership position Deep technical knowledge of Data architecture (event store and stream-processing platform, SQL and NoSQL databases, data transformations, data storage, etc.) Strong expertise in Data Analytics infrastructure (data integrations, orchestrators, data modelling, bi-tools) Proven experience leading and managing large, complex Data projects and teams, including experience with high-scalability Data platforms and tools Proven experience setting up Data Governance practices – solid understanding of data quality, security, and privacy best practices Good understanding of industry-specific data regulations and certifications, such as GDPR Great leadership and communication skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate teams to deliver high-quality work     Nice if you also have…     Good understanding of Data Science concepts (regression/classification, supervised/unsupervised) and MLOps practices (deploying models to production, versioning, monitoring, keeping them up-to-date) Data migration – AWS DMS, Stitch, Fivetran, Meltano Event streaming – Kafka, RabbitMQ, Kinesis Data format – Hudi, Iceberg, Parquet Data warehouses – Redshift & Redshift Spectrum, Snowflake Data Lakes – AWS S3, Glue Data Catalog Data transformation – Airflow, dbt Data Observability/Catalog – Monte Carlo, DataHub, Amundsen Databases – Postgresql, Redis, Elasticsearch MLOps – DVC, Spark, MLFlow, AWS Sagemaker, Feast, Hopsworks AI – TensorFlow, OpenAI, XGBoost Analytics – Metabase, Superset, Looke     What We’re About     At Job&Talent, we're revolutionising the employment market globally. We're headquartered in sunny Madrid, but we're a remote-first company operating in 10 countries across Europe, the United States and Latin America.     But there’s a missing piece. You.     Join our community     If you’re looking for a company that values innovation, high standards and data, you’ve found it. We’re also good listeners, because everyone’s voice is heard at Job&Talent. These values help us make good decisions and keep momentum. That’s how we operate. Standard.     When it comes to our people, we’re all uniquely different. And it’s that difference that makes us stronger.     We encourage everyone to bring their true selves to work. Being real and empathic means we can build better products, services and workplaces for our workers and our clients. And dare we say it, we think that makes us all happier humans.     What’s In It For You     We're building the world’s leading digital marketplace for essential work. You’ll hear 10x experience, AI, technology and human-centred design quite a lot. We strive for that across the entire company, from finance, to supply, to product.     Make an impact through extreme ownership of the work you do. You create something and you help drive it forward. Description: Objective of the AC-JOB Test Position     Testing software like a pro Breaking code with each new flow Finding bugs and glitches fast Our skills are unsurpassed Automated API tests are used to check the functionality, reliability, and performance of an API. By sending requests and verifying responses, an automated API test ensures that the API can handle different input scenarios and behave correctly under different conditions. It saves time, reduces errors, and provides more complete coverage than manual testing.
