Title: Prácticas RRHH verano (teletrabajo o presencial)
Description: Aictina Consulting es una de las principales Agencias Europeas de contratación de profesionales de las TIC (Tecnologías de Información y Comunicaciones) reconocida por ofrecer a clientes y candidatos un servicio altamente profesional y de confianza.  Apostamos por la mejora continua y queremos incorporar un nuevo miembro en el equipo para que nos ayuda a mejorar y a seguir creciendo.  ¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?  Apoyo a los consultores de selección. Criba curricular Entrevistas telefónicas o vía skype, en español e inglés tanto para mercado nacional como internacional. Realizar el reclutamiento y selección de candidatos según las necesidades presentadas por nuestros clientes nacionales e internacionales. Gestión de BBDD Elaboración de los informes finales de los candidatos entrevistados, así como los informes de progresos de los procesos que tenga a cargo, y en los que apoye a los consultores de selección   ¿Qué perfil necesitamos?  Nivel alto de Castellano e Inglés Disponibilidad de horas de prácticas. (horario de mañanas durante el verano) Posibilidad de hacer prácticas de lunes a viernes (media jornada) Posibilidad de realizar convenio con el centro de estudios.   ¿Qué valoramos?  Pasión por RRHH y las tecnologías Interés por aprender y por gestionar procesos del área. Capacidad comunicativa oral, escrita y de redacción. Alto nivel de responsabilidad, implicación, proactividad y capacidad resolutiva.   ¿Qué te ofrecemos?  Tipo de puesto: Beca / prácticas Titulación: Grado en ADE, Psicología o similar y cursando Máster o Postgrado Prácticas curriculares (no remuneradas) Formar parte de un equipo joven y dinámico Oficina localizada en Barcelona (junto a metro Vallcarca) y teletrabajo   NOTA 1: las prácticas son prácticas formativas (curriculares) no remuneradas de unas 300h. A su finalización se podrían realizar prácticas extracurriculares remuneradas o contrato.  NOTA 2: Para estas vacantes sólo podremos considerar a candidatos que tengan permiso de trabajo vigente y en regla, o bien nacionalidad española o de la Unión Europea.  Requisitos:  ¿Qué perfil necesitamos?  Nivel alto de Castellano e Inglés Disponibilidad de horas de prácticas. (horario de mañanas idealmente) Posibilidad de hacer prácticas de lunes a viernes (media jornada) Posibilidad de realizar convenio con el centro de estudios.   ¿Qué valoramos?  Pasión por RRHH y las tecnologías Interés por aprender y por gestionar procesos del área. Capacidad comunicativa oral, escrita y de redacción. Alto nivel de responsabilidad, implicación, proactividad y capacidad resolutiva.

Title: React Developer
Description: En Flat 101 necesitamos ampliar nuestro equipo de desarrollo Front end y buscamos un perfil con experiencia en REACT JS.     ¿Qué es Flat 101?     Flat 101 es la empresa española de referencia en optimización (CRO/CXO/BXO), diseño y desarrollo de productos y servicios digitales. Prestamos servicios de alto rendimiento digital orientados a solucionar los problemas de hoy para conseguir los resultados del mañana.     Nuestro objetivo es revolucionar los productos, servicios y negocios digitales con elegancia y calidad. Y todo ello con un método de trabajo propio contrastado en base a años de trabajo.     Requisitos:     ¿Qué buscamos?     Formación: Ingeniería o Grado Ingeniería Informática, ciclo formativo de Grado Superior Al menos un año de experiencia trabajando con ReactJS. Experiencia con el Stack MERN. Conocimientos de maquetación responsive HTML5 y CSS (SASS, LESS) Experiencia trabajando con GIT Con habilidades para trabajar en equipo y ganas de aprender.     Se valorará positivamente:     Inglés fluido en conversación Experiencia trabajando con Docker Conocimientos de GraphQL Experiencia con herramientas de testing FrontEnd (Jest, Mocha, Cypress) Conocimiento de AB testing     ¿Por qué nosotros? Esto podemos ofrecerte en Flat 101:     Contrato indefinido. 12 pagas. 27 días laborables de vacaciones al año. Modelo de trabajo híbrido, flexible y con posibilidad de teletrabajo al 100%. Tenemos teletrabajo, tenemos presencialidad, tenemos formatos híbridos... tenemos de todo. Si trabajas en una ciudad donde tenemos oficina el formato es híbrido (2 días de oficina presenciales con todas las medidas de seguridad y 3 de remoto). ¿Vives fuera? 100% teletrabajo. ¿Vives en una ciudad con oficinas pero quieres ir todos los días o teletrabajar al 100%? Pídelo y se te concederá. En el caso de desarrollo de negocio es necesario tener contacto personal con clientes y posibles clientes y ello puede condicionar tu agenda. Jornada intensiva todo el año y reducida en verano Incorporarte a una empresa que comenzó en 2013 con 5 personas y que ahora mismo está compuesta por más de 250, creciendo de manera orgánica en base a reputación, buen trabajo y calidad de trato, con un plan estratégico definido para crecer de manera sana, sostenible y con cabeza. Unirte a un equipo humano que realmente cree en esos valores que se leen tanto pero que tan poca gente aplica: respeto, amor por el detalle, cuidado en el hacer las cosas, invertir mimo y cariño en los proyectos, diversidad, ética, inclusión. Participar en nuestros estudios, publicaciones, eventos y whitepapers Conciliación familiar Ser parte de un equipo que realmente quiere ser el mejor que pueda ser. Queremos ser los líderes en cada disciplina que trabajamos Un ambiente que seguramente no habrás experimentado nunca. Pero claro, esto solo puedes saberlo cuando estés dentro. Asistencia a formaciones y eventos internos y externos Formar parte de un equipo referente en todas las disciplinas digitales que trabajamos. Posibilidades reales de mejora y promoción Trabajar en proyectos nacionales e internacionales. Todo el mundo lo dice, pero aquí es cierto. Actualmente tenemos clientes en México, Rumanía, Croacia, UK, Italia, USA, etc. Una filosofía de trabajo basada en poner cariño a los proyectos y honestidad en nuestras relaciones profesionales. No somos una factoría, y no queremos serlo. Creemos y practicamos la filosofía Open Books. ¿Eso qué es? Básicamente, desde dirección compartimos datos de negocio de la empresa de forma transparente e involucramos a todas las personas en las decisiones importantes que debemos tomar, como adopción de jornadas laborales nuevas, formatos de trabajo, ideas de crecimiento, etc, y contamos de manera clara cual es nuestra situación en el mercado, estado de clientes ganados y perdidos, relación con competidores... Continuo aprendizaje Plan de mejora y carrera personalizado con evaluación anual. Cada año aprenderás cosas nuevas, mejorarás en tus habilidades y tu carrera puede evolucionar de muchas formas dentro de la compañía, satisfaciendo tus necesidades de crecimiento profesional y persnal. Acceso a formación especializada diseñada exclusivamente para Flat 101 Visibilidad profesional. Entorno laboral inclusivo y diverso. Somos una empresa que cree en la ética y en la responsabilidad en sus proyectos. Perks adicionales: seguro médico, flexibilidad horaria, asistencia a eventos, retribución flexible, descuentos para empleados, etc...     Somos una empresa construida en torno a las personas que la forman, donde de forma cotidiana se escucha a todo el equipo para la toma de decisiones corporativas. Queremos construir y consolidar la mejor empresa posible y ser una referencia a nivel profesional, humano y ético... y nos encantaría contar contigo, ¿te apuntas?

Title: Product Manager
Description: Grupo Aire somos un grupo de empresas de telecomunicaciones en pleno crecimiento con presencia en toda Iberia. Ofrecemos soluciones de: conectividad, telefonía fija y móvil, contenido audiovisual, cloud y data center. Estamos en plena expansión y queremos reforzar nuestros equipos.     Buscamos un/a Product Manager de servicios tecnológicos para Grupo Aire, quién tendrá como objetivo responsabilizarse de la organización de los servicios de la compañía.     Funciones     Entender toda la amalgama de servicios y dar visión más estratégica y de cliente Estudiar y darle sentido a los productos tecnológicos dentro de Grupo Aire. Responsabilizarse de esta organización, el cómo se va a hacer y qué se necesita para llegar a los objetivos deseados Desarrollo de negocio del producto Impulsar las ventas en los distintos canales comerciales     Requisitos de formación y experiencia     Estudios afines (ingenierías, estudios técnicos, etc.) Amplia experiencia en posición similar Conocimientos de oferta y demanda del sector telecomunicaciones actualmente Buen entendimiento del negocio     Ofrecemos     Jornada completa Contrato indefinido Importante paquete retributivo Modalidad híbrida (dependiendo de ubicación posibilidad remoto) Jornada intensiva verano 23 días hábiles de vacaciones anuales Plan de carrera: ofrecemos una atractiva carrera profesional en función de la experiencia y potencial personal dentro de una compañía en continua evolución y con sólido crecimiento Formación continua Club Descuentos Aire (Principales marcas moda, viajes, entretenimiento, hostelería, motor, electrónica) Team buildings y experiencias empleado ¡Muy buen ambiente de trabajo!

Title: Envíanos tu CV
Description: Luxe Talent es una consultoría internacional de selección y formación de personal con sedes en Barcelona, Madrid, París, Turín, Braga y Ámsterdam, con más de 14 años en el mercado.  En Luxe Talent disponemos de nuevas ofertas de empleo cada día, ¿no has encontrado ninguna vacante que encaje con tu perfil?  Requisitos:  Envíanos tu CV actualizado y lo conservaremos en nuestra base de datos. De esta manera, podremos considerar tu candidatura para futuros procesos que se adapten mejor a tus habilidades y experiencia profesional.
Industry: Industria textil y moda para la venta minorista

Title: QA (diseño de pruebas+agile+automatización de pruebas) (TELETRABAJO)
Description: En Krell Consulting estamos solicitamos un QA (diseño de pruebas+agile+automatización de pruebas) con al menos 2 años de experiencia en programación de software (phyton) y realización de pruebas en proyectos bajo metodología agile (Scrum, Kanban...), mantenimiento de historias de usuario, pruebas funcionales, automatización de pruebas funcionales (Selenium), pruebas de APIs (Postman, Newman...) en proyectos con equipos multidisciplinares utilizando BDD (Gherkin, Cucumber).     El trabajo se realizará en remoto, no es necesario que el trabajador esté en las oficinas de Madrid. FORMACION: Se impartirá una capacitación inicial de 5 días.     SBA 32.000€     ¡Te estamos esperando! Inscríbete y da un salto en tu carrera!

Title: HQ - Engineering Director (EMEA Remote)
Description: Join us to work on the future of work: your next adventure awaits!     Responsibilities     Lead a vital engineering organization of 40-70 professionals, made up of Engineering Managers, Tech Leaders and individual contributors (Backend, Front End, Mobile) Responsible for building a complex multi-country product that can scale to 160 countries Handle a system that performs billions of $ transactions Owner of the E2E execution of all the teams: architecture, code, QA, code review, production deployment, and monitoring Implement necessary processes to achieve Delivery Speed, Quality and Value of your domain Be part of the top engineering management team shaping the engineering DNA Hire and mentor top-talent tech professionals     Requirements     At least 12 years of overall experience with tech product engineering At least 3 years leading an engineering organisation of at least 30 professionals developing the core features/services of a B2C or B2B2C company At least 3 years experience with large-scale distributed systems of more than 1M users in production using microservices/service-oriented architecture At least 5 years of hands-on backend engineering experience with JVM Languages, C#, or C++ in the career.     What We’re About     At Job&Talent, we're revolutionising the employment market globally. Our mission is simple and clear. We’re empowering the people who do essential work - from delivery drivers and warehouse workers, to cooks and cleaners - to get work and get paid on their terms.     We match these people with companies we’ve verified through our powerful tech platform. Apps, AI, web-based tools, innovative matching solutions and more. We create seriously smart technology, made for humans, by humans.     And the numbers show we're doing things right. 340,000 people got work with over 2,500 companies globally last year, with clients spanning industries from logistics to retail, hospitality and more. We generated €1.9 billion in revenue in 2022. And we’re grateful to our top tier investors at Atomico, Kinnevik and Softbank.     We're headquartered in sunny Madrid, but we're a remote-first company operating in 10 countries across Europe, the United States and Latin America.     But there’s a missing piece. You.     Join our community     If you’re looking for a company that values innovation, high standards and data, you’ve found it. We’re also good listeners, because everyone’s voice is heard at Job&Talent. These values help us make good decisions and keep momentum. That’s how we operate. Standard.     When it comes to our people, we’re all uniquely different. And it’s that difference that makes us stronger.     We encourage everyone to bring their true selves to work. Being real and empathic means we can build better products, services and workplaces for our workers and our clients. And dare we say it, we think that makes us all happier humans.     What’s In It For You     We're building the world’s leading digital marketplace for essential work. You’ll hear 10x experience, AI, technology and human-centred design quite a lot. We strive for that across the entire company, from finance, to supply, to product.     Make an impact through extreme ownership of the work you do. You create something and you help drive it forward. At Job&Talent, you’ll make an impact across borders with cross-functional teams, wherever you are.     Be rewarded financially. It’s ingrained into our company philosophy. We offer our employees competitive salaries and benefits. Our Talent team can tell you a lot more about the perks in your region.     Grow professionally by doing, not just watching or talking. We’re completely hands-on and we’re bootstrappers, making the most of our resources. And don’t be surprised to find yourself on a call with one of our founders. They like the details as much as the big picture.     Proud to champion equality     At Job&Talent we value diversity and we're an Equal Opportunities employer. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified people regardless of race, disability, religious beliefs or sexual orientation. Come join us. We look forward to your application.

Title: Community Manager
Description: XpeedStudio, a household name in the tech sphere of Bangladesh, was founded in 2013 by Ataur R with a pledge to innovate and bring groundbreaking results. Specializing in AI, Machine Learning, SaaS, and Mobile Applications, XpeedStudio strives to produce high-quality, user-friendly, and next-gen web solutions for people worldwide.     We feel proud to have served over 10 million happy users, including small to large businesses, enterprises, eCommerce, and personal websites. PHP, ReactJS, NodeJS, OpenAI GPT-3, Google NLP, Docker, Ionic, and PuppeteerJs are some of the programming languages, frameworks, libraries, and models we use across all technological frontiers & innovation of our products. Our versatile product line includes prominent tools like ElementsKit, ShopEngine, GetGenie, Metform and Wp Social — dominating multiple industries like WordPress, SaaS, and many more!     The Role     You Will Be Responsible For     Defining and developing a community management strategy. Organising various community building initiatives to cultivate and grow participation in community forums. Monitoring and optimising community engagement levels.     Ideal Profile     You have at least 1 year experience ideally in Community Manager within IT industry. Experience within would be a strong advantage. You are a strong networker & relationship builder You are a strong team player who can manage multiple stakeholders You possess strong analytical skills and are comfortable dealing with numerical data     What's on Offer?     Opportunity in an established company in the SaaS and WordPress space Flexible working options from anywhere around the world Fantastic work culture

Title: Order Routing Product Manager - ML experience (Riga, Tallinn or remote within EMEA)
Description: The Company     James Berdigans, CEO of Printify:     “Our mission is to build a platform that lets anyone, anywhere unlock their own personal freedom. The freedom to generate income, be your own boss and set your schedule. So far we’ve seen more than 6 million people sign up to start their own eCommerce businesses with Printify. Because every order is made on-demand, there’s no risk to getting started, just a reward for putting in the work. Our aim is to put this power to build a business into the hands of every person who wants to create their own business.”     On September 9th, 2021, Printify announced that it has secured $50M in Series A funding led by Index Ventures, with participation from H&M Group, Virgin Group, founders of leading technology companies Wise, Vinted, Squarespace, RedHat, and entertainment industry investors such as Will Smith’s Dreamers VC.     Printify will use this investment to further expand its marketplace and to hire the best talents available around the world.     The Team     Printify’s product team owns a portfolio of products ranging from merchant and print provider facing to internal technical support. We use the best product management practices to deliver products that customers love. We can proudly say that we are a highly data-driven, customer-centric product organization.     The Role     Product managers at Printify are the essential drivers for our product vision and strategy and aim at delivering high-value solutions for both merchants & print providers. Product managers connect the technical and business worlds. They work closely with engineers, designers, data scientists, researchers and business leaders to build products and guide them throughout the execution cycle, building, positioning, and tailoring our solutions to our users.     Your responsibilities     Define and execute a multi­-year product vision and strategy while balancing short­ and long­-term goals Facilitate timely decision-making across a broad network of internal and external stakeholders Coordinate and motivate a team of engineers and other cross-functional representatives while maintaining team health Make appropriate trade-offs between business and technical constraints, clearly communicating goals, roles, and responsibilities Frequently identify significant product, organizational, and process opportunities and drive them to production, without the need for explicit direction Incorporate data, research, and market analysis to inform product strategies and roadmaps Decide on impactful high-level business metrics   Minimum Qualifications     Experience working with a product that utilized machine learning Experience working closely with data scientists Extended experience with product management Track record for delivering quality products on time Experience in going through an entire product lifecycle, integrating customer feedback into product requirements, driving prioritization and pre/post-launch execution      Preferred Qualifications     Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field Background in data analytics or data science Experience with supply chain optimization Passion for understanding complex problems and driving high-quality and innovative technical solutions Excellent quantitative problem-solving and analytical skills Ability to quickly absorb technical concepts and communicate them to a non-technical audience Experience working in or with eCommerce or online marketplace companies Experience working with a diverse team of engineers, product managers, data analysts, and senior leaders Excellent written & spoken communication skills in English   What we offer     Stock options so you own a part of Printify Opportunity to work fully remote within EMEA time zones Work from anywhere - our Printify Houses in Riga or Tallinn, your remote home office, or a co-working hub Start your workday anywhere between 7 AM and 11 AM. As long as the job is done and you’re happy and healthy, you can adapt your workflow Apple MacBook laptop as your standard work equipment, covered by Printify International relocation support for international candidates who wish to work in Riga or Tallinn Access to mentorship, internal meetups, and hackathons both on-site and online A learning budget for your professional development based on a position level and access to our book library Health insurance or health insurance budget depending on your location and contract type Paid health days whenever you need them without a doctor's note depending on your contract type Extra paid days off for wellbeing as well as a celebration day of your choosing Access to the in-house gym or gym allowance depending on your location and contract type   Joining Printify means joining an international company with an amazing team that has grown to over 500 people. At Printify, people from over 20 nationalities and with many different backgrounds are working together in our Riga office and around the world.     We play to win together, and we always strive for excellence. We want to achieve great things and make a meaningful change in our customers’ lives. Our customers are our most important asset and our compass in showing us the direction to go. We value a strong learning culture and are united by a growth mindset.     Words from our investors:     Richard Branson, Founder of the Virgin Group: “Entrepreneurial spirit runs through the Virgin Group, which is why I’m proud to support Printify. Both Printify’s vision and success story to date embed this special entrepreneurial spirit, which in turn has created a rapidly growing and robust e-commerce platform. Printify’s unique proposition helps people market their brands through customizable products, with no upfront investment. We’re excited to support its growth in the coming years.”     Elise Fahlen, Investment Manager at H&M CO:LAB: “With the world experiencing rapid growth in on-demand services, H&M Group is thrilled to have invested in Printify and the team behind it. The execution of the founder’s vision and their impressive success to date speaks not only to the scalability of the product but also in their ability to be a long-standing industry leader in this space.”     Dino Becirovic, Principal at Index Ventures: "Printify is the leading marketplace for on-demand manufacturing, offering the largest selection of products and print providers. They have removed all the barriers to product creation and enabled over 2 million creators to launch successful merchandise businesses at the push of a button. Over time, as more manufacturers come online and more methods become available, Printify will allow any creator to bring their wildest product ideas to reality.”
Industry: Transporte, logística, cadena de suministro y almacenamiento

Title: Junior Analytics Engineer
Description: What Is Exoticca     Exoticca was founded in 2013 by a team of travel visionaries with deep knowledge in the creation and online distribution of multi-day tour packages. Our mission is to offer our clients the possibility to visit the most beautiful and stimulating places on our planet, through the best holiday packages, at unbelievable prices. Our customers can find out more about our trips and book them instantly in a matter of minutes through our website, avoiding the usual long exchanges of email, meetings, or calls required by more traditional travel agencies, which makes us the most convenient way of booking a multi-day tour package.     At Exoticca we are looking for people who want to offer their best to create unforgettable experiences for our customers. We are a young, dynamic, multicultural team of around +350 people, in rapid international growth, seeking for new partners to help us create the best and most forward-thinking travel company of our generation.     We are a highly ambitious and well-balanced start-up, backed by top national and international investors that have also participated in the growth of other success stories, such as Skype, Wallapop, Glovo, Wix, Idealista, among others.     What about the Data team?     At Exoticca, we believe Data is the main responsible for making data essential in key decision making across the whole organization. We capture vast amounts of data from multiple customer touch points, spanning from consideration and booking to pre-travel, travel, and post-travel. Combined with our customer-centric approach, we believe that our data-driven culture is the key to delivering unparalleled products & services that wow our customers and create unforgettable experiences to be remembered for a lifetime.     In order to achieve such ambitious goals, our Data team works together with other departments, such as Marketing, Product, Travel, Sales or Customer Success, to uncover the most valuable insights our data can deliver, and convert them into actual company initiatives, business decisions, or product features. There are myriad opportunities for using data to grow sales, increase customer satisfaction, optimize & automate processes, and much more. We can’t wait to have you on board!     Join us as a Junior Analytics Engineer, based in our city center Barcelona offices and with the possibility to work remotely in this “new normal” lifestyle.     Which will be your main responsibilities:     Using basic knowledge, with direct supervision, provide analytics support to deliver market insights to internal/external business clients:     To extract and analyze data from the database using SQL. To be in touch with business partner To be in touch with our data warehouse To have a coast-to-coast data vision in a modern data stack     Requirements     SQL/Python and academic experience with coding assignments Visual techniques for data analysis and presentation Fluency in English     Skills:     Collaborative, committed, and team-oriented work ethic Authentic, fun, curious, and highly eager to learn and improve constantly at a personal and professional level     Benefits     We propose the use of flexible compensation management for diet, transportation, private health insurance wit Cobee 30% of your time will be spent on improving your skills Travel packages at reduced prices! Referral bonus, if you bring people as talented as you Unlimited coffee, team lunches, English lessons, quarterly activities, biannual parties And last but not least, becoming part of a fun and motivated multicultural team at an agile and rapid growing organization!     Exoticca is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusiveness are our core. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under European, country, or local law.
Function: Gestión y Tecnología de la información

Title: Ingeniero/a de Comunicaciones
Description: En Sothis estamos creciendo a pasos agigantados y tenemos una gran oportunidad para ti. ¡Abrimos vacante para incorporar a un/a Ingeniero/a de Comunicaciones en España!     ¿A qué nos dedicamos?     Estamos especializados en la implantación de soluciones integrales de tecnología.     ¿Cuáles serán tus funciones principales?     Realizarás la gestión y operación completa de elementos de red de diferentes tecnologías, protocolos y plataformas tecnológicas (routing, switching, seguridad, Wireless, etc.), y diferentes fabricantes.     También gestionarás la operación completa sobre Cisco Callmanager y Call Manager Express.     Por supuesto, te mantendrás en constante contacto e interlocución directa con clientes y fabricantes a nivel técnico detallado, y también diseñarás, configurarás e implementarás los proyectos de Networking.     Tendrás que realizar la documentación técnica (esquemas, informes, recomendaciones, etc.). Y llevarás a cabo el análisis, redacción y ejecución de puestas en marcha.     ¿Nos eliges?     Queremos contar contigo a largo plazo para que crezcas con nosotros/as (contrato indefinido) y te ofrecemos un plan de carrera profesional apoyado por las formaciones técnicas y de gestión necesarias para lograrlo.     Además, contarás con un paquete retributivo competitivo acorde a los conocimientos y experiencia aportados, jornada intensiva los meses de julio y agosto, y todos los viernes del año, formación en idiomas, y la posibilidad de acogerte al programa de retribución flexible: Ticket Guardería, Ticket restaurante, Ticket formación, Tarjeta transporte y Seguro Médico.     También tendrás acceso a descuentos en distintos establecimientos, productos y servicios simplemente por formar parte del equipo.     ¡Y muchas más cosas que queremos que conozcas!     Requisitos:     ¿Qué es lo que queremos de ti?     ¡Que tengas entusiasmo por unirte a nuestro proyecto! ¡Que seas una persona comprometida y con ilusión por afrontar nuevos retos! Y sobre todo, que te apasione tanto como a nosotros la tecnología.     ¿Qué talento necesitamos?     Solo te pedimos que cuentes con experiencia de al menos un año como ingeniero/a de redes y comunicaciones.     La formación mínima que requerimos es el Ciclo formativo de grado superior en Administración de Sistemas informáticos en Red o equivalente.     Necesitamos que ya hayas realizado despliegues de soluciones de capa 2, Switching LAN y Wifi y que cuentes con experiencia en centralitas y VozIP.     Nos encantaría que hayas tomado contacto directo con el cliente, y que tengas soltura redactando documentación... sabemos que es la parte menos atractiva, ¡pero todo cuenta para dar un servicio de diez! :)     ¿Algo más con lo que aportar valor?     ¡Claro! Valoramos muchas certificaciones en el proceso de selección: Fortinet NSE5, NSE6, Cisco CCNA, CCNP, Aruba ACxA, ACxP. Y conocimientos y experiencia con Aruba Central, Airwave, Clearpass, F5, Check Point…     ¿Te atreves con el reto? Inscríbete, ¡te estamos buscando!.     Desde SOTHIS queremos informar a todo interesado/a en nuestras ofertas de empleo que las únicas ofertas vigentes están publicadas en nuestra página web https://www.sothis.tech/portal-talento/, no debiendo confiar en portales que simplemente se limitan a agregar la información de nuestras ofertas con objeto recabar sus datos personales.

Title: Referente Social - Valencia
Description: ¿Estás buscando un proyecto de alto crecimiento personal/profesional y generando impacto con lo que haces?  Estamos buscando a un/a Referente Social para formar parte de uno de nuestros equipos en Qida. 🚀  Estarás Involucrado En La Primera Línea Del Desarrollo De Productos Para Conseguir Un Nuevo Modelo De Atención Domiciliaria Que  Fomente la prevención y el envejecimiento activo Permita mejorar la calidad de vida de las personas en casa Permita a QIDA crecer preservando e incluso aumentando la calidad en el servicio.  ¿Quiénes somos? 🌟  QIDA Es Una Start-up Privada y Social De Alto Crecimiento En El Sector De La Atención Domiciliaria, Fundada El 2018 Con Una Misión Social y Doble  Primero, queremos construir el servicio de atención domiciliaria de más calidad del mundo: experto, humano, centrado en la persona y utilizando las nuevas tecnologías; Segundo, queremos devolver el estatus social a los cuidadores y cuidadoras, pagándoles justamente y valorándoles como profesionales.  La visión de QIDA es hacer sostenible el sistema sanitario y social a escala global ayudando a las personas en situación de dependencia y/o cronicidad a vivir «Más tiempo, en Mejor estado de salud y Más calidad de vida en casa» (lo que nosotros le decimos «la triple M»).  QIDA está cambiando el mundo, siendo líder absoluto en calidad del sector (NPS de 4.8/5) y en tecnología. QIDA aporta un enfoque centrado en la atención personalizada en el domicilio basado en la tecnología, la calidad y el impacto social.  En Qida somos la primera empresa de nuestro sector en España en ser B Corp. Con este reconocimiento se evidencia que nos preocupamos por generar un impacto positivo en el cuidado de las personas mayores, además de que nuestros estándares en términos de desempeño social, transparencia y responsabilidad legal están en su más alto exponente.  QIDA elige no escoger entre impacto social y rentabilidad; QIDA persigue ambas cosas al mismo nivel. QIDA va a cambiar la vida de las personas con calidad, personalización y tecnología, con impacto económico y social.  ¿Cuál sería tu rol? 💻  Valoración física, cognitiva y social del caso vía remota o presencial según situación. Seguimiento del caso vía remota y/o presencial según la situación. Acompañar y ser la persona referente de la persona atendida. Gestión y activación de servicios asociados a la prevención y cuidado Atención a las familias y personas atendidas Orientación y acompañamiento así como detección de situaciones que requieran gestión que impliquen a la persona atendida y/o a la familia o entorno. Atención, comprensión y conocimiento de las necesidades de la persona y la familia en cada etapa de la prestación del servicio. Participación en los proyectos transversales, por ejemplo: creación y mejora del Plan de Atención Individual, creación y mejora de la formación interna, creación de contenido, intervención grupal u otros proyectos estratégicos que mejoren la calidad de vida de las personas en sus domicilios.  ¿Qué ofrecemos? 🤓  Contrato indefinido a jornada completa en un sector en crecimiento y dentro de un equipo que te ayudará a crecer profesionalmente. Modalidad de trabajo Full-remote 💻 Sesiones de feedback individuales con tu manager enfocadas en el desarrollo de talento 📈 Ambiente laboral de calidad 🤝 y ser parte de un equipo comprometido con los valores y cultura de empresa de impacto social. 23 días de vacaciones y día libre de cumpleaños 🌞 Aplicación de ahorro fiscal Cobee para gastos de comidas y transporte 💪 Activación de Payflow para anticipos de nóminas QidaDay: Dos veces por año nos reunimos con toda la empresa para recordar y celebrar nuestros logros, objetivos y valores 🍻💃  Requisitos  ¿A quién estamos buscando? 🔎  Grado en Psicología/ Trabajo Social/ Educación Social/ Terapia Ocupacional. Estar colegiado/a como profesional del sector Residir en la zona de Valencia. Experiencia previa de 2 años en el sector de la tercera edad/dependencia Alta capacidad de organización Alta capacidad de mediación y resolución de problemas Excelentes habilidades de comunicación Actitud emprendedora e iniciativa Disponibilidad de vehículo propio (valorable)  ﻿  Fecha de incorporación: 2/3 meses  ¿Estás interesado/a? 💪  ¡Inscríbete en nuestra oferta y ayúdanos a cambiar el mundo!  En Qida apostamos por la diversidad y por la creación de un equipo que represente los valores de la compañía, por ello, todas las decisiones que tomamos se basan en las competencias y habilidades de las personas. Valoramos su pasión por descubrir, reinventar y construir

Title: Property Manager
Description: EL candidato, cuya ubicación será la oficina principal de MVGM en Madrid, sería el responsable de la gestión de los inmuebles que le sean asignados. Controla la gestión operativa, y apoya la financiera del inmueble, supervisando todos los servicios, operaciones y funciones acordadas en el mandato de gestión firmado con el cliente:    Desarrollar e implementar el plan de gestión anual de cada inmueble    Supervisar el desarrollo y gestión del presupuesto operativo anual de cada inmueble    Revisar, controlar y facilitar al cliente informes mensuales, trimestrales y anuales financieros y operativos    Desarrollar e implementar programas innovadores, procedimientos o procesos que reduzcan tanto a corto como a largo plazo, los costes operativos del inmueble    Maximizar la relación con los proveedores y contratistas de preferencia y expandir la relación con nuevos prestadores de servicios para los activos    Coordinar con los diferentes proveedores y contratistas, la consecución de los objetivos establecidos    Optimizar la relación gestor – arrendatario – cliente    Asegurar el cumplimiento de lo estipulado en los contratos de arrendamiento    Priorizar y atender todas las demandas de cada inmueble y sus usuarios, tomando las medidas y/o acciones apropiadas en cada caso    Realizar visitas periódicas al inmueble, además de las necesarias en caso de problemas    Gestionar y fomentar la relación con el cliente    Asegurar el cumplimiento de los estándares de auditoria del cliente    Conocimientos requeridos:    Titulación Universitaria, (Diplomado o licenciado), preferentemente en Empresariales, ICADE, o ramas de Arquitectura y/o Ingeniería Nivel alto de Ingles Conocimiento general del sector inmobiliario Conocimientos técnicos generales de construcción y del funcionamiento y mantenimiento de los inmuebles Paquete office nivel avanzado, especialmente Excel  Conocimientos deseables:    Legislación relativa a los contratos de arrendamiento de inmuebles Gestión presupuestaria

Title: Product Designer (Webflow)
Description: Everything happens somewhere - which is why spatial analytics is fundamental to companies trying to understand the “where” and the “why” of their business. CARTO is the leading cloud-native location intelligence platform, trusted by data scientists, data analysts and developers from companies such as Vodafone, IKEA, Decathlon, Coca-Cola and Mastercard to provide geospatial insights for use cases such as site selection, geomarketing, route optimization, network planning and much more.     With an exceptionally diverse team of 170 people spread across the US and Europe, CARTO (backed by Insight Partners, Accel Partners, Salesforce Ventures, Earlybird Ventures, and Kibo Ventures, among others) is changing the way companies analyze location data - making it simple to do this straight out of modern, cloud data warehouses. Redefining its category, the company has grown rapidly in recent years providing a compelling alternative to legacy GIS software.     To continue this growth, the Product team is looking for a talented and experienced Product Designer, capable of providing and transforming mission-critical goals, insights on behavior, and user motivation into pleasurable, data-rich - but never data overwhelming - product interfaces and websites. We think that the practice of proper product design principles should feel like an excellent excuse to reach the outstanding. Consequently, as a Product Designer at CARTO, you will elaborate on your decisions and back brilliant execution with flawless logic and purpose.     The position is open to remote, but it’s also possible to work from our offices in Madrid or Seville.     You will     Create and maintain specifications, interface guidelines, and standards across the Marketing and Product teams Collaborate with the Marketing team to translate design concepts into interactive and responsive websites using Webflow Provide the Marketing team with graphics for marketing campaigns based on brand guidelines and specific project needs Be exposed and be able to shape the beautiful complexity of building map-making and data analysis interfaces, which is nothing short of breathtaking. If this does not get you going, nothing will Learn a lot about data and analytics, which is a necessity to do the job well Meet, discuss, and learn with and from a blended team of engineers, geographers, product managers, data scientists, marketers, designers, and other spatial data experts Help define the product, openly refuse to be at the end of the cascade, and inject yourself into research and problem-shaping activities. As a Product Designer, you will be finding the proper questions that provide actionable insights to your craft. Develop visual design concepts and systems that incorporate analytics and research into iterative design solutions   You offer     Proven professional experience using Figma, Webflow and Adobe, and a good understanding of their features, limitations and best practices. A strong design portfolio with relevant references built with the aforementioned tools to share with your application Bonus points for some experience with HTML/CSS Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment, effectively communicate ideas, and contribute to creative discussions Experience working in the marketing and design of digital B2B products, with at least 3 years experience in a studio or product design environment Your visual design skills are on point but are not just skin deep; you are also a conceptual thinker and hopefully an original one too Great layout and typographic skills You are also willing to construct and collaborate on the thinking originated by others You understand design as an ever evolving iterative processSome rapid prototyping experience will not hurt Experience with Design Systems Fluent in English, and with a good level of Spanish being ideal   We offer     A big vision: to help the world use location-based data to make better decisions. We believe that openness and sustainability are baked into this vision, and we’re sharing it with the world Contribute to a platform used by top companies around the world. Your work will have a direct impact on our users and clients Competitive, results-based compensation Access to our employee stock options plan Private medical insurance Flexible work hours in a focused but casual environment Education stipend Remote work stipend Flexible compensation English classes   To apply     Do you feel that you don't check all of the requirements? At CARTO we believe that professional development happens through teaching and learning from your peers and managers. Even if you’re uncertain about whether you have the experience we’re looking for, please apply if this position sparks your curiosity.     A diversity of identity, perspective, and experience makes us stronger. We welcome you to apply to CARTO regardless of your background, age, gender, ethnicity, orientation, or ability.     To learn more about us, please visit our blog or follow us on Twitter (@carto) or Instagram (@cartohq).     Not the right job for you? Take a look at the rest of our openings at carto.com/careers

Title: Spain Senior Business Development Manager
Description: About us:     Asksuite is a SaaS technology company that developed the first AI booking assistant and omnichannel hotel service platform, becoming a four-time global award winner in the hospitality/tourism industry. Our AI is available 24/7 and communicates in several languages. We have more than 3,100 customers in +50 countries (and growing).     Our multicultural team is composed of more than 100 talented professionals spread across the globe. If you’re interested in learning and growing fast with us, you’re in the right place!!     In this role you will:     Be responsible for the entire sales funnel, from prospecting new opportunities with focus in acquiring new customers, to negotiations and closing deals; Execute business development activities, interacting with prospects by telephone, email and social media; Identify and qualify new sales opportunities (inbound and outbound); Present our solution with a focus on the prospect's needs and opportunities; Prepare and submit proposals according to the profile of each potential customer; Negotiate prices, contract and payment terms to close new customers; Maintain an up-to-date CRM, fully controlling your process and reaching individual goals; Analyze and improve your own results continually to help the team reach the KPI results.     You’ll be great at it if:     You possess strong development and negotiation skills; You've proven a high performance and target achievement track record; You’re highly communicative and enjoy talking with people from several cultures; You’re self-motivated and driven by challenges; You’re able to work independently and as a team in a fast-paced environment; You’re excited to always learn more; You’re focused on metrics and closing deals. Minimum 2 years of experience as Inside Sales, Closer or Business Development Manager in SaaS Companies (Software as a Service); Strong and professional communication skills - written, verbal, presentation; Fluent Spanish and English; Available to work 40 hours per week.     Nice-to-have:     Previous experience in SaaS SMB market;     Previous Business Development Representative successful experience;     Previews Inside Sales Representative successful experience;     Previous experience in the hospitality market.     What do we love about Asksuite?     3rd Best Place to Work in 2023 by Hotel Tech Report; Flexible work schedule; No dress code; Feedback culture; Multicultural and inclusive environment; Ever-increasing career growth opportunities.     Apply today to join us on this journey!

Title: Senior Buyer
Description: Who we are:     Wikifarmer is a global platform with the mission of empowering farmers by educating them and offering them access to the open market to sell their products at fair prices.     The Problem We Are Solving:     Most farmers in the world still cultivate their fields with techniques learned from experience or taught by their ancestors, leading to non-optimum practices in terms of yield and regard to the environmental impact.     Farmers produce the most valuable part of the food supply chain, but they are the ones getting the least value out of it.     How we are fixing this:     Wikifarmer is building both an educational platform and a digital Marketplace. On one side of our Platform, producers can tap into and update their agricultural knowledge and practices and on the other side they can upload their products for free, gaining immediate and direct access to domestic and international markets.     What we are looking for:     Having recently secured a new round of funding from Point Nine (Revolut, Delivery Hero, Typeform) we are starting to build our core team - central to those hires will be a Senior Buyer for our Marketplace.     Job Duties and Responsibilities:     The Senior Buyer will be responsible for developing and executing purchasing strategies, negotiating deals, and managing vendor relationships within the food industry across the Mediterranean region (producers, agricultural cooperatives and packing houses), specifically in fresh fruit and vegetables and olive oils.     Develop, lead and execute purchasing strategies, both domestic and international Increase the depth of suppliers on specific products across all countries (Mediterranean) Negotiation, closing deals with optimal terms Create strong relationships with existing and new suppliers Identify and partner with new suppliers in completely new categories Manage potential claims coming from customers Assess, manage, and mitigate risk Manage and ensure quality together with the quality department Work closely with sales teams to match demand with supply Provide insights on potential price fluctuations per product     Requirements:     Solid experience (6+ years) purchasing fruit and vegetables from producers across the Mediterranean region. Olive oil experience is a huge bonus Excellent negotiation and networking skills Proven experience building strong working relationships with both existing and new producers Tech savvy, we are digitalising this industry and we need to be ahead of the curve The ideal candidate with also have quality control experience Business fluency in English as well as Spanish, Italian or both Leadership skills - we are always looking for our future leaders as we grow the business You must be located in either Spain or Italy     What we offer:     24 days annual leave plus bank holidays Fixed salary (€45k - €70k depending on location and experience) plus a bonus scheme for successful deals Car allowance Equity Private Medical Insurance L&D budget We are an early startup which is going places and you can make an immediate impact Transparency and Collaboration please submit your CV in English

Title: HR Manager/HR Business Partner
Description: HR Manager / HR Business Partner     Lev Haolam is an Israeli company that supports small and medium businesses in disputed territories of Israel through a subscription service for unique products from Israel and an online store. Our international team of specialists works tirelessly to create opportunities for the development of Israel. At Lev Haolam, we value efficiency, openness to innovation, and offer a chance to make a significant impact on the company's growth and our clients.     We have a young and ambitious team spread across 10 countries. English and Russian are our primary languages of communication.     We're currently seeking an experienced HR manager/HRBP to join our team and help drive our growth. While we've already made progress, the pace is accelerating, and we need someone to guide us in establishing streamlined and dynamic processes for our exceptional team.     In this role, you will:     Establish HR processes encompassing recruitment and onboarding, training and development, performance evaluation, motivation systems, and internal communications. Adapt the organizational structure to accommodate our rapid company growth. Recruit and hire employees by developing job profiles, defining recruitment strategies, conducting interviews and competency assessments, negotiating offers, and handling documentation. Analyze the labor market in Israel, CIS, and the USA to devise effective staffing strategies. Facilitate the seamless adaptation of new employees by creating adaptation plans with managers, monitoring their progress, and assisting in addressing any challenges. Develop both tangible and intangible motivation programs to inspire our team. Organize engaging events to foster employee engagement and shape our corporate culture. Establish a unified HR information system and oversee personnel administration. Formulate HR policies that cater to the unique requirements of our distributed teams. Regularly communicate with the team, identify and address personal and professional concerns, and identify areas for growth and development.     What we expect from candidates:     A minimum of 2 years of experience in a similar position. A bachelor's degree in a relevant field (personnel management, psychology). Demonstrated experience in building HR functions. Proven track record of implementing impactful changes in HR processes. Experience working with distributed teams and a solid understanding of the nuances of developing HR policies in such environments. Practical expertise in global talent acquisition within the IT and Marketing domains, including executive-level positions. Proficiency in developing motivation programs tied to Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). Strong background in internal communications and developing the HR brand. Fluent spoken and written proficiency in Russian and English. Interviews will be conducted in English for 50% of the process. Knowledge of Hebrew is a plus.     We offer:     International company with a focus on the US market Opportunities for professional growth and performance-based income growth Competitive compensation in USD Service agreement (requires individual entrepreneurship or self-employment status) Fully remote work format     Powered by JazzHR     fvDDOqkCRL

Title: PROGRAMADOR REACT 100% REMOTO
Description: para conquistar tus metas, y ten siempre presente disfrutar del camino.     Actualmente nos encontramos en búsqueda de un perfil para cubrir el rol de PROGRAMADOR FRONTEND REACT para proyecto 100% REMOTO     REQUISITOS IMPRESCINDIBLES:     A partir de 3 años de experiencia en React y Redux Test unitarios con Jest Experiencia en CI/CD con Jenkins/Sonar     CONDICIONES:     Contratación indefinida por Irium con posibilidad de pasar a plantilla cliente.     Modalidad de trabajo: 100% Remoto.     Salario: Entre 30k y 42k según valía y posición.     Retribución flexible: tickets restaurant, seguro médico y tickets guardería.     Acceso ilimitado a formación tecnológica puntera en modalidad barra libre.     IRIUM es una empresa formada por profesionales con inquietudes, dinámicos y resolutivos. Nuestros valores son la responsabilidad y el compromiso con el trabajo bien hecho, este es el espíritu que buscamos en IRIUM, sea cual sea tu edad, si te reconoces ¡esta es tu empresa!     Podemos construir juntos el futuro. ¿Hablamos?     Powered by JazzHR     6G8GRHINJZ

Title: Marketing Project Manager (Remote or Barcelona based)
Description: About us:     We are a thriving international company in the eCommerce space. We’re unique in what we do, offering employees a balance between the stability of a larger organisation while maintaining our culture of an innovative, leading-edge startup. Apply today, become a vital part of our tomorrow.     We have offices in Europe (Spain, Cyprus, Georgia & the Ukraine), United States & Canada.     Get a buzz off of the latest Marketing trends? Obsessed with the latest best practices? Are you a great project manager that has an eye for detail? Want your hard work to have a positive impact on what the company does? If so, this is the job for you! We are looking for an enthusiastic Project Manager to join our marketing dream team. The chosen candidate will take responsibility for planning/executing marketing activities in order to develop and maintain awareness of the brand, maximise revenues and drive traffic.     Marketing Specialist Responsibilities:     Support marketing managers in managing integrated marketing campaigns across both offline and online tactics. Assist in outbound or inbound marketing activities by demonstrating expertise in various areas (content development and optimization, advertising, events planning, etc.) Brainstorm and develop ideas for creative marketing campaigns. Researching and analysing market trends, competitor offerings, product specifications, and target audience. Knowledge in key areas of marketing (social media, content marketing, email marketing, PPC and SEM). Plan and execute initiatives to reach the target audience through appropriate channels (social media, e-mail, PR, etc.) Working creatively alongside the team to come up with branding ideas, advertising copy, graphic designs, and promotional materials. Identifying the appropriate media channels where each product or service's marketing materials can be delivered to the public. Enforcing brand marketing guidelines throughout each product to create a cohesive feel to each campaign. Managing and supervising marketing projects and staff members throughout each project/ campaign from beginning to end. Research possible collaborations across all Marketing channels that are relevant to the brand and take action. Adjusting the marketing plan as needed in response to data tracking efforts. Report findings and results to upper management and stakeholders.     Requirements:     Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field. Native English speaker Content/writing experience. Knowledge of Media Channels and Marketing Strategy. Excellent organisational, prioritisation, and decision-making skills. Strong analytical skills, Critical thinking. Good communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills. Proactive and able to manage multiple projects Knowledge of SEO Creative, Innovative, Independent     Big plus:     Second language Creative Background Alternative Lifestyle     Location: We prefer if candidates are available to work at our Barcelona office. But we can consider remote option as well.     Time zone: EU     We offer:     Professional growth & development No bureaucracy Flexible working conditions Vacation, sick and personal days Cool young & creative team!     Powered by JazzHR     X3YnNNjDFZ
Function: Gestión y Tecnología de la información

Title: Principal Consultant HR- Spain
Description: Thirdera is looking for highly skilled Consulting Practice Manager to join our team!     What is Thirdera?     Thirdera is a global services provider that uses ServiceNow to help enterprises unlock their business and customer workflows in the cloud through digitization and automation. Thirdera brings together the power of the ServiceNow platform and its limitless potential across the world of work. Our architects, developers, consultants, designers, and project managers help our customers transform, get more from ServiceNow, and unlock hidden potential. We are ushering in the next era of transformation, digitization, automation, and partner expectation, all with and at the speed of NOW.     Your Mission     Responsible for managing the main pillars of a practice: people management, portfolio/delivery management and sales enablement. Has profit and loss responsibility or financial/expense management of practice. Accountable for operational/financial metrics and overall business results of practice. Responsible for maintaining practice direction, ensuring quality of consulting delivery, and maintaining customer reference ability. Ensures that operational policies are followed and that business objectives are achieved by focusing on best practices and process improvements. Develops plans to successfully implement operational policies and achieves business plan. Is accountable for managing and growing a revenue stream and customer base.     Responsibilities     Analyzes business needs to help ensure Thirdera solution meets the customer’s objectives by combining industry best practices, product knowledge, and business acumen. Exercise’s judgment and business acumen in selecting methods and techniques to deliver functional and technical solutions on non-routine and very complex aspects of applications and technology installations. Provides direction and mentoring to project teams, and effectively influences customer leadership on key decisions. Supports the business development efforts by pursuing new opportunities and extensions. Collaborates with the consulting sales team by providing domain expertise. Resolves complex customer issues by recommending and implementing solutions.     What's in it for you?     We offer a fun, highly engaging and unique culture. You'll get the best learning and career experience from day 1, by being able to work with ServiceNow Experts, access certifications and accreditations.     You'll be empowered to work for top-of-the-line companies and amazing partners, while having fun at it!     Requirements:     Graduated in Software engineer, Electrical engineer, Industrial Engineer, or related Education Certificate. Professional Certification ServiceNow Sys Admin Certification – Must. Scrum Master Certification – Nice to have. At least 6 years of experience working with technology processes. 4+ years of experience working with ServiceNow HR module – Must. ITSM/ITIL knowledge – Nice to have.     Salary Range     Welcome to Pay for Performance! We provide competitive compensation, generous benefits, and a professional and culturally diverse work environment. Work-life balance is very important to us so our job opportunities allow for remote working so you can manage your own time.     Application and Selection Process     A phone screen with the hiring manager to validate your experience and expectations for new opportunities. Never more than three (3) interviews with technical, functional and leadership staff A standard Background and Work Reference Check. If all above goes well, you will get an offer.     Thirdera is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer.     E-verify notice: Federal law requires Thirdera to verify the identity and employment eligibility of all persons hired to work in the United States. Thirdera will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), with information from each new employee's Form I-9 to confirm work authorization.     Powered by JazzHR     hZ20PBokHw
Function: Gestión y Tecnología de la información

Title: Sales Director, Olive Oil and Packaged Goods
Description: Who we are:     Wikifarmer is a global platform with the mission of empowering farmers by educating them and offering them access to the open market to sell their products at fair prices.     The Problem We Are Solving:     Most farmers in the world still cultivate their fields with techniques learned from experience or taught by their ancestors, leading to non-optimum practices in terms of yield and regard to the environmental impact.     Farmers produce the most valuable part of the food supply chain, but they are the ones getting the least value out of it.     How we are fixing this:     Wikifarmer is building both an educational platform and a digital Marketplace. On one side of our Platform, producers can tap into and update their agricultural knowledge and practices and on the other side they can upload their products for free, gaining immediate and direct access to domestic and international markets.     What we are looking for:     Having recently secured a new round of funding from Point Nine (Revolut, Delivery Hero, Typeform) we are starting to build our core team - central to those hires will be a Sales Director for our Marketplace, managing B2B sales of olive oil, other oils, vinegars and packaged good to Food Production Units and Wholesalers. This senior hire will form part of our leadership team reporting directly to our CEO and have people managing responsibilities.     Job Duties and Responsibilities:     Sell the platform's food and agricultural products to customers in the food sector (Food Processing Units, Food Wholesalers, Major Retailers) Developing new business opportunities both in your local region (Spain or Italy) and further afield in Europe and globally Acquire new accounts, by sourcing new products on demand Develop strong relationships with customers (owners, supply and purchasing directors) in order to upsell and cross sell Build partnerships with agricultural co-operatives and independent producers, contributing to the supply side strategy of the company Utilise our CRM (Hubspot) to effectively manage and activate incoming leads Grow the market for Wikifarmer to a stage where a local sales and business development team will be built and managed Travel up to 25% of the time.     Key requirements:     You have a significant amount of sales experience and a successful commercial track record within the Food Wholesale or Export industry, specifically selling Olive Oil You have a strong network of decision-making Food and Beverage Buyers You have financial and business acumen, being very literate in calculating margins and profitability You have impactful communication and presentation skills You are comfortable in negotiating with a long term relationship mindset You're an entrepreneur at heart and you're not afraid to build everything from scratch Excellent knowledge of the Spanish or Italian and English language You need to be based in Spain or Italy     What we can offer you:     Fixed salary plus commission (€100k - €120k depending on location and level of experience) Car allowance Equity in the business Private Medical Insurance L&D budget We are an early startup which is going places and you can make an immediate impact Transparency and Collaboration please submit your CV in English

Title: Agente Telefónico 30h (TELETRABJO)
Description: ¡En Konecta, el talento marca la diferencia y sabemos que los grandes profesionales, hacen grandes compañías!  Gracias a nuestro equipo, cada vez son más las empresas que confían en nosotros para que podamos brindarles la mejor experiencia en cada interacción y en cada punto de contacto con sus clientes.  Estamos buscando personal para nuestro servicio de emisión de llamadas para empresa de carácter social, en modelo de teletrabajo (debes ir a sede a recoger el equipo en el Polígono de Onzonilla).  En cuanto el proceso de selección finalice, te brindaremos una completa formación tras la cual, día a día, irás creciendo personal y profesionalmente, siendo parte importante de mantenernos como empresa líder del sector del contact center.  Requisitos del puesto:  Habilidad de comunicación. Interés por participar en una de las empresas líderes en el sector.   Desde Konecta te garantizamos:  Posibilidades reales de crecimiento. Formación previa del 05/07 al 14/07 en horario de 9-15h Incorporación: 17/07 Jornada: 30 h/sem de lunes a viernes. Horario: turnos rotativos de 09 a 15 y de 15 a 21 Salario: 969 € brutos /mes + increibles incentivos mensuales.   ¡Anímate a Konectar!  Requisitos:  Habilidad de comunicación. Interés por participar en una de las empresas líderes en el sector.

Title: Industrial Control / Automation Engineer (ES)
Description: Signaloid provides a computing platform to quantify, transmit, and track data uncertainty dynamically and throughout computations in unmodified computing workloads. Our technologies are used in applications including materials modeling, autonomous systems, computational finance, machine learning, and noisy intermediate-scale quantum computing. Our team consists of contrarian engineers with combined research, engineering, and leadership experience from Apple, ARC, ARM, Bell Labs, CMU, University of Cambridge, EPFL, IBM Research, Max Planck, MIT, and NEC Labs. Find out more at https://signaloid.com and try out the Signaloid uncertainty-tracking computing platform by signing up for free at https://get.signaloid.io.     Role Description     In this role, you will:     Be in charge of developing a commercial application for release on an industrial control automation platform Be responsible for interfacing with developers of an internal REST/GraphQL cloud API and developers of an external API Be responsible for the design and delivery of a user Interface as part of the app development Be responsible for the design and implementation of machine learning methods on industrial data     After a year in this role, based on your demonstrated performance, you will have the opportunity to:     Work with the leadership team on strategy and implementation of new capabilities of Signaloid's products for industrial control automation, to address customer needs Grow into a role of team lead responsible for a broader range of embedded and edge computing use cases of Signaloid's technology Expand your role if desired, to include more customer-facing engagement with Signaloid's international partners     Requirements     Undergraduate or masters degree in computer engineering, computer science, or a related discipline Familiarity with Snap containers Familiarity with JavaScript and with node.js-based stacks At least three years experience with C/C++ At least three years experience with Python Deep knowledge of the Linux operating system and familiarity with Ubuntu Core Familiarity with containerization tools in general Previous experience with TensorFlow, both for model training as well as deployment/inference A willingness to listen to people until they feel understood Honesty, empathy, and a willingness to see the world from the viewpoint of others     Additional Desirable Skills and Experience:     Good working understanding of industrial control automation hardware (PLCs) Good working understanding of control systems Previous experience with the Bosch Rexroth ctrlX platform Previous experience with TensorFlowLite     Our Recruiting Procedure     All positions require you to write a one-page cover letter. We use this to screen for communication skills, as clear communication is essential in a remote working environment Applicants who pass the cover letter screening receive an initial 15-minute Zoom screening call with a member of our People Development Team to discuss your CV Applicants who pass the screening interview, regardless of the position you are interviewing for, will be given a real-world project to solve over the course of one week (or two weeks if you are currently employed in a full-time job). In exchange for your time, we give you two books relevant to the rest of the interview process and £500 worth of free credits on the Signaloid Cloud Developer Platform Applicants who successfully complete the project are invited for a set of 45-minute interviews with people from our core teams (there will be up to six such interviews) which will use the project you completed as a discussion point In the final stage, applicants are invited for an on-site interview with members of the team in Cambridge     Benefits     A flexible remote-first work environment     Be part of an international team with the flexibility to choose where you live You can work any set of eight hours in a day provided four of those hours overlap with the working day in Zurich Join the rest of the team every three months for an in-person session somewhere in Europe     Competitive Compensation     Yearly bonus based on company's Objectives and Key Results (OKR) performance and bi-yearly bonus based on your project team's OKR performance Simple transparent compensation across the company, with four pay levels, in all roles, based on skill level: Contributor, Senior Contributor, Lead Contributor, and Principal Contributor All full-time employees receive attractive stock options package     A driven but respectful environment     Our motto is "We're all going to die": We never speak ill of others even if we differ in our viewpoints; we show up every day with a sense of urgency; we treat each other with respect as though each day were our last

Title: Specialist
Description: Objective of the AC-JOB Test Position     Testing software like a pro Breaking code with each new flow Finding bugs and glitches fast Our skills are unsurpassed Automated API tests are used to check the functionality, reliability, and performance of an API. By sending requests and verifying responses, an automated API test ensures that the API can handle different input scenarios and behave correctly under different conditions. It saves time, reduces errors, and provides more complete coverage than manual testing.
