Title: Product Manager
Description: Working at Adaptavist     The Adaptavist Group is a global family of companies with a common goal. We combine the best of teamwork, technology, and processes, helping all kinds of businesses be better today and tomorrow.     We are experts at delivering enterprise software, tailored solutions, and quality services across some of the world’s most trusted technology ecosystems, including Atlassian, AWS, Slack, GitLab, and Aha!     We make change happen. From anywhere.     Our flexible, remote-first way of working means that work can fit around your life, rather than your life fitting around work.     About The Team     At Kolekti, we have a clear vision: helping modern workers be the experts they were hired to be.     As part of this, we build market-leading apps that help users get more from the tools they already use. Our products extend and enhance Confluence and Trello - and are made by (and for) teams like yours.     We specialise in the work management practice. With a team of experts working across product development, quality assurance, user experience, customer support, and more, we’re a truly global and diverse team united in our goal to end inefficient work.     About The Role     As Product Manager this position will play a key role in ensuring the success of Kolekti’s new app for Atlassian’s Confluence.     This role will primarily operate to start in the introduction phase of the app’s lifecycle, where the focus will be trying to reach market fit and progressing the app into the growth phase. Activities will include research (into the product, problem space, competitors and customer), defining solutions, helping to drive technical implementations and analysing the success (or failure) of solutions implemented.     What you'll be doing     Defining and prioritising features and requirements, taking into account multiple inputs including customer needs and Atlassian      compatibility     Operating cross-functionally to execute on the roadmap, including engaging with UX, Marketing, Support and Developers and other      Functions As Required.     Setting goals (on both a product level and feature level), measuring and iterating on the outcomes Deep understanding of the customer through a range of inputs - such as customer interviews and analytics Driving strategic product decisions via evaluation of market trends, user feedback, and analysis of product performance Defining the vision for an app      What we're looking for     At least 3 years of Product Manager, Product Owner or Product Marketing Manager experience Collaborative approach to leading and inspiring a team Driven to set and accomplish complex goals. Experience in taking an idea, making a plan, and executing Excellent interpersonal skills, both written and verbal, enabling you to work across a range of functions, teams, and seniority Experience in defining measures of success in a product, and interpreting complex data Proficient in English      At Adaptavist, we are committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive community, and believe this positively impacts both the creation of our innovative products and our delivery of bespoke solutions to our global customers and our own unique culture. We encourage all qualified applicants, regardless of age, disability, race, sexual orientation, religion or belief, sex, gender identity, pregnancy and maternity, marriage, and civil partnership status. From our family-friendly policies to our flexible work environment we offer a range of benefits and policies in order to support staff from all different backgrounds. If you have any questions, please do ask us.     We look forward to your application!
Industry: Transporte, logística, cadena de suministro y almacenamiento

Title: Administrador senior de Identidad
Description: ¡Hola! En Krell-consulting, una empresa líder en soluciones tecnológicas, estamos buscando un/a Administrador/a senior de Identidad para unirse a nuestro talentoso equipo. Si tienes experiencia en el campo de la administración de identidad y estás interesado en trabajar en un ambiente dinámico y desafiante, ¡esta oportunidad es para ti!     Acerca de nosotros     En Krell-consulting, nos especializamos en ofrecer servicios de TI de primera clase a nuestros clientes en todo el mundo. Trabajamos con tecnologías de vanguardia y nos enorgullece brindar soluciones personalizadas que impulsen el crecimiento y la eficiencia de nuestros clientes. Nos esforzamos por mantenernos a la vanguardia de la industria y brindar oportunidades de desarrollo continuo a nuestro equipo.     Descripción del puesto     Como Administrador/a senior de Identidad, serás responsable de gestionar y administrar los sistemas y servicios relacionados con la identidad y la seguridad de nuestros clientes. Tu experiencia en las siguientes áreas será fundamental:     Administración de entornos de identidad en la nube, especialmente en plataformas como AZURE y AWS. Diseño e implementación de políticas y procesos de identidad y acceso. Supervisión y resolución de problemas relacionados con la administración de identidad y la seguridad. Colaboración con equipos multidisciplinarios para garantizar el cumplimiento de los requisitos de identidad y acceso. Mantenimiento y actualización de las políticas y configuraciones de seguridad. Gestión de riesgos y evaluación de vulnerabilidades para garantizar la seguridad de los sistemas de identidad.     Requisitos del puesto     Para tener éxito en este puesto, requerimos que cumplas con los siguientes criterios:     Experiencia mínima de 5 años en administración de identidad y seguridad. Conocimientos avanzados en el manejo de plataformas como AZURE y AWS. Capacidad para comunicarte de manera efectiva en inglés, tanto verbalmente como por escrito. Experiencia en el diseño y la implementación de políticas y procesos de identidad y acceso. Fuertes habilidades analíticas y capacidad para resolver problemas complejos. Certificaciones relevantes en la administración de identidad y seguridad son una ventaja. Excelentes habilidades de comunicación y capacidad para colaborar con equipos multidisciplinarios.     ¿Por qué unirte a nuestro equipo?     Ofrecemos un ambiente de trabajo amigable y colaborativo donde se fomenta el crecimiento profesional. Oportunidades de desarrollo y capacitación continua para mantenerse a la vanguardia de la industria. Trabaja en proyectos emocionantes y desafiantes que te permitirán ampliar tus conocimientos y habilidades. Salario competitivo y beneficios adicionales. Posibilidad de trabajar con clientes de renombre a nivel nacional e internacional.     Si estás buscando un nuevo desafío en el campo de la administración de identidad y te apasiona seguir aprendiendo y creciendo en un entorno estimulante, ¡esperamos recibir tu solicitud!     Envíanos tu CV actualizado a antonio.garcia@krell-consulting.com     ¡Únete a nosotros hoy en Krell-consulting y sé parte de nuestro éxito! 💼🌍✨
Function: Gestión y Tecnología de la información

Title: Performance Strategist (Southern or Central Europe)
Description: Kitman Labs is a global human performance company, disrupting and transforming the way the sports industry uses data to increase the performance of the world's top athletes.     Driven by a passion to innovate in the areas of sports performance, analytics and user experience, we have assembled a team of the industry’s top data scientists, sports performance scientists, and technologists.     Kitman Labs’ advanced Outcome-driven Analytics and Performance Intelligence Platform are used by over 700 teams in 50 leagues on 6 continents spanning soccer, rugby, American football, basketball and ice hockey.     We are seeking a senior level practitioner with commercial experience to be based in Southern or Central Europe to join our Performance Strategy Team.     Focused on maintaining and growing the business within our current customer base, this is a high impact role - both internally and externally - working toward our customers’ success, providing an unbelievable experience for our customers, driving practitioner-led innovation, and increasing the excitement about our solutions in the market.     Our Performance Strategists work with a variety of different roles with our customers - from front office through all back office departments, first teams and academies - and are the voice of the customer to all departments within Kitman Labs. This is a unique opportunity to use your deep experience in high performance and commerce to have a positive impact with a large number of teams and be a part of developing the next generation of high performance best practices and solutions.     We will expect you to:     Design and deliver a strategy to maintain and grow the business across a number of our customers in Southern and Central Europe Work alongside our finance and revenue operations teams, to own all commercial conversations with our partners in Southern and Central Europe Work directly with elite teams and academies to understand their goals, identify performance objectives and challenges, and define solutions and align our team and the customer team around a success plan Run quarterly success plan reviews with all customers Work with Kitman Labs Applied Performance Specialist team to ensure that we execute on the mutual success plan Help drive practitioner led innovation in the company and represent the voice of the practitioner in the roadmap and product feedback process Prioritise performance & research questions for analysis with Kitman Labs data science team and deliver the findings of this analysis Support our Account Executive team as the Performance Expert on new partnership opportunities Act as a subject matter expert to support high quality, industry-impacting thought leadership content Be a spokesperson for Kitman Labs via and at internal and external events      This might be the right role for you if you have:     Fluency in English & French & Spanish An ability to take a strategic approach to planning how all departments within an elite sporting organisation can contribute to success through alignment around a common goal The ability to translate a strategic plan into a set of deliverables Run a technical, performance and/or medical department Have an appreciation for the commercial side of business (either within or outside of sports organisations) A track record of working closely with senior stakeholders in elite sporting organisations Leadership skills Communication and presentation skills 10+ years working with Elite Sporting Organisations. Experience with football organisations is preferable, but not mandatory 5+ years as Head of Department within one of the roles outlined above   In addition to building a team with diverse skill-sets, Kitman Labs is committed to hiring people with diverse backgrounds. We do not discriminate based on age, civil or family status, disability, ethnicity, gender, race, religion, or sexual orientation. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please let us know.     You can find information about how we process, share and keep your personal data safe in our privacy policy
Industry: Transporte, logística, cadena de suministro y almacenamiento

Title: Quality Manager (Relocate to Malta)
Description: Magro Brothers Group of Companies is a private, family-owned organisation. It finds its roots in 1916 when three Magro brothers joined their father`s business as general provisions merchants.     In 1934 they ventured in the processing and canning of fresh tomatoes and subsequently branched into a number of other business activities including the importation into Malta of livestock, fodder and foodstuffs and exports of local agricultural produce.     In 1977, John and Michael Magro, the sons of one of the first partners, took over the running of the business and further expanded their activities to include tinplate can manufacture, food distribution, retailing, advertising & marketing, property development.     In 1995, the company moved to a purposely built factory with a covered area of 27,000 square metres which today has become a centre of excellence for food processing in the Mediterranean.     In December 2013, John and Michael, being the 3rd generation in the Magro Brothers business enterprise, transferred their shares to John’s children namely, Christian, Nicholas and Joanna. Christian was appointed C.E.O. of the Group in January 2018 while John remains chairman of the Group and Michael continues to form part of the main board of directors.     The backbone of the food sector of Magro Brothers Group of Companies is still the processing of fresh tomatoes – Magro Brothers (Foods) Ltd is the major company within the group. It is one of the few local companies which handle the whole production cycle of tomato related products, from the growing of crops to the distribution of the finished product. This also includes the production of tinplate-cans. The present production range is very diversified and includes canned tomatoes, table and pasta sauces, ketchup, mayonnaise and other condiments, thin sauces, jams and ready-to-eat jellies.     The company is also well established in several overseas markets with sales offices in UK and Ireland supplying high profile international brands. Presently the company exports some 45% of its production to 20 countries spread in four continents.     In 2004, as part of the company’s policy of diversification and living up to market expectations, Magro Brothers Group expanded their business to offer exclusive gifting and hampers of Maltese delicacies and crafts under the Savina Brand and, in 2010 they ventured also in the production of traditional Maltese cheeses and dairy products under the popular Hanini Brand.     Today, with over 100 years’ experience, Magro Brothers Group of Companies has become one of the leading enterprises in Malta and has gained the respect of the local business community and the trust of most financial and commercial organisations. The owners take pride into rigorously monitoring the crops and herds of the many Maltese and Gozitan farmers who regularly supply fresh agricultural produce and milk to their organisation. This has helped the company to achieve the well-deserved premier position in food processing in Malta.     The company is very proud of its Quality credentials and boasts a BRC Grade AA food safety certification, an Organic certification and ISO 22000. They offer brand owners a wealth of manufacturing expertise and specialize in private label. Currently they supply their products to various multinational brand owners around the world and in major retail outlets.     The Role     You will be responsible for the running of the Quality Department on day-to-day basis and reports directly to the Operations Manager.     Your Responsibilities Will Include     Heading the Quality Departments: Quality Assurance, Quality Control and Research and Development whilst supporting these department by contributing to shared process and policy development. Ensuring compliance with relative legislation and regulations across the organization. Ensuring that all managers and responsible individuals develop and maintain the quality management systems for which they are accountable. Ensuring that customer requirements and expectations are met or exceeded. Champion, support and lead quality improvements initiatives across the organization. Managing the update and revision of all quality documents. Ensuring that certification to quality standards and registration achieved and maintained. Liaising with external stakeholders on quality and regulatory. Must have an in-depth understanding of EU and UK legislation in relation to FMCG food manufacturing to produce safe, legal and good quality products to meet the needs of our customers. Attending to pre-production / first production runs ensuring product and process match that defined in the specification. Continuously identify and communicate improvement opportunities. Leverage technology to manage compliance processes. Keep abreast of emerging issues in food safety and quality. Managing a team of 1-5 people.     Ideal Profile     You have a bachelor’s degree in food science, Food Technology or a related field You have at least 3 years of experience within quality, including experience within a food manufacturing company. You have an experience in product development environment, nutrition & health, science, and technology and culinary. You are familiar to Food Management System – HACCPs and International Certifications which includes BRC and ISO 22000 You are familiar with EU Food Legislation You have a good communication, interpersonal, negotiation, and organisational skills.     What's on Offer?     Role required relocation to Malta Outstanding opportunity for a quality manager with Food manufacturing experience

Title: Senior Desarrollo de Negocio - Business Development
Description: En Flat 101 estamos buscando personas para trabajar en nuestra área de desarrollo de negocio y que participen en el proceso de expansión de nuestra empresa, referencia en servicios digitales de alto rendimiento y con una cartera de clientes en continuo crecimiento.     La principal misión de esta persona será la de consolidar y abrir oportunidades comerciales y de negocio tanto en nuestros clientes actuales como en nuevas cuentas en las que podemos aportar un valor diferencial gracias a nuestra experiencia y capacitaciones.     Queremos ganar nuevos clientes, pero no hacerlo de cualquier manera ni con un discurso comercial vacío y sin sentido. Realmente queremos que nos ayudes a tener una propuesta de valor diferencial de verdad y que así consigamos los mejores proyectos posibles.     Somos un equipo en plena expansión internacional que ofrece todas las modalidades de trabajo y un plan de carrera y progresión que garantiza una carrera profesional sólida al más alto nivel dentro del ecosistema digital en el que nos movemos     Requisitos:     ¿Qué buscamos?     El perfil que estamos buscando tendrá que llevar a cabo las siguientes TAREAS:     Gestionar oportunidades de negocio que generamos con nuestros propios recursos y que deben ser trabajadas: entender necesidades del posible cliente, valorar nuestra idoneidad en los proyectos, plantear un escenario de trabajo en coordinación con el equipo técnico… Crear oportunidades de negocio nuevas y proactivas aprovechando todos los recursos que Flat 101 pone a tu disposición. Idear y ejecutar estrategias y tácticas que nos permitan llegar a los clientes idóneos en los que desarrollar nuestra actividad. No nos interesa vender mucho, nos interesa la venta inteligente, vender a clientes en los que podemos hacer un trabajo excepcional sintiéndonos todos satisfechos con él. Proponer alianzas que nos permitan crecer en mercados o sectores en los que aún tenemos amplio recorrido. Liderar la conversación con posibles clientes y las propuestas de trabajo con ellos, para crear las mejores soluciones posibles desde la honestidad y la responsabilidad con nuestro trabajo. Tener conversaciones y reuniones con clientes y posibles clientes para entender sus necesidades y como construir la mejor propuesta posible: teléfono, videollamada, reunión presencial… saber desenvolverse en todos los escenarios con soltura es imprescindible. Elaborar y presentar propuestas de trabajo y proyectos a clientes y posibles clientes.     ¿A quién buscamos?     A una persona que encaje con estas habilidades:     Experiencia demostrable en gestión de cuentas y en desarrollo de negocio Conocimiento de las principales disciplinas digitales que trabajamos en Flat 101: Analítica digital, UX/UI, CRO, tecnología aplicada al marketing, captación de tráfico. Buena capacidad de comunicación y sobre todo de comprensión de las necesidades de un posible cliente, y cómo traducir eso a una propuesta concreta y personalizada. Capacidad de trabajo en equipo. Innovación, hambre por conocer nuevas tendencias y posibilidades, pero también sentido común para saber en qué proyectos pueden plantearse unas cosas y en cuáles no Inglés a nivel conversación, dado que muchos de nuestros proyectos son para el mercado EU y LATAM y es necesario poder llevar una conversación fluida en ese idioma en múltiples oportunidades. Trabajo en equipo. Capacidad de entender las limitaciones de las diferentes áreas y sus puntos fuertes para junto con ellas crear las mejores propuestas posibles.     ¿Cómo será tu evolución?     1 MES: Habrás conocido al equipo. Empezarás a familiarizarte con nuestra metodología. Conocerás los proyectos en los que trabajamos, se te integrara en los equipos de algunos proyectos para que empieces tu rodaje con nosotros, etc..     3 MESES: Tendrás asignados tus propios proyectos y responsabilidades y habrás conocido a tus clientes internos, con los que trabajarás de manera continua. Trabajarás de manera independiente, etc…     6 MESES: Tendrás una adaptación del 100% a nuestra metodología de trabajo. Realizarás formaciones específicas de tu área, etc…     12 MESES: ¡Tu primer Flat aniversario! Recibirás la correspondiente felicitación por parte de tus compañeros. Ha llegado el momento de tener tu primera evaluación anual y ver cómo ha sido tu evolución en esta primera etapa… etc.     ¿Por qué nosotros? Esto podemos ofrecerte en Flat 101:     Incorporarte a una empresa que comenzó en 2013 con 5 personas y que ahora mismo está compuesta por 250, creciendo en base a reputación, buen trabajo y calidad de trato. Posibilidades reales de mejora y promoción. Plan de mejora y carrera personalizado con evaluación anual. Cada año aprenderás cosas nuevas, mejorarás en tus habilidades y tu carrera puede evolucionar de muchas formas dentro de la compañía, en rama técnica, de gestión, negocio o especialista, satisfaciendo tus necesidades de crecimiento profesional y personal. Programa de talento anual, donde un grupo de 20-30 personas accede a una formación exclusiva para mejorar en liderazgo y «soft skills» como comunicación, gestión de problemas, etc... Trabajar en proyectos nacionales e internacionales. Todo el mundo lo dice, pero aquí es cierto. Actualmente tenemos clientes en Mexico, UK, Italia, USA, etc. Unirte a un equipo humano que realmente cree en esos valores que se leen tanto pero que tan poca gente aplica: respeto, amor por el detalle, cuidado en el hacer las cosas, invertir mimo y cariño en los proyectos, diversidad, ética, inclusión. Conciliación familiar. Madres, padres y personas con responsabilidades hacia otras personas que necesitan cuidado y atención, bienvenidos a Flat 101. Contrato indefinido y estable desde el primer día. Queremos crecer contigo y tener una relación larga. 12 pagas. 27 días laborables de vacaciones al año. Sí, 27, un 20% más de vacaciones que la media. Salario de 40.000 € / año si se cumplen los retos establecidos. Dependiendo de habilidades, experiencia, etc, esta cantidad podrá ser superior. Dietas y suplementos si debes trabajar en las oficinas de cliente en algún momento del proyecto. Si trabajas en remoto, dietas suplementarias por el coste de electricidad e internet. Si traes un nuevo cliente, recibes una comisión del proyecto en el que vamos a trabajar. Si traes a una persona a trabajar con nosotros, recibes una bonificación salarial. Modelo de trabajo voluntario, que deberás escoger entre formato híbrido, flexible, teletrabajo al 100% o presencial. Tenemos teletrabajo, tenemos presencialidad, tenemos formatos híbridos... tenemos de todo. Si trabajas en una ciudad donde tenemos oficina puedes optar por formato híbrido (2 días de oficina presenciales con todas las medidas de seguridad y 3 de remoto) o remoto. ¿Vives fuera? 100% teletrabajo. ¿Vives en una ciudad con oficinas pero quieres ir todos los días o teletrabajar al 100%? Pídelo y se te concederá. Eventos y dinámicas de manera recurrente, para compartir tiempo juntos, sentirnos equipo y aprender unos de otros. Hacemos al menos dos actividades mensuales, que te permiten estar mucho más cerca de las personas de Flat 101, estés donde estés tú.. Jornada intensiva todo el año y reducida en verano, con flexibilidad en la salida y entrada y responsabilidad y autonomía en la organización de tu día a día. Participar en nuestros estudios, publicaciones, eventos y whitepapers Ser parte de un equipo que realmente quiere ser el mejor que pueda ser. Queremos ser los líderes en cada disciplina que trabajamos Un ambiente que seguramente no habrás experimentado nunca. Pero claro, esto solo podrás saberlo cuando estés dentro. Asistencia a formaciones y eventos internos y externos Formar parte de un equipo referente en analítica digital, diseño de productos y servicios digitales y CRO con amplia experiencia en el sector y en continuo crecimiento. Una filosofía de trabajo basada en poner cariño a los proyectos y honestidad en nuestras relaciones profesionales. No somos una factoría, y no queremos serlo. Creemos y practicamos la filosofía Open Books. ¿Eso qué es? Básicamente, desde dirección compartimos datos de negocio de la empresa de forma transparente e involucramos a todas las personas en las decisiones importantes que debemos tomar, como adopción de jornadas laborales nuevas, formatos de trabajo, ideas de crecimiento, etc, y contamos de manera clara cual es nuestra situación en el mercado, estado de clientes ganados y perdidos, relación con competidores... Acceso a formación especializada diseñada exclusivamente para Flat 101. Visibilidad profesional. Oficinas céntricas y bien comunicadas: en Madrid, Gran Vía; en Zaragoza, WTCZ; en Barcelona, Rambla de Catalunya Entorno laboral inclusivo y diverso. Somos una empresa que cree en la ética y en la responsabilidad en sus proyectos. Somos coherentes con lo que predicamos y por ello tenemos plan de igualdad, un protocolo especifico para prevenir cualquier forma de acoso o abuso, y continuamente intentamos mejorar nuestro ambiente. Perks adicionales: seguro médico, flexibilidad horaria, asistencia a eventos, retribución flexible, descuentos a empleados, etc.     Somos una empresa construida en torno a las personas que la forman, donde de forma cotidiana se escucha a todo el equipo para la toma de decisiones corporativas. Queremos construir y consolidar la mejor empresa posible y ser una referencia a nivel profesional, humano y ético... y nos encantaría contar contigo, ¿te apuntas?

Company: TST Poland Sp Z o o
Title: Web Analytics
Description: About The Role     Help Optimize Store Site     Strong eCommerce acumen or worked in e-Commerce company is Mandatory.     Help improve Store Conversion by 0.25% by building A/B testing funnel, Customer Journey, Improve NPS.     Technical Skills : Adobe Omniture (Workspace), CSDB ( One who understands evars, props ), Google Analytics, Big Query , SQL     Tag management (knowledge on GTM/Javascript/Node.js/Vue.js)     Knowledge on Python is plus     Inclination towards data science     What You Can Bring To The Table     eCommerce (premium) Requirement analysis Project reporting, meeting with a client, Project monitoring and control Good communication and fluency in English are a must. Excellent leadership and decision-making skills. Organizational and time management skills Software Development / Applications

Title: Lead Concept Artist
Description: Magic Media is a pioneering media, entertainment and tech group powered by creativity and innovation. We have a physical presence in 14 countries and expertise in the areas of art, animation, cybersecurity, game development, software development, VFX and video production amongst others. We work with leading developers and publishers within the games and tech industry, providing support and solutions designed around individual needs and carried out by global experts.     People are what make games great! Magic Media is currently seeking a Lead Concept Artist to help our team on their next adventure. The ideal candidate enjoys putting their skills and knowledge to use in a variety of styles. Your broader experience in game development and general concept art pipelines will help you work collaboratively with art directors, 3D artists, designers, and animators to create an immersive and epic experience.     WHAT YOU WILL DO:     Lead and mentor a team of concept artists, ensuring that each has clear, concrete tasks, goals, and regular constructive feedback Partner closely with producers in helping delegate tasks, staff plan, and arrange meetings as needed to ensure individuals’ workloads are manageable and the team’s deliverables can be completed on schedule Provide time and cost estimates to build the art budgets for potential and current projects in collaboration with the creative leadership team Work with clients in upholding their artistic vision and ensuring outgoing work is technically sound and meets artistic standards Build and maintain partner and client relationships, trust and communication Explore opportunities to artistically and technically innovate, streamline tools and processes, and champion best practices for the team Stay on top of industry standards and identify new tools and technologies to improve content production Support project content creation and concept needs when needed. Help continue to expand the capabilities of the Concept Art team through training, mentorship, team building, and refinements of process and technique Work closely with HR and management in carrying out key department responsibilities that include hiring, onboarding, appraising performance and resolving issues Be proactive about elevating your team’s concerns to the larger team and making sure that your discipline is well represented     Requirements     An accomplished concept artist with 5+ years of experience within the game industry, with 2+ years of experience as a Lead Concept Artist Thorough understanding of video game development, art processes, and production pipelines with experience working on different game genres across all platforms Extensive knowledge of standard digital painting/illustration tools like adobe PS/AI, Procreate, etc 3D modeling skills and working knowledge of a 3D package (3DS Max/Maya/Zbrush) are a strong plus Solid knowledge of fundamental art principles(shape language/color theory/ anatomy/light/perspective) as well as current and next-gen art techniques Extensive experience overseeing managing people/artists and teams Passionate about mentoring others in order to further develop their artistic and technical skill sets Highly creative and flexible in visualising different art styles Excellent skills communicating through sketches, thumbnails, and paintovers Good understanding of which style and visuals are expected in each task or project A demonstrable commitment to creative collaboration within a team and with other departments Experience in creating, documenting, and championing concept art workflows and pipelines Excellent organization, time management, and communication skills Professional working English proficiency     Note: Applications for this role must include a portfolio/reel (or link to a portfolio/reel). Applications that do not have this information will not be considered.     Benefits     Permanently remote position An opportunity to hone and improve your skills by applying them to a diverse variety of engaging projects Be part of an international group with offices worldwide Career growth and development Working closely with a team of like-minded people in a fast-paced, multicultural environment Ongoing training and professional self-improvement opportunities Flexible working hours An inclusive culture and open communication     At Magic Media, our passion lies in gaming. Our vision is to create and deliver engaging and interesting games for our clients. We can deliver this high-quality work on any platform, whether it be on a console, PC, or mobile. We know that reputation and results go hand-in-hand. Therefore, we work hard to find experts and talented creators to deliver the best results.     If you do not meet all the requirements, but believe you’d still be a great fit for the role, don’t worry! We’d still love to hear from you, please get in touch!

Title: QA Director (f/m/d)
Description: Klang is a game studio exploring the future of humanity through various forms of media. We aim to present deep, meaningful subjects in a way that's captivating, easy-to-digest and entertaining for all ages.     At the heart of Klang is Seed, a large-scale, persistent virtual world that we believe will redefine the MMO landscape and have a positive impact on our species.     We aspire to bring people together through engaging media experiences and by building strong communities.     It's a super exciting project, but in order for us to achieve a goal like this we are going to need a lot of help! From people just like you.     We are currently looking for a QA Director to help us deliver our game Seed and its mobile companion app.     This is a super exciting chance to take the helm of our QA team and drive its leadership, nurture the team towards their growth goals and help to define what QA will look like at Klang in the future.     Summary     You would report to the Head of Production as discipline leader for all QA Testers, along with being ultimately accountable that all bugs are reported and QA processes are kept up to date and constantly improved upon.     The QA team are a super fun, diverse group of people that love working in a collaborative and supportive environment.You would take the leadership of this incredible team and help to continue to deepen the culture of trust, team-work and fun.     You would be encouraged to implement new ways of thinking, processes and attitudes to how the QA team approaches their work.     You will essentially play a huge role in our ability to launch Seed on time and within budget!     This is a permanent position and we are open to hiring this position remotely or at our Head office in Berlin.     What you will do     Acting as discipline leader and people manager for a team of QA Testers, helping to grow the team in terms of quality and skill set. Documenting and iterating upon our current QA processes and Test Scripts. Checking and improving on the quality of all our testing, making sure all bugs are in the database. Managing outsourcing companies for penetration and compatibility testing. Helping to organise large external playtests with customers. Bringing the latest QA Automation techniques into the company.     Who we think will be a great fit     8+ years total of game development experience with 5 years as QA Director Shipped at least 2 AAA PC titles on a major platform. Experience communicating across all levels in an organisation. Experience of the latest QA Automation techniques.     If you don't feel that you quite meet all the requirements above, but the position still excites you and you think you would love to work for Klang, reach out! We still want to hear from you.     At Klang, we create products that inspire people to deepen their understanding of the emergent nature of society and collectively envision a better future.     At the heart of Klang is SEED an accessible, persistent world in which players share a history and shape a future. We provide an environment for a broad audience to belong and develop relationships in a society simulation inspired by life itself.     We explicitly encourage applications from applicants from groups underrepresented in games/tech spaces. We value all kinds of backgrounds and walks of life.

Description: En Classgap estamos buscando profesores/as para dar clases particulares online de coreano para estudiantes.     ¿Te gustaría ganar un dinero extra?     Si tienes conocimiento de coreano, empieza a dar clases online y ayuda a los alumnos a alcanzar sus metas. No se requiere experiencia previa como profesor pero sí mucha motivación. Inscríbete ahora y empieza a generar ingresos en 48h.     VENTAJAS:     Flexibilidad horaria Posibilidad de teletrabajo / en remoto Podrás establecer el precio de tus clases

Title: Sustainability Senior Consultant
Description: Clarity AI’s mission is to bring social impact to the market. Our disruptive tech tools allow investors, companies, and consumers to invest sustainably, shop sustainably, and report or benchmark for sustainability with easy-to-use, AI-powered technology.     We are now a team of more than 300 highly passionate individuals coming from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading startup backed by investors and strategic partners such as SoftBank, BlackRock, and Deutsche Börse who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, Portugal, the UK, and the US this year so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading! Your work will be shaping and guide the sustainable decisions of consumers and investors throughout the world.     We are looking for a Sustainability Senior Consultant, who has international experience in a quickly scaling, tech-oriented, product-driven culture to manage a team of sustainability experts.Sustainability Senior Consultant you will help us enhance our storytelling and ensure Clarity AI gains further presence in the sustainability community and client base, while working in a multicultural, flexible and fast-paced environment.     The role provides an opportunity to contribute to the mission of Clarity (“to bring societal impacts to market”) by drafting and ghost writing presentations, blogs, whitepapers, articles for the Chief Sustainability Officer (CSO) and mapping and kicking off engagements with key stakeholders and (potential) clients in the sustainability ecosystem. The role will also ensure that the CSO office contacts are engaged to ensure proper Clarity AI introduction and problem solving.     Location: Madrid, open to remote within Spain.     Requirements     Role Responsibilities:     Ghost write drafts for thought leaderships presentations, articles, blogs and whitepapers to support the CSO in enhancing his and Clarity AI’s visibility Research, analyze and mine our dataset to support pre-agreed stories, or seek new ones Map key stakeholders and market positioning partnerships and support the engagement with key players such as PRI, GFANZ, UNCTAD, OPSWF, IFSWF, and others in the sustainability ecosystem Facilitate Lead Generation leveraging on CSO’s activities, drafting the CSO’s client engagement emails, and coordinating with other Clarity AI internal teams Explore the CSO’s new strategy or product ideas with other teams Other support to CSO to enhance Clarity AI strategy and product design     Qualifications     3 - 5 years industry experience in in the sustainability space, preferably in sustainable finance Excellent oral and written communication skills in English. Spanish and other languages are a plus Ability to communicate effectively at all levels. Experience communicating to both technical and non-technical stakeholders Social media savvy, preferably with experience in supporting others drives their media coverage A good understanding of the asset management ecosystem and the role asset owners, investment managers and service providers play The versatility and willingness to learn on the job and pivot when reactive needs arise Ability to work collaboratively with cross functional and diverse teams at all levels of the organization. Strong organizational, time-management skills with the ability to succeed in a fast paced environment with changing requirements and priorities Highly motivated, independent and deeply passionate about sustainability, impact and finance     Benefits     WHAT WE OFFER:     Our people are our main asset. We have built a unique team and we all share 3 differential aspects: Excellence, Passion and Values:     Our team comprises professionals from leading tech, consulting and banking firms, entrepreneurs, PhDs from top research institutions, and MBA graduates from top business schools Clarity’s Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur who has been recognized as one of the most distinguished leaders under the age of 40 by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum. Rebeca is joined by an excellent leadership team coming from diverse backgrounds, countries and experiences     We are different. We work hard to become the best place to work and pride ourselves on our culture:     Fact based: Promoting objective, fact-based and solution-oriented discussions Diverse: Encouraging diversity of personalities, cultures and experiences Transparent: Communicating feedback transparently, constructively and in real-time Meritocratic: Striving for excellence and rewarding the best Flexible: Working flexibly in the broadest sense (schedule, location, vacation, styles)     Clarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. Thats why we created our own ERG groups.     Our own ERG groups act as a voluntary employee resource group, they commit to promoting these values and creating a safe and supportive community for all employees. They are committed to creating a workplace that champions sustainability, diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI).     To do this, they will advocate for sustainability initiatives, host and participate in events, workshops, provide a safe space for employees to share their experiences, ideas, and solutions, and collaborate with other departments and employee groups to improve the company's sustainability goals.     By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.     We care about our employees and think they deserve the best.     ESOP/ Phantom stock: We want our employees to really feel part of Clarity. That’s why we give them the opportunity to participate in our success with ESOP or phantom stock options Training budget: Continued learning is important to us so we provide everyone with a yearly training budget Additional benefits are available depending on your location     We are a US company with a UK and Spanish subsidiary. We have offices in New York City, London and Madrid and have possibilities for remote working for many of our roles.     Clarity has received several awards:     Fast Company - Most Innovative Companies 2023 WEF, Young Global Leader - Rebeca Minguela Forrester New Wave Leader 2022 European Commission | EU Seal of Excellence 2020 World Economic Forum - Technology Pioneer 2020

Title: ANALISTA FUNCIONAL AGILE - 100% remoto
Description: Como parte de Ayesa, conformamos uno de los principales conglomerados de servicios de Ingeniería y Tecnologías de la Información (TIC) del mercado. Somos más de 11.000 personas en más de 20 países de Europa, América, África y Asia y contamos con el reconocimiento de Forbes como una de las 50 mejores empresas para trabajar. Resulta gratificante comprobar cómo nuestro trabajo, apoyado en la tecnología, ayuda a personas y organizaciones a superar retos y conseguir objetivos. Si tú también quieres contribuir a estos cambios y experimentar esta sensación especial, ¡acércate y ven a formar parte de este gran equipo!  At Ibermatica and Ayesa Company, we are looking for an Agile Functional Analyst to join our team and work with one of the most influential clients in the banking sector. Main responsabilities: -The Product Owner leads and owns the development and performance of a specific IT product throughout its entire lifecycle (analysis, monitoring, development, maintenance and continuous improvement) -Supports the creation of user stories and its translation to technical tasks for the development team; coordinates testing activities; and approves release plans. -Accordingly, is responsible of the compliance and adherence to technical quality & performance standards within the IT products they manage. -Proven track record and experience in developing IT processes and solutions, successfully executing programs that meet the objectives of excellence in a dynamic organization environment. -Practiced ability to analyze, develop and implement complex programming solutions. -Ability to execute test plans, create test cases test data and contribute to appropriate software (including programming languages) development life cycle methodology and application of specialized business -Self-starter, works with minimal, participates as a team member and fosters teamwork by inter-group coordination within the modules of the project. -Effectively collaborates and communicates with the stakeholders and ensure client satisfaction.  Previous experience in ecommerce, retail & cards/onboarding projects. - Specific skills: - Deep Knowledge on at least one of banking products, cads, accounts, deposits, loans, mortgages, assurances... - Deep Knowledge on at least one of banking processes and solutions, onboarding, payments, servicing.... - Lead the translation of user stories into detailed technical requirements and technical tasks to feed developer squad teams, providing a systems perspective and identifying impacts and dependencies. Ensures the applicable definition of ready / definition of done requirements get documented accordingly. - Support the development squad teams to rebalance effort between user story development and defect/ticket resolution, on a daily basis - Facilitate critical dependencies management within the IT product and across products. - Support the development of and the execution of acceptance tests based on acceptance criteria, coordinating all test activities and ensuring that each story meets acceptance criterio - Continuously update the delivery team in case of business changes, in coordination with Business Product Owners and other peer Technical Product Owners - Approve the final release plan, in accordance with agreed priorities and dependencies, in collaboration with the Release Manager - Analyse and report delivery, progress, risks and opportunities - English B2
Industry: Servicios de TI y consultoría de TI

Title: Client Relations Manager - Spain (m/f/d)
Description: Allow us to introduce ourselves     Hello there! We're Appinio, the fastest (and coolest) market research platform. On a mission to make the world a little more fact-based, we help companies understand how consumers think and make better data-driven decisions.     We started out in Hamburg back in 2014 but we're now humbled to call the world our playground, with over 200 employees spread across 25 cities (we're remote-first), 2000+ international clients and a panel reach of 7 million, globally.     Want to be a part of the Appinio movement? 🚀     Your mission as a Client Relations Manager - Spain (m/f/d)     Join Appinio's dynamic team as a Client Relations Manager - Spain and play a pivotal role in driving our expansion and consolidating the Appinio brand in the Spanish market. We are seeking a highly skilled and sales-driven individual with exceptional soft skills to excel in this crucial position.     As a Client Relations Manager, you will collaborate closely with our Spain Managing Director, becoming a reliable sparring partner for new clients. Your expertise will be instrumental in advising and coaching clients on the significance and potential of market research, innovation, and consumer centricity. Your ability to inspire marketing and insights decision-makers in Spain will be essential in promoting Appinio's unique Saas solutions and persuading C-Level Executives to collaborate with us.     We strongly prefer candidates based in Spain; however, we welcome applications from exceptional individuals located anywhere in the world, as the opportunity to drive our business remotely is available.     What You'll Be Doing     Represent Appinio to marketing and insights decision-makers of multinational companies Acquire new customers and provide expert advice and coaching on Appinio's agile Saas solutions Scope and qualify client requirements for both new and existing projects Ensure delivery of high-quality outputs that meet client and service requirements, serving as a liaison between clients and internal departments Maximize revenue opportunities from existing and new client bases, aligning with the client's research roadmap Build and maintain a robust professional network Act as a public speaker, presenting at events and trade fairs Contribute to the further development of our business, including expanding our presence in the Spanish market and supporting Latam market development as needed     You will thrive in this role if     You have 3+ years of proven experience and an extensive network in the market research industry, coupled with a strong customer-centric mindset, which are mandatory requirements for this role You have an above-average degree in business administration, economics, or a related field You have several years of successful experience in B2B sales, with proficiency in sales methods, lead generation, and customer acquisition in the Spanish market You have native fluency in Spanish and excellent communication skills in English You have proficiency in working with CRM tools such as Salesforce or Hubspot You have strong analytical and critical thinking abilities You have an empathetic nature with a keen sense for understanding the needs of others     What's in it for you?     Flexibility Policy - meaning there is no hard cap on the number of vacation days Work-from-anywhere Policy You have the chance to develop our amazing product from one of the countries where we operate: Spain, France, Germany, Portugal, the Netherlands or the UK You have the chance to work outside of your country of residence for a maximum of 180 days per year, given that you have a valid work permit for that country Udemy L&D Platform - full access to 22,000+ courses and certifications to deepen your knowledge as your career progresses All the hardware you need and your own MacBook In case you're located in Hamburg or Berlin, you'll get a Deutschlandticket or access to a mobility budget with the RYDES app to get you to and from the office space In case you're located in Hamburg you'll get access to our beautiful office in Hamburg's city center - terrace and BBQ included ;-) In case you are located in Germany or Spain, you will have access to a Subsidized Urban Sports Club membership In case you're located in Berlin, you will have access to our co-working space to get together with our fellow Appinioneers     This post not only outlines our ideal candidate but also serves as an inspiration for what this role can evolve into. Even if you consider yourself an 80% fit but have a genuine passion for this position, we encourage you to apply. We're eager to hear from individuals who share our enthusiasm.     Appinio is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.     Learn more about us:     appinio.com LinkedIn Xing Kununu Instagram

Title: Product Research & Innovation - Product Specialist
Description: At Clarity AI, we are committed to bringing social impact to markets. We are a tech company started in 2017, leveraging AI and machine learning technologies to ensure environmental, social and governance dimensions are the focal point of decision making within financial markets.     We are now a team of more than 300 highly passionate individuals coming from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading startup backed by investors and strategic partners such as SoftBank, BlackRock, and Deutsche Börse who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, Portugal, the UK, and the US this year so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading! Your work will be shaping and guide the sustainable decisions of consumers and investors throughout the world.     We are looking for an Product Specialist to join our Product Research & Innovation chapter. Your work will be shaping and guiding the sustainable decisions of consumers and investors throughout the world.     Position Overview     We are looking for an individual to work on the creation of new methodologies and features for our product. The position is within our Regulation team, which develops tools to help investors assess the sustainability of their investments under regulatory frameworks such as the EU Taxonomy.     The Product Specialist should possess exceptional quantitative skills and thrive in an entrepreneurial setting. The ideal candidate loves having different types of problems thrown at them, is able to quickly digest and understand the key challenges, and provides actionable advice and guidance on how to proceed.     LOCATION: This role can be performed remotely from the UK or Spain.     Key Responsibilities     The role will include, but not be limited to, the following activities:     Work closely with other chapters (e.g., product management, data engineering, data science, business development) to define, create and validate our solutions. Fostering an environment of effective collaboration and coordination across chapters Identify, understand and evaluate different methodological options and propose the most appropriate solutions for our clients Identify and propose continuous improvements and refinements to the product functionalities and methodologies Explore statistical properties of datasets and identify relevant insights that support the development of new features to improve our product Prepare analysis and presentations that document insights and findings to drive the decision making process and communicate results     Requirements     Qualifications     Outstanding quantitative, critical thinking and problem solving skills Deeply passionate about sustainability Intellectual curiosity and sense of humor 3+ years of relevant work experience are preferred Experience identifying, analyzing, and interpreting patterns and trends in complex data sets, with tools such as Python, R or SQL Self-starter who will thrive in a start-up setting by taking ownership and initiative Decisive and action oriented who can get things done, make rapid decisions even when short of information, and has a high level of energy and stamina Degree in engineering, economics, statistics, math, or other applied quantitative field Complete fluency in English (minimum C1)     Benefits     Our people are our main asset. We have built a unique team and we all share 3 differential aspects: Excellence, Passion and Values:     Our team comprises professionals from leading tech, consulting and banking firms, entrepreneurs, PhDs from top research institutions, and MBA graduates from top business schools Clarity’s Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur who has been recognized as one of the most distinguished leaders under the age of 40 by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum. Rebeca is joined by an excellent leadership team coming from diverse backgrounds, countries and experiences     We are different. We work hard to become the best place to work and pride ourselves on our culture:     Fact based: Promoting objective, fact-based and solution-oriented discussions Diverse: Encouraging diversity of personalities, cultures and experiences Transparent: Communicating feedback transparently, constructively and in real-time Meritocratic: Striving for excellence and rewarding the best Flexible: Working flexibly in the broadest sense (schedule, location, vacation, styles)     Clarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. Thats why we created our own ERG groups.     Our own ERG groups act as a voluntary employee resource group, they commit to promoting these values and creating a safe and supportive community for all employees. They are committed to creating a workplace that champions sustainability, diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI).     To do this, they will advocate for sustainability initiatives, host and participate in events, workshops, provide a safe space for employees to share their experiences, ideas, and solutions, and collaborate with other departments and employee groups to improve the company's sustainability goals.     By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.     We care about our employees and think they deserve the best.     ESOP/ Phantom stock: We want our employees to really feel part of Clarity. That’s why we give them the opportunity to participate in our success with ESOP or phantom stock options Training budget: Continued learning is important to us so we provide everyone with a yearly training budget Additional benefits are available depending on your location     We are a US company with a UK and Spanish subsidiary. We have offices in New York City, London and Madrid and have possibilities for remote working for many of our roles.     Clarity has received several awards:     Fast Company - Most Innovative Companies 2023 WEF, Young Global Leader - Rebeca Minguela Forrester New Wave Leader 2022 European Commission | EU Seal of Excellence 2020 World Economic Forum - Technology Pioneer 2020     Privacy Policy     Responsibility: Clarity AI Inc. 160 Greentree Drive, Suite 101, City of Dover, County of Kent, Delaware 19904, United States.     Purpose: management of selection processes for new employees.     Legitimation: necessary processing for contract execution.     Recipients: company of the Clarity Group in the country that would carry out the contract or where position is being offered.     Rights: the interested party may exercise the rights of access, rectification, opposition, limitation, suppression, portability and not to be the object of automated decisions according to the Privacy Policy.     More info: to consult the privacy policy in detail, click on the following link (Privacy Policy)

Title: Product Research & Innovation - Jr Product Specialist
Description: Description     At Clarity AI, we are committed to bringing social impact to markets. We are a tech company started in 2017, leveraging AI and machine learning technologies to ensure environmental, social and governance dimensions are the focal point of decision making within financial markets.     We are now a team of more than 300 highly passionate individuals coming from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading startup backed by investors and strategic partners such as SoftBank, BlackRock, and Deutsche Börse who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, Portugal, the UK, and the US this year so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading!     Your work will be shaping and guide the sustainable decisions of consumers and investors throughout the world.We are looking for a Jr. Product Specialist to join our Product Research & Innovation chapter. Your work will be shaping and guiding the sustainable decisions of consumers and investors throughout the world.     We are looking for an individual to work on the creation of new methodologies and features for our digital product to help our clients in the financial industry. This position is within our ESG Risk team, who is in charge of developing analytics to assess sustainability risks of investment decisions. Such analytics cover a broad range of topics from exposure to financially material ESG topics, to screenings to detect involvement in controversial activities (e.g., fossil fuels, alcohol, nuclear weapons), or Natural Language Processing Algorithms to identify reputational risks through assessment of third party news and reports.     The Jr. Product Specialist should possess exceptional quantitative skills and thrive in an entrepreneurial setting. You will be required to contribute to research and innovation projects, finding scientifically robust solutions that address the needs of our clients and can be integrated in our tech tool.     The ideal candidate should love having different types of problems thrown at him, be able to quickly digest and understand the key challenges, and provide actionable advice and guidance on how to proceed.     LOCATION: Madrid, Remote     Key Responsibilities     The ESG Risk Jr. product specialist will be responsible for conducting quantitative and qualitative analysis, as well as developing models to support the launch of new product features or existing product enhancements. The role will include, but not be limited to, the following activities:     Conduct quantitative and qualitative analysis on sustainability issues. Analyze and evaluate data from various sources to enhance existing methodologies and support decision-making processes Identify and interpret statistical properties of datasets to uncover valuable insights for product development Conduct validation tests and checks on methodologies to ensure accuracy and reliability Support the implementation of new product features and enhancements Identify and propose improvements to the product functionalities and methodologies Support in the preparation of reports to document insights and findings, and presentations to communicate results to stakeholders and clients     Requirements     Qualifications     Deeply passionate about sustainability Degree in economics, econometrics, statistics, math, or other applied quantitative field 3+ years of relevant work experience. Experience identifying, analyzing, and interpreting patterns and trends in complex data sets, with tools like Python Knowledge of key sustainability challenges and trends for different industries will be a plus Outstanding quantitative and critical thinking skills Self-starter who will thrive in a start-up setting by taking ownership and initiative Decisive and action oriented individual who can get things done, make rapid decisions even when short of information, and has a high level of energy and stamina Complete fluency in English (minimum C1) Intellectual curiosity and sense of humor     Benefits     Our people are our main asset. We have built a unique team and we all share 3 differential aspects: Excellence, Passion and Values:     Our team comprises professionals from leading tech, consulting and banking firms, entrepreneurs, PhDs from top research institutions, and MBA graduates from top business schools Clarity’s Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur who has been recognized as one of the most distinguished leaders under the age of 40 by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum. Rebeca is joined by an excellent leadership team coming from diverse backgrounds, countries and experiences     We are different. We work hard to become the best place to work and pride ourselves on our culture:     Fact based: Promoting objective, fact-based and solution-oriented discussions Diverse: Encouraging diversity of personalities, cultures and experiences Transparent: Communicating feedback transparently, constructively and in real-time Meritocratic: Striving for excellence and rewarding the best Flexible: Working flexibly in the broadest sense (schedule, location, vacation, styles)     Clarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. Thats why we created our own ERG groups.     Our own ERG groups act as a voluntary employee resource group, they commit to promoting these values and creating a safe and supportive community for all employees. They are committed to creating a workplace that champions sustainability, diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI).     To do this, they will advocate for sustainability initiatives, host and participate in events, workshops, provide a safe space for employees to share their experiences, ideas, and solutions, and collaborate with other departments and employee groups to improve the company's sustainability goals.     By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.     We care about our employees and think they deserve the best.     ESOP/ Phantom stock: We want our employees to really feel part of Clarity. That’s why we give them the opportunity to participate in our success with ESOP or phantom stock options Training budget: Continued learning is important to us so we provide everyone with a yearly training budget Additional benefits are available depending on your location     We are a US company with a UK and Spanish subsidiary. We have offices in New York City, London and Madrid and have possibilities for remote working for many of our roles.     Clarity has received several awards:     Fast Company - Most Innovative Companies 2023 WEF, Young Global Leader - Rebeca Minguela Forrester New Wave Leader 2022 European Commission | EU Seal of Excellence 2020 World Economic Forum - Technology Pioneer 2020     Privacy Policy     Responsibility: Clarity AI Inc. 160 Greentree Drive, Suite 101, City of Dover, County of Kent, Delaware 19904, United States.
