Title: Marketing Technology and Data Analyst (Remote Position)
Description: Our Organisation     Learnlight is an EdTech company that provides language, intercultural and soft skills training to leading companies and organizations around the world. We deliver blended virtual, blended face-to-face, and digital solutions to 100,000+ learners in 1500+ clients across 150+ countries. We specialize in the digital transformation of learning programs and the empowerment of talent to excel in an increasingly complex global environment.     Objective     The primary purpose of the Marketing Operations Specialist is to align our marketing strategy with our business objectives by ensuring that the systems managing and nurturing our audiences (MS Dynamics 365 for Marketing and other software) are aligned and used to their best advantage. The role will require you to liaise with internal and external departments and agencies.     They will be responsible for supporting the Marketing Team in developing and implementing efficient processes, streamlining existing workflows, leveraging marketing automation, and monitoring the execution and performance of our marketing initiatives.     Key to the success of this role includes significant marketing experience working with marketing automation platforms, lead scoring platforms, and CRMs, preferably MS Dynamics 365, but also Marketo, Pardot, Salesforce, or other related software.     Responsibilities     Own the data architecture and data synchronization between MS Dynamics 365 Sales and Marketing apps to ensure data is accurate and timely Maintain existing marketing technology and integrate new tools and processes to drive optimization and automation Develop a deep understanding of the target market and segments to maintain a high-quality database of target companies with relevant titles, contacts, and contact details Assist in maintaining a clean database through regular audits and troubleshooting Create behavioral and demographic segmentation programs to support automated nurture, lead scoring, and ABM initiatives Own analytics, reporting, and data integration for the sales/marketing team and identify possible improvement areas Monitor campaigns and create detailed metrics reports to optimize performance based on progress and industry best practices Develop and oversee the implementation of cost-efficient processes for our marketing operations Work with our marketing and sales teams to become an expert on the company’s lead funnel – from web visitor to customer and everything in between Support in creating training materials, including documentation, tutorials, and interactive sessions, to educate our marketing team on Dynamics 365 Marketing Guide the marketing team on utilizing Dynamics 365 Marketing to personalize messaging, leverage customer insights, and strengthen relationships with our target audience Assist in leveraging the event planning system features, including contact management, registration, attendance tracking, and post-event engagement, both for in-person and webinar events     Requirements     Good understanding of integrated marketing and communications strategies and how they come together to provide measurable results Multi-tasking skills with excellent attention to detail Ability to pick up new technologies and tackle challenges quickly     Skills     C1 level of English  Project management skills and experience with marketing automation, email marketing, databases and other related marketing platforms Knowledge of Adobe, Google Analytics or Paid Search advantageous     Education & Experience     Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, or similar Significant marketing experience working with either MS Dynamics 365, Marketo, Pardot, Salesforce, or other related software B2B marketing and data analytics experience Previous experience working at an EdTech advantageous Experience in a fast-paced global environment a plus     Benefits     People-Powered Culture: We have a flat, modern, meritocratic culture that values enthusiasm, initiative, and commitment above all else.       Flexible Working: Learnlight is a fully distributed virtual business with staff in 30+ countries and offices in 9 European cities.        Competitive Remuneration: We offer market-matching competitive salaries.      Learning & Development: Personalized language and soft skills training; ongoing professional development talks and masterclasses; frequent coaching and constructive feedback.    Diversity & Inclusion: Learnlight fosters an open, positive, and diverse community that welcomes talent regardless of gender, religion, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age or disability.      Community Events: We offer a range of social events including Virtual Drinks, Book Club, Tea Time and in-person departmental and All Company meetups     Details     Location: Home-based Schedule: Starting schedule between 8 a.m. and 11 a.m. CEST/UTC+2 Contract: Full-time     Think you might be a good fit for this job? If so, please click on the "Application tab" or "Apply for this job" button now.     The personal data you provide will be processed by LEARNLIGHT in order to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. Under the legal conditions, you have the right to access, rectify and delete the data, to limit its processing, to oppose its processing and to its portability to our e-mail address privacy@learnlight.com.

Title: VP of Engineering Operations (ES)
Description: Signaloid provides efficient computing hardware and software technologies to quantify, transmit, and track data uncertainty in computations on empirical data. Our technologies are used in applications including materials modeling, autonomous systems, computational finance, machine learning, and noisy intermediate-scale quantum computing. Our team consists of contrarian engineers with combined research, engineering, and leadership experience from Apple, ARC, ARM, Bell Labs, CMU, University of Cambridge, EPFL, IBM Research, Max Planck, MIT, and NEC Labs. Find out more at https://signaloid.com and try out the Signaloid uncertainty-tracking computing platform by signing up for free at https://get.signaloid.io.     Role Description     In this role, you will lead the engineering-focused operations and successful commercial delivery to customers of Signaloid's computing platform which allows our customers to quantify how doubts in the data inputs of their existing software affects their software's outputs, allowing our customers to satisfy regulations, save money, and save lives.     To succeed in this role, you will be someone who brings to the team the following attributes:     A self-motivated individual with a desire to learn about our existing operations An ability to communicate clearly and concisely while conveying empathy An ability to efficiently understand our technology solution as well as our implementation technology stack, without unduly burdening teams with excessive requests for meetings A willingness to help the team improve our operations within the constraints of a fast-paced technology startup An ability to use tools such as Slack and GitHub for communication and project management An ability to take initiatives while actively working to understand the reality and constraints of your environment     In this role, you will need to continuously grow your ability to achieve objectives including:     Coordinating our entire company engineering operations to deliver the vision set by the company leadership Work with our Engineering and Traction teams to define measurable key results, derived from the company vision and leadership's strategy, that lead to on-time and on-budget delivery of our business objectives     Within a year in this role, you can expect to:     Work more closely within the leadership team to set and deliver the long-term strategy of the company Propose and lead new strategic initiatives within the company Have the opportunity to contribute to and explore other opportunities within Signaloid based on your demonstrated performance     Requirements     Hands-on experience working within engineering teams and leading technically-oriented but customer-focused teams delivering world-leading products Demonstrated ability to lead the operations of an organization in the presence of market, regulatory, and technical uncertainty Honesty, empathy, and a willingness to see the world from the viewpoint of others     Additional Desirable Attributes, Skills, and Experience:     Knowledge of one or more additional spoken languages beyond English is a plus Willingness to accept a compensation package which is heavily weighted towards long-term equity A candidate with a diverse background Demonstrable track record of exceptional oral, written, and graphic communication.     Our Recruiting Procedure     All positions require you to write a one-page cover letter (you can also substitute the cover letter for a snippet of code that will run on the signaloid.io platform; be creative!). We use the cover letter / code snippet to screen for communication skills, as clear communication is essential in a remote working environment Applicants who pass the cover letter screening receive an initial 15-minute Zoom screening call with a member of our People Development Team to discuss your CV Applicants who pass the screening interview, regardless of the position they are interviewing for, will be given a real-world project to solve over the course of one week (or two weeks if you are currently employed in a full-time job). In exchange for your time, we give you two books relevant to the rest of the interview process and £500 worth of free credits on the Signaloid Cloud Developer Platform Applicants who successfully complete the project are invited for a set of 45-minute interviews with people from our core teams (there will be up to six such interviews) which will use the project you completed as a discussion point In the final stage, applicants are invited for an on-site interview with members of the team in Cambridge, or a "virtual onsite" interview where a team from Signaloid will be at your disposal to implement a solution to a representative challenge you could face in the role     Benefits     A flexible remote-first work environment     Be part of an international team with the flexibility to choose where you live You can work any set of eight hours in a day provided four of those hours overlap with the working day in Zurich Regularly join the rest of the team for in-person sessions somewhere in Europe (travel and lodging expenses covered by Signaloid)     Competitive Compensation     Yearly bonus based on company's Objectives and Key Results (OKR) performance and bi-yearly bonus based on your project team's OKR performance Simple transparent compensation across the company All full-time employees receive attractive stock options package     A driven but respectful environment     Our motto is "We're all going to die": We never speak ill of others even if we differ in our viewpoints; we show up every day with a sense of urgency; we treat each other with respect as though each day were our last No isolated "projects": No person in the team works in isolation and a successful outcome for the thread of work you lead will inherently depend on getting help from (and helping) other members of the team

Title: Data Analyst | Python & MySQL (Remote)
Description: iubenda is a legal-tech scale-up founded in 2011, now trusted by over 90K clients in the EU, the US, and 100+ more Countries. We are leaders in our industry and operate on a global scale developing and releasing innovative tech solutions. Our mission is to provide our clients with everything their business needs - to be compliant with legal, local, and regional requirements; so that they can focus on their core product. Recently, we have undertaken a new thrilling adventure, joining forces with team.blue (a worldwide leader in digital enablement). If you're excited to work at a company in a scaling-up environment providing SaaS solutions to ~1M users - and equally important - to join a team of friendly people with a culture based on continuous learning, transparency, and collaboration. Then, you're looking at the right place!   Your mission  We're looking for an enthusiastic and business-support-oriented Data Analyst to join our Finance Team and be responsible for providing support in revenue-controlling, budgeting and forecasting, and business KPIs optimization.  You will report to our Financial Controlling Manager and will be in charge of: - Collection and analyses of data coming from different systems (i.e., data warehouse, databases, and web apps); - Drafting reports, presentations, and business analyses related also, but not only, to web analytics services through BI tools; - Carrying out activities aimed at budgeting and forecasting, and revenue recognition; - Taking care of churn and retention analysis, funnel optimization, A/B testing, customer scoring, and predictive modeling; - Interacting with different teams, especially with the Software Development one.   Requirements  - At least 3 years of experience in a similar role; - Sound knowledge of Python language (aimed at MySQL connections, CSV imports, connections with external sources, data processing, and data visualization); - Sound knowledge of MySQL (aimed at writing complex Queries and Store Procedures); - Sound knowledge of PowerBI or Tableau (aimed at creating and managing dashboards); - Good Excel and Powerpoint skills (i.e., complex formulas and visual charts); - Familiarity with general economics concepts; - Full professional proficiency in English.   Added values  - Proactive and willing to provide ideas and propose improvements; - Familiarity with statistics and predictive models. - Good knowledge of marketing tools such as Heap.io, Funnel.io, or similar (aimed at extracting data and creating and managing dashboards); - Previous experience in a SaaS company;   Location  At iubenda we believe in full-remote. Accordingly, you will be completely free and entitled to work from wherever you prefer in the world. At the same time in case you prefer to work from an office, at your disposal you have our Italian (Milan and Bologna) and German (Berlin and Hamburg) offices, to allow you to follow a hybrid work model.   Benefits  COMPETITIVE SALARY - We offer a competitive salary compared with other European scale-ups. We have high standards for finding the best people to join our team. Besides, we offer generous paid time off (+25 weekdays/year); REMOTE WORK - You can work 100% remotely or if you prefer, from one of our beautiful offices in Italy (Bologna and Milan) and Germany (Berlin and Hamburg). We are used and fully structured to onboard people who prefer to work full-time remotely. TRAVEL ALLOWANCE TO VISIT A COLLEAGUE - You will be provided with a travel allowance so that you can visit your colleagues based on the other side of the world; COMPANY RETREATS - We get together in amazing destinations once a year to work, bond, and enjoy team-building activities. We offer fully paid week-long retreats; WORK EQUIPMENT - You will be provided with an equipment allowance so that you can perform at your best; LEARNING BUDGET - We'll sponsor your professional growth by providing a budget that can be used for courses, events, workshops, and books; BRIGHT & HEALTHY WORK ENVIRONMENT - You will be part of a multicultural team full of talented, mature, and experienced colleagues. Along with that, you will find a team spirit, which you would rarely find elsewhere; THERAPY INCENTIVE - We sponsor online therapy sessions in English and Italian with psychologists experienced in different approaches; ENGLISH CLASSES - We offer online English classes weekly, on several different levels, within working hours.  Please send your CV in English. Want to know more about iubenda? Check us out at: iubenda.com | LinkedIn | Facebook |Twitter
Function: Gestión y Tecnología de la información
Industry: Servicios de TI y consultoría de TI

Title: Social Media Marketing Specialist
Description: The role of a Social Media Marketing Specialist at Canonical     We're on the look out for a brilliant Social Media Marketing Specialist to join our team and take our communications to the next level. Our social media provides a window between the people who make our products and those who use them. With audiences in the millions, our online communities have the opportunity to talk to us, engage with us, provide feedback and be involved in the world of Ubuntu. From #opensource to coffee on K8s, launch previews to twitter storms over some cool release swag, our marketing team is committed to creating conversations with audiences all over planet earth: developers, tech enthusiasts, security engineers...     The ideal candidate is passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. They prefer to work in an environment that emphasises ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. They love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier.     This role sits in the communications team reporting to the director of communications.     Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.     What your day will look like     Create, schedule and publish content and campaigns across multiple social media channels Deliver regular analysis and reporting on social media metrics, content performance and campaigns results Support the growth and nurturing of Canonical's social media audiences, while increasing engagement rates and valuable actions Develop flair with copywriting and asset creation to create messaging that aligns with the brand and its personality, and drives audiences towards action Be responsible for executing A/B and multivariate growth tests Be audience centric, focusing on platform and community moderation, as well as direct audience engagement Create awareness on integrated campaigns, product launches, webinar series, industry announcements and core content. Package all of Canonical's product offerings and educational material creatively, from bare metal, AI, Kubernetes to chats on diversity and CSR.     What we are looking for in you     Experience managing social media platforms for tech brands, part of a content team or marketing agency Hands-on knowledge of social media management tools, an understanding of web analytics tools (social and web) Proficiency with at least four social media platforms including LinkedIn, YouTube, Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and Reddit An analytical eye and a good sense for the type of content that performs best depending on platform and objective Experience with educational content funnels, and using video as a core social media marketing asset Exceptional interpersonal skills and aptitude for forging trusting relationships across diverse, cross-functional teams Excellent verbal and written communication skills, strong content marketer Proven ability to prioritise and differentiate what matters from the noise, meeting deadlines without sacrificing quality Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events     What We Offer You     Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.     In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, please ask your Talent Partner.     Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004! Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum Annual compensation review Recognition rewards Annual holiday leave Parental Leave Employee Assistance Programme Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints' Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events     About Canonical     Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.     Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.     Canonical is an equal opportunity employer     We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: QA Manager - Madrid (M/F)
Description: Estamos a recrutar um/a QA Manager (m/f) para reforçar a nossa equipa em Madrid com possibilidade de trabalhar em regime remoto.     O que procuramos:     Licenciatura em Engenharia, Sistemas de Informação, Gestão ou equivalente; Mais de 5 anos de experiência; Experiência em automação de testes com Selenium e Cypress; Fluência em Espanhol (obrigatório); Bons conhecimentos de Inglês (valorizado).      O que temos para oferecer:     Flexibilidade no regime de trabalho (remoto); Plano de acompanhamento regular; Participação em projetos com tecnologia inovadora e de dimensão internacional; Remuneração compatível com a experiência demonstrada, seguro de saúde e seguro de vida; Dia de Aniversário e Prémio de Referências.      Se te revês neste perfil, envia-nos o CV atualizado para recrutamento@movilges.com     Se quiseres saber mais sobre Nós:     A Movilges conta com mais de 30 anos de experiência no mercado Espanhol, especializada em Logística, Mobilidade e IT, oferece serviços de Consultoria, desenvolvimento de aplicações e manutenção de sistemas. Tal como o universo tecnológico, em constante evolução, também a Movilges pretende evoluir, aumentando a sua presença em Portugal, não só prestando os melhores serviços a parceiros e clientes, bem como oferecendo as melhores condições, benefícios e oportunidades de crescimento profissional para toda a sua equipa.     Em Portugal estamos presentes em diferentes setores, tais como, tecnologia, saúde, administração pública, energia, serviços, banca e seguros.     Ao remeter-nos a sua candidatura, autoriza a Movilges Portugal a tratar os seus dados pessoais tais como nome, e-mail, contacto telefónico e informações referentes às suas experiências académicas e profissionais, constantes no seu CV. O processamento destes dados serve apenas para os fins legítimos da empresa, ou seja, para os processos de recrutamento de profissionais qualificados para a nossa equipa. Para alguma questão relacionada com os seus dados pessoais pode contactar-nos para o email portugal@movilges.com
Industry: Servicios de TI y consultoría de TI

Title: Art Producer - Game Team
Description: Who We Are  At Fortis Games we aspire to make great games that bring people together while redefining how game companies work. We believe in building a sense of belonging through our games, their communities, and how we operate and treat each other. Through our game communities, we will create powerful connections and lasting memories. We will foster a culture of diversity, equity and belonging where together our diverse skills, experiences and background impact the games we make.  We are an early but mighty organization with a leadership team of game industry veterans. There are many opportunities for you to have a big impact on the products we’ll be making as well as the overall direction of the company. If you’re passionate about tackling difficult problems with direct and thoughtful communication and team first mentality, we may be the right place for you.  About The Role  As Art Producer you will join a growing team to help develop and release a new game. You will collaborate with all areas of the team to drive forward the project strategy. As a strong facilitator, you will own the team planning to ensure all members of the art team have common and clear goals. You will be responsible for scheduling and working with the art team to ensure delivery of game ready assets.  Own the delivery of art assets needed for features, milestones, and releases. Establish and create processes to help the art team and vendor run efficiently and smoothly. Act as the glue between art teams and production, communicating needs, identifying dependencies, and addressing issues. Work closely with the Art Director to distill the vision into guidelines to guide outsourced art outputs Set up quality control and review mechanisms to support the art director and leads and ensure quality output. Facilitate communication, reviews, and delivery of assets with art outsource groups. Ensure that team members are working from a tracked schedule and that they have a strong sense of ownership, responsibility and accountability   What you’ll need to be successful  3+ years experience working in game development or live operations in production or art management. Strong understanding of agile methodology (Agile, Kanban, Clickup, Asana, Jira) A team player who works well with others and leads by example Great organization, planning, and attention to detail. Ability to effectively structure and track large amounts of complex information. Familiarity with artistic techniques, approaches, and technology, and ability to effectively communicate requirements and feedback on these topics to subject matter experts. Ability to communicate clearly across teams, disciplines, and multiple stakeholders. Experience working with external art vendors or partners.   Why join us  There are many reasons to join us, but here are a few:  We strongly believe we are changing how games studios operate and at the core of what we do is making great games that create a connected community We're not just about making Games Where You Belong. We're also about building communities where our people belong. That's why Fortis is a thriving environment that celebrates diversity, embraces inclusivity, and fosters growth. Build and grow with a seasoned team of accomplished talent who have left an impactful mark in their disciplines, both in and out of gaming   Fortis is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Company: Agencia Amazon Nozama Solutions | Primera Plataforma Tecnológica de Gestión de cuentas Amazon.
Title: Técnico administrativo área logística
Description: ¡Únete a nuestro equipo en Nozama Solutions y sé parte del éxito!     Somos la plataforma líder en gestión de cuentas Amazon en España, ¡y nuestra ambición no tiene límites! Buscamos profesionales apasionados que quieran aportar su talento a una empresa en constante crecimiento. Si tienes una actitud positiva, eres resiliente y estás listo/a para alcanzar el éxito junto a nosotros, ¡te estamos buscando!     Vamos a incorporar a nuestra compañía un perfil admisntrativo del área logística, para gestionar la parte operativa e incidencias de nuestro centro logístico en México.     ¿Te emociona la idea de trabajar en un entorno joven y entusiasta dentro de una compañía en pleno auge? Entonces, no pierdas esta oportunidad y solicita nuestra oferta, siempre que cumplas con los siguientes requisitos:     Experiencia en tareas administrativas. Nivel de inglés alto (al menos B2). Perfil polivalente y multitarea. Alta capacidad analítica. Capacidad para tomar decisiones y adaptabilidad al cambio. Capacidad resolutiva y motivación para llevar a cabo las funciones requeridas de forma óptima.     ¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?     Gestión y análisis de datos, con el objetivo de que la producción diaria se reciba y envíe en condiciones adecuadas. Gestión de incidencias del centro logístico. Realización de tareas administrativas fundamentales para el buen funcionamiento del departamento. Realización de guardias en caso de necesidad (Festivos). Viajes al centro logístico en México de forma periódica.     ¿Qué ofrecemos?     Contrato indefinido, porque creemos en la estabilidad y el crecimiento mutuo. Trabajo 100% remoto. Formación específica para el puesto de forma presencial en nuestras oficinas de Pinto (los primeros 1-2 meses). Excelente ambiente de trabajo.     Por operativa del centro logístico, será necesario que la persona que se incorpore tenga disponibilidad horaria en turno de tarde y noche.     Nos motiva crear un lugar de trabajo inclusivo que fomente y valore la diversidad. Creemos que cuanto más inclusivos seamos, mejor será nuestro trabajo. Para ello, es importante que nuestros empleados se sientan cómodos aportando su auténtico potencial al trabajo.

Title: Client Relationship Manager - France (Remote)
Description: Position     The principal purpose of the Client Relationship Manager is to build long-term relationships with clients, proactively foster the achievements of sales and ensure that the highest level of Client experience is delivered. They should be able to upsell and cross- sell generating more revenue in the assigned portfolio.     The Client Relationship Manager should represent the company values and demonstrate Learnlight attitudes towards clients and team members.     Responsibilities     Main Objectives     Build and develop the client portfolio. Ensure business opportunities are maximized Aim to preserve customers and renew contracts     Client Retention and Growth     Understand customer needs and develop plans to address them Identify key staff in client companies to cultivate profitable relationships Resolve customer complaints quickly and effectively Forward upselling and cross-selling opportunities to the sales team Promote high-quality sales, supply and customer service processes Create strategies to combat potential revenue losses Guarantee the program renewals, bring in repeated business by resolving any outstanding issues Design programs and proposals selecting the best language solutions according to the client’s budget and needs Program follow-up, end-of-program, new services meetings and calls with clients. Show attention to clients and keep them informed about new language trends, services, etc Control of the client portfolio billing to guarantee the maintenance and growth of the accounts Provide clear forecasting for sales planning purposes.  Identify opportunities to increase sales of existing products and services or highlighting requirements for developing new products     General Client Management     Understand the services and company's structure as well as facilitates communication between various departments Serve as a liaison between a company and clients to help ensure client satisfaction. Help in the client’s segmentation Conduct and lead the implementation of the programs sold Have control of the client's billing by completing the invoicing & forecasting document Enter and update the client's forecasting in the Invoicing & forecasting document Updating and maintaining CRM Receiving and improve stable clients from the Sales Development teams Upsell new and more profitable products in current clients Conduct and guide the client in the transition to virtual programs Liaise with the rest of sales teams     Requirements     Competencies     Friendly, personal attitude Ability to juggle multiple account management projects at a time, while maintaining sharp attention to detail Strong communication, negotiation, and presentation skills Team-oriented Strategic and big picture mind set Fantastic research skills Results oriented with a can-do attitude Creative thinker ready to develop solutions for existing clients, as well as pursue new clientele opportunities In depth understanding of our company's products or services and knowledge of the competition     Skills     Native/C2 level in French C1 level in English Great presentation skills in a virtual environment     Education & Experience     Demonstrated experience in B2B sales Previous work experience EdTech or Training industry, preferred Experience delivering client-focused solutions to customer needs Experience using CRM sales related tools Experience working with a remote team highly valued     Benefits     Flexible Working: Learnlight is a fully distributed virtual business with staff in 30+ countries and offices in 9 European cities People-Powered Culture: We have a flat, modern, meritocratic culture that values enthusiasm, initiative, and commitment above all else.  Competitive Remuneration: We offer market-matching competitive salaries.      Learning & Development: Personalized language and soft skills training; ongoing professional development talks and masterclasses; frequent coaching and constructive feedback.    Diversity & Inclusion: Learnlight fosters an open, positive, and diverse community that welcomes talent regardless of gender, religion, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age or disability.      Community Events: We offer a range of social events including Virtual Drinks, Book Club, Tea Time and in-person departmental and All Company meetups     Details     Location: Office-based or Home-based (or a mix)     Contract: Full-time   Schedule: European time zone

Title: Specialist
Description: Objective of the AC-JOB Test Position     Testing software like a pro Breaking code with each new flow Finding bugs and glitches fast Our skills are unsurpassed Automated API tests are used to check the functionality, reliability, and performance of an API. By sending requests and verifying responses, an automated API test ensures that the API can handle different input scenarios and behave correctly under different conditions. It saves time, reduces errors, and provides more complete coverage than manual testing.

Title: Senior Expansion Manager Spain (f/m/d)
Description: We at STAYERY see ourselves as the next-generation serviced apartment brand. Being part of our team makes it easy for you to give your best, because we are always supportive and motivating. We love it when you shine with a hands-on mentality, try things out, and simply take action. Exciting goals are what drive us. 🚀  What do you do?  You are our go-to contact person for the further expansion of STAYERY in Spain You research, select and acquire new locations and secure projects through expressions of interest You actively expand and leverage your network of brokers, consultants, and project developers to further STAYERY's expansion You help position STAYERY as an attractive partner for real estate developers and investors  You've got what it takes!  You have a degree in real estate/business administration or a related field You have at least 3 years of professional experience in real estate/ project development/ expansion You have a solid network in the real estate industry (hotel segment is desirable) You work independently and in a structured manner You speak Spanish at a native level and fluent English; German language skills are a plus  And there's more on top!  Celebrate with us 🪩 - You won't get bored with us. We foster an exceptional team spirit through regular team and company events such as Christmas or summer parties. Our quarterly events also keep you up to date on STAYERY's development and exciting news. Technically flawless 🧑‍💻 - For us it's Apple all over! We work with modern hardware, so you will use a MacBook to enable your best work. Room to grow 💡 - Many talk about flat hierarchies, but we live them. We all work together closely, regardless of our roles. Short decision-making paths accelerate processes, and you have more say. All of this is part of our startup vibe! Stay flexible 🏄 - Flexibility in our work routine is essential. We trust our employees to plan independently and make their projects a success.  Your path to us 🚀  Get to know us - In a conversation with our HR manager Lena, you will gain insight into STAYERY and the position. Case study - Tackle an exciting practical task and show us what you're capable of. Case study interview - Meet our co-founder Hannibal and discuss your case study results. Meet the team- Get to know your future colleagues over a coffee and ask any open questions. Your application  STAYERY is an equal opportunity and diversity employer - regardless of age, nationality, ethnic origin, disability, gender, religion, sexual orientation or social background. We recognize the strength in diversity and foster a work environment that includes and values all employees equally. You can submit your application to us without a photo or providing your nationality, age and gender. We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Sales & Marketing Lead
Description: About TrekkSoft     TrekkSoft is a tech centric company in the Tours and Activities industry. For over 10 years it has developed cutting edge booking solutions for activity providers, DMOs and OTAs. We are part of the TrekkSoft Group of companies with which we maintain a close working relationship.     Our team is globally distributed and works together on solving market challenges. We implement a transparent and open management system where individual impact is encouraged. We make the world’s activities bookable by enabling our diverse and exciting client base.     About The Role     TrekkSoft is looking for its next Business Development Lead. This is a senior, hands-on sales role that will spend the majority of time closing deals, but also includes Marketing leadership and team management aspects. You will be taking ownership of two main functions:     First: Senior ABM sales representative, create your own ABM funnel and close target accounts in key territories.     Second: Manage and lead a small Sales & Marketing team, owning the output of the entire team.     You will own the sales pipeline and drive deal closing, primarily through an ABM approach. This requires experience in this area, a strong understanding of digital marketing in the SaaS segment, and passion for the travel industry. It will also require strong experience in driving long cycle lead nurturing with the team, while being able to win difficult deals individually or by supporting team members.     A key function of this role is to build and foster synergies between Marketing and Sales with a focus on generating and qualifying the right leads so that meaningful clients join the service. Do note that most of your time will be spent on first hand selling. In this role, your ability to make an impact in an agile SaaS company should be a primary driver and source of success.     The role reports directly to the COO and CEO.     Responsibilities:     Hands on Sales (roughly 2/3 of your time):     Create and manage your own ABM funnel in key territories (Switzerland, Norway, and others where applicable) through outbound methods Reach personal sales targets through calling, automation and face to face contact Attend trade shows and other lead generating events Build and nurture long term relationships in the Tour Operator industry     Sales and Marketing team leadership (roughly 1/3 of your time):     Define the Sales and Marketing approach based on our product, market, and resources Own the Marketing and Sales sales pipelines of the entire team. Review and refine the sales and marketing processes, building a strong and sustained ABM approach in our core markets Drive and prioritize the Sales-Marketing planning with the team, with the goal of collaborating on funnel creation and closing deals Manage a small Sales and Marketing team. Prioritize tasks, lead the Sales and Marketing meetings Coaching and mentoring, as well as performing periodic performance reviews and bonus tracking for your team Work cross functionally with other departments to feed information on sales focus and product fit. Help define clear USPs for the product Review and report on the Sales and Marketing KPIs to management Use and refine the sales metrics and dashboards to produce insight driven action     Requirements     First hand, 10+ years of experience in a senior outbound / AMB sales role Exposure to Marketing & Sales planning. Passion for the tourism industry Being a native German speaker is a strong plus. Fluent English is a must Willingness to travel Strong experience owning and managing marketing and sales pipelines in Hubspot, Salesforce or a similar platform. Strong ability to learn and articulate the functionalities of complex software     Benefits     Competitive salary An opportunity to grow into a hands-on leadership role in Marketing & Sales A full-time contract, with a 6 month trial period Work from our coworking office in Barcelona, fully remote from a different location, or through a combination. We are flexible! Support for online certifications, courses and books Be part of a highly international, motivated and fun team Take the day off on your birthday Join our yearly Team Week in an international location! Participate in TSG Group retreats twice a year to share experiences with leaders from across the groups other companies. Grow in a dynamic and fast-paced environment with lots of opportunities to make an impact

Title: TRABAJA CON NOSOTROS DESDE DONDE ESTÉS
Chief of Staff
Description: ALOHAS is more than a fashion brand: it’s a responsible shopping experience and a chance to participate in the fight against overproduction in fashion.     Working at ALOHAS is being part of the innovation and growth of a Spanish start-up with a young, creative and proactive team, good communication and a high level of energy! It’s demanding but extremely rewarding due to an environment where we take pride in learning from one another and strive to make sustainability a way of life beyond the workplace.     In a nutshell, we love what we do and it shows! 😀     THE ROLE     The Chief of Staff to the CEO is a very talented individual who serves as a trusted advisor and confidant to the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) for up to 36 months. The Chief of Staff to the CEO and the CEO work closely together to get twice as much done as the CEO would be able to do alone. Over time the work will get more interesting culminating in a senior leadership position at ALOHAS or another company. This is a unique opportunity to see every aspect of a fast-growing unicorn at the CEO level. For more context see the references at the end of this page.     YOUR CHALLENGE:     The responsibilities include both directed work that will mostly be triggered by a direction from the CEO as well as leadership work that is self-directed. Over the course of a rotation, the mix will shift from majority-directed work to majority leadership work.     Directed Work     Create investor updates, pitch decks, speeches, conference submissions, and presentations on behalf of the CEO.     Suggest changes to processes via the handbook based on discussions during meetings or from the CEO and address any comments on them. The CEO shadows will keep doing the majority of these.     Draft blog posts and articles out of recorded meetings and handbook content.     Ensure upcoming meetings are relevant and well structured, and that the preparation is complete and correct.     Ensure action points coming out of meetings (i.e. executive, OKR, key, or incident meetings) are implemented.     Reinforce communication guidelines.     Prep for the CEO Group Conversations     Moderate the e-group meetings.     Keep this job family up-to-date.     Leadership Work     Initiate and guide the OKR process according to the OKR schedule     Identify opportunities to acknowledge success and ensure that they are appropriately recognized by the CEO.     Review OKR suggestions during the scheduled OKR meetings and outside of the meetings.     Own agenda for the E-group offsite.     Serve as a proxy for the CEO by attending meetings in place of the CEO and making decisions on the CEO's behalf.     Chief of Staff to the CEO will participate in every E-group meeting. The person will not be an executive or part of the e-group.     Act as the communication arm for the CEO with team members, clients, investors, community members, and other stakeholders.     Act as a sounding board to the CEO for new ideas and initiatives.     Prepare ahead of formal and informal Board meetings. Ensure CEO has up-to-date information from every function in advance of questions from the board.     Run special projects that are urgent and important, for example building a company-wide compensation model.     Lead all many-function efforts     YOU WILL ROCK AT THIS ROLE IF…     Capacity to become a senior leader at ALOHAS. Proven ability to quickly learn new things. Concise written and verbal communication. Structured about how to prioritize work and time. Able to make a clear business case for proposals. Master’s degree in Engineering or Business Administration or equivalent experience. Experience with data analysis. Proven success in project coordination and reporting. Proven track record of effectively interacting with senior stakeholders on cross-functional projects. Experience leading a team. 4+ years combined experience in:- Senior operating role at a significant fast-growing startup - Strategy consulting or Venture capital. 2+ years of people management experience. Operational experience in a previous role     Rotation     Rotation is 24 to 36 months with the following tentative schedule:     2-3 months of onboarding, 18 months of execution, 1 - 4 months of recruiting your replacement and waiting for them to start, 2 - 3 months of onboarding your replacement and interviewing at ALOHAS for senior leadership positions.     BENEFITS Of Being Part Of ALOHAS     Culture of freedom, diversity & inclusion, and responsibility ✨ Flexible schedule: Fit it into your routine! ⏰ Discounts: You will have special discounts 💯 and we do not forget your family and friends either! Home office setup: You will get a laptop + electronic devices like a keyboard, mouse, and second screen 💻 Keep learning with ALOHAS 🎓 We offer English courses to our employees, more languages coming soon! We take care of your happiness 🌈 and professional growth with constructive feedback 💪 After-work events in Barcelona and Madrid every month 🎉     Ready for the challenge?🚀     About ALOHAS     Want to know more? Video Presentation     Apply to work with us: careers.alohas.io     Our website: alohas.io/ IG: @alohas
Industry: Industria textil y moda para la venta minorista

Title: Content Creator
Description: We’re looking for a Content Creator who can help us expand our site, blog, web app, templates, knowledge base, etc. We are a small team so this is a rare opportunity to have real and immediate impact as a writer & content manager!     Key Responsibilities     Manage content strategy, create targeted and relevant content, and distribute marketing communications and content to audiences online. Use content to create demand for Beau software and move customers through their buyer journey. Write blog posts and knowledge base articles. Brainstorm campaign ideas. Help us to improve existing content creation and content updating processes. Manage existing projects and take full-responsibility of all content relating processes (writing & updating content yourself). Manages the company’s social media accounts and posts content.     The Copywriter Profile     You’re a natural when it comes to writing in English. An adaptable writing style - we’re not looking for academic papers. You have an eye for the written word, graphics and beautiful digital content. You have a knowledge of SEO problematics. Having a critical mindset is key. You’re not afraid to question your work and improve. That’s how you learn and grow!     What We Offer     A freelance remote position as one of early employees at YC-company. Possibility to work from wherever you feel comfortable. We offer you flexible working hours with daily or weekly goals. Join an amazingly talented team.

Title: Senior Backend Engineer .Net (Fully Remote)
Description: Top 3 Reasons To Join Us     Competitive Salary 100% Remote Working on the latest tech for the Insurtech Market Leader     About Us     At CoverGo, our mission is to empower all insurance companies to make insurance 100% digital and accessible to everyone.     We are a leading global no-code insurance platform for health, life, and P&C We’re the winner of the Insurtech of the Year in all of Asia and other awards globally We work with insurance enterprise clients such as AXA, Bupa, MSIG, Dai-ichi, Bank of China Group Insurance, and many more We're an international, diverse team of over 120 people with 30 nationalities and team members working remotely from all over the world We are fully funded and backed by reputable VC funds and strategic institutional investors We have offices in the US, Singapore, Hong Kong, UAE and Vietnam We’ve grown our annualized revenue by over 30x since January 2021 We’re constantly working towards making CoverGo a workplace that you love coming to. We deeply believe that bringing together a diversity of thoughts, expressions, and perspectives is key to building the best culture for equally diverse communities all over the world     About The Role     Net Backend engineering is the heart of our technical excellence. We are looking for people who are able to analyze complex insurance domains and build high-quality API and microservices in cross-functional product and project teams     CoverGo is a Kubernetes-native platform that consists of around twenty microservices exposed via a GraphQL gateway (https://api.covergo.com/playground), based on .net 6.     What You Will Do     Help us build, grow and maintain our services Apply your skills to develop robust and scalable software     You'll be successful in this role if:     You are a hands-on engineer, and you love what you do You are a quick learner and excited about learning new technologies You are passionate about automated testing, code quality and engineering best practices You advocate software craftsmanship and take pride in your work You enjoy collaborating with engineers across functional teams and have excellent communication skills You enjoy taking full ownership of projects from conception to production     What We Need     Experience in Event sourcing, CQRS, and DDD (Domain Driven Design) Excellent understanding of .NET Core and C# Experience with Docker Familiarity with microservices using GraphQL Experience with database technologies like MongoDB, PostgreSQL Intensive TDD practice     It'll be nice if you have some experience in areas:     Event Storming or Event Modeling SpecFlow and BDD GitHub Actions Cloud Computing platforms: Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, Alibaba etc MS/BS in Computer Science or a related degree Insurance and fintech experience Read and understood books from Vaughn Vernon, Eric Evans, Martin Fowler Kubernetes GitOps     Why You'll Love Working Here     Salary: Up to 6,000 USD/Month Fully remote employment. Work from anywhere and/or from one of our physical offices in Vietnam, Singapore or Hong Kong occasionally Paid annual leave Employee stock options Company Performance Bonus Company activities & Team offsites Training and Development Plan     Covergo Company Video

Title: Global PR Manager
Description: ALOHAS is more than a fashion brand: it’s a responsible shopping experience and a chance to participate in the fight against overproduction in fashion.     Working at ALOHAS is being part of the innovation and growth of a Spanish start-up with a young, creative and proactive team, good communication and a high level of energy! It’s demanding but extremely rewarding due to an environment where we take pride in learning from one another and strive to make sustainability a way of life beyond the workplace.     In a nutshell, we love what we do and it shows! 😀     THE ROLE     The Global PR Manager will be in charge of managing the regional pr specialists, developing and executing the brand’s overall awareness through public relations & celebrity initiatives to generate qualitative visibility for the brand globally. The role requires a dynamic, experienced, and team-centric individual.     YOUR CHALLENGE     Develop and maintain working relationships with editors, e-influencers, agents, key stakeholders and vendors in the luxury, fashion & community spaces. Manage and develop a team of 3 to 5 freelance pr specialists. Own, maintain and present departmental growth through KPIs, identifying strengths as well as areas for growth. Analyze missed opportunities and strategize on how to course correct. Main point of contact for all reporting and analytics. Brainstorm ideas for PR opportunities and develop strong angles for pitches, press releases and e-influencer campaigns. Introduce both traditional & forward-thinking ideas. Liaise and partner with communications, affiliates, social media and partnerships on global strategies to create buzz and awareness in global and local markets across the regions. Responsible for concepting the strategy and executing PR for influencer activations, press, asset creation, pitching, e-influencer activations, events & experiences. Provides direction and guidance to other PR team members who may be supporting the project(s). Monthly check of the actual financial costs including the countries within your scope, samples, deliveries, office supplies, gifting, etc. Hire and oversee seasonal freelancer and intern support. Maintain up to date media contact lists. Manage seasonal sample orders and responsible for overseeing sample inventory seasonally. Manage editorial, influencer and VIP requests from editors, KOLs and stylists and oversee day to day sample management.     YOU WILL ROCK AT THIS ROLE IF     You have established influencer, community & editorial relationships in the luxury, creative & fashion space You have combination of creative & strategic thinking with ability to identify opportunities You are proactive, flexible, organized and hardworking You have 5 years of pr marketing or communications experience You are native french & english speaker, fluent in another language is a plus You have uphold keen understanding of the brand' values and goals You have excellent verbal & written communication, interpersonal skills & presentation You have time management skills and ability to multitask – this role requires managing many different areas for several aspects of the business simultaneously; candidate should not get stressed under pressure You provide a consistent, professional and diligent internal & external experience while managing project expectations Ideal candidate will be a motivated team player with the ability to multitask while prioritizing a dynamic workload You have bachelor’s Degree preferred     BENEFITS Of Being Part Of ALOHAS     Culture of freedom, diversity & inclusion, and responsibility ✨ Flexible schedule: Fit it into your routine! ⏰ Discounts: You will have special discounts 💯 and we do not forget your family and friends either! Office: In the heart of Barcelona, in the Gracia neighbourhood, where we take care of coffee ☕ and fruit 🍎 Work remotely: live and work wherever you want 🌍 within the CET time zone! Home office setup: You will get a laptop + electronic devices like a keyboard, mouse, and second screen 💻 Keep learning with ALOHAS 🎓 We offer English courses to our employees, more languages coming soon! We take care of your happiness 🌈 and professional growth with constructive feedback 💪 After-work events in Barcelona and Madrid every month 🎉     Ready for the challenge?🚀     About ALOHAS     Want to know more? Title: Global Head of Fraud
Description: Paymentology is the first truly global issuer-processor, giving banks and FinTechs the technology, team, and experience to rapidly issue and process Mastercard, Visa, and UnionPay cards across more than 50 countries, at scale.  Our advanced, multi-cloud platform, offering both shared and dedicated processing instances, vast global presence, and richer, real-time data, set us apart as the leader in payments.  The Global Head of Fraud is responsible for leading and managing Paymentology's global fraud prevention and detection efforts. This strategic role involves overseeing the development and implementation of robust fraud prevention strategies, policies, and procedures. The Global Head of Fraud will collaborate with cross-functional teams and external partners to ensure compliance with regulations, enhance fraud prevention measures, and protect Paymentology and its customers from fraudulent activities.  What you get to do::  The Global Head of Fraud will collaborate with cross-functional teams and external partners to ensure compliance with regulations, enhance fraud prevention measures, and protect Paymentology and its customers from fraudulent activities.   Develop and execute a comprehensive global fraud prevention strategy aligned with Paymentology's risk management objectives. Develop and implement a strategy for Fraud monitoring, working closely with Compliance and Product teams. Lead and manage a globally distributed team of fraud prevention professionals, providing guidance, support, and performance feedback. Own and continuously improve team capabilities, skills, and capacity development, including key areas (like processes, quality assurance, regulatory compliance, and workforce management) ownership. Implement effective fraud prevention policies, procedures, and controls to safeguard Paymentology and its customers from fraud risks. Stay updated on industry trends, emerging fraud typologies, and regulatory requirements to continuously enhance Paymentology's fraud prevention measures. Collaborate with internal stakeholders, such as Compliance, Legal, and IT, to integrate fraud prevention efforts across all business units and systems. Establish and maintain relationships with industry partners, law enforcement agencies, and regulatory bodies to exchange information and stay ahead of fraud trends. Conduct regular fraud risk assessments to identify vulnerabilities and recommend appropriate mitigation strategies. Utilise advanced fraud detection tools, technologies, and analytics to proactively identify and investigate suspicious activities. Rigorously use data to drive decision-making, develop new approaches, evaluate program performance, and advocate for product changes that improve the accuracy of our fraud monitoring program. Drive awareness and training programs to educate employees about fraud risks, prevention techniques, and reporting procedures. Prepare and present reports to senior management and the board of directors, highlighting key fraud prevention initiatives, performance metrics, and risk mitigation strategies. Assume leadership of fraud incident handling, ensuring a prompt intervention, followed by a well-coordinated and thorough investigation, report, and successful implementation of preventative measures. Engage with key clients in any matters pertaining to fraud, guiding them as subject matter experts and giving them confidence in the Paymentology platforms.   Requirements:  What it takes to succeed:   Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Finance, Business Administration, or Risk Management. Advanced degree preferred. Proven experience of at least 10 years in fraud prevention, detection, and investigation, preferably in a global or multinational organisation. Strong knowledge of fraud prevention strategies, methodologies, and industry best practices. Familiarity with global fraud regulations, compliance requirements, and industry standards. Demonstrated leadership and people management skills, with a track record of building and developing high-performing teams. Analytical mindset with the ability to analyse complex data, identify patterns, and make informed decisions. Proficiency in using fraud detection tools, data analytics, and case management systems. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders at all levels. Strong organisational skills, including the ability to prioritise tasks, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and meet deadlines. Professional certifications in fraud prevention or related areas, such as Certified Fraud Examiner (CFE) or Certified Fraud Control Manager (CFCM), are desirable.   This is a full-time, remote contractor position and we are looking for candidates, located in timezone (UTC +1-4). Flexible hours are a must for our remote team!  What you can look forward to::  At Paymentology we value making a difference to the lives of the people who work for us and who live in the communities where we operate. You can look forward to working with a diverse, global team where Paymentologists at all levels play an important part in our global mission to advance the world through payments and make a difference on a global scale.

Title: Software Engineer
Description: Who are ZenRows?     We are a fast growing startup, working 100% remotely, developing the most complete AntiBot bypassing system. ZenRows proprietary SaaS API facilitates web data extraction at scale for companies worldwide without the hassle!     Founded by serial entrepreneurs Aurken and Ander, we are a small team of 3 engineers looking to bring our next Software Engineer into the team! We have recently secured our first round of funding of €1.1 million, are already profitable, and our web traffic is expected to double in the next 3 months.     Responsibilities     We seek someone with a startup mentality who enjoys the massive technical challenges that come with it. Through joining ZenRows you will:     Become ZenRows 4th person in our Engineering team Help scale our API application in our next exciting stage of growth Keep our services reliable, available and fast Design, implement and maintain developer tools Respond to, investigate and fix issues, whether deep in the code or within client applications Create the engineering playbook & best practices to be followed by the team Mentor future hires     A few challenges you'll handle on a daily basis:     Fine-tuning TLS ciphers Patching browsers to death Developing anti-fingerprinting techniques Tweaking high-performance proxies, gateways and load balancers Reverse engineering heavily obfuscated files     Requirements     Who are we looking for?     A talented Backend Software Engineer with experience working successfully in large scale operations Golang experience is preferred, however the ability to adapt to new languages is more important - we work in a no stack environment so knowledge matters more than languages and frameworks Hands-on and accountable - we HATE micromanaging as much as you do Eager to learn and experiment with new technologies No ego Proactive, transparent with a no BS culture Self-learner, good teacher, top student Analytical Results-oriented     Benefits     Equity in ZenRows Flexible work schedule Fully Remote work High growth environment with huge opportunity to grow Language classes Budget for professional training and development Whatever tools you need to do awesome work     Apply now, join our team and unleash your potential!

Title: Product Designer
Description: En BESIDE apostamos por el mejor talento dentro del sector tecnológico.  Contamos con una unidad de Selección Especializada en perfiles de Ingeniería para incorporarse en la plantilla de nuestros clientes. Trabajamos con un amplio rango de empresas, que nos permitirá encontrarte el puesto que más se ajuste a tus necesidades e intereses profesionales. Te podrás incorporar en las empresas más innovadoras, ofreciéndote proyectos punteros dentro de las ramas de I+D, automoción, pharma, diseño de maquinaria, desarrollo de producto, etc...  Conectamos el mejor talento tech con las mejores oportunidades.  Actualmente estamos en búsqueda de un/a Product Designer para incorporarse de manera indefinida en nuestro cliente final, un estudio de productos digitales de Barcelona.  Nos asociamos con empresas audaces para innovar nuevos servicios y construir productos digitales. Nuestros valores son: muestra tu pasión, actuar como un propietario y pensar con rigor, resolverlo y mantener la línea.  Como diseñador de movimiento, desarrollarás conceptos innovadores e impulsarás la  idea hasta los resultados finales.Trabajarás en y producirás productos disruptivos pero  soluciones de interfaz de usuario altamente intuitivas y bellamente elaboradas para web móviles y otras plataformas. Como parte de un equipo multidisciplinar, serás responsable de la conceptualización creativa y asegurar la más alta calidad de ejecución ejecución visual e interactiva.  Tus principales responsabilidades serán:  Trabajar junto con socios y jefes de producto para entender los objetivos de negocio y métricas clave y definir cómo se traducen en el diseño. Realizar tu propia investigación y entrevistas con usuarios para validar conceptos. Colaborar estrechamente con los clientes, a través de rondas de retroalimentación. Crear prototipos y diseñar interacciones de alta fidelidad. Mantener un extraordinario nivel de atención al detalle en cada paso del   proceso para proporcionar una ejecución excepcional desde el pensamiento conceptual hasta la interacción y el diseño visual.  Qué te ofrecemos:  Un sistema híbrido de trabajo desde casa/oficina con un horario flexible. Si quieres venir a la oficina, siempre habrá fruta fresca, café y tentempiés. 22 días de vacaciones. Macbook Pro 13" o similar. Un salario base de aproximadamente 26.000€ - 32.000€ brutos al año. Tu cumpleaños como día extra de vacaciones pagadas. Eventos sociales y fiestas legendarias.   Requisitos:  Aportarás:  Capacidad para comunicar los fundamentos del diseño a los clientes. Puede articular el   el "por qué" y dirigir debates sobre su proceso, exploraciones y conclusiones.  Sólidos conocimientos de los principios y mejores prácticas de UX, incluyendo   entender cuándo y dónde se deben incorporar diferentes metodologías en el proceso de diseño.  Conocimiento de Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, y herramientas de prototipado. Se valorará positivamente la experiencia en motion design o ilustración. Habilidades de comunicación escrita y verbal efectivas, seguras y concisas.   (español e inglés)  Mérito extra si:  Has puesto en marcha proyectos paralelos propios. Te gusta trabajar fuera de tu zona de confort. Le apasionan las tendencias y la evolución del diseño y la tecnología. Tienes experiencia en consultoría o en trabajar con clientes corporativos.

Title: Middle Office Specialist
Description: ¡Hola!     Tenemos una nueva oportunidad laboral en MBC. ¿Quieres unirte a nosotros?        Sobre MBC     May Business Consulting es una empresa de consultoría internacional que ofrece asesoría en transformación digital, gestión del cambio, eficiencia y control. Tenemos un enfoque centrado completamente en el cliente, nos involucramos al 100% de manera proactiva para maximizar nuestro valor agregado. Nuestro modelo de negocio nos permite ayudar a nuestros clientes de manera eficiente a mejorar los niveles de servicio y reducir costes.     Estamos situados en España y Reino Unido, y trabajamos en proyectos internacionales con entidades financieras, bancos, fintechs y startups. Actualmente nos encontramos en un momento de expansión y crecimiento por ello nos gustaría aumentar nuestra área de consultores.        Sobre el perfil     Estamos buscando un Middle Office Associate para incorporar en nuestro equipo de Alemania. Colaborarás con uno de nuestros clientes del sector bancario dentro del área de Trade Finance.     Como Middle Office Associate, realizará la administración, el seguimiento y el control de las transacciones comerciales, como garantías directas e indirectas, SBLC, cartas de crédito de importación y exportación registradas en la Sucursal de Frankfurt.     Tareas     • Administración y control de todas las transacciones comerciales registradas en la Sucursal de Frankfurt.     • Comprobación de contratos y derechos de cobro de autorizaciones (legales, de riesgos, de cumplimiento/delito financiero, firmas autorizadas...)     • Elaboración del Memorándum de cierre y archivo de toda la documentación aplicable.     • Control de las Condiciones Precedentes (Cps) aplicables a transacciones para iniciar operaciones.     • Apoyar el flujo de trabajo de operaciones para productos actuales y nuevos (por ejemplo, comercio).     • Seguimiento y reporte de la posición de riesgos de los clientes, seguimiento del proceso de facturación y/o cualquier partida de conciliación relacionada.     • Apoyar la implementación de las iniciativas estratégicas clave de Frankfurt que afectan a esta familia de productos.     Sobre ti     Experiencia en Trade, conocimiento de garantías y Cartas de crédito para realizar funciones de MO. Estudios en Economía, Administración de Empresas o similar. Nivel alto de alemán, inglés y español. Familiarizado con el comercio financiero y los contratos de cuentas por cobrar, así como con los términos económicos de las transacciones. Disponibilidad para vivir en Frankfurt que es la oficina desde la que se prestará servicio Buen dominio de MS Office        Sobre lo que te ofrece MBC     Atractivo paquete retributivo. Contrato indefinido con MBC + posibilidad de contratación directa con el cliente pasados 6 meses. Retribución flexible que incluye: seguro médico, cheques restaurantes, etc. Formación gratuita personalizada para ayudarte a tu crecimiento profesional. Participar en diversos proyectos interesantes con enfoque internacional y en un sector en continuo crecimiento. Plan de carrera. Ubicación del puesto: Frankfurt, Alemania.        Únete a una empresa joven de consultoría, con muchas posibilidades de crecimiento y desarrollo profesional. Trabaja en proyectos internacionales con buen ambiente de trabajo.
Industry: Banca y Asesoría y servicios empresariales

Title: INT Journalist
Description: Sporty's sites are some of the most popular on the internet, consistently staying in Alexa's list of top websites for the countries they operate in.     Sporty Group is seeking a highly motivated and skilled Journalist and reporter to join our news platform, Sporty News. As a part of our dynamic team, you will be responsible for creating, curating, and supervising sports and football-related articles under the guidance of our Content Editor Lead. This position is ideal for a junior journalist or recent graduate who possesses a genuine passion for sports, particularly football, and has exceptional English language skills.     Responsibilities     Produce high-quality and engaging sports and football-related articles for Sporty News, covering a range of topics such as match analysis, player interviews, sports events, transfer news, and other relevant stories     Curate and proofread articles contributed by third party providers to ensure accuracy, coherence, and adherence to Sporty Group's editorial guidelines and standards     Stay up-to-date with the latest sports and football news, events, and trends, and ensure timely coverage on Sporty News     Assist the Content Editor Lead in developing and executing an effective content strategy that aligns with Sporty Group's vision and audience interests     Collaborate with the social media team to optimise the presentation and distribution of articles on various platforms     Utilise your English proficiency skills to create and review content while considering the needs of our global English-speaking audience     Requirements     Exceptional working proficiency in verbal and written English are essential to create and supervise high-quality content     A degree in journalism, communications, or a related field is preferred, but candidates with relevant experience and a passion for sports journalism will also be considered     Master’s degree in journalism would be highly valuable     A genuine love and knowledge of sports, particularly football, is necessary to craft engaging and insightful articles     Strong journalistic writing abilities, including research, interviewing, and storytelling, to produce captivating content     Experience in editing and proofreading content, with a keen eye for detail, grammar, and style     Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, meet tight deadlines, and manage multiple tasks effectively     Excellent collaboration skills to work harmoniously with the Content Editor Lead, writers, and other team members     Fluency in Spanish is a plus     Benefits     Quarterly and flash bonuses     Flexible working hours     Top-of-the-line equipment     Education allowance     Referral bonuses     28 days paid annual leave     Annual company retreat - we all went to Dubai together in 2022 and have 2 global retreats in planning for 2023!     Highly talented, dependable co-workers in a global, multicultural organisation     Payment via DEEL, a world class online wallet system     Our teams are small enough for you to be impactful     Our business is globally established and successful, offering stability and security to our Team Members     Our Mission     Our mission is to be an everyday entertainment platform for everyone     Our Operating Principles     Create Value for Users Act in the Long-Term Interests of Sporty Focus on Product Improvements & Innovation Be Responsible Preserve Integrity & Honesty Respect Confidentiality & Privacy Ensure Stability, Security & Scalability Work Hard with Passion & Pride      Working at Sporty     The top-down mentality at Sporty is high performance based, meaning we trust you to do your job with an emphasis on support to help you achieve, grow and de-block any issues when they're in your way.     Generally employees can choose their own hours, as long as they are collaborating and doing stand-ups etc. The emphasis is really on results.     As we are a highly structured and established company we are able to offer the security and support of a global business with the allure of a startup environment. Sporty is independently managed and financed, meaning we don’t have arbitrary shareholder or VC targets to cater to.     We literally build, spend and make decisions based on the ethos of building THE best platform of its kind. We are truly a tech company to the core and take excellent care of our Team Members.
Industry: Transporte, logística, cadena de suministro y almacenamiento

Company: TST Poland Sp Z o o
Title: NLP Analyst
Description: Responsibilities     Research and analyze the scope of intents within the linguistic and technical dimensions of bot's capabilities.     Establish intent and entity scopes     Identify training needs/ gaps     Collaborate with design and development teams to ensure NL performance supports positive UX     Define the approach towards using specific platform features to service the needs of business use cases     Clean, label, and prepare training data     Create and maintain testing data sets to verify NLU performance     Analyze chat/call history and optimize intent/entity training     Debug the bot behavior and fix NL issues     Create intent/ entity accuracy reports     Must Have Skills     Excellent written and spoken communication skills     An appreciation for constant learning and solutioning     A willingness to take on challenges that are not clearly defined     Strong customer relationship management skills     Understanding of User Experience principles and techniques     Hands-on experience with chatbots and voice assistants     Background in linguistic analysis of conversational language     Ability to explain complex concepts to a diverse audience and advocate for solutions that optimize the capabilities of the platform     Familiarity with G-Suite, Office 365, and collaboration tools like MS Teams and Slack     Other Skills We'd Appreciate     Training in computational linguistics. Knowledge of deterministic and probabilistic models.     Experience building ML model data sets     Experience in data analysis. Including cleaning, classification and labeling     Experience fine tuning ASR and TTS models, background in speech acoustics     Programming capabilities in Javascript & Python     An understanding of text processing pipelines     Education Qualifications     Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computational Linguistics, or related field plus 1-3 years' professional experience     Masters Degree in Computer Science, Computational Linguistics, or related field preferred
Industry: Servicios de TI y consultoría de TI
