Title: SEM Specialist/Remoto
Description: Nuestro cliente es una agencia de diseño web y marketing digital con más de 15 años de experiencia en proyectos tecnológicos y digitales. Crean plataformas online para la venta de productos y servicios de cualquier sector.  Cubren todos los servicios como agencia digital 360 ayudando a sus clientes a simplificar el proceso de innovación y transformación digital. Desde servicios de agencia de branding digital identidad corporativa para entornos interactivos diseño de páginas web y desarrollo de aplicaciones web o móvil marketing digital hasta estrategias de inbound marketing.  Dentro de su plan de crecimiento estamos buscando un SEM Specialist con experiencia de al menos 2 años en campañas enfocadas a lead generation.  Como especialista en PPC te encargarás de planificar implementar optimizar y analizar las campañas de paid media tanto en Google Ads como en Social Ads para los clientes de la agencia.  Las funciones del puesto son  Planificación puesta en marcha y optimización de campañas PPC en plataformas como Google Ads y Facebook Ads.  Toma de decisiones en la optimización de campañas en base a los principales KPIs .  Monitorización trackeo y medición de las campañas en Google Analytics Conocimiento generación e implementación de píxeles para los distintos tipos de conversión y creación de eventos y objetivos en Google Analytics .  Generación de audiencias en las distintas plataformas para llevar a cabo acciones de remarketing.  Analizar resultados y realizar t est A/B con he rramientas como Google Optimize y Data Studio.  Elaboración y seguimiento de informes relativos a la campaña e interpretación.  Control de las campañas y su rendimiento propuestas de mejora y análisis de cambios en la cuenta (estacionalidades competencia producto etc).  Requisitos mínimos  Experiencia de al menos 2 años en gestión de campañas PPC.  Experiencia en diferentes tipos de campañas en Google (Search Display Shopping) y Facebook Ads e Instagram Ads.  Capacidad de análisis y conocimiento de los principales indicadores de rendimiento de una campaña CPC CTR CPL de Conversión CPA etc.  Fuerte orientación a resultados CPC CPL CPA etc.  Persona analítica con gran capacidad matemática y para trabajar con grandes volúmenes de datos .  Capacidad de trabajo en equipo.  Persona apasionada del mundo digital responsable constante y proactiva.  Se tendrá muy en cuenta la proactividad y constante innovación en el modelo de negocio de la compañía.  Uso de herramientas como Data Studio Google Marketing Platform (Analytics Data Studio Optimize Tag Manager...)  Requisitos Deseados  Valorable certificaciones de Google Ads .  Experiencia en diferentes tipos de campañas en Linkedin Ads y Twitter Ads .  Valorable conocimiento de plataformas publicitarias de afiliación y social media marketing  Valorable experiencia en plataformas de compra programática (DSP SSP y DMP).  ¿Qué ofrecemos?  Ofrecemos un entorno de trabajo estable en el que crecer y desarrollar carrera profesional en proyectos de primer nivel cargados de innovación con posibilidad de progresión continua en función de las aptitudes y capacidad de asunción de responsabilidades.  Contrato indefinido y retribución acorde a la experiencia aportada.  Teletrabajo 100 .  sem, ppc, Search, Display, Shopping, CPC, CPL, CPA, Data Studio, Google Marketing Platform, Analytics , Data Studio, Optimize , Tag Manager, DSP, SSP, DMP  4f421bef92f6a33c2941

Title: Sales Executive - Spain
Description: AnyVan makes moving anything, anywhere easier, more affordable and greener for everyone. With Over 8 million customers across the UK and Europe since our launch over a decade ago, we’re proud to be known as the largest, fastest growing tech company in the logistics industry.     Like many popular marketplaces, we’re asset light – i.e., we don’t own any vehicles or employ any drivers. We work with our transport partners and use technology to disrupt the entire delivery and moving process and to optimise the most efficient journeys.     Sustainability is a core part of AnyVan’s mission and reducing environmental impact has always been at the heart of our business. We’re proud to say we’ve achieved carbon-neutral status on all our transport moves, and we won’t stop here.     We’ve continuously celebrated exciting growth and key milestones, a key highlight being a £125mn investment from Vitruvian partners to reinforce our position as the UK market leader. We’re expecting the next 5 years to be even more exciting.     Our platform might be driven by technology, but we know it’s our people that make AnyVan a great place to work. We think big, we think differently, and we empower our colleagues to make a difference. We know good ideas can come from anyone in any role – so if you’re a self-starter looking to ‘move’ your career forward – Team AnyVan would love to hear from you.     What you’ll be doing:     Helping our customers move home/items as cost effectively and environmentally friendly as possible in Spain Manage a pipeline of warm leads, pro-actively contacting our customers via phone and email to understand their needs and find the most effective solution to identify, qualify and complete the sale Managing short sales cycles with varying order sizes, building trust based relationships - keeping customer satisfaction front of mind at all times Managing quotes and liaising with our transport providers to negotiate the best prices for our customers Working to agreed targets that focus on both numbers (revenue generation) and ethics (selling in the right way) Having fun and contributing to a positive team vibe. This is a busy role and we know it’s important to create those moments to lighten the mood and have a laugh - the whole team plays their part in supporting each other Skills and experience we think you’ll need to be successful in the role:     High fluency in Spanish and English Ideally worked in Sales position previously Experience working in a fast paced sales environment Comfortable spending most of your day speaking on the phone Comfortable working to and achieving targets Strong emotional intelligence Self-motivated, resilient and not phased by change One team mind-set and the ability to develop, high quality, trust-based working relationships and guide customers and transport providers through processes to achieve the best results for the business Company Benefits     Competitive base salary with scope for progression Performance related pay opportunities Vitality Healthcare Flexible working options/hybrid working options wherever possible 25 days holiday (plus bank holidays), which increases with tenure up to 30 days Standard pension contribution Volunteer Day Enhanced Maternity, Paternity and Adoption In-house barista, breakfast and snacks every day Friday drinks and regular social activities including office ping pong table and darts board Office facilities include showers and safe cycle parking The chance to work for a fast-growing disruptive technology business
Industry: Transporte, logística, cadena de suministro y almacenamiento

Title: Product Manager (Remote)
Description: About The Company     WealthKernel is a VC-backed FinTech company whose mission is to enable change that makes financial services better for everyday people. We aim to be the AWS of savings, investment, and pension infrastructure. We recently won the WealthTech Company of the Year award at the FinTech Awards London. At the heart of WealthKernel is an Api-first, DevOps culture.     About The Job     WK’s Associate Product Managers will be playing a key part in providing value and support to our cross-functional teams, helping innovate and build the WealthKernel platform while gaining valuable on-the-job training and coaching. You will be working closely with our team of developers, co-leading the Squads with the Lead Software Engineers and acting as the glue that holds all functions together.     Job Responsibilities     Contributing to problem and solution discovery efforts by conducting internal stakeholder and customer interviews and research, and developing and running experiments to validate concepts. Writing stories that articulate work to be done by Engineering in support of solutions and production support. Working closely with Engineering to ensure solutions are ultimately delivered in a timely and cost-effective manner. Working closely with stakeholder to understand the business and adapt solutions as it evolves. Supporting stakeholders in the development of feature descriptions and new release content. Maintaining a prioritized backlog that aligns with available Engineering capacity and maps to an overall solution roadmap.     Requirements     1-2 years experience as a Product Manager or Product Owner You have sound knowledge of API Development and SDLC Strong Wealth Management domain knowledge, Solid technical acumen and the ability to learn tech concepts quickly, Assertive and strong-willed, but diplomatic and a great negotiator.     Preferred Skills And Character Traits     Self-starter, self-driven, customer-centric, analytical and data driven, superb prioritization skills, transversality, great communication skills.     Benefits     Why us?     We believe in transparency and empowering people We want you to challenge us and also to accept being challenged We want you to learn from your mistakes. We want you to propose and try new things We believe in results. We don’t micromanage. We trust you. You will have the opportunity to grow and develop your skills in new areas while working in an open, creative, and collaborative environment. You will work hands-on with experienced professionals who will always be one click away from you if you need their help     Company Benefits     Working in a multicultural environment A positive and collaborative working culture Competitive pay package 22 days of holidays (plus bank holidays) Remotely based position (forever!) Company team retreats     If you have the confidence, energy, and passion to take on this challenging people role and build a unique Compliance Department, please get in touch!

Title: Mechanical / Electrical / Plumbing / Fire Protection Engineer - Facility
Description: Description  PLEASE SUBMIT CV IN ENGLISH.  The PAC Group is seeking Mechanical/Electrical/Plumbing/Fire Protection (MEPF) specialist with 5-8+ years’ related experience in dealing with MEPF design, problem-solving and stakeholder coordination/communication/documentation. Project sites are located throughout Europe, but mainly remote working from your own base location is anticipated.  Requirements  PAC is a professional engineering services provider working with a variety of clients throughout the world. In this role, candidate will join our Facilities and Building Systems Engineering team to support various client projects.  Experience in facilities systems design review and issues management for non-production facilities. Knowledgeable in Project Management tools and techniques. Ability to communicate very effectively and efficiently with multiple project stakeholders. Ability to develop, maintain and produce reports quickly and accurately using established reporting templates in Excel. Experienced in design change tracking and management. Able to work independently on a professional level.   Requirements  The role will involve participation in facility/building systems design reviews including revisions to drawings, identifying potential issues and communicating them to project stakeholders, fielding questions and dealing with issues raised, project progress reporting, assessment of new design change requests, communication with cost estimators, participation in standing calls with project team stakeholders, dealing with Requests for Information, proficiency in completing reports using Excel-based templates.  This role requires excellent cross-functional communication abilities to ensure alignment between project stakeholders.  In addition to great interpersonal skills, the candidate will also possess -  Proficiency with the full suite of MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project) and Outlook. Minimum Bachelor degree from related discipline(s) or equivalent experience and 5-8+ years related experience. Applicable mechanical or electrical, plumbing, fire protection background.   Prequalification:  Candidates should have prior work experience in facilities design and review. Shall be able to travel periodically to client sites throughout Europe, but regularly be a remotely working professional. Ability to start this role within 4-6 weeks or sooner. Fluency in English for business purposes.   Benefits  To learn more about The PAC Group visit our website at www.pacgroup.com and view our short introduction video.
Function: Gestión y Tecnología de la información

Title: Customer Success Spain
Description: Barkyn delivers health and happiness to pet families around the world.     We are an ambitious, forward-thinking startup on a big mission! We’re not only changing the pet market, but we’re also reshaping the way the e-commerce experience should feel: human, personalized, seamless, and beautiful. We are backed by international investors and considered one of Europe’s Top 100 Startups by Wired.     Customer Success Agent     We're creating a beloved brand in Europe, and this is where your story starts!     You will contribute to the high-quality standards of our Spanish market by being a customer hero and wowing them on all support channels: chat, Facebook, Instagram, email, and phone.     Specifically, We Expect You To     Act as a Barkyn ambassador in all customer interactions, being true to our brand values and friendly tone; Be accountable for a seamless and human end-to-end customer experience; Interact with customers via chat, email, or phone conversations to provide information and assistance; Use computer systems to track, gather information, and/or troubleshoot customer issues. Customer-centric attitude.     Brownie Points     Experience in a startup; Experience with Loyalty Lion / Shopify / DIXA; Dog owner.

Title: QA Test Lead
Description: Are you a dynamic and driven professional seeking an exciting opportunity to make an impact?  As the Kantar XTEL Customer Success Team, we are committed to transparency, diversity, merit, innovation and encouraging a culture of empowerment, personal impact and career growth.  We are looking for a passionate QA Test Lead to join our team.  QA Test Lead who will be involved in test planning, reporting, escalation of issues and bug management; while being hands-on (it is ca. 50% operational role), having also a tester leading and mentoring responsibility.  Are we a phenomenal fit? We are looking for someone who…..  Is with a can-do attitude– whether it’s sorting out a knotty problem or calming a stressed-out collaborator, can you look on the forward-thinking side? Is Original – we love to hear ideas on how we can be doing things differently so that we can all be more engaged and successful with our clients. Makes and takes Opportunities – are you the kind of person who will step up and volunteer to take something on, even if it’s outside of your comfort zone? Takes Ownership – for the team! You use your strengths to help us grow together. Has an Open Mind – we favor constructive feedback given in a kind way and appreciate the same in return. Is fantastic communicator – you’ve got top-notch written and verbal skills in English and know how to put them to great use in everyday stakeholder management.  Our QA Test Lead will be responsible for...  QA process across the Scrum team; Daily high-level reporting on test progress during releases in accordance with the plan; Timely escalation of High/Critical issues to ensure resolution within planned timelines; Bug management; Reviewing the test coverage of Test Cases and User Stories; Enforcing quality gates based on the QA and Release strategies; Mentoring and assessing testers; assuring all testers are trained and up to date with product modules; Hands-on involvement in testing when needed; Being familiarized with product modules in order to ensure effective review of testing coverage; Test planning for releases, including manual, automation, and non-functional testing; Providing input to the release sign-off process.  A great candidate will have:  More than 2 years of Test Lead experience People management and mentoring experience Extensive Test analyst experience in all test phases Strong manual test experience across the full lifecycle – Functional Testing (User Stories), Integration Testing and UAT (end to end); Understanding of Test automation and when it should be implemented; Bug management experience and maintaining the quality of data within the bug management tool; Experience of working in Scrum teams and a very good understanding of Agile methodology; Understanding of industry best practices from a Test perspective – ISTQB/TMMI etc.; Experience in different sectors and environments would be an advantage; Experience of working with remote teams; Highly analytical individual with a focus on detail.  What will you get?  challenging position in a fast-growing Revenue Growth and Trade Promotion Management software company being part of a young and international team with strong ownership and a can-do mentality, reporting to the Engineering Manager opportunity to actively contribute to the further growth of the organization an international multidisciplinary setting and close cooperation with the business flexible working with possibility of remote of hybrid work (the company HQ is based in Bologna) We as a team have a passion for learning and growing to be the best version of ourselves.  Do you have strengths you can share? If so, we’d love to hear from you. We appreciate that everyone has different backgrounds and experience, so if you don’t meet all the criteria above, please don’t be deterred from applying. We could be just what you are looking for!  Please note that this job description provides a general overview of the responsibilities and qualifications required. It is not an exhaustive list, but we believe it captures the essence of this exciting role.

Title: Quality Control

Knowledge of established control procedures (Global Test Scorecards).     Knowledge of Agile methodologies and tools (Jira, Confluence...).     Definition and adaptation of internal quality procedures, standards and specifications based on industry quality standards and audit recommendations.     Assurance of testing quality standards at company level. Review of quality metrics, in order to identify opportunities for improvement or deficiencies in meeting set standards- Knowledge of REST and HTTP APIs (verbs, codes, headers...).     Advanced use of Postman and Swagger (e.g. for automatic generation of dtos and serviceClients). Knowledge or experience in AA+ and AAA Accessibility.- Summary of the W3C | Web Accessibility Initiative (WAI) | W3C accessibility standards.     English B2     Responsabilites;     You will be responsible for identifying and solving domain-specific challenges and accountable for the successful implementation of the Continuous Testing strategy in collaboration with Testing Architects and Product Owners.     The Company     Being part of THE WHITEAM means collaborate with a company constituted by professionals with extensive experience in technology consulting.     We certainly believe that companies and clients are the key to moving forward in the sector, but is the people who build the opportunities. We consider it essential that our organisation is based on our greatest asset and value-added brand, which is our team.

Title: Director/VP of GTM Strategy
Description: Clarity AI’s mission is to bring social impact to the market. Our disruptive tech tools allow investors, companies, and consumers to invest sustainably, shop sustainably, and report or benchmark for sustainability with easy-to-use, AI-powered technology.     We are now a team of more than 300 highly passionate individuals coming from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading startup backed by investors and strategic partners such as SoftBank, BlackRock, and Deutsche Börse who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, Portugal, the UK, and the US this year so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading! Your work will be shaping and guide the sustainable decisions of consumers and investors throughout the world.     We are looking for a Director/VP of GTM Strategy to join our Strategy team. As a Director/VP of GTM Strategy, you will play a key role at Clarity AI, leading a team focused on the definition and execution of Global GTM strategy across geographies from the US to the EU and the Middle East and across segments (investors, corporates, consumers and Governments), as well you will play a key role, with almost daily interaction with the CEO that would allow allowing a top candidate to impact Clarity AI's success directly.     The role is a perfect opportunity to join Clarity AI in a pivotal role that can generate impact from day one and that will open the door to several other senior positions within the company.     Location: Madrid/Barcelona or London (we offer relocation support)     Key Responsibilities:     GO TO MARKET STRATEGY:     Coordinate quarterly and yearly GTM strategy and goals alongside Head of Strategy, Head of Product and Head of Solutions (and Finance). E.g., Segment and use case prioritisation, Geographic footprint, Team sizing, Strategic account engagement strategy and Key partnerships and platform distribution strategy Review of quarterly and annual GTM metrics and results and consequent strategy adjustments Define the action plan to follow the defined strategy and meet the defined goals (Product, Sales, Marketing)     PMO OF TRANSVERSAL GTM INITIATIVES     Strategic accounts tracking Project Management of initiatives for each quarter to ensure performance is aligned with targets, and “live” changes can be made based on market response Inter team coordination and coaching to accelerate actions in PMO Reporting in Operational Committees (OPCO) to ensure the proper steering of company-wide actions Ad-Hoc tactical sales campaign definition and management (as required)     PRICING STRATEGY Definition of company-wide pricing strategy: Direct sales Platform redistribution Definition of product-pricing bundles together with Product Owners and Sales Pricing tool development Sales team coaching on pricing     AD-HOC SUPPORT (high-priority topics)     Go-to-market Market Intelligence & Battlecards Interim: Platforms leadership coverage     Requirements     8+ years of work experience after graduate school, with a distinctive record of professional achievement and impact Associate Principal/Principal level (or equivalent title) experience at a tier-one consulting firm Sophisticated executive, comfortable functioning at the highest levels of organisations; excellent presentation skills, including strong verbal and writing capabilities Team orientation and collaborative approach; outstanding listening skills and the ability to manage through influence Exceptional intellectual and analytical curiosity, a creative visionary who can drive innovation Previous experience in Start-ups and scale-ups is considered a plus     Benefits     We care about our employees and think they deserve the best.     ESOP/ Phantom stock: We want our employees to feel part of Clarity. That’s why we allow them to participate in our success with ESOP or phantom stock options Training budget: Continued learning is important for us, so we provide everyone with a yearly training budget Additional benefits are available depending on your location (e.g. gym access, etc.)     Clarity has received several awards:     Fast Company - Most Innovative Companies 2023 WEF, Young Global Leader - Rebeca Minguela Forrester New Wave Leader 2022 European Commission | EU Seal of Excellence 2020 World Economic Forum - Technology Pioneer 2020

Title: Professional Services Specialist (Fully Remote)
Description: Passion.io’s goal is to make the world more confident and passionate. We do this by empowering Creators to launch highly impactful mobile apps for a fraction of the cost. We are an international remote team of 50+ people, supporting 8,000+ Creators and 700k+ end-users from all over the world.     We have an exciting opportunity for a Professional Services Specialist to join our team. If you are an experienced professional with at least 1+ Year of working experience within a similar role in a SaaS environment, working with HelpDesk software, Photoshop and Canva and able to provide Social Media support and management - we would love to meet you!     Requirements     What you'll bring to the team     1-2 years’ of working experience within a similar role in a SaaS environment 🪜 Great customer service skills - providing exemplary service via email / chat. 🧑‍💻 Basic Graphic Design Knowledge - you know how to work on Canva and Photoshop (or similar) 🧑‍🎨 Experience working with HelpDesk software (like Zendesk) with Zapier being highly advantageous 🛠️ Exceptionally keen eye on details related to design and copy (experience writing and/or reviewing copy in English) 👁️‍🗨️ Experience being a Creative Problem Solver 🕵️ Confident in speaking and interacting with clients through virtual calls. 🙋 Proactive, always looking for ways to improve process and customer experience 💁 Fluent in English 🎙️     ❗❗ Please note: While this position is FULLY REMOTE, ability to work full-time US hours (Pacific to Eastern) is essential 🕛     What you'll be working on     Effectively reply to customers' questions and concerns about the Product, their App and their account. 🌠 Migrate Creator’s content from their old platform (video/written/ audio/ files) to Passion.io and organize it in the best way possible 💪(each platform has different requirements - e.g course structure). Create the App design using Canva and the brand assets provided by the Creators ✍️ App Submission - Check daily status for Apps in review on Apple & Google and collaborate with the app Submission team to resolve any rejections or issues 🎟️ App Submission - send updates to Apple and Google when there’s a major update from Passion (with new features and bug fixes). 🗞️ Help the team with ad hoc admin tasks. 🤝 Basic / limited set up Typeform for customers and Zapier 🛠️     Benefits     What we offer you     🌍 Work from anywhere and full flexibility. ✈️ Bi-annual international gatherings in a cool venue somewhere even cooler. Our last trips brought us to Croatia, Portugal, and Greece. 📈 An autonomous/entrepreneurial work style where your success is measured by results (not time). 🤯 The steepest learning curve you’ve ever experienced including regular career coaching sessions, internal and external training, coaching, and much more. We also support you with attending conferences, taking courses, and purchasing books. 🤝 An open, honest, creative, and results-driven environment where your opinion is highly valued. 💻 Flexible equipment policy with a budget that renews every year. 🏢 Co-working policy: If you prefer to work from a co-working space, we'll help pay for it 🏝 24 days of paid vacation plus 10 days of “Celebration Leave” that allows you to take the holidays off you actually celebrate (instead of the statutory holidays in the country you happen to live in). 👶 Paid parental leave: We offer a generous period of fully paid parental leave

Title: Frontend Developer React - 100% remoto
Description: Buscamos desarrolladores de React para colaborar con una de las empresas de retail más grandes a nivel global. Si te apasiona la tecbología y quieres aprender de los mejores, ¡sigue leyendo!     Posición: frontend developer react Typescript     Responsabilidades     Desarrollo de interfaces de usuario usando componentes de React y tecnologías asociadas Gestión de la comunicación de datos con servidores, optimización perfilado de componentes y documentación del código. Trabajo con el equipo de diseño/desarrollo para decidir las estrategias implementación de los interfaces de usuario necesarios. Identificación de requerimientos e interacciones a desarrollar. Desarrollo de los interfaces de usuario a nivel estructural y visual usando técnicas de CSS responsive. Búsqueda de posibles errores en componentes existentes. Análisis, perfilado y optimización de componentes. Desarrollo de tests usando Jest. Documentación del código necesario para crear los componentes.     Experiencia     Amplio conocimiento en las tecnologías base de la web en las que está basado el trabajo con React: HTML, CSS y JS Conocimiento avanzado de las APIs e interfaces que proporcionan los navegadores para la creación de aplicaciones web interactivas. Diseño e implementación de interfaces de usuario modernos. Experiencia previa en desarrollo de aplicaciones web con React moderno. Tanto de componentes de clase como componentes funcionales. Dominio de uso y creación de hooks. Conocimiento del ecosistema react: Redux, webpack, Router, etc. Herramientas generales de desarrollo como Eslint, prettier, etc. Experiencia en diseño e implementación de interfaces de usuario. Accesibilidad, HTML Semántico, CSS modular, BEM, maquetación responsive, ES6, PWAs, etc. Dominio de las técnicas de creación de interfaces adaptables a diferentes plataformas y tamaños de pantalla. Experiencia con testing de aplicaciones de frontend. Experiencia en debugging, perfilado y optimización de aplicaciones frontend usando las herramientas de desarrollo que proporcionan los diferentes navegadores. Experiencia con Typescript Experiencia con Arquitectura Hexagonal

Title: Receptionist & Office Services Administrator - Madrid
Description: Job Name: Receptionist & Office Services Administrator - Madrid     Job Type: Permanent     Country: Spain     City:     State: FL     Languages:     SGF Global is a global leader with over 30 years’ experience providing recruitment solutions. Our company provides staffing and support solutions in over 35 countries worldwide, having expanded by successfully integrating the processes of recruitment, development and retention of personnel.     The Opportunity:     The Receptionist & Office Services Administrator will deliver and provide day-to-day facilities tasks and operational activities for the Madrid office. The candidate is expected to be a self-starter and comfortable in an environment that is fast-paced and growing.     Working hours : 10 am – 7 pm (1 hour for lunch) Monday to Friday; on Fridays, if office life allowed it, it could be adjusted to 8 am- 5 pm.     Key Responsibilities:     Answer calls in a courteous and professional manner, prioritizing as appropriate. Provide assistance and information to callers, re-direct calls as appropriate, take and relay adequate messages when required. Greet all visitors such as clients, candidates, delivery persons, maintenance workers, etc. ensuring proper security is in place for all guests and the best image is projected. Book meeting rooms and ensure their logistics including general set up/clean-up of rooms, catering requests, liaising with Technology Services for audio and video conferencing requests. Book couriers, parking spaces and catering as requested, ensuring requests are properly recorded and allocated to the appropriate cost code. Handle incoming and outgoing mail and packages, copy/binding requests and large mailings. Ordering, stocking and inventory management of office, kitchen, office stationery. Ordering of business cards and other printed stationery General and preventive equipment maintenance including coordination of repairs Work effectively with all departments and staff members as needed to handle requests and to fulfil common goals in a proactive and customer service manner, escalating to the Office Manager when appropriate. Assist with new hire on boarding, conduct office tour and explanation of office procedures including health and safety. Register new employees and provide office tag. Providers set up and invoices administration. Assisting in other administrative support tasks, as requested by the management.     About you:     Minimum two years’ experience working in an administrative or customer service capacity Experience in professional services industry preferred, but not required Excellent verbal and written communication skills and able to deal with people at all levels across a multicultural environment Fluent in English & Spanish (verbal & written) Team player who has experience of and has enjoyed working as part of a team Customer service focused – dedicated to meeting the expectations executing deliverables to the highest standards and committed to ensure that the best professional image is projected all the time. Ability to multitask, prioritise and manage one’s own time. Not a clock watcher or someone who is unwilling to step outside the job description Self-starter who has an appetite for learning and is driven to excel and grow Attention to detail and stickler for accuracy Flexible attitude, hard-working and results driven Good knowledge of Outlook & Word, basic knowledge of Excel

Title: Product Owner ¡Remoto!
Description: Buscamos un PRODUCT OWNER con al menos 2 años de experiencia trabajando en funciones relacionadas     ¿QUÉ TE HARÁ TRIUNFAR?     Experiencia en la aplicación de Scrum o Kanban implantación guiado de los equipos etc.     Experiencia en aumentar el rendimiento de los equipos y maximizar el valor entregado.     Debe conocer y tener experiencia en la definición aplicación y seguimiento de OKRs     Experiencia en la ayuda y guiado de los equipos especialmente en la definición de historias de usuario DoR DoD y priorización.     Se valora la posesión de certificaciones relacionadas scrum lean     MODALIDAD Remoto desde cualquier ubicación a nivel nacional.     ¿POR QUÉ ELEGIRNOS? ¡Esto es lo que te ofrecemos!     Te ofrecemos distintas oportunidades de formación y amplio abanico de retos y proyectos acordes con tus objetivos personales y profesionales revisión salarial crecimiento vertical y horizontal. ¡Trabajamos en proyectos retadores!     Tenemos distintas oportunidades que ofrecerte! Finalizar tu contrato con nosotros siempre va a ser la última opción vamos a buscar proyectos para ti según tus necesidades y preferencias     Flexibilidad horaria para poder conciliar vida laboral y personal.     Seguimiento personalizado gracias al acompañamiento de nuestra figura de People Partner y nuestro Business Manager que siempre van a estar conectados contigo para lo que necesites!     Formarás parte de una empresa responsable y comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades.     Trato cercano y seguimiento continuo durante todo el proceso de selección vas a estar en constante comunicación con nosotros sobre cómo avanza tu candidatura así como en contacto sobre posibles oportunidades que se adapten a lo que buscas a nivel laboral     Ofrecemos proyectos completamente estables y de larga duración en los que podrás desarrollarte profesionalmente y apoyarte en los profesionales que actualmente colaboran en ellos.     Proyectos a la carta podrás valorar el que más se ajuste a tus preferencias a nivel laboral y que puedan encajar en tus búsquedas.     Salario competitivo siempre acorde a las competencias que aportes según tu experiencia.     Acceso a beneficios fiscales gracias a nuestro plan de Retribución Flexible (ticket restaurante ticket transporte cheque guardería y formación).     Nos adaptamos a tus preferencias tenemos proyectos en modalidad remoto 100 híbrido o incluso presencial si quieres interactuar de manera presencial con tus compañeros!     En Digital Talent Agency te ofrecemos desarrollar proyectos en empresas destacadas del sector tecnológico poniendo foco en tu desarrollo profesional qué te gusta cómo eres y con qué tipo de proyectos te sientes motivado.     ¡Queremos conocerte!     OKR, Lean, Scrum     eecd19e2b21e5314d440

Title: Professional Services Specialist (Fully Remote)
Description: Passion.io’s goal is to make the world more confident and passionate. We do this by empowering Creators to launch highly impactful mobile apps for a fraction of the cost. We are an international remote team of 50+ people, supporting 8,000+ Creators and 700k+ end-users from all over the world.     We have an exciting opportunity for a Professional Services Specialist to join our team. If you are an experienced professional with at least 1+ Year of working experience within a similar role in a SaaS environment, working with HelpDesk software, Photoshop and Canva and able to provide Social Media support and management - we would love to meet you!     Requirements     What you'll bring to the team     1-2 years’ of working experience within a similar role in a SaaS environment 🪜 Great customer service skills - providing exemplary service via email / chat. 🧑‍💻 Basic Graphic Design Knowledge - you know how to work on Canva and Photoshop (or similar) 🧑‍🎨 Experience working with HelpDesk software (like Zendesk) with Zapier being highly advantageous 🛠️ Exceptionally keen eye on details related to design and copy (experience writing and/or reviewing copy in English) 👁️‍🗨️ Experience being a Creative Problem Solver 🕵️ Confident in speaking and interacting with clients through virtual calls. 🙋 Proactive, always looking for ways to improve process and customer experience 💁 Fluent in English 🎙️     ❗❗ Please note: While this position is FULLY REMOTE, ability to work full-time US hours (Pacific to Eastern) is essential 🕛     What you'll be working on     Effectively reply to customers' questions and concerns about the Product, their App and their account. 🌠 Migrate Creator’s content from their old platform (video/written/ audio/ files) to Passion.io and organize it in the best way possible 💪(each platform has different requirements - e.g course structure). Create the App design using Canva and the brand assets provided by the Creators ✍️ App Submission - Check daily status for Apps in review on Apple & Google and collaborate with the app Submission team to resolve any rejections or issues 🎟️ App Submission - send updates to Apple and Google when there’s a major update from Passion (with new features and bug fixes). 🗞️ Help the team with ad hoc admin tasks. 🤝 Basic / limited set up Typeform for customers and Zapier 🛠️     Benefits     What we offer you     🌍 Work from anywhere and full flexibility. ✈️ Bi-annual international gatherings in a cool venue somewhere even cooler. Our last trips brought us to Croatia, Portugal, and Greece. 📈 An autonomous/entrepreneurial work style where your success is measured by results (not time). 🤯 The steepest learning curve you’ve ever experienced including regular career coaching sessions, internal and external training, coaching, and much more. We also support you with attending conferences, taking courses, and purchasing books. 🤝 An open, honest, creative, and results-driven environment where your opinion is highly valued. 💻 Flexible equipment policy with a budget that renews every year. 🏢 Co-working policy: If you prefer to work from a co-working space, we'll help pay for it 🏝 24 days of paid vacation plus 10 days of “Celebration Leave” that allows you to take the holidays off you actually celebrate (instead of the statutory holidays in the country you happen to live in). 👶 Paid parental leave: We offer a generous period of fully paid parental leave
Function: Gestión y Tecnología de la información

Title: Nodejs Developer
Description: What is Exoticca?     Do you like traveling? Do you enjoy the exotic? Do you like challenges? If the answer is YES, welcome to Exoticca!     Exoticca is a company that started in 2013 by professionals specialized in the creation and online distribution of trips. Our mission is to offer our clients the possibility to visit the most beautiful and stimulating places on our planet, though the best holiday packages, at unbelievable prices. We are a highly ambitious and well-funded start-up, backed by top national and international investors that have also participated in the growth of other success stories, such as Glovo, SinDelantal.com, or Idealista, among others.     At Exoticca we are looking for people who want to offer their best to create unforgettable experiences for our customers. We are a young, dynamic, multicultural team in rapid international growth, seeking new partners to help us create the best and most forward-thinking travel company of our generation.     What are we proposing?     We are looking for tech-heroes with the desire to contribute to our mission, who admire different world cultures and have huge respect for the environment, who moreover feel energized with challenges and love being part of our company growth.     As a NodeJS Developer, you will be using mainly Nodejs and its related technologies to design, develop and implement projects derived from the challenges that we take on.     Your new and fresh ideas will always be welcomed to build the software that makes our vision a scalable reality.     Responsibilities     Being responsible for designing, developing and implementing projects derived from the technological solutions to solve any challenges that we take on Be co-responsible for developing and refactoring our legacy website applying best practices Be responsible for building, maintaining and scaling infrastructure for production and development environments Work closely with the development team to understand automation needs     Requirements     Experience + 3 years in Nodejs Experience TypeScript Experience developing REST APIs Experience using GIT Experience with Vagrant & Docker     Nice to have:     Experience in NestJ, PHP, MySQL Experience in DDD and hexagonal architecture Experience in infrastructure design Knowledge with some message-broker for ex.: RabbitMQ     Benefits     Competitive compensation package, in line with job responsibilities and experience Individual Training Budget Flexible compensation on transportation and food with Cobee also in our private health insurance Flexible working schedule, just make sure you meet your monthly goals! !00% Remote working Permanent contract from the start Travel with Exoticca at reduced prices !!! Referral bonus, if you bring people as talented as you can earn a very nice bonus! And last but not least, becoming part of a fun and motivated multicultural team at an agile and rapid growing organization where teamwork, drive, commitment, resilience and being customer-centric are the core values     Exoticca is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusiveness are our core. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under European, country, or local law.

Title: SEO Manager
Description: Who are ZenRows?     We are a fast-growing startup, working 100% remotely, developing the most complete anti-bot bypassing system. ZenRows proprietary SaaS API facilitates web data extraction at scale for companies worldwide without the hassle!     Founded by serial entrepreneurs Aurken and Ander, we are a small team looking to bring an SEO Manager into the team! We have recently secured our first round of funding of €1.1 million, are already profitable, and our web traffic is expected to double in the next 3 months.     Responsibilities     Reporting to the Chief Growth Officer and partnering with the Engineering team, the SEO Manager will scale up the SEO operations of one of the fastest-growing startups in Europe, where content is our most important acquisition driver.     We’re looking for an SEO Manager to win over the biggest companies worldwide. By joining ZenRows you will:     Lead the day-to-day operations in the SEO pipeline, from creating briefs for writers to reviewing their output Implement new ideas for traffic conversion and obsess over full-funnel customer acquisition Keep track of the published content to ensure it ranks #1 Kick off our video strategy Optimise processes and guidelines and document learnings on the go Hire and manage writers Be hands-on with the content     Requirements     Who are we looking for?     Solid SEO experience, with some experience in research and strategy Excellent writer within educational content. Amazing copywriting skills - you’ll engage with sales pages and traffic conversion Some sort of distribution experience beyond adding keywords to a text for Google is a plus Prior experience having a full-funnel overview Track record understanding analytics, learning, and then applying it to future content You’re a big challenger and have a personal tendency to go deep on topics. What we do is in between the legs of web development and cyber security. In other words: you have no fear of technical products. Experience working at a startup previously Experience working 100% remotely We’re looking for someone who’s truly passionate about what we do and how we help our customers Strong ability in written English     Benefits     Flexible work schedule Fully remote work Possibility of equity in ZenRows High growth environment with a huge opportunity to grow Budget for professional training and development Whatever tools you need to do awesome work

Title: Design Manager - Brand & Marketing
Description: The role of a Design Manager at Canonical     Our Design Manager will play a key role making open source software available to the world. Our Design function ensures the experience of using software is true to our intentions, and the Design Manager makes this possible through leadership within, and beyond, our teams.     As a Design Manager, you bring experience managing delivery teams and have expertise in visual and UX design. This enables you to coach designers cross-context to move towards tangible outcomes and lift the quality of their work. You will manage expectations and ensure deadlines are met in a timely manner against your roadmap. You will be able to communicate clearly and actively listen to product and engineering stakeholders, and your team, to drive sustainable quality improvements and guide individuals towards meaningful growth.     Leading the Brand & Marketing Design team, you will take responsibility for how we express the Canonical and Ubuntu brands and product content operations, especially on our web touchpoints.     Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region     What your day will look like     Reviewing the work of your design team for quality Working with individual designers to support their professional growth Continuously improving operational workflows, including production outsourcing and collaboration with Web Engineering Working with stakeholders, especially Marketing and our Head of Brand, to clearly define and validate outcomes Evolving design systems and guidelines to drive consistent quality and improve efficiency Coordinating with the rest of design leadership to mature our collective practice Bringing your team and others together to share their work and strengthen culture Engaging the open source community to learn and make the value of our work legible     What we are looking for in you     A portfolio demonstrating quality in UI design, especially visually Exceptional educational achievements in design or related behavioral science discipline Full lifecycle experience from user needs discovery through validation and implementation guidance Commitment to transparent project delivery and owning team deadlines Experience of managing a team that interacts with technical stakeholders Familiarity with quantitative optimisation approaches A passion for balancing consistency and innovation Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events     What we offer you     Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits below, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.     In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.     Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004! Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum Annual compensation review Recognition rewards Annual holiday leave Parental Leave Employee Assistance Programme Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints' Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events     About Canonical     Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.     Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.     Canonical is an equal opportunity employer     We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Senior Business Analyst - Health Insurance (Fully Remote)
Description: Top 3 Reasons To Join Us     Competitive salary Remote working option Working on the latest tech     About us:     At CoverGo, our mission is to empower all insurance companies to make insurance 100% digital and accessible to everyone We are a leading global no-code insurance platform for health, life, and P&C We’re the winner of the Insurtech of the Year in all of Asia and other awards globally We work with insurance enterprise clients such as AXA, Bupa, MSIG, Dai-ichi, Bank of China Group Insurance, and many more We’re an international, diverse team of over 120 people with 30 nationalities and team members working remotely from all over the world We are fully funded and backed by reputable VC funds and strategic institutional investors We have offices in the US, Singapore, Hong Kong, UAE and Vietnam We’ve grown our annualized revenue by over 30x since January 2021 We’re constantly working towards making CoverGo a workplace that you love coming to. We deeply believe that bringing together a diversity of thoughts, expressions, and perspectives is key to building the best culture for equally diverse communities all over the world     What You Will Do:     Applies appropriate methodologies and tools for analyzing a range of standard, functional and/or cross-functional issues Assists in identifying process gaps and issues Plans and designs simple to complex business processes and system modifications. Makes recommendations to improve and support business activities Gathers business requirements through a variety of techniques such as work sessions and interviews. Analyzes and documents client simple to complex business requirements and processes; communicates these requirements to appropriate parties Creates complex test case scenarios to be used in testing; monitors/oversees the testing of business applications to verify that all client requirements are incorporated into the system design Provides input into developing and modifying systems to meet client needs. Develops business requirements documents/user stories to support the required modifications Coordinates and facilitates meetings with clients to gather and document requirements and explore potential solutions Coordinates business analyst tasks on information technology projects and provides project team member guidance and support. May plan, allocate and monitor work of other business analysts Provides time estimates for project related tasks Provides leadership and work guidance to less experienced personnel Aids in updating process and procedural documentation Work with clients and technical resources to identify their business problems and develop the right approach and analytical solution Basic understanding of technical development cycle of mobile application or web portals Experience participating in successful projects with cross-functional teams Agile/Scrum Framework for Project Planning & Release Management is a must Ability to understand complex systems and related data to surface actionable insights, demonstrate sound judgment and decision-making skills Business analysis skills including facilitation, process documentation, requirements gathering and user acceptance testing Strong organizational/time management skills to prioritize work and meet deadlines within defined timeframes Performing/interpreting requirement analysis to identify value creation opportunities for clients Design and document new process and system changes Support QA, UAT and Release phases of the project via defect analysis, change maintenance, etc Any other task as may be assigned     What We Need:     Minimum 5 years of experience as Business Analyst A degree in Business, IT or any relevant field Strong knowledge and experience in any of the insurance domain (Life, Group, or P&C) is a must Life Insurance domain certification from INS/LOMA or III is an added advantage Proven experience in eliciting requirements and testing Analytical and Critical thinking ability Experience in an Agile and/or Scrum environment is a must Good knowledge in generating process documentation Good written and verbal communication skills in English and Spanish is a must Should be able to work independently and own the tasks and communicate effectively within the team Good attitude, self-motivated, self-starter, and proactive Knowledge of business analysis concepts of defining requirements, translating to technical solutions, and Agile approach to prioritizing work to epics, sprints Ability to document system functionality, data integration and workflow     Why You'll Love Working Here     Full-remote employment Local time zone office hours, work by your schedule Paid annual leaves Employee stock options Company Performance bonus Performance review Company activities & team offsites to exotic locations Training and development plan     Covergo Company Video

Title: Teletrabajo de Profesor/a Particular
Description: Se busca profesores/as particulares para brindar clases en distintas materias a estudiantes de diferentes niveles educativos. Necesitamos profesores de:     Idiomas: inglés, francés, alemán, ruso, chino, árabe, portugués, japonés…     Ciencias: matemáticas, biología, química, física, estadística, contabilidad, etc...     Ciencias sociales: derecho, sociología, psicología, pedagogía...     Arte y materias artísticas: historia del arte, fotografía, dibujo, pintura, arte contemporáneo, cine y audiovisual…     Tecnología: informática, diseño gráfico, dibujo técnico, photoshop, programación..     TAREAS:     Preparar clases personalizadas según nivel de cada estudiante Hacer el acompañamiento de la evolución del estudiante     REQUISITOS:     No se requiere experiencia como profesor Nivel B1 de inglés Compromiso con los alumnos     BENEFICIOS:     Horario flexible Modalidad de trabajo híbrido Retribución de 15 a 36€/h

Title: Games Writer - Spain, Remote
Description: Dexerto are looking for a full-time Games Writer for our Spanish website, Dexerto.es     The majority of the content you will produce will be translated into Spanish from Dexerto’s English language website, so it is essential that you are fluent in English and Spanish.     We are looking for a writer who has great general knowledge of gaming, including games that Dexerto.es covers on a weekly basis such as Call of Duty, EA Sports FC, and Pokemon. You should also be across all the latest trends in gaming and be willing and able to cover the biggest current and upcoming games, including Diablo, Baldur's Gate, Spider-Man and more. Other knowledge areas that would be beneficial include gaming streamers, social media trends, and TV and Movies.     This is a varied role that will give you the chance to develop your skills in many different ways. Your main task will be to cover news and publish and update compelling guides, making sure that they are formatted to effectively answer readers’ searches. You’ll use data provided by our SEO Manager to optimize articles for specific keywords while working with our editors to ensure content is of a high standard.     We are looking for an organized person who is able to confidently research and write about a variety of topics. You’ll be expected to use content management systems and spreadsheets, so you will need to be comfortable with technology and be able to pick up new working practices quickly. Writing experience, understanding of SEO practices, basic photo editing skills, and familiarity with Google Sheets would also be desirable.     Requirements     Understanding and knowledge of gaming Good writing skills Good organization and time management skills Able to work independently and as part of a team Excellent attention to detail – able to spot grammatical errors and formatting mistakes Great communication skills – able to take instruction and keep various members of the team updated on progress Own computing equipment that can run Photoshop or similar programs Able to work full-time hours (40) without other education or job commitments Experience with Google Sheets and content management systems, photo editing skills, and SEO knowledge is desirable, but not essential Some writing experience is desirable     Application Instructions – Please Complete The Following     Submit your resume with a detailed cover letter explaining how your skills and experience relate to the role. We would like to see examples of your previous work.

Title: Design Manager - Brand & Marketing
Description: The role of a Design Manager at Canonical     Our Design Manager will play a key role making open source software available to the world. Our Design function ensures the experience of using software is true to our intentions, and the Design Manager makes this possible through leadership within, and beyond, our teams.     As a Design Manager, you bring experience managing delivery teams and have expertise in visual and UX design. This enables you to coach designers cross-context to move towards tangible outcomes and lift the quality of their work. You will manage expectations and ensure deadlines are met in a timely manner against your roadmap. You will be able to communicate clearly and actively listen to product and engineering stakeholders, and your team, to drive sustainable quality improvements and guide individuals towards meaningful growth.     Leading the Brand & Marketing Design team, you will take responsibility for how we express the Canonical and Ubuntu brands and product content operations, especially on our web touchpoints.     Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region     What your day will look like     Reviewing the work of your design team for quality Working with individual designers to support their professional growth Continuously improving operational workflows, including production outsourcing and collaboration with Web Engineering Working with stakeholders, especially Marketing and our Head of Brand, to clearly define and validate outcomes Evolving design systems and guidelines to drive consistent quality and improve efficiency Coordinating with the rest of design leadership to mature our collective practice Bringing your team and others together to share their work and strengthen culture Engaging the open source community to learn and make the value of our work legible     What we are looking for in you     A portfolio demonstrating quality in UI design, especially visually Exceptional educational achievements in design or related behavioral science discipline Full lifecycle experience from user needs discovery through validation and implementation guidance Commitment to transparent project delivery and owning team deadlines Experience of managing a team that interacts with technical stakeholders Familiarity with quantitative optimisation approaches A passion for balancing consistency and innovation Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events     What we offer you     Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits below, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.     In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.     Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004! Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum Annual compensation review Recognition rewards Annual holiday leave Parental Leave Employee Assistance Programme Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints' Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events     About Canonical     Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.     Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.     Canonical is an equal opportunity employer     We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Curriculum manager
Description: The role of a Curriculum Manager at Canonical     For today's developers and system administrators, Ubuntu is the centrepiece of their valuable professional skills from cloud to containers, from edge to IoT, and in data science and AI. We are building a program to help technical professionals test, certify and showcase their open source abilities. This will be the Canonical Ubuntu version of RHCE, Cisco CNE and similar certifications. Join a fast-paced, global, fully remote team and help set the trajectory of our expanding technical certifications, credentials and future training programmes. This position requires the ability to balance the rigorous methodology of instructional design with the technical experience of an engineer to help create engaging technical curriculum and assessment content.     As a Curriculum Manager on the Credentials & Curriculum team, you'll use your skills as a quick learner and effective communicator to balance an interest in open source communities, operating systems, DevOps and cloud technologies, scripting languages, and git repositories, with a passion for improving assessment and instructional content through blueprinting, JTA surveys, and SME recruitment and management phases.     This role reports to the Skills Certification Lead.     Location: This role can be held anywhere in the EMEA or Americas time zones / regions.     What Your Day Will Look Like     Working with stakeholders and cross-teams in analysing instructional design requests to determine technical resource requirements and project needs Creating relevant, engaging, accurate instructional, assessment, and supporting content based on blueprints, JTA surveys, item writing panels, SME guidance, and industry best practices Leading curriculum development efforts and manage multiple development projects through effective Agile techniques, regular meetings, privacy and security procedures, and SME recruitment and engagement to ensure extremely technical content is relevant, appropriately challenging, and offers the highest quality user experience. Act as internal Subject-Matter Expert (SME) for all products in verifying item and item instruction accuracy and determining exam delivery platform, specifications Working with technical vendors and internal teams to manage porting and transferring of content and user data in various internal and vendor-based systems, including GitHub repositories and JIRA     What We Are Looking For In You     Effective communication and collaboration across cross-functional teams, vendors, and with internal stakeholders to ensure resources and needs align Relevant, engaging and accurate instructional design and assessment Industry best practices of exam blueprinting and job task analysis Strong initiative and leadership skills, Agile experience, and security and privacy assessment User-friendly, accessible methods of conveying highly technical information that is relevant, appropriately challenging, and offers the highest quality user experience. Experience with GitHub repositories,CRMs, and JIRA Curiosity and the drive to learn highly complex technologies rapidly and autonomously in addition to working with SMEs.     What We Offer You     Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.     In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, please ask your Talent Partner.     An opportunity to shape the open source community An inclusive work environment Learning and development Annual compensation review Recognition rewards Annual leave Priority Pass for travel     About Canonical     Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.     Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.     Canonical is an equal opportunity employer     We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products.Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Social Media Marketing Specialist
Description: The role of a Social Media Marketing Specialist at Canonical     We're on the look out for a brilliant Social Media Marketing Specialist to join our team and take our communications to the next level. Our social media provides a window between the people who make our products and those who use them. With audiences in the millions, our online communities have the opportunity to talk to us, engage with us, provide feedback and be involved in the world of Ubuntu. From #opensource to coffee on K8s, launch previews to twitter storms over some cool release swag, our marketing team is committed to creating conversations with audiences all over planet earth: developers, tech enthusiasts, security engineers...     The ideal candidate is passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. They prefer to work in an environment that emphasises ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. They love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier.     This role sits in the communications team reporting to the director of communications.     Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.     What your day will look like     Create, schedule and publish content and campaigns across multiple social media channels Deliver regular analysis and reporting on social media metrics, content performance and campaigns results Support the growth and nurturing of Canonical's social media audiences, while increasing engagement rates and valuable actions Develop flair with copywriting and asset creation to create messaging that aligns with the brand and its personality, and drives audiences towards action Be responsible for executing A/B and multivariate growth tests Be audience centric, focusing on platform and community moderation, as well as direct audience engagement Create awareness on integrated campaigns, product launches, webinar series, industry announcements and core content. Package all of Canonical's product offerings and educational material creatively, from bare metal, AI, Kubernetes to chats on diversity and CSR.     What we are looking for in you     Experience managing social media platforms for tech brands, part of a content team or marketing agency Hands-on knowledge of social media management tools, an understanding of web analytics tools (social and web) Proficiency with at least four social media platforms including LinkedIn, YouTube, Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and Reddit An analytical eye and a good sense for the type of content that performs best depending on platform and objective Experience with educational content funnels, and using video as a core social media marketing asset Exceptional interpersonal skills and aptitude for forging trusting relationships across diverse, cross-functional teams Excellent verbal and written communication skills, strong content marketer Proven ability to prioritise and differentiate what matters from the noise, meeting deadlines without sacrificing quality Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events     What We Offer You     Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.     In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, please ask your Talent Partner.     Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004! Title: Ingeniero/a de Ciberseguridad (Remoto)
Description: En Sothis estamos creciendo a pasos agigantados y tenemos una gran oportunidad para ti. ¡Abrimos vacante para incorporar a un/a Ingeniero/a de Ciberseguridad en España!     ¿A qué nos dedicamos?     Estamos especializados en la implantación de soluciones integrales de tecnología.     ¿Cuáles será tu misión?     Como miembro de nuestro equipo de ciberseguridad liderarás la gestión /operación de la seguridad del cliente (análisis y gestión de vulnerabilidades, monitorización de eventos de seguridad (SIEM), definición de reglas de correlación, análisis de fuentes de inteligencia externa, análisis de malware y APTs, auditorias técnicas de seguridad, y respuesta ante incidentes, etc.), colaborarás en el diseño de arquitecturas de seguridad y darás soporte a las tareas de seguridad de la operativa diaria de la organización, y en la detección y evaluación de nuevas amenazas, así como colaboración en el análisis y diseño de las medidas adecuadas para su mitigación.     Definirás los requisitos y controles de seguridad, participarás en el seguimiento y monitorización de los proyectos de seguridad y en la gestión de incidentes y emergencias, así como en la creación de documentación relativa a los trabajos de seguridad del departamento.     ¿Nos eliges?     Queremos contar contigo a largo plazo para que crezcas con nosotros/as (contrato indefinido) y te ofrecemos un plan de carrera profesional apoyado por las formaciones técnicas y de gestión necesarias para lograrlo.     Además, contarás con un paquete retributivo competitivo acorde a los conocimientos y experiencia aportados, jornada intensiva los meses de julio y agosto, y todos los viernes del año, formación en idiomas, y la posibilidad de acogerte al programa de retribución flexible: Ticket Guardería, Ticket restaurante, Ticket formación, Tarjeta transporte y Seguro Médico.     También tendrás acceso a descuentos en distintos establecimientos, productos y servicios simplemente por formar parte del equipo.     ¡Y muchas más cosas que queremos que conozcas!     Requisitos:     ¿Qué talento buscamos?     Solo te pedimos que cuentes con experiencia de al menos tres años en el ámbito de la ciberseguridad como; análisis de malware / plataformas antimalware, análisis forense, identificación de amenazas para el posterior diseño e implementación de contramedidas técnicas, y en el diseño y desarrollo de proyectos, planes, programas y herramientas de seguridad que den soporte o automaticen parte de las tareas a realizar.     Es imprescindible que conozcas herramientas de análisis de vulnerabilidades y evaluación de seguridad, herramientas analíticas y de orquestación de seguridad y en distintos estándares de seguridad como MITRE y ENISA.     ¿Algo más con lo que aportar valor?     ¡Claro! Valoramos positivamente que tengas experiencia en la implantación de sistemas de seguridad perimetral (IDS, IPS, WAF, etc.) y que tengas una o varias de las siguientes certificaciones: GCIA, GCIH, CEH, ECIH, CISA, CISM, CISSP, Comptia Security+.     Además, tendremos en cuenta cualquier otra certificación relacionada de fabricantes de seguridad, por ejemplo, CRISC, CCSE, CCSA, JNCIA, JNCIE, CCIE, CCNP, CCNA, PCNSA.     También sumará en el proceso que tengas conocimiento de metodologías de pruebas de seguridad como ISSAF, OSSTMM, etc., de herramientas y equipos de respuesta ante incidentes (IRT).     Por último, nos encantaría que tuvieras presencia en foros, asociaciones o iniciativas relacionadas con el sector y con el puesto, y que estés al día de amenazas emergentes sabiendo relacionarlas con el impacto que puedan tener en distintos sectores de negocio.     ¿Te atreves con el reto? Inscríbete, ¡te estamos buscando!.     Desde SOTHIS queremos informar a todo interesado/a en nuestras ofertas de empleo que las únicas ofertas vigentes están publicadas en nuestra página web https://www.sothis.tech/portal-de-talento/, no debiendo confiar en portales que simplemente se limitan a agregar la información de nuestras ofertas con objeto recabar sus datos personales.
Function: Gestión y Tecnología de la información

Title: Empleo para Analista de Laboratorio
Description: En Classgap estamos buscando analistas de laboratorio con conocimiento de química para que puedan compartir sus conocimientos dando clases particulares online de química para estudiantes.     ¿Te gustaría ganar un dinero extra?     Si tienes conocimiento de química empieza a dar clases online y ayuda a los alumnos a alcanzar sus metas. No se requiere experiencia previa como profesor pero sí mucha motivación. Inscríbete ahora y empieza a generar ingresos en 48h.     VENTAJAS:     Flexibilidad horaria Posibilidad de teletrabajo / en remoto Podrás establecer el precio de tus clases

Title: Coach Educativo - Trabajo Híbrido
Description: En los últimos años muchas padres y madres buscan los servicios de un coach educativo para ayudar en el desarrollo de sus hijos en el entorno escolar.     En Tusclasesparticulares buscamos coaches educativos para ayudar a nuestro estudiantes.     Tareas:     Ayudar al estudiante a encontrar su potencial Ayudar al alumno a encontrar recursos para estudiar mejor Supervisar el progreso del estudiante     Requisitos:     Formación relacionada con psicología/pedagogía/coach No se requiere experiencia como coach Compromiso con los estudiantes     Beneficios:     Horario flexible Modalidad de trabajo híbrido Retribución de 15 a 35€/h
