Self-motivated and results-orientated with a clear focus on accuracy. High level of honesty, integrity, and ability to handle confidential data. Flexible attitude and easily adaptable to change. Willing to take the initiative and provide suggestions and ideas to contribute to the success of the role/team. Ambitious to grow your career within HR. Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events     What we offer you     We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus which varies based on seniority but starts at a range up to 10%. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to ensure fairness globally.     Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person - we've been working remotely since 2004! Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year Annual compensation review Recognition rewards Annual holiday leave Maternity and paternity leave Employee Assistance Programme Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues from your team and others Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events     About Canonical     Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. Title: New Graduate HR Generalist
Description: We have openings for recent graduates in our global team of HR Generalists, one in each major region of the world. We are holding these positions for truly exceptional individuals who will graduate from their first undergraduate degree in the next year, or who have graduated in the last six months at the time of application. We will assess candidates on the basis of academic achievement and extramural leadership. Candidates will need to show a track record at school and university of consistent over-achievement as well as evidence of a desire and ability to learn, drive and shape HR practices on the global stage in a rapidly changing world.     Our people are based in more than 70 countries around the world. Our HR department depends on the precise application of policy and process as well as a depth of compliance and People partnering to make us an efficient, friendly, quality-driven, real-time service. The Associate HR Generalist will be responsible for supporting and coordinating general HR activities supporting our AMER, EMEA and APAC regions and driving our HR processes. This is a great opportunity to start and progress your career in a People function supporting team members worldwide.     The successful candidate will bring an exceptional academic track record coupled with some experience working in an entry-level role in an HR or People Team. You will bring some existing knowledge of employment law. Ideally, we are looking for someone who has an inherent interest in the Technology sector, specifically Open Source.     Location: These roles can be held in any time zone. We have HR teams for EMEA, APAC and the Americas.     What your day will look like     Provide HR support by answering team members' questions and responding to requests regarding their employment and contracts, escalating when necessary. Requests may include information about the new starter process and onboarding, questions regarding global benefits, employment verifications, and other general inquiries. Maintain our HRIS, ensuring a high degree of accuracy and timeliness in processing all team member changes and new joiners. Owning global projects (e.g. engagement, training or culture initiatives) Partnering with the managers and employees - supporting HR processes and driving the people strategy for your areas of responsibility Working as a truly global partner to colleagues, especially leads, managers and executives Process new hires, including country-specific on-boarding documentation, creation of files, systems set-up, and coordination of introductory reviews. Provide support to employees for the enrollment and processing of benefits and the payroll process, ensuring monthly data is provided on time and is accurate. Liaise with payroll to guarantee smooth salary payments. Create purchase orders for internal departments. Provide administrative support to employees for the enrollment and processing of benefits. Conduct regular audits of employment files and systems to ensure they are up-to-date, accurate, and GDPR compliant. Continually work to better our processes, spotting areas we can improve to drive our function forward. Conduct and manage global background checks.     What we are looking for in you     An exceptional academic track record from both high school and preferably university Experience working in an entry-level role in an HR/People team is beneficial, preferably in the Technology industry. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Able to prioritize complex workloads, manage time effectively and work well under pressure. Self-motivated and results-orientated with a clear focus on accuracy. High level of honesty, integrity, and ability to handle confidential data. Flexible attitude and easily adaptable to change. Willing to take the initiative and provide suggestions and ideas to contribute to the success of the role/team. Ambitious to grow your career within HR. Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events     What we offer you     We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus which varies based on seniority but starts at a range up to 10%. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to ensure fairness globally.     Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person - we've been working remotely since 2004! As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. Title: Inbound Sales Manager
Description: Cloudbeds provides the platform that powers hospitality, driving streamlined operations, increasing reservations and revenue, and enabling memorable guest experiences for lodging businesses of all sizes and types. Named the No. 1 PMS and No. 1 Hotel Management System by Hotel Tech Report in 2022, Cloudbeds is trusted by properties across the globe for its award-winning front desk, revenue, distribution, guest acquisition and guest engagement solutions seamlessly combined in a single unified system.     Behind the Cloudbeds platform is a growing team of 700+ employees distributed across 40+ countries speaking 30+ languages. From data architects to UX designers, integrations managers to payments experts, former hotel managers to former OTA executives, our team comprises the brightest minds in technology and hospitality working to solve the industry’s biggest challenges.     This Means We     From the beginning, we've believed that our people are our greatest asset, so we founded the company as #RemoteFirst, #RemoteAlways with shared core values that allow our team to thrive.     Hire the best people around the world; Emphasize the value of results over hours put in; Provide flexibility in working hours and locations; Foster an inclusive environment that celebrates bold thinking and diverse perspectives; Offer open vacation policies, free LinkedIn Learning, and other benefits that promote well-being and professional development.     As an Inbound Sales Manager, you will be responsible for building, driving, and managing a team of Inbound Sales Executives to deliver above quota sales performance.     Primary Responsibilities     What You Will Do:     You will be responsible for all aspects of the team’s sales cycle, including the execution of individual and team sales plans to exceed quotas; managing and ensuring adherence to the Cloudbeds Sales Process methodology; leveraging alternate channels to build sales volume; ensuring high level of customer renewal rates; disciplined expense management; maintaining a healthy culture that resuls in consistent performance, and, most importantly, maintaining the highest levels of integrity in everything that we do.     Secondary Responsibilities     Accurately create and deliver forecasts to sales leadership; provide feedback to sales leadership, product, engineering and marketing regarding what you’re hearing in the field; assist with virtual presentations of the tool to clients all over the world; represent Cloudbeds at major industry events.     You’ll Succeed With     5+ years experience as a quota-buster, modeling a consultative sales approach 2+ years of sales management experience Demonstrable success in leading/training sales professionals Demonstrable success in selling hospitality management software or other SaaS solutions Track record of overachievement in new logo acquisition, high customer renewal rates and the ability to drive exceptional outbound prospecting results Exceptional presentation skills; able to effectively and energetically present to customers, peers, and leadership Ability to optimize the SaaS sales model as necessary to accelerate growth Drive to quickly develop subject matter expertise in Salesforce CRM, Tableau, Zendesk and an ever-expanding list of productivity tools     Bonus     Proven track record of taking a region from $5M ARR to $15M+. Track record developing and sustaining partners for a start-up. Fluent English and, Spanish or Portuguese languages preferrable. Hospitality experience and/or education.     Our company culture supports flexible working schedules with an open Paid Time Away policy and gives all team members the opportunity to travel and work remotely with great people. If you think you have the skills and passion, we’ll give you the support and opportunity to thrive in your career. If you would like to be considered for the role, we would love to hear from you!     Company Awards to Check Out!     Fastest Growing Companies | Inc. 500 (2018 & 2019) Best Places to Work | Inc Magazine (2017 & 2018) Best Places to Work | HotelTechReport (2018, 2019, 2020, 2021) Best Property Management System | HotelTechReport (2021, 2022) Best Hotel Management Software | HotelTechReport (2022) Start-Ups to Watch | Forbes (2018) Best Startup Employers | Forbes (2020, 2022) Technology Fast 500 | Deloitte (2019, 2020, 2021) Top 100 North America | Red Herring (2020) Connect MIP Award (Technology)     Cloudbeds is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer that celebrates the diversity in our global team! We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.     Cloudbeds is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, Cloudbeds will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations in the hiring process. We encourage deaf, hard of hearing, deaf-blind, and deaf-disabled individuals to apply. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process or to perform essential job functions, please contact our HR team by phone at 858-201-7832 or via email at accommodations@cloudbeds.com. Cloudbeds will provide an American Sign Language (ASL) interpreter where needed as a reasonable accommodation for the hiring processes.     To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies: Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Cloudbeds. Staffing, recruiting agencies, and individuals being represented by an agency are not authorized to use this site or to submit applications, and any such submissions will be considered unsolicited. Cloudbeds does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Cloudbeds employees, or any other company location. Cloudbeds is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/applications.

The successful candidate will bring an exceptional academic track record coupled with some experience working in an entry-level role in an HR or People Team. You will bring some existing knowledge of employment law. Ideally, we are looking for someone who has an inherent interest in the Technology sector, specifically Open Source.     Location: These roles can be held in any time zone. We have HR teams for EMEA, APAC and the Americas.     What your day will look like     Provide HR support by answering team members' questions and responding to requests regarding their employment and contracts, escalating when necessary. Requests may include information about the new starter process and onboarding, questions regarding global benefits, employment verifications, and other general inquiries. Maintain our HRIS, ensuring a high degree of accuracy and timeliness in processing all team member changes and new joiners. Owning global projects (e.g. engagement, training or culture initiatives) Partnering with the managers and employees - supporting HR processes and driving the people strategy for your areas of responsibility Working as a truly global partner to colleagues, especially leads, managers and executives Process new hires, including country-specific on-boarding documentation, creation of files, systems set-up, and coordination of introductory reviews. Provide support to employees for the enrollment and processing of benefits and the payroll process, ensuring monthly data is provided on time and is accurate. Liaise with payroll to guarantee smooth salary payments. Create purchase orders for internal departments. Provide administrative support to employees for the enrollment and processing of benefits. Conduct regular audits of employment files and systems to ensure they are up-to-date, accurate, and GDPR compliant. Continually work to better our processes, spotting areas we can improve to drive our function forward. Conduct and manage global background checks.     What we are looking for in you     An exceptional academic track record from both high school and preferably university Experience working in an entry-level role in an HR/People team is beneficial, preferably in the Technology industry. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Able to prioritize complex workloads, manage time effectively and work well under pressure. Self-motivated and results-orientated with a clear focus on accuracy. High level of honesty, integrity, and ability to handle confidential data. Flexible attitude and easily adaptable to change. Willing to take the initiative and provide suggestions and ideas to contribute to the success of the role/team. Ambitious to grow your career within HR. Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events     What we offer you     We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus which varies based on seniority but starts at a range up to 10%. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to ensure fairness globally.     Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person - we've been working remotely since 2004! Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year Annual compensation review Recognition rewards Annual holiday leave Maternity and paternity leave Employee Assistance Programme Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues from your team and others Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events     About Canonical     Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.     Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.     Canonical is an equal opportunity employer     We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Analista Digital
Description: Estamos buscando un analista digital para nuestro equipo de consultoría, que trabajará muy cerca de los clientes para ayudarles a conseguir sus objetivos de negocio a través de la analítica de datos y la estrategia digital.     ¿Quiénes somos?     Hay algunas cosas importantes que deberías saber de nosotros:     Nuestros éxitos se deben a las personas que formamos parte del Equipo Improver. Tenemos diferentes formaciones y experiencias: analistas, técnicos, ingenieros, matemáticos, marketers, pero nos encanta que nos llamen Business Improvers, porque nos impulsa ayudar a nuestros clientes a tomar mejores decisiones de negocio. Nos gustan los datos. Nos gusta el valor de los datos y su aplicación. Nos gustan las automatizaciones, identificar, clasificar y dar respuestas. Somos honestos, transparentes y responsables en los servicios que prestamos, nuestros conocimientos y experiencia. No tememos al error, lo identificamos y reaccionamos rápidamente. Nos importan las personas con las que trabajamos, compañeros, clientes y proveedores. Y nos gusta el trabajo en equipo, estar al día en tecnología y nuevas herramientas, no tememos a los retos y tenemos el instinto analítico muy, muy desarrollado.     ¿Cómo será tu día a día en Improving Metrics?     Tras unas semanas de acompañamiento con un/a mentor/a, tendrás autonomía para:     Recoger necesidades del cliente para implementar herramientas que optimicen su ecosistema digital y ayudar en la explotación de los datos relevantes para negocio. Definir métricas y KPIs, validados con el cliente. Ordenar el ecosistema de medición digital de nuestros clientes. Mantener y evolucionar la integración de los entornos digitales Elaborar informes y cuadros de mando operacionales, tácticos y estratégicos de ayuda al control y la toma de decisiones. Diseñar el plan de pruebas que permita mantener la calidad de los datos recogidos. Generar conocimiento útil de negocio a partir de los datos recogido, normalmente grandes volúmenes de datos. Proponer las mejoras y cambios necesarios para conseguir los objetivos de negocio. Asesorar a los equipos en la toma de decisiones basadas en datos. Gestión de la implantación de herramientas de medición. Mentorización de nuevos Improvers, cuando te sientas cómodo/a para acompañarles en su nuevo proyecto.     ¿Qué consideramos importante para nuestros/as analistas digitales?     Experiencia laboral en análisis Web y App Sólida experiencia con Google Analytics 4(GA4). Experiencia con Google Tag Manager (GTM). Experiencia en creación e impulso de planes de analítica digital. Sólida experiencia en visualización de datos con Looker Studio. Conocimientos avanzados en Excel. Soltura con herramientas de visualización de datos Mucho interés por el mundo digital, y por aprender, siempre. Que te guste trabajar con clientes El trabajo en equipo Gusto por el detalle, capacidad de análisis y síntesis. Pensamiento analítico     ¿Qué otras cosas valoramos, pero no son imprescindibles?     Conocimientos en Márketing Digital y CRO Conocimientos en Power Bi o Tableau Experiencia con lenguajes como R y/o Python Experiencia con BigQuery y entorno Google Cloud o en su defecto, Microsoft Azure. Conocimiento de inglés a nivel C1. Experiencia trabajando con clientes, por ejemplo, en una agencia, aunque no sea en analítica.     ¿Qué te ofrecemos?     Formar parte de un equipo profesional, muy orientado a la calidad del trabajo, del que podrás aprender y que estarán encantados de que contribuyas con tu experiencia. Proyección profesional, sentémonos a planificar tu carrera. Proyectos interesantes, trabajando al lado de grandes clientes. 100% remote, aunque si vives en A Coruña o en Madrid, puedes venir a la oficina cuando quieras. Horario flexible para que puedas conciliar tu vida con tu proyecto profesional. Jornada intensiva los viernes y 3 meses en verano. Beneficios sociales.     ¿Consideras que encajas bastante pero crees que te falta algo? Lo más importante en Improving Metrics es que tengas: pasión, integridad y compromiso, innovación, persistencia, paciencia y, sobre todo, muchas ganas de aprender y hacer un gran trabajo para nuestros clientes, de modo que, si este/a eres tú, te animamos a conocernos aunque tu experiencia no encaje al 100% con esta descripción.     ¿Tienes alma Improver? ¡Apúntate! Te estamos esperando
Function: Gestión y Tecnología de la información
Industry: Servicios de TI y consultoría de TI

Title: eCommerce Designer
Description: About The Company     The Ridge crafts products made to last a lifetime through with simple, functional designs ready for anything and everything. Our materials are chosen with care and a thoughtful connection to the insights of our growing community - setting our North star as we strive to improve everyday. Together we can do more with less.     Ridge started with The Ridge Wallet as a Kickstarter project in 2013 and is now in the hands and pockets of over 3 million people worldwide! We currently operate around the globe selling in the US, Canada, the UK, EU, and Australia on Shopify and through other channels such as Amazon and Wholesalers. We have also expanded and continue to expand our product catalog to include KeyCases, Bolt Action Pens, Knives, Rings, Watches and we have plenty more in the works!     We are looking for people interested in positions with tremendous growth potential, but which come with high expectations of work rate and quality of work. We are a fully remote company and utilize that to find the best talent around the world to join our team. Since we are a remote-first company, we always do our best to be as accommodating to a healthy work/life balance.     The Role     Apply here: https://tally.so/r/3NDKlW     Your Responsibilities Will Include     Collaborate for Brand Identity and Project Requirements: Work closely with Ecommerce Operations, cross-functional teams, and all creative channels to understand project requirements and develop visually stunning graphics, illustrations, and layouts that contribute to a cohesive brand identity across various digital platforms. Ensure consistency and adherence to brand guidelines in all design outputs. Visual Asset Production: Create and optimize graphics and images for online use, ensuring high-quality and optimized files suitable for web and mobile platforms. Collaboration and Communication: Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as product management, UX/UI designers, and developers to understand project requirements and deliver designs that meet business objectives. Clearly communicate design concepts, ideas, and timelines to stakeholders. Actively participate in brainstorming sessions while aligning creative decisions with the Brand Mission, Vision, and Values. Creative Ideation: Contribute innovative ideas and creative concepts for digital product experiences, considering user needs, design trends, and business goals. File Organization: Maintain a well-organized file structure and adhere to version control best practices to ensure easy access and retrieval of design assets. Continuous Learning: Stay updated with industry trends, emerging design tools, and techniques to enhance design skills and contribute to the overall creative development of our digital products. Growth and Participation: Display a hunger to grow within the company and actively participate in team discussions, brainstorming sessions, and design critiques to contribute to the improvement of design processes and the overall success of our digital products.     Ideal Profile     Requirements     Education: A bachelor's degree in graphic design, visual communication, or a related field is preferred, but not required. We value relevant experience and passion for the field equally. Demonstrated skills and a strong portfolio showcasing creativity and design expertise will be considered in lieu of a degree. Ecommerce experience is required. Portfolio: A portfolio of your previous design work is required upon submission of your application. The portfolio should demonstrate your skills, creativity, and understanding of design principles. It should showcase a variety of design projects, highlighting your ability to create visually appealing and impactful designs for digital platforms. Software Proficiency: Mastery of Adobe Creative Cloud (specifically Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign) is essential. Proficiency in Figma is also required, as it will be a key tool for collaboration and design prototyping. Design Skills: Strong conceptualization and visual communication abilities, with a keen eye for detail. Understanding of color theory, typography, layout, and composition principles. Organizational Skills: Excellent time management and organizational skills to handle multiple design projects simultaneously and meet deadlines consistently. Adaptability: Ability to adapt to fast-paced environments and evolving design requirements while maintaining a high level of creativity and quality. Communication Skills: Effective verbal and written communication skills are essential. We are looking for someone who can actively participate in brainstorming sessions while understanding that the Brand Mission, Vision, and Values govern creative decisions. The ability to articulate design concepts and ideas while aligning them with the brand's core principles is crucial.     What's on Offer?     Opportunity within company with a solid track record of success Flexible working options Leadership Role
Industry: Industria textil y moda para la venta minorista

Title: New Graduate HR Generalist
Description: We have openings for recent graduates in our global team of HR Generalists, one in each major region of the world. We are holding these positions for truly exceptional individuals who will graduate from their first undergraduate degree in the next year, or who have graduated in the last six months at the time of application. We will assess candidates on the basis of academic achievement and extramural leadership. Candidates will need to show a track record at school and university of consistent over-achievement as well as evidence of a desire and ability to learn, drive and shape HR practices on the global stage in a rapidly changing world.     Our people are based in more than 70 countries around the world. Our HR department depends on the precise application of policy and process as well as a depth of compliance and People partnering to make us an efficient, friendly, quality-driven, real-time service. Title: QA Tester Funcional 100% Remoto
Description: En Arelance sabemos que las personas son el activo más importante dentro de una empresa y por tanto invertimos muchos esfuerzos en buscar los mejores profesionales para nuestros clientes y en ofrecer a nuestros candidatos los mejores proyectos.     En este momento buscamos Testers con al menos 4 años de experiencia como QA Funcional para un proyecto 100 Remoto.     ¿Cuáles serán las funciones del puesto?     Diseñar y Ejecutar pruebas funcionales. Realización de Casos de prueba. Gestión de Defectos. Acceso a Bases de Datos.     ¿Cuáles son los requisitos mínimos?     Poseer al menos 4 años de experiencia en diseño análisis y ejecución de pruebas funcionales. Experiencia con las tecnologías JIRA y Quality Center para la gestión. Haber realizado llamadas a APIs o servicios Soap. Tener experiencia previa realizando Accesos a BBDD PL/SQL.     ¿Qué ofrecemos?     Incorporación en un proyecto estable y de larga duración. Contrato indefinido. Modalidad de trabajo 100 Remoto. Acceso a formación.     Si tienes interés en una gran oportunidad como ésta y quieres conocer más detalles ¡inscríbete! ¡Queremos conocerte!     JIRA, Quality Center,     72551fad325fa3093042

Title: Director, Start-up (Spain)
Description: The Director, Start-Up is responsible for providing leadership and oversight to site contracting, and site activation teams, ensuring alignment with study and site activation timelines. The Director, Start-Up will provide leadership to functional leads of Site Selection and Site Contracting.  The Director, Start Up has line management responsibility for functional area staff in accordance with company policies and applicable regulations. Responsibilities include overseeing the training of the new employees, participating in hiring activities, performance management, guiding professional development, addressing employee relation issues and escalating issues, as necessary.  This role is perfect for you if:   If you have extensive global experience in managing teams assigned to the start of studies If you are innovative, aim for excellence and want to make a difference in the global expansion of our company If you are a manager who has an inclusive and agile approach that emphasizes the front line and dares to take action.   More specifically, the Director, Site Start up:   Provides overall guidance and oversight to the department on best practices and guidance for efficient site selection and activation, start up, and site contracting. Ensures teams have support and resources to perform efficiently in start up roles in adherence to project timelines and financial goals. Interviews and hires candidates for roles within the department. Conduct periodic and annual performance reviews for direct reports. Manages departmental expenses to be within the approved annual budget. Participates in forecasting expenses and resources needs as required. Drives department deliverables and sets priorities for functional teams in site selection and site contracting. Identifies processes that need development and improvement. Acts as an agent of change within the organization. Develops partnership with targeted sites to establish repeatable accelerated start up strategies. Participates in proposal requests by providing recommendations on number of sites and recruitment period for new proposal requests. Participates in proposal defense meetings and client interactions, as necessary. Supervises the maintenance and development of the investigators database to support site identification and selection. Acts as a point of escalation for clients and project teams encountering service delivery challenges during start up. Sets direction with team member to resolve service delivery challenges to avoid missing deliverables. Escalates to senior management significant issues as necessary. Ensures adequate training and consistent use by internal team members of SOPs and Tools related to sites selection, site contracting, and site start-up activities. Oversees and supports teams to meet project budgets and timelines for feasibility, sites selection, sites budget and contract, ethics submissions, essential regulatory document collection, review and management. Develops and maintains positive and productive relationships with key clinical research sites, vendors and sponsors. Supports integration of feasibility data and site activation metrics in recruitment projections for proposals and awarded studies. Identifies, maintains and reports on key performance indicators (KPIs) for Site Selection, Site Contracting and Site Activation. Collaborates with Clinical Operations and Project Management when site quality issues are identified to ensure that impacts on site desirability for inclusion in future studies is related to sites performance through project meetings, escalation of site communications, and quality assurance audit findings. Identifies improvements and efficiencies to site selection and activation processes and shares lessons learned broadly with key stakeholders Collaborates with Senior Executives to establishes a strategic vision and long-range plan for the department across functional areas. Develops new and leads the improvement of existing department systems, SOPs, and processes. Authors, reviews and updates related SOPs and Tools as necessary. Ensures consistency and best practices are followed on all processes, protocols, and clinical systems, such as within the Clinical Trial Management System (CTMS) and electronic Trial Master File Ensures proper training is implemented to demonstrate CFR, GCP/ICH compliance May perform other tasks in order to fulfill project requirements, as needed.   Requirements:  IDEAL PROFILE  Education   B.Sc. in a relevant field of study.   Experience   Bilingual (English and Spanish) with excellent written English skills. Minimum of 10 years’ experience in clinical research in the biotechnology, pharmaceutical, or CRO industry, including significant and relevant experience in staff management and in site selection and study start-up activities and/or has worked closely with sites.   Knowledge And Skills   Excellent presentation, negotiation, documentation, and leadership skills, as well as strong team-orientation and interpersonal skills. Customer focus with ability to manage challenging priorities and remain flexible and adaptive in stressful situations. Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, Power Point). Experience of dermatological clinical research is a definite asset. Quick learner, good adaptability and versatile. Ability to work in a team environment and establish good relationships with colleagues, sponsors, and sites. Organized, able to juggle competing priorities, and work in a fast pace and evolving environment. Good knowledge of good clinical practices, and applicable local and international regulations /guidelines.   Our company:  The work environment  At Innovaderm, you will work with brilliant and driven colleagues. Our values are collaboration, innovation, reliability and responsiveness. We offer a stimulating work environment and attractive advancement opportunities.  ﻿When joining Innovaderm, you will be eligible for the following perks:   Flexible work schedule Permanent full-time position various benefits 100% remote role Ongoing learning and development   Innovaderm is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, sex, genetic information, marital status, national origin, race, religion, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, citizenship status, individuals with disabilities or other characteristics protected by law.

Title: Consultor/a de redes y ciberseguridad
Description: En Digital Talent Agency te ofrecemos oportunidades laborales de incorporación directa en empresas destacadas del sector tecnológico.     Ponemos el foco en tu desarrollo profesional qué te gusta cómo eres y con qué tipo de proyectos te sientes motivado.     Formamos parte de Zemsania Global Group y juntos contamos con más de 18 de años de experiencia en asesoramiento profesional a candidatos y búsqueda y selección de perfiles tecnológicos..     Buscamos un consultor/a de redes y comunicaciones para trabajar de manera remota.     Tus funciones serán     Definir los requisitos de comunicaciones y seguridad perimetral en proyectos Cloud y Onpremise.     Ejecutar y coordinar las auditorías técnicas y los tests de incursión.     Gestionar y explotar la red     Generar procedimientos y documentación técnica de comunicaciones y seguridad perimetral.     Gestionar y resolver los incidentes de seguridad.     Administrar elementos de seguridad perimetral.     Requisitos mínimos     3 años de experiencia en     Seguridad perimetral (PaloAlto Fortinet etc.) Herramientas de Web Aplication Firewall Routing y Switching (Cisco Extreme HP etc.) Tecnología Wireless Arquitectura de redes. Routing avanzado Gestión de direccionamiento IP Conocimientos en sistemas de autentificación de red.     PaloAlto, Fortinet,     036611a22288036b5547

Title: Product Manager - Remote (EU)
Description: This is a remote position.     About The Company     WealthKernel is a VC-backed FinTech company whose mission is to enable change that makes financial services better for everyday people. We aim to be the AWS of savings, investment, and pension infrastructure. We recently won the WealthTech Company of the Year award at the FinTech Awards London. At the heart of WealthKernel is an Api-first, DevOps culture.     About The Job     WK’s Associate Product Managers will be playing a key part in providing value and support to our cross-functional teams, helping innovate and build the WealthKernel platform while gaining valuable on-the-job training and coaching. You will be working closely with our team of developers, co-leading the Squads with the Lead Software Engineers and acting as the glue that holds all functions together.     Please keep in mind that although this is a fully remote position, only candidates based in the European Union will be considered.     Job Responsibilities     Contributing to problem and solution discovery efforts by conducting internal stakeholder and customer interviews and research, and developing and running experiments to validate concepts. Writing stories that articulate work to be done by Engineering in support of solutions and production support. Working closely with Engineering to ensure solutions are ultimately delivered in a timely and cost-effective manner. Working closely with stakeholder to understand the business and adapt solutions as it evolves. Supporting stakeholders in the development of feature descriptions and new release content. Maintaining a prioritized backlog that aligns with available Engineering capacity and maps to an overall solution roadmap.     Requirements     3+ years experience as a Product Manager or Product Owner You have sound knowledge of API Development and SDLC Domain Knowledge: Proven track record and demonstrated expertise of working in either Wealth Management, Brokerage or Trading Operations within the European Union. Solid technical acumen and the ability to learn tech concepts quickly, Assertive and strong-willed, but diplomatic and a great negotiator.     Preferred Skills And Character Traits     Self-starter, self-driven, customer-centric, analytical and data driven, superb prioritization skills, transversality, great communication skills.     Benefits     Why us?     We believe in transparency and empowering people We want you to challenge us and also to accept being challenged We want you to learn from your mistakes. We want you to propose and try new things We believe in results. We don’t micromanage. We trust you. You will have the opportunity to grow and develop your skills in new areas while working in an open, creative, and collaborative environment. You will work hands-on with experienced professionals who will always be one click away from you if you need their help     Company Benefits     Working in a multicultural environment A positive and collaborative working culture Competitive pay package 22 days of holidays (plus bank holidays) Remotely based position (forever!) Company team retreats     If you have the confidence, energy, and passion to take on this challenging people role and join a unique firm, please get in touch!

Title: Chief Operating Officer for a Coaching and Events Company
Description: Hello, Operations Experts!     My name is Petra Fürst and I am the CEO at Soulmate Coaching - our motivated and warm-hearted team will pull out all the stops to help you find a happy relationship with the man of your dreams! We have helped thousands of women on their way to a happy relationship- at live performances, in seminars, workshops, intensive 1-to-1 sessions, and of course via our YouTube channel with 100,000+ subscribers and 25 million video views.     We are looking to hire a motivated Head of Operations who can help us take the business to the next international market level and participate in a high-growth company. We are looking for an excellent leader who can ensure the well-being of the whole team by managing the day-to-day operations of the company and by helping us scale the businesses quickly. Someone who has excellent communication and organizational skills to help all the departments run at maximum efficiency and productivity.     This is a full-time remote position.     We are looking for a Head of Operations specifically with these requirements:     Excellent written and spoken English AND German Has at least 3+ years experience in Operations executive/ leadership positions Has at least 2+ years of experience working in a digital marketing agency setting - OR selling online products / services Has experience in expanding services/products into other language markets (US, Spain, etc.) Has experience in developing and scaling effective operational systems, metrics, and processes Has experience in growing a business to eight-figure revenues Track record of building, leading, and managing teams and has delivered high-impact projects in short timelines Must be comfortable dealing with issues ranging from the operational level through to executive strategy, as well as interpersonal and team related challenges Strong Project Management skills: defining complete action plans and adjustments, analyzing data for performance and project management improvements, and optimizing project flows Has experience with overseeing marketing campaigns, events operations, ticket sales, and promotions     Requirements     Nice to have:     Google analytics certification Experience organizing events (in-person and online) NLP certification (neuro linguistic programming)     Your responsibilities will include (but are not limited to):     Function as head of ops/team leader Directly overseeing the company’s day-to-day operations (service delivery), HR, project management, and accounting/finance functions and employee productivity Working side by side with the founders in implementing operational processes and business strategies that are aligned with the company’s goals Designing and implementing actionable business strategies and plans that ensure alignment with short-term and long-term objectives developed in tandem with the CEO Spearheading the expansion of the company’s products to other markets Maintaining and building trusted relationships with key customers, clients, partners, high-profile speakers, and sponsors Ensuring effective recruiting, onboarding, professional development, performance management, and retention Identifying and analyzing issues and gaps within the organization; planning and implementing improvements Empowering team members’ professional growth through coaching and mentoring to ensure work is carried out to the highest standards     Benefits     Growth Opportunities/Perks:     Working in a challenging environment where you're going to be pushed to do your best work in your entire career Have the freedom to bring ideas, and strategies and be free to implement them Make a difference in a global community challenging a whole industry to think differently 100% remote with flexible overlapping working hours Opportunity to be a part of a fast-growing company and grow with it     This Position Is Perfect For You If…     You’re a Great Leader.     Built on integrity and honesty, you build the best teams, and you're someone the whole team looks up to as a leader & coach. You bring your whole personality to work and are willing to engage on a personal level. You put your whole heart into your work and uplift those around you.     You are Detail-Oriented. You have strong analytical skills and take a data-driven approach to problem-solving. You have sharp attention to detail and can spot inefficiencies in strategies and find creative solutions based on your analysis.     You have a Learning and Growth Mindset. You can acknowledge that everything can always be improved and that you can approach each challenge with a positive ‘can-do attitude.

Title: Customer Service Agent: English - Afternoon Shift
Description: Hi, we're Fever     We're excited you are checking out this job offer.     We are the leading global live-entertainment discovery tech platform with a clear mission: to democratize access to culture and entertainment.     How do we achieve our mission? Fever has developed a proprietary technology that inspires a global community of over 125M people through personalized and curated experiences in their local city whilst empowering entertainment and event creators to reach new audiences and enhance their experience.     Sounds amazing, right?     About the role:     We love our customers and always aim to provide the best service. If you like working at home, this job is for you!     INFO: The Schedule for the afternoon-shift position is 4:00 pm to 00:00 am (5 days/week) with 30 minutes of break.     You will be expected to:     Customer Service by e-mail, phone or social media for solving any incidents generated Managing incoming calls and chats and customer service inquiries Provide accurate, valid and complete information by using the right methods/tools Handle customer complaints, provide appropriate solutions and alternatives within the time limits; follow up to ensure resolution. Keep records of customer interactions, process customer accounts, and file documents Follow communication procedures, guidelines, and policies Take the extra mile to engage customers As the resolutions of incidents are not constant, parallel work for the Department of Operations will be performed. Work schedule: 4:00 pm - 12:00 m with 30 minute break     About you:     Previous experience in User Support or Customer Service positions are highly valuable. Previous experience using Zendesk is preferred. High English level (oral & written) and fluent in Spanish or English Skilled at planning, organizing, prioritizing and executing simultaneous tasks. Have good communication and interpersonal skills. Are a solution-oriented and reliable professional. Are incredibly detail-orientated with excellent time-management skills. Are flexible. Everything can change very quickly and you know how to adapt Have excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Be decisive and organized. Love being part of a dynamic team in a growing company. Candidates must reside in Spain     You can expect to join a group of diverse, hardworking team players, where a cultural fit is someone willing to stay humble and learn, and can work nimbly. We welcome applications with unusual backgrounds with the expectation that the applicant will have acquired hard or soft skills and maturity throughout their experiences.     This role is located in Spain.     Benefits & Perks     Home office Great work environment with a young, international team of talented people to work with! Possibility to receive in advance part of your salary by Payflow 40% discount on all Fever events and experiences Health Insurance Gympass Membership     Thank you for considering joining Fever. We cannot wait to learn more about you!     If you want to learn more about us: Fever's Blog | Tech.Eu | TechCrunch     Fever is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workspace where everyone's background and ideas count. Our main goal is to find the best possible talent regardless of place of birth, racial or ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, religion, opinion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age or caring responsibilities. We encourage everyone to apply!     If you require any kind of accommodation during the selection process please contact our Talent team so we can help you by providing a welcoming and seamless journey.     If you want to know more about how Fever processes your personal data, click here Fever - Candidate Privacy Notice

Title: .net junior developer
Description: NET Junior Developer     Descripción     Uno de nuestros clientes en A Coruña quiere ampliar su plantilla con un nuevo Junior Backend Developer .Net para proyecto con cliente de referencia en el mercado retail a nivel internacional (Guess).     Se trata de un proyecto estable, a largo plazo y con posibilidades de desarrollo profesional dentro de la propia empresa.     El desempeño de las funciones será mayoritariamente en remoto, pero será necesaria disponibilidad presencial en el centro de trabajo (A Coruña) un máximo de una vez por mes (habitualmente la frecuencia es menor),     Formación y experiencias mínimas.     Grado o Licenciatura o ingeniería con al menos 2 años de experiencia laboral con .Net o .Net Core (C#, web APIs REST, MVC, LinQ), algún gestor de base de datos relacional (SQL server, Oracle, etc.) y algún framework de pruebas unitarias (MSTest, XUnit, etc.)     FP/técnico superior con al menos 3 años de experiencia con .Net o .Net Core (C#, web APIs REST, MVC, LinQ) , algún gestor de base de datos relacional (SQL server, Oracle, etc.) y algún framework de pruebas unitarias (MSTest, XUnit, etc.)     Experiencia complementaria:     Azure devops, CI/CD Arquitectura orientadas a microservicios , docker, kubernetes Desarrollo con ServiceBus, RabbitMQ o cualquier message bróker Integración de sistemas     Imprescindible:     Inglés intermedio en escritura y lectura.     Trabajo en remoto, pero imprescindible disponibilidad para trabajar presencialmente en A Coruña un máximo de una vez al mes.     Otras     Con iniciativa y proactividad Capacidad de autoaprendizaje Trabajo en Equipo Zona geográfica, Galicia     Perfil deseado:     La definición del abanico salarial es amplia porque la oferta definitiva se hará en función de las aptitudes de cada candidato concreto.     La fecha de incorporación perfecta sería la más próxima posible

Title: Senior Imports/Exports Sales Manager, Fruits and Vegetables
Description: Who we are:     Wikifarmer is a global platform with the mission of empowering farmers by educating them and offering them access to the open market to sell their products at fair prices.     The Problem We Are Solving:     Most farmers in the world still cultivate their fields with techniques learned from experience or taught by their ancestors, leading to non-optimum practices in terms of yield and regard to the environmental impact. Farmers produce the most valuable part of the food supply chain, but they are the ones getting the least value out of it.     How we are fixing this:     Wikifarmer is building both an educational platform and a digital Marketplace. On one side of our Platform, producers can tap into and update their agricultural knowledge and practices and on the other side they can upload their products for free, gaining immediate and direct access to domestic and international markets.     What we are looking for:     Having recently secured a new round of funding from Point Nine (Revolut, Delivery Hero, Typeform) we are starting to build our core team - central to those hires will be a Senior imports/exports Sales Manager for our Marketplace, managing B2B sales of Fruit and Vegetables to Food Production Units and Wholesalers.     Job Duties and Responsibilities:     Sell the platform's food and agricultural products to customers in the food sector (Food Processing Units, Food Wholesalers, Major Retailers) Developing new business opportunities both in your local region (Spain or Italy) and further afield in Europe and globally Acquire new accounts, by sourcing new products on demand Develop strong relationships with customers (owners, supply and purchasing directors) in order to upsell and cross sell Build partnerships with agricultural co-operatives and independent producers, contributing to the supply side strategy of the company Utilise our CRM (Hubspot) to effectively manage and activate incoming leads Travel up to 25% of the time.     Key requirements:     You have a significant amount of sales experience and a successful commercial track record within the Food Wholesale or Export industry, specifically selling Fruit and Vegetables You have a strong network of decision-making Food and Beverage Buyers You have financial and business acumen, being very literate in calculating margins and profitability You have impactful communication and presentation skills You are comfortable in negotiating with a long term relationship mindset You're an entrepreneur at heart and you're not afraid to build everything from scratch Excellent knowledge of the Spanish or Italian and English language You need to be based in Spain or Italy     What we can offer you:     Fixed salary plus commission (€45k - €70k depending on location and experience) Car Allowance Equity in the business Private Medical Insurance L&D budget We are an early startup which is going places and you can make an immediate impact Transparency and Collaboration please submit your CV in English

Title: Business Development Manager - Spain
Description: At Joseph Joseph we love solving everyday problems through intelligent design to create distinctive, functional products that are a pleasure to own and use. We are one of the world’s leading houseware brands with a global presence spanning over 100 countries, available in most major department stores and independent houseware stores worldwide as well as our rapidly growing ecommerce channel.     We are looking for a Business Development Manager to join our team, working closely with our Spanish customers. Reporting to the Regional Sales Director based in the UK you will be responsible for managing multiple, key customers through positive relationships to deliver profitable and sustainable growth, launching and driving availability of New Product Development while executing promotional plans for the portfolio.     What you will be doing:     Meet and exceed all KPIs for your customer account portfolio Maintain and grow existing accounts and other selected customers Effectively manage all new product launches to drive initial listings and maximise availability and revenue growth Devise and execute comprehensive and cost-effective account plans, JBP’s and promotional plans and regularly review with each individual key account Monitor and report on competitor activity in the market, identify changes and emerging trends in customer and consumer buying patterns Collaborate with other internal departments on customer projects to ensure we maximise our return on investment and act as a best-in-class commercial function Enhance the Company profile through undertaking a range of promotional activities to include attendance at relevant trade shows and exhibitions     What we need from you:     Established experience within a similar sales environment, already operating at an Account Manager level Proven track record of achieving business development and revenue growth Experience of implementing sales plans, developing customer account plans and JBPs and managing budgets Excellent communication and negotiation skills with the ability to influence at all levels whilst providing a quality customer orientated approach Demonstrate excellent analytical, planning, problem solving, presentation and organisational skills Flexible approach towards working hours with the ability to travel throughout Spain A degree within a business discipline is highly desirable Full driving license is a benefit     What you will get from us:     Competitive salary and holiday allowance Performance related bonus An exclusive staff discount

Title: UX/UI Designer- Freelance [Remote]
Description: ABOUT US:  Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.  ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:  When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.  JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below) LOCATION: Remote - Europe only (Time Zone: GMT/WET | Partial overlap) HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $38-$49/hr ESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Short term EXPERIENCE: 5-10 years BRAINTRUST JOB ID: 7950   THE OPPORTUNITY  Requirements  Length of the project: max 8 weeks or 150 hours, whichever is sooner.  Responsibilities:  Conduct discovery phase research to understand EDAA, our current interactions module (Portal), User Personas, and partner with the Head of Product in developing requirements for the redesign. Develop detailed product flows, user journeys, and information architecture. Create low-fidelity wireframes in line with the defined product flows and user journeys. Establish a design system, including a library of reusable components, color palettes, typography, and other design elements. Produce high-fidelity mockups of each screen for both desktop and mobile web browsing. Collaborate closely with our Product Management and Engineering teams to ensure design consistency and quality throughout development. Participate in user testing and feedback sessions, and iterate designs based on user feedback and data. Prepare and deliver presentations to various stakeholders, explaining design choices and gathering feedback.   Requirements:  5+ years of experience as a Product Designer, with a strong portfolio showcasing your UI/UX skills. Proven experience designing SaaS Enterprise products with complex tenancy structure and customizable workflows. Exceptional skills in design software, such as Figma or Adobe XD. Experience in creating both low and high-fidelity wireframes and prototypes. Strong understanding of design systems and able to create a comprehensive library of design components. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to clearly articulate design decisions to stakeholders and team members. Familiarity with Agile development methodologies. Degree in Design or a related field, or equivalent practical experience is preferred.   What You’ll Be Working On  What does the ideal candidate look like?  The ideal candidates should be used to startup environments where they are accountable for their work, used to working autonomously, and also to collaborate with others when needed. Creativity and curiosity are very important too because the person will need to figure things out and seek answers and the root of any issues to make sure they deliver what's expected. Ask the right questions and flag any issues in advance with a solution in mind! Communication skills and spirit to building cross-area relations are critical. They should be more comfortable with a "making sense out of chaos" type of environment than having everything sorted out. Should be an entrepreneurial spirit excited about building something powerful and going the extra mile to get there. Willing to learn and grow, receive and provide feedback and have an open mind in terms of cultures. Willingness to drive the company's growth!   Apply Now!  C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.  Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

Title: Analista Funcional
Description: Estamos buscando un Analista Funcional / Data Engineer altamente motivado para unirse a nuestro equipo. El candidato ideal será responsable de diseñar, construir y mantener nuestra infraestructura de datos, así como de desarrollar cuadros de mando y soluciones innovadoras para la gestión de grandes volúmenes de datos relativos a la gestión de activos inmobiliarios.     Estudios mínimos     Grado, diplomatura, licenciatura o ingeniería, preferiblemente en áreas técnicas (Informática, Física, Matemáticas, etc.)     Responsabilidades:     Diseñar y construir pipelines de datos eficientes y escalables. Desarrollar y mantener sistemas de ETL y bases de datos. Integrar sistemas de diferentes clientes para la explotación de los datos. Trabajar con equipos interdisciplinarios para integrar datos de diferentes fuentes. Optimizar el rendimiento y la disponibilidad de la infraestructura de datos. Desarrollar cuadros de mando que se ajusten a las necesidades de negocio y de dirección. Ayudarnos a construir nuestra Oficina del Dato.     Emais es una empresa de base tecnológica y de ámbito nacional con importantes clientes del sector bancario e inmobiliario. Necesitamos gente comprometida que venga a reforzar nuestro equipo y nos ayude a continuar creciendo y evolucionando nuestro producto, Tailor. https://www.emais.es/tailor/     Nuestra aplicación es compleja, es importante que te guste resolver retos, tanto tecnológicos como de negocio; a tu lado encontrarás un equipo estable de personas con experiencia en innovación, en el desarrollo de producto y en el uso de diferentes tecnologías.     Aunque nos gusta vernos en persona, entendemos nuestro trabajo como remoto por lo que no es necesario que residas en A Coruñ, Madrid o Barcelona (donde actualmente tenemos oficinas), podrás hacerlo en modalidad 100% remota.     Requisitos:     Requisitos mínimos     3 Imprescindible al menos 3 años de experiencia en el levantamiento de procesos Imprescindible al menos 3 años de experiencia en la toma de requerimientos con cliente (interno o externo) y elaboración de pruebas funcionales y de UAT. Imprescindible al menos 2 años de experiencia en la elaboración de documentación técnica con UML Elaboración de presupuestos y estimación de esfuerzos Conocimientos de SQL Experiencia en entornos bancarios, inmobiliarias, aseguradoras, administración pública o gran empresa. Habilidades de comunicación y trabajo en equipo.     Valorable     Participación en equipos de desarrollo de producto Utilización de Cucumber para la automatización de pruebas Experiencia en el modelado mediante notación BPMN Experiencia en la definición de KPI, monitorización y seguimiento

Title: Teleoperador/a 30h (TELETRABAJO)
Description: ¡En Konecta, el talento marca la diferencia y sabemos que los grandes profesionales, hacen grandes compañías!  Gracias a nuestro equipo, cada vez son más las empresas que confían en nosotros para que podamos brindarles la mejor experiencia en cada interacción y en cada punto de contacto con sus clientes.  Por ese motivo, ampliamos nuestra plantilla de teleoperadores/as en Tarragona en modalidad de TELETRABAJO(hay que recoger el equipo en nuestra sede de Barcelona y, ¡te estamos buscando!  En cuanto el proceso de selección finalice, te brindaremos una completa formación tras la cual, día a día, irás creciendo personal y profesionalmente, siendo parte importante de mantenernos como empresa líder del sector del contact center.  Para Konectar con el puesto y conseguir desarrollar tu máximo potencial, nos gustaría que contases con:  Capacidad de aprendizaje Resiliencia Escucha activa Empatía Comunicación Orientación al logro   ¿Qué necesitamos de nuestro nuevo talento K?  Disponibilidad para formación desde el 22/08/ al 29/08 en horario de 09:00 a 15:00 Disponibilidad para trabajar de lunes a viernes en horario de 16 a 22h (se trabaja 1 ó 2 sábados máximo al mes) Contratación con inicio el 31/08/23   ¿Qué ofrecemos a nuestro nuevo talentoK? Requisitos:  Capacidad de aprendizaje Resiliencia Escucha activa Empatía Comunicación Orientación al logro

Title: UI Designer
Description: Hola 👋     En Multiplica Talent te buscamos: somos una consultora de recursos humanos enfocada en la captación del mejor talento digital. Title: Assistant Controller
Description: About Chyron     Chyron is a global leader in products, services, and solutions for professional broadcast. As part of the Chyron team, you will be working with products that create content viewed by billions every day. We serve live television, news, and sports production, as well as other markets such as corporate, government, house of worship, esports and education. We offer the industry leading PRIME Live Platform, encompassing broadcast grade graphics, branding, augmented reality, video and audio mixing and more. Privately held, Chyron is headquartered in Melville, New York. Chyron also has offices in the Czech Republic, Denmark, Finland, Germany, Mexico, the Netherlands, Norway, Singapore, Slovak Republic, Sweden, and the United Kingdom.     Responsibilities     Lead, develop, and mentor a group of 5 to 7 senior accountants, staff accountants, and accounting specialists with the help of an Accounting Manager Close the books in three business days each month in compliance with US GAAP. Key areas of responsibility include AR, AP, and Intercompany Fully manage the Accounts Payable processes (bill coding, payment approvals, etc.), and act as an escalation point with the team Fully manage the Accounts Receivable processes (issuing invoices, customer collections), and act as an escalation point with the team Fully manage the Intercompany process (intercompany loans, IP recharges, etc.) and maintain reconciliations to support monthly activity Fully manage the Daily Cash Reconciliation process, and act as an escalation point with the team   Requirements     Mix of Private and Public accounting experience preferred 4-8 years of relevant work experience Ability to take initiative and be accountable for running multiple processes to conclusion Excellent communication skills including the ability to synthesize and see the big picture Ability to juggle more than one project at a time and work in a fast-paced environment Dedicated, upbeat, and tactful personality with a cheerful, team-oriented demeanor Must seize advantageous changes that will help the business Working knowledge of EU accounting/compliance Proficient in Microsoft Excel and experience with NetSuite a plus   For more information on Chyron, visit www.chyron.com     No solicitations from recruitment firms please.
Industry: Transporte, logística, cadena de suministro y almacenamiento y Publicaciones en línea

Title: Project Leader React BANCA - Teletrabajo
Description: ¡Únete a nuestro equipo como Project Leader en el campo de BANCA! En Krell-consulting, una empresa líder en consultoría y desarrollo de software, buscamos profesionales ambiciosos y talentosos con experiencia en gestión de proyectos. Si te apasiona liderar equipos y trabajar en proyectos relacionados con BANCA, ¡esta es tu oportunidad!     Descripción del puesto     Estamos buscando un Project Leader con un mínimo de 3 años de experiencia en la industria, capaz de liderar equipos y gestionar proyectos en el sector BANCA. En esta posición, serás responsable de dirigir y coordinar el desarrollo de proyectos, garantizando la calidad, el cumplimiento de plazos y los objetivos establecidos.     Responsabilidades principales:     🔹 Supervisar y liderar equipos de desarrollo, asegurando la cooperación y el máximo rendimiento.     🔹 Planificar, organizar y gestionar recursos para cumplir con los objetivos de los proyectos.     🔹 Colaborar estrechamente con el cliente para comprender sus necesidades y brindar soluciones eficientes y efectivas.     🔹 Realizar un seguimiento del avance del proyecto, gestionar riesgos y resolver posibles problemas.     🔹 Garantizar la calidad del software y la implementación adecuada de las funcionalidades requeridas.     🔹 Reportar de manera regular el progreso del proyecto al equipo directivo y a los stakeholders.     Requisitos del puesto:     🔸 Experiencia mínima de 3 años como Project Leader o en roles similares en la industria de la BANCA.     🔸 Conocimiento y experiencia con tecnologías relacionadas con BANCA, como REACT.     🔸 Conocimiento experto en herramientas de gestión de proyectos y metodologías ágiles.     🔸 Fuertes habilidades de liderazgo y capacidad para motivar y gestionar equipos de manera efectiva.     🔸 Excelentes habilidades de comunicación, tanto en español como en inglés.     🔸 Orientación a resultados y habilidad para trabajar bajo presión.     Ofrecemos:     🌟 Oportunidad de trabajar en proyectos desafiantes con clientes de renombre en el sector BANCA.     🌟 Ambiente de trabajo dinámico y motivador, con un enfoque en el crecimiento profesional y personal.     🌟 Formación continua y oportunidades de desarrollo para expandir tus habilidades y conocimientos.     🌟 Salario competitivo acorde con tu experiencia y habilidades.

Title: Director/Jefe de Equipo IT (m/f/d)
Description: ¡Únete a nuestro equipo como director/a de planta!     Somos una empresa de servicios de TI con más de 35 años de experiencia en el mercado     alemán y 5 años en Hungría. Nuestros servicios son principalmente soluciones y servicios     individuales con los que trabajamos en proyectos para nuestros clientes en Alemania y a     nivel internacional.     Estamos buscando a alguien que nos ayude a formar un equipo en     España. Este puesto es perfecto para directores de proyectos con experiencia y jóvenes     líderes que quieren crecer con nosotros.     Como director/a de planta tendrás la oportunidad de liderar y desarrollar un equipo en     España. Serás responsable de la gestión de proyectos la supervisión del personal y la     coordinación con otros departamentos. Además tendrás la oportunidad de trabajar en un     ambiente internacional y colaborar con otros equipos en Europa.     Nuestra cultura de trabajo es híbrida significa que puedes trabajar desde cualquier lugar. La     formación tiene lugar en nuestra oficina en Alemania. Después te ofrecemos la posibilidad     de trabajar al 100 de forma remota desde España. Estaríamos encantados si nos visitas de     vez en cuando en nuestra oficina en Braunschweig.     Si eres una persona con ganas de trabajar en un ambiente internacional y quieres enriquecer     nuestra cultura corporativa ¡Únete a nosotros y ayúdanos a formar un equipo exitoso en     España!     Aparte de alemán hablamos mucho inglés en BREDEX pero no te preocupes si no eres un     hablante nativo ¡nosotros tampoco lo somos! Además ofrecemos cursos de inglés para     mejorar tus conocimientos y también tienes la posibilidad de aprender alemán.     Descripción     Support in site development in Spain     Recruiting and team building     Management and coordination tasks     Project management and controlling     Para ello ¿Qué vas a necesitar?     Experience in the field of IT services     Leadership experience as project manager department manager or managing     director     Willingness to shape the organisation and ability to make decisions     Interest in taking on responsibility     Customer and employee orientation     Good organisational skills     Fluent english skills and the willingnless to learn german     ¿Qué te ofrecemos?     The option to work full-time remotely flexible working time models without     core working hours     Individual professional and personal development paths as well as continuous     education through the internal BREDEX Academy and external seminars     workshops and conferences     Co-design and plenty of room for your own ideas and suggestions     Mentoring and buddy program from the first day     Value-oriented and sustainable corporate culture     You are welcome to visit us in Brunswick regulary. Where you have the     opportunity to participate in game nights sport programs or barbecues with your     colleagues.     We value diversity and therefore welcome all applications - regardless of gender nationality     ethnic and social origin religion/belief disability age and sexual orientation and identity.
