Title: B2B Content Specialist
Description: You'll be responsible for creating videos, producing written content, and leveraging your video editing skills to enhance the visual appeal of our client's materials. Your contributions will drive engagement and promote our brand's presence across platforms like Instagram, Reels, TikTok, and LinkedIn.  Key Responsibilities:  Collaborate with the marketing team to develop and execute B2B content strategies that align with our brand and business objectives. Edit videos using various editing software to create visually appealing and engaging content. Craft well-written, insightful, and compelling copy for various platforms, maintaining a consistent brand voice and tone. Develop, produce, and publish videos and written content across social media platforms, including Instagram, Reels, TikTok, and LinkedIn. Monitor and analyze the performance of content using analytics tools and provide recommendations for continuous improvement. Stay up-to-date with industry trends, social media developments, and emerging platforms to ensure our content remains fresh and relevant. Collaborate with designers, photographers, and other team members to create multimedia content communicating our key messages. Work closely with subject matter experts to gather information and insights for content creation. Manage content calendars, ensuring timely delivery and optimal engagement with the target audience. Assist in brainstorming and developing innovative ideas for content campaigns and initiatives.   Qualifications:  Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, Journalism, or a related field preferred. A minimum of 2 years of experience in content creation, preferably in a B2B environment. Proficiency in video editing using various software (e.g., Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, etc.). Exceptional writing and editing skills, with a keen eye for detail and grammar. Demonstrated experience in managing and growing social media platforms, including Instagram, Reels, TikTok, and LinkedIn. Strong understanding of B2B marketing strategies and content trends. Creative thinker with the ability to develop unique and engaging content concepts. Strong organizational skills, ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, and meet deadlines. Knowledge of SEO best practices and how they apply to content creation. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across teams. A plus is a basic knowledge of design principles and an eye for visual aesthetics.   Benefits:  Competitive salary and benefits package. Opportunity to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. Chance to contribute to the growth and success of a forward-thinking B2B company. Access to professional development and growth opportunities.

Title: Engineering Manager (Producto, Agile) Remoto(*)
Description: En BETWEEN apostamos por el mejor talento dentro del sector tecnológico. Nos involucramos en una gran variedad de proyectos punteros, trabajando con las últimas tecnologías. Actualmente en BETWEEN contamos con un equipo de más de 800 personas.  Trabajamos en ámbitos como BI, IoT, Big Data e I+D. En el área de Operaciones implantamos proyectos de Service Desk, Infraestructuras IT y proyectos Cloud, entre otros.  Actualmente seleccionamos un/a Engineering Manager para incorporarse de forma indefinida en uno de los equipos de I+D que Between tiene implantados en uno de nuestros principales clientes.  La persona seleccionada liderará los equipos de ingeniería de un nuevo producto de e-commerce que está muy cerca de su primer lanzamiento  ¿Qué haré? Estas serán tus funciones principales:  Entrega de valor y planificación. Asegurar la entrega de valor a los clientes. Cuando sea necesario, gestionar dependencias, riesgos y bloqueos del equipo. Responsable de la salud del equipo, de mantener una cultura de mejora continua y de velar por el crecimiento de los miembros del equipo. Ciclo de desarrollo, evolución de equipos y sistemas . Liderar y optimizar el ciclo de vida de desarrollo. Definir la estructura de los equipos, liderar los procesos de selección y onboarding. Preocupación por la excelencia operacional de tus sistemas y su rendimiento en producción. Identificar y liderar mejoras de calidad en las áreas que lo necesiten. Liderar la estrategia de comunicación del equipo, interna y con otros equipos: OKRs, performance, roadmap, KPIs, Costes.   Además, trabajando para BETWEEN obtendrás los siguientes beneficios añadidos:  Seguro médico incluido por ser Betweener Posibilidad de formar parte de una empresa en pleno crecimiento a nivel nacional e internacional. Un buen lugar donde trabajar: cuidamos de nuestro equipo y la sociedad a través de iniciativas, programas de conciliación y de responsabilidad social corporativa Te integrarás en un equipo de alto rendimiento y con un alto grado de especialización. Dispondrás de oportunidades de formación y desarrollo profesional Pondremos a tu disposición un amplio abanico de retos y proyectos acordes con tus objetivos personales y profesionales. Posibilidad de elegir cómo obtener parte de tu salario gracias a las ventajas fiscales de nuestra Retribución Flexible, y descuentos para acceder a centros de fitness, entre otros En BETWEEN, la igualdad de oportunidades es uno de nuestros valores. Nuestro compromiso es contratar al mejor talentos independientemente de su raza, religión, sexo, edad y personas con otras capacidades y promover su desarrollo profesional y personal.   Requisitos:  Imprescindible:  Más de 3 años de experiencia liderando equipos de ingeniería. Experiencia colaborando con product managers en el desarrollo de productos de software. Pasión por hacer crecer a los miembros del equipo y desarrollar su talento. Experiencia desarrollando y diseñando sistemas distribuidos y escalables. Conocimiento de buenas prácticas en ingeniería de software a lo largo de todo el ciclo de desarrollo: coding standards, code reviews, CI/CD, testing y operación de servicios en producción. Foco en excelencia operacional. Equilibrio entre entrega de soluciones innovadoras para nuestros clientes y construir sistemas de calidad y altamente resilientes.
Function: Gestión y Tecnología de la información

Title: Senior Water Advisor - Remote
Description: Do you want to contribute to solving one of the most important issues of our generation? Join us in accelerating the transition to a water-secure world.  Waterplan is a fast-growing startup in the Climate Tech space that develops the world's leading B2B Enterprise SaaS platform for companies to measure, respond, report, and monitor companies' increasingly changing water risk. You can find more info by watching this World Economic Forum post.  By showing companies the business case for mitigating water risk, Waterplan accelerates the transition to a world where companies are incentivized to save more water, abate the discharge of polluting effluents, contribute to long-term sustainability of water resources, and preserve shared value.  To help fulfill this mission, we are looking for a Senior Water Advisor focused on nature-based solutions (NbS) to join the Customer Success team at Waterplan. In this role, you will collaborate with customers, partners, and internal teams to define and quantify NbS impact based on your experience in hydrology and ecology.  You will work in a fully remote distributed team across multiple disciplines at a science-oriented company. At Waterplan, you will have the chance to work at the forefront of our industry and with world-leading water and sustainability experts.  We are a dedicated and talented team with ambitious growth goals planned for the next few years. If you are interested in the Climate Tech space and in growing the Climate Water Resilience category, you have an entrepreneurial spirit and a lot of drive; we want to get to know you!  Responsibilities  Own the quality, accuracy, clarity, and timeliness of deliverables to clients. Provide direction and focus to the research needed to meet these objectives. Participate along the customer journey as a water subject matter expert and deliver Waterplan’s value proposition. Deliver insights and recommendations to our customers through different actions according to their use case and purchase driver. Collaborate with internal stakeholders (Customer Success, Water Advisor peers, Science, Sales) as a subject matter expert - on industry, region, or use case - to help our clients achieve their goals and delight them. Actively contribute and provide feedback to the Product team to improve and expand our product(s) and services. Build internal expertise through formal and informal training. Proactively research and share trends and developments in industry, policy, news, etc. both within the organization and externally.   Skills And Qualifications  Outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal, and comfortable presenting clearly and concisely to C-suite/VPs/Directors. Proactive and hands-on with a collaborative and iterative continuous improvement mindset and approach. Highly organized with the ability to self-train and manage own time and deliverables effectively. Ability with Google Suite (spreadsheets, presentations, etc.). Experience working in a consulting or technical advisory capacity. Degree (Masters preferred) in a water-related science or engineering discipline. Technical expertise in one or more (several preferred) of the following areas: water resources management; nature-based solutions and VWB accounting; ecology and biodiversity; GIS and remote sensing systems; and multi-stakeholder engagement.   At Waterplan you'll enjoy:  Our Team. We are convinced our team is our most valuable asset. At Waterplan you will have the chance to work at the forefront of our industry and you will be working with world-leading experts in water Our Spirit. We are building something big, you will be part of an ambitious and impactful project as we are trying to achieve one of the major world's sustainable development goals Our Culture. We are a fully remote company with unlimited PTO Our Values. Think Long-Term, Iterative Excellence, Thoughtful Discussion, Make Others Successful
Industry: Servicios de TI y consultoría de TI

Title: Director Global HR Operations - remote possible
Description: Help us bring people and businesses together     Our SaaS platform enables multi-location brands and businesses to boost their online presence. From big to small, from Adidas to ZenPark, our client base contains some of your favourite brands as well, we bet.     The Past, Present & Future     The Past: Uberall was founded in 2013 by David Federhen and Florian Hübner, two longtime friends with a vision to improve customer experience across the online and offline worlds. They created a platform that connected companies with local customers in the digital-first moment.     The Present: We're on a mission to empower businesses to thrive locally, and believe every business deserves success, regardless of size or location. Simply put, our location marketing platform exists to help our customers get found online and connect with customers through search, discovery, engagement, and conversion.     The Future: We're a fast-growing company with a bright future, and our journey to become the global leader in location marketing is well underway. We have a passionate and diverse team, a comprehensive, intuitive platform, and a clear vision for the future. We're looking for talented and passionate people (like you 👋) to join us on our journey.     You and us     We are approaching 400 Uberallers, with 50+ different nationalities, who live and breathe our three core values:     🌵 GROW TOGETHER     ⛰ DEMONSTRATE PASSION & PERFORMANCE     ✊ BE BOLD & DRIVE CHANGE     So, what are you waiting for? If you're passionate, driven, and ready to be bold, we want you on our team! Apply now and let's grow together.🚀     About the role:     You are a key player in our Uberall People & Culture team, turning our people-first strategy into reality on a daily basis. You make a direct impact on evolving our amazing company culture.     You run a small, global, and professional team that is passionate about Uberallers. As the leader of Uberall’s global People Operations team your work is crucial in ensuring that our 400+ Uberallers across 30 countries can be productive day by day - you and your team provide relevant people services, support, and tools in a compelling and compliant way. Not only that - the foundations you set also help Uberall grow for the future.     Also, you will be part of the Global People & Culture leadership team and be reporting directly to the Chief People Officer.     What you’ll be responsible for:     Define, implement and continuously evolve the full range of Uberall’s employment-related policies & processes in a people-centric way, ensuring we offer a compelling and compliant people experience for Uberallers and are an employer of choice for our candidates Build and continuously develop a high-performing team of HR operations professionals around the globe with strong drive and commitment to running excellent global HR operations in a fast-paced environment Drive excellence by taking care of the day-to-day and the details in all things employment: Your team is responsible for the employee lifecycle all the way from onboarding to offboarding, including preparing necessary documents in accordance with local labor law requirements Plan and execute our ‘annual clock’ of people processes regarding performance, compensation & benefits (even outside of a standard compensation structure), development, and engagement Ensure that Uberall maintains accurate and accessible employee data and records and has a powerful toolset (HRIS etc.) that Uberallers love using Ensure we run efficient payroll and compelling benefits processes by collaborating effectively with our partners Maintain and evolve partnerships with our EOR provider thus bringing to life Uberall’s flexible ways of working, global mobility, and hybrid work culture Handle any employment relations matters professionally, swiftly, and in strong collaboration with our legal partners Collaborate effectively with other people-centered teams (Talent Acquisition, HRBPs, L&D, Culture, etc.) and stakeholders (Finance, IT, Legal, etc.) to keep shaping powerful moments along the employee journey     You’d be a great fit if you are:     A true professional Integrity - You deeply value professionalism and compliance and know how to apply these principles in a constructive way with business stakeholders HR generalist - You know the nuts and bolts of HRM, are likely certified and have spent about 8+ years leading a people operations team in a global growth environment, ideally in a scaleup or global organization Applied labor law - You have in-depth knowledge and experience of applied German labor law and/or are versed in working with employment matters across global geographies, in particular, North America and EMEA (e.g. US, UK, France, Netherlands, Spain) Compensation & benefits - You have the ability to understand the importance of such a strategy and execute it from global to local People advocate Implements people first culture - You understand how to turn policies and processes into a compelling experience for Uberallers Emotional intelligence - You are able to relate to people from a range of backgrounds and are a whizz at conflict resolution Diversity & Inclusion - You love working across cultures and timezones in a hybrid work environment Excellent operator Proactive - you foresee issues before they arise and continuously work to ensure conflicts or disengagement does not happen Maintain accountability - You possess strong ownership and drive, you make things happen and push to finish what you started You are results- not task-focused - You know how to prioritize, and you drive momentum both individually and in a team environment Continuous improvement & innovation - You care about the quality implementation and delivery, and constantly look for ways to improve and evolve what we do High-performing team creator Performance - You set targets, provide constructive and frequent feedback, and are great at managing expectations up, down, and across the organization Present & available - You are service-minded and enjoy being in the front line working directly with Uberallers Stakeholder management - You educate and coach leaders and stakeholders in alignment with organizational goals Stellar communication skills - You maintain clarity, transparency, and simplicity in how you communicate at all levels of the organization     What we offer:     💜 A mission with meaning and purpose At Uberall, we foster genuine connections between local businesses and people. Our diverse team allows us to win together with our partners, co-workers, and customers. Speaking of our customers, they’re some of the most recognizable businesses in the world.     😁 A truly human culture We’re famous for our culture. Uberallers live by our values of mutual respect and boldness. We’re open, collaborative risk-takers with a whole lot of passion and grit.     🤸🏽‍♀️ Flexibility to fit your lifestyle Want to come to an office for collaboration? We’ve got space for you in Berlin, Amsterdam, Detroit, and London. Prefer to work remotely? Fine by us! Bonus points if we meet your pets in a video call. If working from another country is legally possible for you and within a reasonable time zone, we happily support work-ations.     💸 A piece of the pie Our pay & perks are competitive, and you better believe we review them on the regular to make sure they stay that way. We grow together, so of course all Uberallers are part of our long-term incentive program through VSOP/ESOP.     ♺ Emotional and intellectual connection Events and alignment sessions - YES and YES. With the team, cross-functions, regional, you name it - we love bringing people together. Uberallers share a LOT of hobbies. Whatever you’re into – reading books, baking, heavy metal, fostering kittens . . . you’ll find kindred spirits on our team.     🧘 Health and Wellness We prioritize your wellness with generous holiday time, paid parental and circumstantial leave, and individualized health and wellness opportunities depending on your location.     ⭐️ All-access pass Get immersed in Uberall from day one. Your onboarding is packed with a deep dive into our values, insights into all our departments, and a chance to ask the CEO anything. We come together monthly for our town hall and product showroom so you’re always in the know.     🌵 Everyday growth We support you on your non-stop learning journey. We offer development dialogues, live workshops on topics like resilience and feedback, and a Leadership Academy to make sure our leaders have all the tools to bring out the very best in teams. Need to improve your language skills? We have German and business English classes, and virtual coffee chats in 7 different languages.     🖥 Top-of-the-line tech MacBook Pro, magic mouse, 2nd screen . . . Need anything else? Let the People & Culture team know.     Remember our "Grow Together" value from the beginning of the ad?     We mean it.     🌵🏔✊     Everything starts with getting in touch. The best way to express your interest is by applying online. We will be carefully reading your profile and can't wait to hear from you.     In the meantime, let our " life@uberall " social accounts give you some real-life impressions.     👥 Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging:     At Uberall, we believe inclusion unlocks the potential of diversity. It’s right there in our number one core value – Grow Together. Sure, we’re approaching 400 unique people with over 50 nationalities working in 30 different countries, but we’re all Uberallers. That means we’re collaborative, open-minded, and assume positive intent in everything we do. We don’t judge, and we don’t exclude.     Our flexible ways of working are designed to make sure each and every Uberaller belongs and thrives, no matter their background, abilities, or lifestyle. We don’t just think inclusion makes us stronger, we KNOW it.

Title: Project Resource Manager (Digital Solutions)
Description: Top 3 Reasons To Join Us     Competitive Salary 100% Remote Working with a diverse team across the globe     About Us     At CoverGo, our mission is to empower all insurance companies to make insurance 100% digital and accessible to everyone.     We are a leading global no-code insurance platform for health, life, and P&C We’re the winner of the Insurtech of the Year in all of Asia and other awards globally We work with insurance enterprise clients such as AXA, Bupa, MSIG, Dai-ichi, Bank of China Group Insurance, and many more We're an international, diverse team of over 120 people with 30 nationalities and team members working remotely from all over the world We are fully funded and backed by reputable VC funds and strategic institutional investors We have offices in the US, Singapore, Hong Kong, UAE and Vietnam We’ve grown our annualized revenue by over 30x since January 2021 We’re constantly working towards making CoverGo a workplace that you love coming to. We deeply believe that bringing together a diversity of thoughts, expressions, and perspectives is key to building the best culture for equally diverse communities all over the world     What You Will Do     Assigning available staff to projects based on their skills and experience, project needs and priorities set by the delivery leadership Evaluating hiring needs in accordance with upcoming projects and project budgets Providing project managers with ongoing resource management and related support Monitoring and analysis of employee utilisation, workload, overtime hours and other key metrics Mitigating resource concerns by reallocating resources, adjusting goals, or assigning additional staff Collaborating on resource management with other internal departments Maintain a database of current and potential technical staff and their skills and expertise Work with senior management to develop and implement policies and procedures regarding resource management, including staff utilisation rates, forecasting, and budgeting Develop and maintain relationships with outside technical vendors and service providers to supplement our in-house staff resources Create metrics and reporting for our resources Keeping informed on current trends in resource management     What We Need     Bachelor's degree in Business, Operations, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field Minimum 8 years of overall experience, majority of which are doing resource management, preferably in B2B SaaS or enterprise software industry Experience in resourcing for large-scale software implementations and client deliveries, preferably hands-on project management experience Strong project, resource management and budgeting skills Proficient in using resource management software, CRM, analytical tools, and project management software (e.g., JIRA, Meisterplan, Trello) Knowledgeable of current technology market and economic trends Understanding of the software development lifecycle, SaaS and IT project implementation Familiarity with financial and market analysis and reporting Knowledgeable in hiring, onboarding, and training processes Resource Management Certified Professional (RMCP) is a plus!     Management And Interpersonal Skills You Should Have     Strong communication and interpersonal skills Ability to work well as part of a team and to collaborate with others Demonstrated strategic thinking with outstanding negotiation, delegating, and appointment skills Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously in a fast-paced environment under tight deadlines Strong organisational, analytical, and problem-solving skills Data-driven approach to make objective decisions Flexibility, quick decision-making skills, and ability to adapt to change Proven people management and coaching skills Excellent time-management and presentation skills     Why You'll Love Working Here     Full-remote employment, work from anywhere and/or from one of our physical offices in Vietnam, Singapore or Hong Kong occasionally Local time zone office hours, work by your schedule Paid annual leaves Employee stock options Performance bonus Company activities & team offsites to exotic locations Training and development plan     CoverGo Company Video
Function: Gestión y Tecnología de la información

Title: Sales Director
Description: Amagi helps bring entertainment to hundreds of millions of consumers leading the transformation in media consumption. We believe in a connected ecosystem bringing content owners, distribution platforms, consumers and advertisers together to create great experiences.     Amagi supports 500+ content brands, 800+ playout chains and over 2,000 channel deliveries on its platform in over 40 countries and the largest SaaS provider in FAST (Free Ad-supported Streaming TV) cloud broadcast markets. We have been growing at more than 100% year-on-year with 25+ Bn CTV ad impressions and are looking for a business development leader that will accelerate our growth journey. We are a hyper-growth Series F tech startup with 1000+ employees across US, Europe and Asia.     JOB SUMMARY  We are seeking a highly motivated and dynamic Director of Sales to support our sales efforts. As the Director of Sales, you will be responsible for driving revenue growth by developing and executing strategic sales plans and building strong relationships with key customers and partners. Your primary focus will be to increase sales of Amagi’s TV-media focused technology and managed services in the UK, as a primary focus market, and few additional EU countries as  secondary markets. The role will focus on broadcast TV and /or streaming TV verticals.     This is a hands-on sales role. The role will require you to actively work with individual customers to understand customer business objectives, customer requirements, and pain points and orchestrate the value that Amagi can bring to the customer.     KEY RESPONSIBILITIES  Build, own and execute a sales plan for the region Manage sales cycle from lead generation to deal closure Account management for existing clients You will excel at this role, if You have a good technical understanding, ideally with a background in software and technology You have loads of passion, self-drive and entrepreneurial attitude You are insanely driven and ambitious – have always exceeded your targets You are willing to go the extra mile to drive sales You are willing to do whatever it takes to make the company succeed You have extensive experience navigating complex organizations and closing sales You have great communication skills – customers love you You are an excellent team player – putting the needs of the team before yours     JOB REQUIREMENTS  At least 7 years of experience with selling technology/content / services in one or more of the following: Broadcast TV ecosystem Streaming TV ecosystem Cloud-based or SaaS / IaaS / PaaS products Proven record of exceeding goals

Title: B2B Content Creator
Description: Our client is seeking a creative and talented B2B Content Creator to join their team. With a minimum of 2 years of experience, you will play a vital role in crafting engaging and informative content that resonates with our B2B audience. Your knack for video editing and passion for writing will be pivotal in creating compelling content for various platforms.  Key Responsibilities:  Dynamic Video Editing: Use your editing skills to create captivating and professional videos that effectively convey our B2B messaging. Craft videos that resonate with our target audience and engage them on platforms like Instagram, Reels, and TikTok. Compelling Content Creation: Leverage your passion for writing to produce engaging written content that complements our videos. Craft thought-provoking captions, descriptions, and posts that resonate with our B2B audience. Platform Diversity: Create and post content across multiple platforms, including Instagram, Reels, TikTok, and LinkedIn. Tailor your content strategy to each platform's unique audience and requirements. B2B Focus: Understand our B2B audience's needs and preferences and curate content that addresses their pain points, provides valuable insights, and showcases our expertise. Collaborative Engagement: Collaborate with our marketing and creative teams to ensure alignment with our brand's messaging and strategy. Work closely with team members to brainstorm ideas, plan content calendars, and execute campaigns.   Required Skillsets:  Video Editing Proficiency: Demonstrated experience editing videos using various video editing software. Writing Passion: A genuine interest in writing and crafting compelling content that aligns with our B2B messaging. Creativity: A creative mindset that can generate innovative content ideas and storytelling approaches. Attention to Detail: Meticulousness in video editing, content creation, and quality control. Digital Fluency: Familiarity with social media platforms, trends, and best practices for B2B content creation.   Preferred Qualifications:  Portfolio: A portfolio showcasing your video editing skills and written content samples. B2B Experience: Experience creating B2B-focused content and understanding the unique needs and preferences of a B2B audience.

Title: Senior Sales Executive - Spain
Description: Goodays (formerly Critizr) is Europe's leading Customer Experience Management Platform. Founded in 2012, our vision is to make commerce better for everyone - for merchants and customers. We want to help everyone deliver more human and personal customer experiences every day.     Our mission is to bring our customers’ entire companies together around a single goal: the customer. We provide a highly adopted Customer Experience Management platform that makes it easier to deliver more human and personal customer experiences at scale.     Our technology is used in 25 countries by over 150 of Europe's biggest companies, including Carrefour, Domino's, Credit Agricole, New Look, Leroy Merlin and Rexel. We are present in more than 70,000 business locations and give the entire organization, from C-suite to frontline, CX and insights teams the tools they need to bring value to the company and the customer.     In our energetic Sales&Marketing team, we have sales executives who are dedicated to maximizing the value of our products and our loyal customer base, targeting new logos and services for our customers, while also driving revenue growth for our company. Our cutting-edge product ensures customer satisfaction and nearly zero churns. The Sales&Marketing teams working with Sales Operations & Product teams identify new opportunities and ensure that our customers are receiving the best possible value from our offerings. You'll be the ultimate escalation point.     Responsibilities     What will your main responsibilities be?     Develop a client portfolio: You will be responsible for creating and developing a portfolio of “strategic clients” for Goodays in Spain. Define strategy: You will define the strategy around these accounts to reach and exceed our sales targets. Close deals: You will be asked to drive the sales cycle all the way through to closing the contract. Generate leads: You will be expected to leverage your network to bring in qualified leads and thereby accelerate the sales pipeline. Serve as liaison: You will oversee reliable reporting of sales activity reporting directly to the VP of Sales.     Desired Education & Experience     You have a master’s in business or equivalent experience. You have a minimum of 8 years’ experience selling software solutions (SaaS) and developing large accounts. You master complex sales methodologies such as SPIN, Strategic Selling, Target Account Selling or Challenger Sales. Your professional journey and success demonstrates that you are a sales superstar dealing with Large Enterprise business You have a solid experience of value selling to businesses A solid knowledge of the retail sector in the Iberia area is a plus Spanish native speaker, English proficiency     Other Requirements     Growth mindset, with whatever it takes and learner spirit. Flexibility and understanding of the culture of a fast-paced, commercially oriented technology company. Highly responsive and service-oriented attitude, accustomed to working in an international environment, action-driven. Hands-on project management experience, including the ability to organize, prioritize, and manage deadlines. Ability to maintain strong working relationships Collaborative team player combined with the ability to work independently. Sound and practical business judgment.     What Goodays Offers You     A front-row seat with a company that is changing the way multiple industries do business, thanks to a best-in-class product and exponential growth A great and diverse team of professionals who are talented, fun, supportive, open, communicative and who you can learn from and share with Fun and challenging working environment with significant opportunities for career growth and development (Did you know we’re ranked in top 100 of EU tech start-ups?) An international environment Attractive salary package including excellent pension, health insurance and life insurance Open and inclusive working environment including flexible hours and parent-friendly options

Title: Nutrition Specialist at GoPrimal
Description: GoPrimal, a company based in Vienna, Austria, is seeking a Nutrition Specialist to join their team. As a company focused on addressing micronutrient deficiencies in modern life, GoPrimal is dedicated to improving the longevity of all athletes, from amateurs to professionals. The ideal candidate will have a passion for nutrition and a strong understanding of how it impacts athletic performance. Responsibilities include developing and implementing nutrition plans, conducting research, and providing guidance to clients. The Nutrition Specialist will work closely with the GoPrimal team to ensure that all products and services are in line with the company's values and mission. If you are a driven and knowledgeable nutrition professional with a desire to make a positive impact on the lives of athletes, we encourage you to apply.     Tasks     Develop nutrition plans for athletes and individuals based on their specific dietary needs and fitness goals. Educate athletes and individuals on the importance of proper nutrition and how it affects their athletic performance. Stay up-to-date on the latest research and trends in nutrition and apply this knowledge to improve our products. Collaborate with our product development team to ensure that our products meet the nutritional needs of our customers. Provide excellent customer service and support to our athletes and individuals by answering nutrition-related questions and addressing concerns.      Requirements     Bachelor's degree in nutrition or related field Certification as a Registered Dietitian Minimum of 1 year experience in the field of nutrition Strong communication and interpersonal skills Ability to create and implement personalized nutrition plans for clients

Title: Project Manager, Divestiture, Pharmaceutical
Description: The PM consultant is entrusted with the scoping, planning, execution and transition of assigned projects within the Value Chain Management organization of Product Management Office.     Focused on Divestiture, the Project Manager will lead the execution of both Pharm to Pharm and Pharm to Consumer divestitures. Market authorization holder (MAH) transfers will be the primary focus.     Prior experience leading specific projects in these types of projects is the primary qualification for this role.     This role requires a dynamic leader who can collaborate effectively and communicate proactively with cross-functional team members. One that can demonstrate experience in the successful delivery of multiple projects from planning through to closeout. The PM should possess leadership, people management skills have a high level of proficiency and experience in project management. Be highly focused and inner-directed to ensure on-time, high-quality delivery of projects in accordance with defined objectives. Well organized and resourceful and will do what it takes to get the job done on time The Project Manager serves as the primary contact and authority within the Product Management group for assigned projects, and, in collaboration with the Value Chain Leader(s), executes his/her respective projects in-line with business and supply chain strategies and targets to achieve financial and business-related results The Project Manager shall lead specific Divestment projects within the VCM PMO project portfolio     Travel Requirements: No     Core Competencies:     Team Leadership Previous Delisting -Divestment Experience Regulatory Knowledge Complex Project Planning & Team coordination Stakeholder Management Crisis Management Risk Management Problem Solving Financial Management & Budgeting Decision Making Negotiation Excellent communication skills Change Management Experience with Change Controls/Trackwise Experience with Quality Systems Business acumen     Requirements     Required/Preferred:     Experience leading Divestiture projects within the pharmaceutical industry Previous Supply Chain Experience Previous Pharm/OTC/Consumer Experience Project Management Experience MS Project Excel     Benefits     About Endeavor:     At Endeavor Consulting Group, our mission is to provide straightforward solutions to complicated situations. As a specialty project management technology and integration firm, we are laser focused on Operational Systems, Supply Chain Integration, and Product Development for Life Sciences enterprises. Our team is driven, energetic, and passionate about delivering results and earning the trust of our ever-expanding client base.     We are dedicated to building a thriving company culture and a workplace environment that fosters respect, honesty, and creativity. Our goal is to help our clients triumph; to do that, we must remain fiercely committed to ensuring the happiness and fulfillment of our employees. In pursuit of excellence, we look for individuals with a customer-focused approach to problem-solving, a desire to exceed expectations, a philanthropic point of view, a dedication to quality service, and a strong technological background.     We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. We are committed to providing accommodation for employees with disabilities.     This job description does not state or imply that the above are the only duties and responsibilities assigned to this position. Employees holding this position will be required to perform any other job-related duties as requested by Management.     Want to learn more?     Check out our website: Endeavor Consulting Group | Solutions Made Simple Follow us on LinkedIn: Endeavor Consulting Group | LinkedIn Follow us on Twitter: @endeavorcg | Twitter

Title: ESPECIALISTA EN AGENCIA DE VIAJES EN REMOTO
Description: Nuestra agencia de viajes está buscando agentes de viajes amigables y profesionales para unirse a nuestro equipo. Como agente de viajes, debe ser un apasionado de ver el mundo y ayudar a otros a hacer lo mismo. Este rol implica la planificación de vacaciones, la sugerencia de destinos de viaje, el mantenimiento de archivos de clientes y la gestión de eventos a gran escala.     Su objetivo final será mantener a nuestros clientes satisfechos y leales para futuros servicios. La persona ideal será un excelente comunicador con un profundo conocimiento de los destinos turísticos nacionales e internacionales. Para tener éxito en este puesto, también debe poseer excelentes habilidades de negociación y ventas.     FUNCIONES Y RESPONSABILIDADES:     Organizar viajes para clientes de negocios y de vacaciones. Determinar las necesidades y preferencias de los clientes, como horarios y costos. Planificar y organizar paquetes turísticos, excursiones y viajes de un día. Encuentre información sobre tarifas y horarios. Calcular los costos totales de viaje. Realice reservas para viajes, hoteles, coches de alquiler y eventos especiales, como visitas guiadas y excursiones. Informe a los clientes sobre cómo será su viaje, incluidos los detalles sobre los documentos requeridos, como pasaportes o visas. Brindar consejos sobre las condiciones climáticas locales, las costumbres y las atracciones. Haga arreglos de reserva alternativos si surgen cambios antes o durante el viaje.     BENEFICIOS:     No se necesita experiencia Se brindará capacitación Horarios flexibles     Powered by JazzHR     DiVoyLaO2c

Title: Regional Business Development Sales Manager / Affiliate Partner in Spain
Description: This is a remote position.     At Mindojo, we're revolutionizing education with our adaptive platform used by leading test-prep courses such as Bloomberg Exam Prep. We've just launched a cutting-edge app offering a suite of learning games for the millions of kids in Spain learning English as a second language (ESL).     As our Regional Business Development Manager / Affiliate Partner in Spain, you will be instrumental in expanding our reach, striking B2B and B2G deals, and fostering beneficial partnerships within the region.     This is a highly independent role where you are in control of your success. The role is primarily contingency-based, so you will have vast earning potential which is in your hands. If you're ambitious, motivated, and eager to apply your business development skills at scale, this opportunity provides the perfect platform.     We offer a contract role. With our flexible work environment, you can operate from any location within Spain.     Requirements     Key Responsibilities:     Manage and increase the number of outbound activities to schedule meetings with potential clients/partners, negotiate, and close deals. Identify new business opportunities within the region. Focus on B2B/B2G deals for our English learning product for kids/schools and/or our AI e-learning platform. Developing positive relationships with key client decision-makers in Spain. Collaborate closely with product and project managers. Maintain an updated CRM database of prospects.     Skills & Qualifications:     Proven track record of achieving business and sales goals. Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to engage effectively at various levels of management. Excellent presentation skills to articulate our value proposition effectively. Proactive attitude with excellent organizational skills. General tech savviness. Fluent in English and Spanish, both oral and written.

Title: Beca - Digital Marketing Assistant
Description: Nuestra misión     Queremos ayudar a construir el futuro a través de la tecnología, aportando soluciones digitales que ayuden a cambiar diferentes sectores de nuestra sociedad. Somos el primer Exponencial Tech Hub basado en España, que trabaja día a día en cambiar como interactuaremos en el mañana.     Nuestros valores     En ALUXION defendemos y buscamos los siguientes valores en nuestros aluxioners, lo que define nuestro alma y nuestra forma de ser como equipo y como personas:     Exponencialidad: Pensar más allá y adaptarnos a los cambios con las últimas tecnologías y metodologías.     Transparencia: Creemos en contar las cosas como son y en escuchar, como motor de cambio y de progreso en la empresa. Vanguardia: No tener miedo a estar siempre a la última y convertirnos en líderes de nuestro sector. Pasión: Amar lo que uno hace como motor de su día a día y como forma de vida. Responsabilidad: Tenemos que tener responsabilidad con nuestros compañeros y con nuestra sociedad. Locura: Quienes están lo suficientemente locos para pensar que pueden cambiar el mundo, son quienes lo cambian.      Tasks     Tu principal tarea será apoyar al equipo de operaciones y estrategia, llevando a cabo las siguientes funciones:     Generación de contenidos para redes sociales Redacción de contenidos y artículos para blogs y webs Apoyo en la creación de presentaciones de empresa      Requirements     Esta vacante en modalidad de beca está enfocada principalmente a aquellas personas que quieran dar sus primeros pasos en el mundo empresarial, por ello no es necesario disponer de experiencia previa, pero si será indispensable:     Estar cursando o recientemente haber acabado un grado, curso, master o alguna modalidad de estudio relacionada con la vacante. Tener posibilidad de firmar un convenio de 6 meses con tu centro de estudios. Tener un alto nivel de inglés para poder trabajar en ambos idiomas sin problema.      Benefits     Posibilidad de contrato fijo al final de la beca. Reportar y trabajar directamente con los directivos de la empresa. Apoyo al estudio de 300€/mes

Title: Product Designer
Description: "I built my talents on the shoulders of someone else’s talent."     Michael Jordan     At Naiz Fit we are thrilled to announce an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Product Designer (UX-UI).     In collaboration with the Technology team and reporting to the CTO, the mission is to design and build products that optimize our customers' engagement and satisfaction, contributing to the company's success.     We are looking for adventurers like you who want to be part of our expansion globally and make a lasting impact in the fashion industry.     Join the team and keep rocking it Naiz Style.     What does Naiz Fit do?     At the beginning of every story there is a once upon a time, some complicit glances and the must-have butterflies in your stomach, and to begin our story we would love to get you to know us a bit better.     The once upon a time starts with a question: which is your size? We bet you had to answer that (and had no idea how to;)) at least once in your life while buying a new outfit.     That was our trigger when, 5 years ago, we were born to help the fashion industry to solve this question.     We had complicit glances with the first brands and what made us deeply understand the problem to build a solution for all of us, because brands and fashion lovers are in the same game. #YourBodyYourSize.     The magic (and butterflies) came when we unified the digital world with its data, and the creative art of fashion by trying the collections of the brands who want to solve their sizing issues on real people with different body types.     Because fashion is way more than a bunch of numbers.     We are partners in crime with brands to create an industry where all body types will find their perfect fit. Our story started as a digital solution for ecommerce to assist buyers while choosing sizes.     That was the beginning of an adventure that brought us to today, now we are part of MySize Inc group, a Nasdaq listed company, and we are helping fashion brands with solutions for ecommerce, retail and product departments to address size&fit issues with ad hoc solutions for every step of the value chain.     Our clients     Our clients are the heart of our focus. Here are a few examples of the variety of clients we work with:     🗝️ Key Responsabilities:     Propose, design, and refine concept solutions for responsive web. Interact and work with our customers to understand the needs, pain points, and preferences. Gain insights into their workflows and requirements to develop the design process. Design and create user personas, user journeys, and customer workflows to create and communicate the design process and solutions. Create and manage design systems for digital products. Conduct user and UX research; identify user problems and design solutions. Develop and make our product visual design efficient through strong and consistent UI skills to ensure consistency across products. Build & nurture your product vision and turn into a well-thought product strategy and roadmap. Make sure that we’re building the right features. Work closely with the CTO to set and our engineers team to ensure that implementation quality meets design requirements. Occasionally wear multiple design hats, helping developers and business in the discovery phase of new initiatives or products.     ✅ Desired Skills, Know How And Experience     You have 3+ years experience in designing and conceptualizing products working on projects with different levels of complexity. You are familiar with the whole product cycle: researching the problem, phasing and deciding with engineers, prototyping the solution, testing it with users, documenting it and working with engineers to implement it. You love design, pay attention to detail, and have a passion for making complex things intuitive. You are interested in understanding the operations and technical limitations to best adapt your solutions. You are familiar with design tools such as Figma or Sketch. You are enthusiastic, self-sufficient, but also team-oriented. Knows how to give and receive feedback. You are highly communicative, able to work with cross- functional teams. A passion for understanding customer needs and translating them into innovative design solutions. You have strong communication skills, both in English and Spanish.     🎯 Requirements     Updated portfolio based on real business cases showing real digital product history and ideas that demonstrate your skills.     Why would you love to join us?     🔝 We are getting bigger but we still have a start-up feeling.     ⚡A key position in one of the most important delivery teams of the company where you can see your impact on the business from the very beginning.     🖖We believe in autonomy and taking initiative.     👫We cultivate a positive work culture that supports personal and professional growth; we are all part of the same project, and we are passionate about it.     👧Become a part of our dynamic work environment, where the values of freedom and responsibility thrive.     🤩Employee engagement activities and quarterly work retreats.     🌍 Remote friendly culture. But ideally joining the Barcelona office to meet the rest of the Growth team.     🏢 2 offices: San Sebastian (HQ) and Barcelona.     Our Values     Ask for forgiveness, not permission Embrace Uniqueness Team of Minions Enjoy the ride     To prove our culture, we leave you here a talk given by our CEO, Borja Cembrero, which we believe represents our culture very well.     Disclaimer, it is in Spanish 🇪🇸     If you think you are a good fit, apply and send us anything you think will help us get to know you better so we can schedule a first interview.🖖     (**) We have crossed out the words artificial intelligence because we are tired of so much big words in the tech world. We solve a problem, which is THE important thing. But if you join us, we'll explain you all the details about how we solve it!
Industry: Industria textil y moda para la venta minorista

Title: Ingeniero CAD en la Industria del Reciclaje
Description: ¡Excelente oportunidad para un ingeniero CAD en la industria del reciclaje!     ¿Es usted un ingeniero calificado apasionado por el desarrollo de máquinas y la promoción de la sustentabilidad a través del reciclaje? Si tiene experiencia en dibujo CAD con Solidworks y un conocimiento profundo de cintas transportadoras, trituradoras, molinos y diseño estructural, ¡tenemos una gran oportunidad para tí!     Acerca de nuestro cliente: es una empresa de renombre ubicada en el corazón de los Países Bajos, especializada en soluciones innovadoras para la industria del reciclaje, con un enfoque principal en alimentos y plásticos. Su compromiso con la conciencia ambiental y la tecnología de punta les ha permitido atender a una clientela internacional.     Posición y Responsabilidades     Como ingeniero de CAD, será responsable de diseñar y desarrollar máquinas que desempeñan un papel vital en los procesos de reciclaje. Su experiencia en dibujo CAD con Solidworks será fundamental para crear diseños de máquinas precisos y eficientes. Sus responsabilidades principales incluirán:     Desarrollo y producción de dibujos CAD para máquinas de reciclaje utilizando Solidworks. Diseño de transportadores (sinfín y banda), trituradoras, molinos y otros equipos de reciclaje. Incorporar principios de diseño estructural para garantizar la estabilidad y confiabilidad de las máquinas. Colaborar con el equipo de ingeniería para optimizar los diseños y mejorar el rendimiento del producto. Asegurar el cumplimiento de los estándares de la industria y las normas de seguridad. Resolución de problemas y soporte técnico durante las fases de fabricación y pruebas.     Requisitos     Para prosperar en este rol, debe poseer las siguientes calificaciones: Dominio de español e inglés, tanto hablado como escrito. Muy buen conocimiento del software CAD, particularmente Solidworks, para el diseño de máquinas. Experiencia en el diseño de transportadores como transportadores de tornillo y de banda, trituradoras, molinos y equipos relacionados. Comprensión básica de los principios de diseño estructural para crear máquinas robustas y duraderas. Preferiblemente experiencia previa en la industria del reciclaje, aunque no obligatoria. Gran habilidad para resolver problemas y un enfoque innovador para los desafíos de ingeniería. Capacidad para trabajar en colaboración en un entorno de equipo y comunicarse de manera efectiva con las partes interesadas.     Ofrecemos     Valoramos el talento y la dedicación, y estamos comprometidos a fomentar un ambiente de trabajo próspero. Cuando se una a nuestro equipo, puede esperar:     Una carrera desafiante y gratificante en la vanguardia de la tecnología de reciclaje. Oportunidades para trabajar en proyectos internacionales y colaborar con clientes en todo el mundo. Un contrato fijo. Paquete competitivo de compensación y beneficios. Envíe su CV junto con una carta de presentación que detalle su experiencia y motivación relevantes.     Ubicación     Trabajo desde casa (entre Tarragona y Vilafranca del Penedés)
