Title: EU Project Manager
Description: RSB - Roundtable on Sustainable Biomaterials is looking for a highly motivated and detail-oriented individual to join the team as our EU Project Manager– an ideal position for an someone interested in furthering an international career in an organisation focused on sustainability and industry transformation.     About Us     RSB is a global, multi-stakeholder organisation dedicated to driving the truly sustainable development of the bioeconomy based on our best-in-class sustainability framework. Frequently noted as industry leaders in navigating the complexities of supply chain sustainability, we take pride in applying our robust sustainability framework in diverse sectors including aviation, chemicals, materials, and shipping, among others. For more information, visit www.rsb.org     Our small and dedicated team of committed professionals works on a global scale to develop solutions to some of the world’s biggest challenges. We operate remotely, situated in many countries around the world with a strong, collaborative working environment fostering professional development and a healthy work-life balance. Our team allows for individual autonomy and the opportunity to engage with a full spectrum of roles within the diverse range of organisations in our stakeholder base.     Your Role     As RSB’s EU Project Manager, you will report to the Programme Director and work closely with the EU Project Lead to support the fundraising and implementation of projects funded by Horizon Europe and other EU funding programmes (hereafter referred to as “EU Projects”).  In this role, you will be responsible for:  EU Project Implementation  1) Manage RSB’s EU Projects assigned to you:  Ensuring well planned, resourced, and timely deliverables. Leading internal project team meetings and attending external meetings with project partners and stakeholders. Developing project-specific deliverables, monitoring progress, and leading review sessions. Creating a project budget and assisting with financial monitoring. Identifying opportunities for project efficiencies and quality improvements.  2) Implement work packages and tasks related to EU Projects assigned to you in line with RSB’s strategy and goals:  Leading project deliverable implementation, performing environmental assessments, conducting gap analyses against RSB Standards, supporting supply chains to understand and implement RSB EU RED certification, and conducting stakeholder consultations. Managing the RSB technical team to support work package implementation. Supporting the RSB Communications team writing news articles and thought leadership pieces to promote RSB’s EU activities. Organising in-person and online project meetings, workshops and other related events. Writing project reports and giving presentations at workshops and events.  3) Support existing EU Projects, such as:  ALIGHT (https://alight-aviation.eu/) CARINA (https://www.carina-project.eu/) STAR4BBS (https://star4bbs.eu/)        Fundraising  Support the EU Project Lead and RSB’s Executive Director to develop applications for new EU-funded project opportunities:  Identifying new project opportunities and developing relationship with project partners; and Developing project proposals from initial idea to final documentation and in coordination with project partners.     About You     We are looking for an individual based in Spain, equipped with relevant experience and a strong commitment to sustainability.     Required - Education, Experience, and Qualifications  5+ years of professional experience with 3+ years working in EU projects in the bio-based and circular economy sector (e.g. agriculture, materials, bioenergy). Professional experience with sustainability certification, environmental and social assessments, life cycle analysis calculation, and application of relevant tools. Strong experience writing research papers and reports. Excellent spoken and written English. Degree in a relevant field, e.g., sustainability, environmental management, etc. Knowledge of sustainability, circularity, biofuels/biomaterials in the EU framework. Confidence and ability to communicate effectively with companies, governmental institutions, non-profit agencies, academia, and other experts on a global scale. Proficiency in Microsoft Office software.     Required - Personal Attributes  Proactive Open-minded Efficient Ability to work with a multicultural and virtual team Strong motivation and drive for sustainability Excellent interpersonal communication skills Willing to travel as required by the job Flexible and willing to learn continuously in an exciting environment     Desired - Education, Experience, and Qualifications  Specific knowledge and/or experience in sustainability assessment (environmental, social and economic) in the bioenergy sector. Knowledge of the European Commission management rules associated with the Horizon Europe programme (administrative, financial, legal). Background on social assessment projects.     Why Work with Us     Join a small, dedicated, and multicultural team of professionals committed to building a brighter future for people and planet.     Our Benefits  Competitive salary Excellent holiday provision with 30 days annual paid leave Annual salary adjustments for cost-of-living increases Flexible working hours Remote working in home-office with periodic in-person team meetings Professional development opportunities     Important Information  Location: Home office-based, located in Spain Travel: Required periodically for meetings Position type: Full-time Start Date: January 2024 or earlier Duration: 2-years with option for permanent contract     How to Apply     1) Provide a Cover Letter describing why you wish to work with us, and why you are the right fit.  2) Provide your CV, no more than 2 pages please.  3) Email your application to Sam Hansen, RSB’s Finance & Administration Manager, at Sam.Hansen AT RSB.org with the subject line, “EU Project Manager”.     Please note that applications that do not follow the steps above will not be considered in our selection.

Title: Market Intelligence Specialist - Global (Remote)
Description: Why you should join dLocal?     dLocal enables the biggest companies in the world to collect payments in 40 countries in emerging markets. Global brands rely on us to increase conversion rates and simplify payment expansion effortlessly. As both a payments processor and a merchant of record where we operate, we make it possible for our merchants to make inroads into the world’s fastest-growing, emerging markets.     By joining us you will be a part of an amazing global team that makes it all happen, in a flexible, remote-first dynamic culture with travel, health, and learning benefits, among others. Being a part of dLocal means working with 600+ teammates from 25+ different nationalities and developing an international career that impacts millions of people’s daily lives. We are builders, we never run from a challenge, we are customer-centric, and if this sounds like you, we know you will thrive in our team.     What’s the opportunity?     We are seeking a Market Intelligence Specialist to provide actionable insights and strategic guidance based on in-depth research and analysis of the payments industry and its various segments.     What will I be doing?     The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in shaping our company's competitive strategy by identifying market trends, customer preferences, competitive landscape, and potential opportunities. Collaborate cross-functionally to guide decision-making and contribute to our continuous growth and innovation Conduct comprehensive research on the payments industry, including key trends, emerging technologies, regulatory changes, and customer behaviors Collect and analyze relevant data from various sources, including industry reports, market data, financial statements, and customer surveys Utilize advanced analytical tools and techniques to transform raw data into meaningful insights and actionable recommendations Collaborate with Product, Sales Ops, and Commercial teams to align strategies and prioritize initiatives based on market insights Analyze customer behavior, preferences, and pain points to enhance customer experiences and drive customer acquisition and retention Create well-structured and visually compelling reports, presentations, and dashboards to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders Develop compelling sales materials, including presentations, pitch decks, and collateral, to support sales teams in communicating the value proposition to clients      What skills do I need?     Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Marketing, or a related field (Master's degree preferred) Proven experience (3+ years) in market research, competitive analysis, or market intelligence within the fintech, payments, or related industries Strong analytical skills and proficiency in using data analysis tools and techniques (e.g., Excel, Tableau, SQL) Fluent in English is required, other languages are a plus Knowledge of payment industry trends, technologies, and regulatory landscape Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to convey complex insights to diverse audiences Detail-oriented mindset with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously Self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment Collaborative team player with the ability to work cross-functionally and build relationships at all levels   What happens after you apply?     Our Talent Acquisition team is invested in creating the best candidate experience possible, so don’t worry, you will definitely hear from us. We will review your CV and keep you posted by email at every step of the process!     Also, you can check out our webpage, Linkedin, Instagram, and Youtube for more about dLocal!

Title: Analista Desarrollo de Negocio y Alianzas
Description: Somos una de las aseguradoras más importantes del mundo, formada por personas positivas, dinámicas y comprometidas que hacen que las cosas ocurran. Creemos que nuestra diversidad aporta valor a los equipos, a nuestra cultura y a los clientes. Sabemos que las mejores ideas y soluciones surgen en entornos inclusivos donde todos nos sentimos vistos, escuchados y valorados para que podamos desarrollar nuestro máximo talento.  Qué te ofrecemos:  Hemos sido reconocidos como uno de los mejores lugares para trabajar en España por Forbes y el ranking de Actualidad Económica, y es que contamos con la mejor propuesta de valor para todos los que  formamos parte de Aegon:  🤸‍♂️ Apostamos por la flexibilidad a través de nuestro modelo de trabajo híbrido: contamos con la posibilidad de teletrabajar al menos tres días por semana y también de  compartir tiempo en unas oficinas adaptadas a la metodología ágil.  💃🏻 Te ayudamos a conciliar y desconectar, con flexibilidad horaria durante todo el año y jornada intensiva en el verano.  🥰Las mejores acciones para tubienestar físico y mental (seguro de saludgratuito, fisioterapia en la oficina, iniciativas de vida saludable, etc.) y un gran abanico de beneficios y  ventajas sociales (la empresa hace una alta aportación a tu plan de pensiones, seguro de ahorro para la jubilación, retribución flexible, ayudas a la formación, regalo de  Navidad, etc.).  🏔️Oportunidades de desarrollo a todos los niveles mediante proyectos transversales e internacionales. Contamos con acciones de reconocimiento, compensación variable para  todos y feedback continuo. Nuestro modelo de gestión está basado en tener conversaciones de calidad de manera recurrente, donde tendrás un papel protagonista.  💙Cultura: el 87% de empleados estamos orgullosos de trabajar en Aegon. Somos una empresa internacional, cercana y empática.  La oportunidad laboral de tu vida  ¿Te gustaría ayudar a las personas a vivir su mejor vida?, es a lo que nos dedicamos en nuestro día a día. Lo logramos gracias a que somos una empresa de personas que cuidan de personas, con  curiosidad, conectados con la realidad que nos rodea y centrados en dejar un mundo mejor de como lo hemos encontrado. Siempre aprendemos de nuestros clientes y de las demás personas.  ¡Esperamos que te apasione tanto como a nosotros!  Sobre la posición :  Dentro del departamento de M&A, Desarrollo de Negocio y Alianzas, tendrás responsabilidad sobre las siguientes funciones:  El rol impacta en dos objetivos principales, i) por un lado, una labor de desarrollo de negocio orientada a la búsqueda y cierre de alianzas para la distribución de seguros y ii) por otro lado, aportar buenas capacidades analíticas para identificar y valorar adecuadamente distintas oportunidades que se puedan presentar en el área de M&A Relación con socios de la alianza en el desarrollo de los proyectos. Participar en la gestión de alianzas y nuevas oportunidades de negocio, colaborando en los análisis críticos para la toma de decisiones, los acuerdos de distribución, los productos y otras cuestiones derivadas. Análisis continúo del mercado y la competencia. Seguimiento de la actividad comercial, generación de valorar y seguimiento del negocio. Participar activamente en proyectos estratégicos y transversales tanto a nivel de Aegon   Sobre tus habilidades:  Graduado/a en área Económica o Ingeniería. Deseable formación de posgrado. Experiencia laboral entre 1-3 años, preferiblemente en desarrollo de negocio y corporativo en el sector asegurador, banca, financiero o en consultoría. Experiencia en gestión y ejecución de proyectos. Excelente capacidad analítica y experiencia en modelización financiera y operativa. Nivel Intermedio-alto en inglés

Title: Senior B2B Content Strategist
Description: Role Overview:  As a Senior B2B Content Strategist, you will lead the creation and publication of compelling videos and written content that resonate with the target audience. Your creative abilities and strategic thinking will help our client establish a strong online identity and communicate our brand's message effectively.  Key Responsibilities:  Video Creation: Use your editing skills to craft engaging and informative videos that align with our brand's objectives. These videos will be tailored for platforms such as Instagram, Reels, and TikTok, capturing the attention of our target audience. Content Creation: Develop written content that adds value to our audience's professional lives. Craft insightful articles, posts, and updates for platforms like LinkedIn, showcasing your writing prowess and industry expertise. Content Strategy: Develop and execute a comprehensive content strategy encompassing video and written content. Ensure consistency in messaging, tone, and branding across all platforms. Platform Management: Manage the end-to-end content creation process, from ideation and scripting to editing and publishing. Adapt content to suit the unique requirements of each platform. Audience Engagement: Monitor and engage with our online community across different platforms. Respond to comments, messages, and interactions promptly and meaningfully to foster positive relationships. Data-Driven Insights: Utilize analytics tools to track content performance, identify trends, and gather insights. Use this data to refine and optimize our content strategy for maximum impact.   Required Skills and Qualifications:  6 years of Experience: Proven track record in content creation and strategy, with at least 6 years of relevant experience. Video Editing: Proficiency in video editing using various video editing software. Passion for Writing: Strong writing skills and a genuine enthusiasm for crafting content that resonates with business audiences. Creative Vision: Ability to conceptualize and execute creative ideas that align with brand goals and engage our target audience. Platform Familiarity: Experience creating content and posting on Instagram, Reels, TikTok, and LinkedIn. Strategic Thinking: Ability to think strategically and translate brand messaging into effective content that supports business objectives. Attention to Detail: Meticulous attention to detail to ensure content is error-free, consistent, and of high quality. Time Management: Strong organizational skills to manage multiple projects, meet deadlines, and adapt to changing priorities.   If you're a creative content strategist passionate about video editing and writing, we'd love to hear from you.

Title: Business Development Representative (Italian) - 100% Remote
Description: Who we are     Motive Commerce Search is a plug & play search solution designed to deliver exceptional experiences for shoppers and shop owners alike. The easy to install plugin - available on Prestashop and WooCommerce - is built on technology developed by our sister company, Empathy.co, which works with some of the world’s biggest brands.     Its no-code design lets shop owners effortlessly customise their search while providing powerful backend tools to improve the shopping experience. Motive Commerce Search delivers guaranteed trust thanks to its tracker and cookie-free technology, as well as transparent pricing with no surprises.     Your mission     As a Business Development Representative, you'll collaborate with our Motive G2M team to amplify our presence across 4 countries, including Italy, and aspire to conquer 6-7 additional countries in the next 2 years. Your mission is to take the helm in our growth journey by forging connections with potential clients, cultivating these relationships, and leveraging your communication skills to enhance sales and navigate Motive towards enduring success.     What you’ll do     Develop commercial campaigns from prospecting to closure, analyse campaign results, and propose improvements. Collaborate on preparing and optimising resources for campaign development. Manage the Motive events area: understand event objectives, explore prospect options, and craft event proposals for Motive. Deliver sales pitches, product reports, and other valuable information to potential prospects, promoting Motive's brand and mission while helping prospects identify their product needs. Manage a prospect base consisting of specific target accounts within an assigned territory. Generate new sales leads through outbound prospecting (industry events, cold calling, and emailing). Cultivate lasting trust-based relationships with clients. Work directly with Motive's Marketing Team to identify opportunities from leads. Collaborate closely with other departments, such as Marketing, Customer Care, or Product, to enhance cross-functional connections and add value. Achieve and surpass your monthly quotas and objectives, contributing to the achievement of team goals. Stay updated on new products/services and pricing/payment plans.     What you’ll bring     Language Proficiency: Fluent Italian (C2) and proficient English (at least B2) communication abilities. Outbound B2B Prospecting Expertise: Over a year of cold calling and email outreach experience to generate a robust business pipeline. Relationship Building: Skill in nurturing customer connections from prospecting to closure for impactful growth. Effective Multitasking: Proven track record of prioritising and managing tasks for focused business development. BA or BS Degree: Academic foundation in business, marketing, or related fields. Proven Sales Record: Demonstrated success in business sales or related markets. Startup Exposure: Previous experience in a start-up environment preferred. Excellent Organisational Skills: Strong emphasis on priorities, goal setting, and time management. Clear Communication: Ability to convey technical and non-technical information to staff and customers clearly. Adaptability: Flourish with minimal guidance, proactive approach, and thrive in uncertain situations.     What’s in it for you     Being part of a team with a forward-looking, international mindset and Agile working practises. Remote work contract with all essential equipment to carry it out and set up a home workspace (as well as an awesome welcome pack). Flexible 36-hour workweek to enhance work-life balance. Attractive salary and very competitive benefit package (private medical insurance, private pension plan, online functional training, English lessons, flexible remuneration, etc.). Personal Training Budget and unlimited growth opportunities. Up to 6 training days available per year to attend courses and events. Unlimited certification possibilities, with certification costs covered by Empathy. A range of employee events throughout the year, including team building activities, Sashimi sessions, and Kick-off events. Eligibility to participate in our Empathy Stock Option Plan and Employment Pension Plan. Opportunities to shape the tech community within and outside the company, through mentoring and knowledge-sharing. Unlimited free books to expand your knowledge and foster creativity and self development. The chance to work with cutting-edge technologies and expand your skill set. And most importantly: an amazing working atmosphere and team culture.     Our commitment     At Empathy and Motive, we put people first. For that reason, we are strong supporters of diversity and inclusion. We believe that by providing a fair and diverse workplace, we encourage the atmosphere of trust, understanding and joy that defines us.     We are fully committed to offering equal opportunities, fighting against discrimination every day. We strictly avoid any type of distinction, exclusion, restriction, or preference that could possibly be considered in any way subjective, irrational or disproportional.

Title: Project Manager - Multisite Deployment - [Remote]
Description: ABOUT US:  Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.  ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:  When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.  JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below) LOCATION: Remote - CST | Full day overlap HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $55 – $68/hr ESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Long term EXPERIENCE: 5-10 years BRAINTRUST JOB ID: 8026   THE OPPORTUNITY  What You’ll Be Working On  Requirements/Job Duties:  Manages the day-to-day operational and tactical aspects of multiple and large complex projects with multiple work streams Demonstrates excellent verbal and written communication skills; Develop and execute an efficient internal and external communication strategy for ensuring communication with all levels of management within the team Monitor and report on project progress to stakeholders Build and strengthen relationships with the customer and stakeholders (internal and external) Responsible for creation and maintenance of resource plans ensuring effective resource allocation and distribution across portfolio of projects Utilize project management tools and techniques to improve execution and drive efficiencies. Implements engagement review and quality assurance procedures in accordance with our methodology Ensure profitable and successful execution of all assigned engagements as measured by regional goals and customer feedback Proactively manage changes in project scope Effectively create and execute risk management plans Manage and analyze profitability, revenue, margins, bill rates and utilization across projects Understand and manage key project financial components to ensure projects are delivered within budget Responsible for quality and timely execution of deliverables across projects   Qualifications:  Networking, Storage, Virtualization, Cloud, Security, or Collaboration (Unified Communications) Project Management experience required Unified communications (UC) and contact center (CC) platforms experience required Experience in a Professional Services environment, leading complex Information Technology projects is required Understanding of financial processes; ability to understand, analyze and create financial reports Proven experience with risk management; demonstrated ability to communicate appropriately to leadership Understanding of and the ability to utilize the process of stakeholder analysis Ability to work independently and aggressively track to project timelines Excellent documentation skills and attention to detail Ability to communicate well with customers and co-workers Experience in effectively influencing and leading personnel and the ability to write business reports in a well-organized manner Strong team building skills Excellent problem solving, and critical thinking skills Demonstrated communication skills (written, verbal, and presentation) Proficiency with project management software   Apply Now!  C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.  Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.  JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below) LOCATION: Remote - CST | Full day overlap HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $55 – $68/hr ESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Long term EXPERIENCE: 5-10 years BRAINTRUST JOB ID: 8026   THE OPPORTUNITY  What You’ll Be Working On  Requirements/Job Duties:  Manages the day-to-day operational and tactical aspects of multiple and large complex projects with multiple work streams Demonstrates excellent verbal and written communication skills; Develop and execute an efficient internal and external communication strategy for ensuring communication with all levels of management within the team Monitor and report on project progress to stakeholders Build and strengthen relationships with the customer and stakeholders (internal and external) Responsible for creation and maintenance of resource plans ensuring effective resource allocation and distribution across portfolio of projects Utilize project management tools and techniques to improve execution and drive efficiencies. Implements engagement review and quality assurance procedures in accordance with our methodology Ensure profitable and successful execution of all assigned engagements as measured by regional goals and customer feedback Proactively manage changes in project scope Effectively create and execute risk management plans Manage and analyze profitability, revenue, margins, bill rates and utilization across projects Understand and manage key project financial components to ensure projects are delivered within budget Responsible for quality and timely execution of deliverables across projects   Qualifications:  Networking, Storage, Virtualization, Cloud, Security, or Collaboration (Unified Communications) Project Management experience required Unified communications (UC) and contact center (CC) platforms experience required Experience in a Professional Services environment, leading complex Information Technology projects is required Understanding of financial processes; ability to understand, analyze and create financial reports Proven experience with risk management; demonstrated ability to communicate appropriately to leadership Understanding of and the ability to utilize the process of stakeholder analysis Ability to work independently and aggressively track to project timelines Excellent documentation skills and attention to detail Ability to communicate well with customers and co-workers Experience in effectively influencing and leading personnel and the ability to write business reports in a well-organized manner Strong team building skills Excellent problem solving, and critical thinking skills Demonstrated communication skills (written, verbal, and presentation) Proficiency with project management software   Apply Now!  C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.  Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.
Function: Gestión y Tecnología de la información

Title: Commercial Counsel I
Description: At G-P, our mission is to break down barriers to global business, enabling opportunities for everyone, everywhere. With remote-first and diverse teams all around the world, our people are the key to achieving this mission. That’s why we trust our Dream Team members with the flexibility and autonomy to do their best and most innovative work, encourage and support their personal growth and career development, and believe in recognition for a job well done.  The work you’ll be a part of here will have a positive impact on people and their work/life possibilities around the world. Our industry-leading SaaS-based Global Employment Platform™ enables our customers to expand and grow into 180+ countries, creating more opportunities for global success – without requiring entity or subsidiary setup. Beyond the power of our platform, we never forget that behind every hire is a human being. And that brings us to you.  Beyond a competitive compensation and benefits package, what we offer to all employees is the clear and simple promise of Opportunity Made Possible. Come expand your skills in new ways and experience the thrill of impacting the way the world works, today and in the future.  About The Position  As Commercial Counsel, EMEA, you will be responsible for a high volume of contract negotiations with customers and vendors, focused on the EMEA region, as well as contribute to other matters in support of our global Commercial Legal team. This is an exciting opportunity to play a key role in the ongoing growth of Globalization Partners across the EMEA region and globally.  What You Can Expect To Do  Timely preparation, review, and negotiation of a high volume of contracts and other related documents, including but not limited to master services, consulting, license, and vendor agreements. Most contracts will be in English. Advise the business on contractual rights, obligations, and risks. Prepare and deliver trainings to the Sales team and other internal groups. Work within the Company’s contract management system, including maintaining life-cycle requirements, training, and alerting internal clients to key contract dates and actions. Analyze and revise contracts to ensure compliance with company policy and regulations. Perform other contract related activities and projects, as assigned. Conduct corporate, compliance, and legal research. Assist with other legal tasks, as needed. Coordinate and drive completion of commercial related projects and assorted other legal team projects to address the needs of a global, high-growth company.  What We Are Looking For  Active license to practice law in your jurisdiction. 4-6 years’ of commercial law experience, including contract negotiation and administration. Laser-focused attention to detail. Contracts management software experience. Pragmatic, sales-focused, strong work ethic, and team player. High degree of professionalism in a client-service-focused setting. Strong English language written and verbal communication skills. Ability to communicate with various levels of the organization, including senior management. Sound legal judgment, creative problem-solving, and analytical skills. Organizational, multi-tasking, and prioritization skills. Diligent, great organizational and people skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Enthusiasm to get involved in new areas of law/jurisdictions. Outstanding written and verbal communication skills in English, and focused attention to detail. Sound legal judgment, creative problem-solving ability, and analytical skills. Able to think on your feet, multitask, prioritize, and be proactive.  Ability to provide clear guidance on complex and sensitive issues with an appropriate sense of commercial risk.  Compensation  The annual gross base salary range for this position is €29,200 to €49,000. Actual compensation for this position may vary and will depend on multiple factors including relevant qualifications, experience, education and geographic location. This position is also eligible for an annual bonus dependent on various factors, including and without limitation, individual and company performance in addition to base salary.  Benefits  G-P values its employees and offers excellent benefits and perks including generous paid parental leave, flexible time off, flexible spending accounts, medical Insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, sabbatical after 5 years of service and more. We will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with arrest records, conviction records, or other criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of any applicable state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, and the New York City Fair Chance Act.  G-P is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer, and we are committed to building and maintaining a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture that celebrates authenticity. We prohibit discrimination and harassment against employees or applicants on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, and pregnancy-related conditions), gender identity or expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.  G-P also is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need an accommodation due to a disability during the interview process, please contact us at people@g-p.com.  About Us  G-P helps growing companies unlock their full potential by making it possible to build highly skilled global teams in days instead of months. Through our SaaS-based platform, we help find, hire, onboard, pay, and manage team members, quickly and compliantly, to expand growth opportunities for everyone, everywhere – without the hassle of setting up local subsidiaries or branch offices.  G-P. Global Made Possible.  G-P is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer, and we are committed to building and maintaining a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture that celebrates authenticity. We prohibit discrimination and harassment against employees or applicants on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, and pregnancy-related conditions), gender identity or expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.  G-P also is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need an accommodation due to a disability during the interview process, please contact us at careers@g-p.com.

Title: EDC Content Manager
Description: Apply at the Ridge!     We are an Everyday Carry Product company specializing in minimalist products, headlined by our flagship product The Ridge Wallet. The Ridge Wallet started as a Kickstarter project in 2013 and is now in the hands and pockets of over 3 million people worldwide! We currently operate around the globe selling in the US, Canada, the UK, EU, and Australia on Shopify and through other channels such as Amazon and Wholesalers. We are looking for people interested in positions with tremendous growth potential, but which come with high expectations of work rate and quality of work. We are a fully remote company and are very excited to expand into the Eastern European market to continue to grow our team! We currently have a US-based team of just over 50 people! We currently employ over 60+ international contractors around the world! While this may seem like a lot of people, each department only ranges from 2 - 10 people, which opens up a lot of opportunities for growth and advancement. We strive to work with the best people, both on a talent and commitment level to grow and learn more! Since we are a remote-first company, we always do our best to be as accommodating to a healthy work/life balance.     The Role     Apply here: https://tally.so/r/3NDaVO     Your Responsibilities Will Include     Manage and coordinate all content for articles, including copy, images, and embedded social content. Collaborate with the Editor-in-Chief, Managing Editor, staff writers, graphic designer, and editorial assistants while operating independently to hit content goals. Use the EDC CMS and other content production tools like Trello, Slack, and Notion proficiently to produce, format, and publish content for the site. Conduct logistics planning and help fill out the editorial calendar. Act as a secondary editor and fact-checker to ensure the quality and accuracy of the content. Assist in sourcing images and coordinate follow-ups with writers. The ability to work with Photoshop or other tools for use in article production is a bonus. Ensure all content is delivered within set deadlines. Facilitate communication between SEO and staff writers to ensure streamlined content production.     Ideal Profile     Experience in content management or a related role. Proficiency in using website CMS and other content production tools. Moderate experience with writing and editing, with strong attention to detail. Experience with grammar and research tools, such as Grammarly. Ability to manage multiple tasks, prioritize, and adhere to deadlines. Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work collaboratively with different teams. Knowledge of SEO practices would be an advantage. Familiarity with image sourcing and graphic design. Ability to work independently and as part of a team.     What's on Offer?     Opportunity within company with a solid track record of success Flexible working options Leadership Role
Industry: Industria textil y moda para la venta minorista

Title: Analista de Datos
Description: Somos una de las aseguradoras más importantes del mundo, formada por personas positivas, dinámicas y comprometidas que hacen que las cosas ocurran. Creemos que nuestra diversidad aporta valor a los equipos, a nuestra cultura y a los clientes. Sabemos que las mejores ideas y soluciones surgen en entornos inclusivos donde todos nos sentimos vistos, escuchados y valorados para que podamos desarrollar nuestro máximo talento.  Qué te ofrecemos  Hemos sido reconocidos como uno de los mejores lugares para trabajar en España por la lista Forbes y el ranking de Actualidad Económica, y es que contamos con la mejor propuesta de valor para todos los que formamos parte de Aegon:  🤸‍♂️ Apostamos por la flexibilidad a través de nuestro modelo de trabajo híbrido: contamos con la posibilidad de teletrabajar al menos tres días por semana y también de compartir tiempo en unas oficinas adaptadas a la metodología ágil. 💃🏻 Te ayudamos a conciliar y desconectar, con flexibilidad horaria durante todo el año y jornada intensiva en el verano. 🥰 Las mejores acciones para tu bienestar físico y mental (seguro de salud gratuito, fisioterapia en la oficina, iniciativas de vida saludable, etc.) y un gran abanico de beneficios y ventajas sociales (la empresa hace una alta aportación a tu plan de pensiones, seguro de ahorro para la jubilación, retribución flexible, ayudas a la formación, regalo de Navidad, etc.). 🏔️ Oportunidades de desarrollo a todos los niveles mediante proyectos transversales e internacionales. Contamos con acciones de reconocimiento, compensación variable para todos y feedback continuo. Nuestro modelo de gestión está basado en tener conversaciones de calidad de manera recurrente, donde tendrás un papel protagonista. 💙 Cultura: el 87% de empleados estamos orgullosos de trabajar en Aegon. Somos una empresa internacional, cercana y empática.   La oportunidad laboral de tu vida  ¿Te gustaría ayudar a las personas a vivir su mejor vida?, es a lo que nos dedicamos en nuestro día a día. Lo logramos gracias a que somos una empresa de personas que cuidan de personas, con curiosidad, conectados con la realidad que nos rodea y centrados en dejar un mundo mejor de como lo hemos encontrado. Siempre aprendemos de nuestros clientes y de las demás personas. ¡Esperamos que te apasione tanto como a nosotros!  Sobre la posición :  Si tienes un perfil de Analista Datos acostumbrado a trabajar con las áreas de negocio donde debes manejar, extraer y controlar gran cantidad de información para apoyar a los diferentes departamentos de la dirección financiera, esto te interesa. Buscamos un profesional que le apasione todo lo relacionado con el dato, de forma que su mayor valor añadido se centre en la generación y tratamiento de información, pero sin perder de vista la integridad y el cuadre de información.  Trabajarás en el soporte al departamento Actuarial en el tratamiento y generación de datos. Realizarás análisis de datos para evaluar la calidad e integridad de los datos reportados a las diferentes áreas Automatizarás y documentarás diferentes procesos de la dirección financiera Desarrollarás el mantenimiento, mejora y enriquecimiento de la información requerida en los reportes trimestrales Trabajarás el cuadre de información Técnica-financiera Analizarás y estudiarás ad-hoc la información contenida en el Data Warehouse corporativo Colaborarás y liderarás en los diferentes proyectos de la dirección financiera (IFRS17, DWH, etc)   Sobre tus habilidades:  Grado/Licenciatura en Estadística, Matemáticas o Informática Conocimientos de SAS, SQL Conocimiento avanzado en Excel, VBA. Valorable conocimiento Python Valorable nivel Alto de Inglés. Experiencia de 2 a 4 años en análisis y tratamiento de datos. Capacidad de orientación al detalle, analista,, innovador y con capacidad de trabajo transversal con otros departamentos

Title: Marketing Manager - Greece
Description: About Revolut  People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of aweso﻿me products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 30+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.  As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 6000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love t﻿urning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.﻿  About The Role  If Revolut is a rocket ship – and we like to think it is – best-in-class creativity is what propels us past the competition in the eyes of our customers. Working with Marketing, Product, Analytics, and just about any other team you can think of, our superstar Creative Managers lead the development of jaw-dropping content and campaign strategies, that demonstrate how beneficial our products are to millions of people.  If that sounds like a blast to you (trust us, it is) come join the #DreamTeam ⭐  We're looking for a #GetItDone creative genius to join the team and take the lead on bringing our #NeverSettle propositions to market as a Marketing Manager for Greece, Malta & Cyprus. Revolut has had some next-level product launches in 2022...we can't say what we'll do next 🤫 but we can guarantee you won't want to miss being a part of it!  You will have an exciting opportunity to work closely with the local management team as well as the global function lead to drive the growth in the market!  Sound interesting? Come join the ride 🚀  What You’ll Be Doing  Identifying user needs by deeply understanding customer behaviour and how our product works globally to create data-driven stories and content to drive conversion Independently driving impactful go-to-market product launches by owning development of audience strategy, value proposition, messaging, positioning, and communication strategies Developing research plans to uncover customer insights, steer, and validate the product and marketing roadmaps, and stay on top of the competitive landscape Working with the marketing team to develop market-leading campaign calendars designed to drive engagement across the entire funnel, from acquisition through to retention Owning tone of voice and style guides for the region, and adapting global campaigns to local nuances Running experiments to test hypotheses and bring analytical rigour to campaigns for informing the go-to-market strategy Delivering campaigns with a strong bias for growth and business impact Scaling creative marketing efforts globally by operationalising resources such as playbooks for regional marketing teams   What You'll Need  3+ years of creative experience in B2C marketing in a fast-paced environment (preferably in a hyper growth global tech company) A passion for Revolut’s products Knowledge of markets and the competitive landscape in the FinTech or payments industry Extensive experience developing stories and compelling content to drive conversion Experience of setting strategic direction and project managing complex campaigns that require input and execution from various cross-functional teams A strong track record in planning and creating editorial and commercial content, as well as developing content strategies, editorial plans, tone of voice, and style guides The ability to analyse and distil data into actionable insights and to inform campaign strategy and product development Excellent communication and interpersonal skills To be a charismatic, people-person with the ability to talk to anyone and work in an ever-changing startup environment Fluency in English & Greek, both verbal and written   Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.  Refer to our Data Privacy Statement for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.
Industry: Servicios de TI y consultoría de TI, Desarrollo de software y Servicios financieros

Title: Senior B2B Content Creator
Description: Join our innovative team as a Senior B2B Content Creator, where you will play a pivotal role in crafting compelling content that resonates with our business-to-business (B2B) audience. With a minimum of 4 years of experience in content creation and a passion for video editing and writing, you can impact our brand's online presence significantly.  Role Overview:  As a Senior B2B Content Creator, you will be a driving force in producing engaging videos and written content that cater to our target B2B audience. You will not be required to appear in videos, but your skills in video editing and writing will be essential to creating impactful content across various platforms. If you are ready to deliver compelling content that resonates with businesses, we invite you to join our team.  Key Responsibilities:  Video Creation: Utilize your editing expertise to create engaging and professional videos aligning with our B2B messaging and goals. Content Generation: Craft well-written and insightful content tailored to our B2B audience, highlighting industry trends, insights, and solutions. Content Strategy: Collaborate with the marketing team to develop and execute a content strategy that drives engagement and resonates with B2B professionals. Social Media Management: Create and post content on various social media platforms, including Instagram, Reels, TikTok, and LinkedIn to enhance brand visibility and engagement. Visual Aesthetics: Maintain a keen eye for visual aesthetics, ensuring that all content is consistent with our brand identity and message. Audience Engagement: Monitor engagement and interactions on social media platforms, responding to comments and messages promptly and professionally. Analytics and Optimization: Analyze content performance metrics and use insights to optimize future content strategies.   Required Skillsets:  Video Editing Proficiency: Demonstrated experience in editing videos using various video editing software. Writing Skills: A passion for writing and a knack for crafting compelling and informative written content. Content Creation Experience: A minimum of 4 years of hands-on experience in creating engaging content for online platforms.   Responsibilities Include, but Are Not Limited To:  Instagram Reels TikTok LinkedIn   Preferred Qualifications:  B2B Industry Knowledge: Familiarity with B2B concepts, trends, and audiences.

Title: ESPECIALISTA DE AGENCIA DE VIAJES EN REMOTO
Description: Nuestra agencia de viajes está buscando agentes de viajes amigables y profesionales para unirse a nuestro equipo. Como agente de viajes, debe ser un apasionado de ver el mundo y ayudar a otros a hacer lo mismo. Este rol implica la planificación de vacaciones, la sugerencia de destinos de viaje, el mantenimiento de archivos de clientes y la gestión de eventos a gran escala.     Su objetivo final será mantener a nuestros clientes satisfechos y leales para futuros servicios. La persona ideal será un excelente comunicador con un profundo conocimiento de los destinos turísticos nacionales e internacionales. Para tener éxito en este puesto, también debe poseer excelentes habilidades de negociación y ventas.     FUNCIONES Y RESPONSABILIDADES:     Organizar viajes para clientes de negocios y de vacaciones. Determinar las necesidades y preferencias de los clientes, como horarios y costos. Planificar y organizar paquetes turísticos, excursiones y viajes de un día. Encuentre información sobre tarifas y horarios. Calcular los costos totales de viaje. Realice reservas para viajes, hoteles, coches de alquiler y eventos especiales, como visitas guiadas y excursiones. Informe a los clientes sobre cómo será su viaje, incluidos los detalles sobre los documentos requeridos, como pasaportes o visas. Brindar consejos sobre las condiciones climáticas locales, las costumbres y las atracciones. Haga arreglos de reserva alternativos si surgen cambios antes o durante el viaje.     BENEFICIOS:     No se necesita experiencia Se brindará capacitación Horarios flexibles     Powered by JazzHR     M0Wn0tX15r

Title: Senior Product Manager (Health) - Fully Remote
Description: Top 3 Reasons To Join Us     Employee Stock Options 100% Remote Insurtech industry leader worldwide     About Us     At CoverGo, our mission is to empower all insurance companies to make insurance 100% digital and accessible to everyone.     We are a leading global no-code insurance platform for health, life, and P&C; We’re the winner of the Insurtech of the Year in all of Asia and other awards globally; We work with insurance enterprise clients such as AXA, Bupa, MSIG, Dai-ichi, Bank of China Group Insurance, and many more; We're an international, diverse team of over 120 people with 34 nationalities and team members working remotely from all over the world; We are fully funded and backed by reputable VC funds and strategic institutional investors; We have offices in the US, Singapore, Hong Kong, UAE and Vietnam; We’ve grown our annualized revenue by over 30x since January 2021; We’re constantly working towards making CoverGo a workplace that you love coming to. We deeply believe that bringing together a diversity of thoughts, expressions, and perspectives is key to building the best culture for equally diverse communities all over the world     What You Will Do:     Product Strategy: Develop and execute a compelling product strategy for our products, aligned with the company's vision and objectives Market Analysis: Conduct market research, analyze industry trends, and gather customer insights to identify opportunities for product innovation and differentiation Product Roadmap: Define and communicate a clear and prioritized product roadmap, considering market dynamics, customer insights, and business goals Requirements Gathering: Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and document detailed product requirements, ensuring a deep understanding of customer pain points and business priorities User Experience: Work closely with design and engineering teams to create exceptional user experiences, employing best practices in user interface (UI) and user experience (UX) design Cross-functional teams collaboration: Work cross-functional teams through iterative development cycles, and ensure timely delivery of high-quality product releases Go-to-market Strategy: Collaborate with finance and marketing teams to establish go-to-market strategies for health insurance products Performance Tracking: Define key performance indicators (KPIs) and implement robust tracking mechanisms to measure product performance, identify areas for improvement, and drive data-driven decision-making Stakeholder Collaboration: Collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders, including executive leadership, sales teams, and industry partners, to drive product adoption and achieve business objectives Any other task as may be assigned     What We Need:     Bachelor's degree in business, computer science, or a related field At least 7 years of insurance product management experience, especially health insurance, prefer to have experience with other insurance products such as life and P&C Solid insurance knowledge is a must, specifically health insurance Demonstrated success in managing the entire product lifecycle, from ideation to launch and post-launch optimization Strong analytical skills, with the ability to gather and interpret market data, customer insights, and competitive intelligence Experience working with cross-functional teams and driving collaboration in an Agile development environment Nice to have experience in working with Jira and Confluence suite of products Excellent English communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders Strategic mindset, with the ability to think long-term and translate vision into actionable plans A critical thinker, an innovator and has good problem-solving skills Results-oriented and data-driven, with a passion for delivering exceptional customer experiences and achieving business objectives     Why You'll Love Working Here     Globally Remote Work Opportunity Local time zone office hours, work by your schedule Paid Time Offs Share Option Plan Performance bonus Company activities & team offsites to exotic locations Training and development plan Covergo Company Video

Title: Beca Analista de Datos y Procesos
Description: ¿QUÉ BUSCAMOS?  Estudiante de Ingeniería / ADE / Económicas o afines con interés y formación en el analisis de datos. Interés en el área de procesos y proyectos, siendo valorable alguna experiencia o proyecto afín realizado en el entorno de los estudios. Persona dinámica, estructurada y orientada a resultados. Posibilidad de realizar convenio de prácticas a través del centro de estudios o la Universidad, estimado para 4 o 6 meses.    FUNCIONES:  Análisis de datos Documentación de los procesos operativos y financieros de Aegon y sus Joint Ventures. Revisión de los procesos documentados actualmente y propuesta de mejoras. Apoyo en el mantenimiento de la cadena de valor. Apoyo en la generación de información para los seguimientos operativos de los diferentes ramos de Aegon y sus JVs.    OFRECEMOS:  Beca remunerada Flexibilidad horaria y de jornada. Queda a tu elección, puedes escoger segun tus preferencias y necesidades. Teletrabajo Días libres

Title: Agente telefónico (TELETRABAJO)
Description: En Konecta avanzamos hacia el futuro y lo hacemos juntos/as, ¡porque todos/as desempeñamos un papel importante en la carrera hacia el éxito!  ¿Cómo lo conseguimos? ¡Jugando en equipo! ¡Y tú, estás a un clic de Konectarte!  ¡Te damos las instrucciones para que también puedas participar!  Lee atentamente los pasos a seguir:  Atreverse a formar parte de nuestro proceso de selección en el que queremos conocer todo tu potencial. Querer pertenecer a nuestro equipo de Televenta, donde desempeñarás las funciones de promoción y ventas para una importante compañía del Sector Digital. Poner todo tu interés y compromiso. Lo único que necesitas es:   3.1 Disponibilidad para formación online del 01/09 al 08/09 en horario de 09-15h  3.2 Ser una persona con capacidad de aprendizaje, resiliencia, escucha activa, empatía, comunicación y orientación al logro.  Beneficios del juego: (condiciones)  Salario: 969 euros brutos al mes + incentivos Contrato: Eventual 30h a la semana (prorrogable) Horario: L-V de 09-15h Modalidad de trabajo: TELETRABAJO   Requisitos:  Ser una persona con capacidad de aprendizaje, resiliencia, escucha activa, empatía, comunicación y orientación al logro.

Title: Business Development Lead
Description: About TrekkSoft     TrekkSoft is a tech centric company in the Tours and Activities industry. For over 10 years it has developed cutting edge booking solutions for activity providers, DMOs and OTAs. We are part of the TrekkSoft Group of companies with which we maintain a close working relationship.     Our team is globally distributed and works together on solving market challenges. We implement a transparent and open management system where individual impact is encouraged. We make the world’s activities bookable by enabling our diverse and exciting client base.     About The Role     TrekkSoft is looking for its next Business Development Lead. This is a senior, hands-on sales role that will spend the majority of time closing deals, but also includes Marketing leadership and team management aspects. You will be taking ownership of two main functions:     First: Senior ABM sales representative, create your own ABM funnel and close target accounts in key territories.     Second: Manage and lead a small Sales & Marketing team, owning the output of the entire team.     You will own the sales pipeline and drive deal closing, primarily through an ABM approach. This requires experience in this area, a strong understanding of digital marketing in the SaaS segment, and passion for the travel industry. It will also require strong experience in driving long cycle lead nurturing with the team, while being able to win difficult deals individually or by supporting team members.     A key function of this role is to build and foster synergies between Marketing and Sales with a focus on generating and qualifying the right leads so that meaningful clients join the service. Do note that most of your time will be spent on first hand selling. In this role, your ability to make an impact in an agile SaaS company should be a primary driver and source of success.     The role reports directly to the COO and CEO.     Responsibilities:     Hands on Sales (roughly 2/3 of your time):     Create and manage your own ABM funnel in key territories (Switzerland, Norway, and others where applicable) through outbound methods. Reach personal sales targets through calling, automation and face to face contact Attend trade shows and other lead generating events Build and nurture long term relationships in the Tour Operator industry.     Sales and Marketing team leadership (roughly 1/3 of your time):     Define the Sales and Marketing approach based on our product, market, and resources. Own the Marketing and Sales sales pipelines of the entire team. Review and refine the sales and marketing processes, building a strong and sustained ABM approach in our core markets. Drive and prioritize the Sales-Marketing planning with the team, with the goal of collaborating on funnel creation and closing deals. Manage a small Sales and Marketing team. Prioritize tasks, lead the Sales and Marketing meetings. Coaching and mentoring, as well as performing periodic performance reviews and bonus tracking for your team Work cross functionally with other departments to feed information on sales focus and product fit. Help define clear USPs for the product Review and report on the Sales and Marketing KPIs to management Use and refine the sales metrics and dashboards to produce insight driven action     Requirements     First hand, 10+ years of experience in a senior outbound / AMB sales role First hand experience with Marketing & Sales planning. Passion for the tourism industry Being a native German speaker is a strong plus. Fluent English is a must Willingness to travel to target regions on a regular basis. Strong experience owning and managing Marketing and Sales pipelines in Hubspot, Salesforce or a similar platform. Strong ability to learn and articulate the functionalities of complex software     Benefits     Competitive salary An opportunity to grow into a hands-on leadership role in Marketing & Sales A full-time contract, with a 6 month trial period Work from our coworking office in Barcelona, fully remote from a different location, or through a combination. We are flexible! Support for online certifications, courses and books Be part of a highly international, motivated and fun team Take the day off on your birthday Join our yearly Team Week in an international location! Participate in TSG Group retreats twice a year to share experiences with leaders from across the groups other companies. Grow in a dynamic and fast-paced environment with lots of opportunities to make an impact

Title: Operations Manager for an Ecommerce Dropshipping Company
Description: Hello, Ecommerce Operations Managers!     My name is Nuno Neto and I am the COO at Seth Media - a fast-growing e-commerce drop shipping company based out of Norway specializing in small consumer goods and lifestyle products that combine innovation, function, and style.     We are looking to hire a motivated, experienced Ecommerce Operations Manager who can oversee and manage the entire drop shipping process from China, ensuring a seamless and efficient supply chain, robust supplier relationships, and effective product management. This role requires a deep understanding of the ecommerce landscape, particularly in dropshipping, and the unique challenges and opportunities presented by sourcing products from China.     This is a full-time remote position.     Requirements     We are looking for a Ecommerce Operations Manager specifically with these requirements:     Excellent written and verbal English communication skills Bachelor’s degree in business, Supply Chain Management, or a related field preferred Minimum of 5 years’ experience in ecommerce operations, with a focus on dropshipping Has at least 3+ experience with Supply chain and dropshipping Proven experience in managing end-to-end supply chains and sourcing products from China Skilled at vendor/supplier onboarding and management Strong leadership and team management abilities Strong negotiation and relationship management skills Proficient in ecommerce platforms and tools Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills     Nice to have:     Fluent in Mandarin     Your responsibilities will include (but are not limited to): Supply Chain Management: Oversee the end-to-end dropshipping process, ensuring timely and cost-effective delivery of products to customers Monitor and analyze supply chain metrics to identify areas of improvement and implement strategies to optimize operations Collaborate with logistics partners to ensure efficient and reliable shipping routes Supplier Management: Establish and maintain strong relationships with suppliers in China Negotiate contracts, terms, and pricing with suppliers to ensure the best quality and cost Conduct regular supplier evaluations to ensure compliance with company standards and continuous improvement Address and resolve any supplier-related issues or disputes Product Management: Oversee the selection, sourcing, and listing of products on the ecommerce platform Collaborate with the marketing team to promote selected products and drive sales Monitor product performance metrics and make data-driven decisions to optimize the product portfolio Ensure product listings are accurate, up-to-date, and aligned with brand standards Quality Assurance: Implement quality control measures to ensure products meet or exceed customer expectations Coordinate with suppliers to address and rectify any product quality issues Monitor customer feedback and returns to identify potential product issues and implement corrective actions Team Leadership: Lead and mentor a team of operations specialists, providing guidance and support as needed Foster a collaborative and results-driven environment within the operations team Conduct regular team meetings to review performance metrics and set goals Strategic Planning: Stay updated with industry trends, challenges, and best practices in dropshipping and ecommerce Collaborate with senior leadership to develop strategic plans and initiatives to grow the business Identify and explore new opportunities for expansion or diversification     Benefits     Growth Opportunities/Perks:     Huge potential for learning and growth in a fast-paced, high-growth company Incentivized growth as you take on more responsibility Health Insurance Fully remote work Flexible working hours Opportunities for bonuses and additional financial incentives     This Position Is Perfect For You If…     You’re an Organized Leader.     Built on integrity and honesty, you're someone the whole team looks up to as a great manager. You are organized enough to make sure that you’re on top of your own goals and responsibilities. You bring your whole personality to work and are willing to engage on a personal level. You put your whole heart into your work and uplift those around you.     You're an Analytical Problem Solver.     You have strong analytical skills and take a data-driven approach to problem-solving. You have sharp attention to detail and can spot inefficiencies in strategies and find creative solutions based on your analysis.     You're an Excellent Communicator     You have excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal skills that allow you to explain complex topics in simple ways. You are able to clearly get your point across and get all stakeholders aligned on a common goal.     What we do:     Please visit our website to get a good understanding of our services:     osmo-official.com     Our hiring process is made up of four parts, so please be aware that you will need to dedicate time for a questionnaire, a video, and two 1-on-1 interviews.     Thank you for taking the time to consider this position. I look forward to hearing from you soon!     Nuno

Title: Product Marketing Manager (Remote within EMEA)
Description: The Company     James Berdigans, CEO of Printify:     “Our mission is to build a platform that lets anyone, anywhere unlock their own personal freedom. The freedom to generate income, be your own boss and set your schedule. So far we’ve seen more than 6 million people sign up to start their own eCommerce businesses with Printify. Because every order is made on-demand, there’s no risk to getting started, just a reward for putting in the work. Our aim is to put this power to build a business into the hands of every person who wants to create their own business.”     On September 9th, 2021, Printify announced that it has secured $50M in Series A funding led by Index Ventures, with participation from H&M Group, Virgin Group, founders of leading technology companies Wise, Vinted, Squarespace, RedHat, and the entertainment industry investors such as Will Smith’s Dreamers VC.     Printify will use this investment to further expand its marketplace and to hire the best talents available around the world.     The Team     The Product Marketing team sits at the convergence of product, sales, and acquisitions, and is a key element in driving our users' success and growth.     The Role     As a Product Marketing Manager, you will be driving go-to-market and growth strategies across different teams, identifying growth opportunities, and driving user insights. You’ll collaborate closely with product, sales, and acquisitions.     Your responsibilities     Work closely with the Product team on go-to-market and growth strategies for different features and product areas Drive and execute marketing plans and campaigns across sales, success, and acquisitions Report on Product Marketing initiatives performance, being accountable for results and impact Stay informed of the trends in the industry and competitive landscape Drive user insights, both quantitative and qualitative, including data analysis and running surveys or other research needs in collaboration with the research team Identify growth opportunities and proactively look for ways how to improve Printify's offering   Minimum Qualifications     6+ years of experience in Product Marketing, Marketing Strategy, or related field within a software company Experience working with cross-functional teams and stakeholders at all levels of an organization Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to articulate complex ideas and strategies to a diverse audience Good understanding of marketing performance indicators   Preferred Qualifications     Experience collaborating with product managers in shaping new features and launching these to market Experience in e-commerce Strong project management skills Problem-solving and data-driven mindset Ability to work independently, having a proactive approach with a get-things-done attitude Ability to prioritize effectively Ability to influence without authority Being comfortable with remote work setup and async collaboration Experience with user research   What we offer     Stock options so you own a part of Printify Opportunity to work fully remote within EMEA time zones Work from anywhere - our Printify Houses in Riga or Tallinn, your remote home office, or a co-working hub Start your workday anywhere between 7 AM and 11 AM. As long as the job is done and you’re happy and healthy, you can adapt your workflow Apple MacBook laptop as your standard work equipment, covered by Printify International relocation support for international candidates who wish to work in Riga or Tallinn Access to mentorship, internal meetups, and hackathons both on-site and online A learning budget for your professional development based on a position level and access to our book library Health insurance or health insurance budget depending on your location and contract type Paid health days whenever you need them without a doctor's note depending on your contract type Extra paid days off for wellbeing as well as a celebration day of your choosing Access to the in-house gym or gym allowance depending on your location and contract type   Joining Printify means joining an international company with an amazing team that has grown to over 500 people. At Printify, people from over 20 nationalities and with many different backgrounds are working together in our Riga office and around the world.     We play to win together, and we always strive for excellence. We want to achieve great things and make a meaningful change in our customers’ lives. Our customers are our most important asset and our compass in showing us the direction to go. We value a strong learning culture and are united by a growth mindset.     Words from our investors:     Richard Branson, Founder of the Virgin Group: “Entrepreneurial spirit runs through the Virgin Group, which is why I’m proud to support Printify. Both Printify’s vision and success story to date embed this special entrepreneurial spirit, which in turn has created a rapidly growing and robust e-commerce platform. Printify’s unique proposition helps people market their brands through customizable products, with no upfront investment. We’re excited to support its growth in the coming years.”     Elise Fahlen, Investment Manager at H&M CO:LAB: “With the world experiencing rapid growth in on-demand services, H&M Group is thrilled to have invested in Printify and the team behind it. The execution of the founder’s vision and their impressive success to date speaks not only to the scalability of the product but also in their ability to be a long-standing industry leader in this space.”     Dino Becirovic, Principal at Index Ventures: "Printify is the leading marketplace for on-demand manufacturing, offering the largest selection of products and print providers. They have removed all the barriers to product creation and enabled over 2 million creators to launch successful merchandise businesses at the push of a button. Over time, as more manufacturers come online and more methods become available, Printify will allow any creator to bring their wildest product ideas to reality.”
Industry: Transporte, logística, cadena de suministro y almacenamiento

Title: Sales Development Representative
Description: Canonical es una empresa global que prioriza el trabajo remoto, es la editora de Ubuntu y soluciones empresariales de código abierto para la nube, desarrolladores, IoT e IA. Ubuntu es la distribución de Linux de más rápido crecimiento y se ubica como el sistema operativo número uno en la nube.     En asociación con Google, Amazon, IBM y Microsoft, Canonical ayuda a las empresas a ser más ágiles, productivas y a adoptar nuevas tecnologías más rápidamente. Ejemplos de éxito de los clientes incluyen IA, Blockchain, IoT, robótica avanzada y vehículos autónomos, donde Ubuntu es la plataforma de desarrollo preferida.     El papel de un representante de desarrollo de ventas en Canonical     Canonical es rentable y está creciendo. Consideramos que nuestra organización de desarrollo de ventas es la mejor academia de ventas de tecnología del mercado y, como tal, seleccionamos candidatos excepcionales y ambiciosos para unirse a nuestro equipo. Disfrutarás de este papel si eres organizado, persistente, carismático y trabajador. Deberás estar interesado en la tecnología y sus implicaciones comerciales. En este puesto, colaborarás con un equipo regional de ventas y marketing, y tu objetivo principal es encontrar proyectos de clientes que se ajusten a nuestras líneas de productos y difundir el buen nombre de Canonical en múltiples industrias y geografías diferentes.     Haz clic AQUÍ para ver a nuestro equipo SDR discutir su papel en Canonical     Cómo será tu día     Manejar las consultas entrantes de los clientes a través de correo electrónico, teléfono y chat. Ejecutar campañas salientes de ventas y marketing. Viajar a eventos y conferencias en todo el mundo, presentar en stands e impulsar oportunidades de marketing y ventas cara a cara. Colaborar entre múltiples equipos y partes interesadas de alto nivel para impulsar resultados. Trabajar directamente con marketing en campañas. Investigar información sobre clientes potenciales. Generar un pipeline de varios millones Identificar perspectivas y tendencias del mercado. Ayudar a definir los procesos y políticas del equipo. Servir de enlace con clientes nuevos y existentes, organizando y asistiendo a reuniones mientras mapea activamente cuentas para identificar nuevas oportunidades. Crear, actualizar, mantener y fomentar con precisión clientes potenciales en oportunidades globales.     Lo que buscamos en ti     Excelentes resultados académicos en la escuela y la universidad. Pasión por los negocios y la tecnología. Compromiso con el aprendizaje y la mejora continua: curioso, flexible, científico. Resolución creativa de problemas y colaboración entre equipos. Habilidades de comunicación verbal y escrita. Impulsado por resultados con un espíritu de superación Persistencia y perseverancia     Que te ofrecemos     Tu salario base dependerá de varios factores, incluida su ubicación geográfica, nivel de experiencia, conocimientos y habilidades. Además de los beneficios anteriores, ciertos roles también son elegibles para beneficios y recompensas adicionales, incluidas bonificaciones anuales e incentivos de ventas basados en los ingresos o la utilización. Nuestra filosofía de compensación es garantizar la equidad en toda nuestra fuerza laboral global.     Además de un salario base competitivo, brindamos a todos los miembros del equipo beneficios adicionales que reflejan nuestros valores e ideales. Ten en cuenta que pueden aplicarse beneficios adicionales según el lugar de trabajo y, para obtener más información al respecto, consulte a su socio de talento.     Presupuesto de aprendizaje y desarrollo personal de 2000 USD al año. Revisión anual de compensación Recompensas de reconocimiento Vacaciones anuales Licencia parental Programa de asistencia al empleado Oportunidad de viajar a nuevas ubicaciones para conocer colegas en "sprints" Priority Pass para viajes y mejoras de viaje para eventos de empresa de larga distancia     Canonical es un empleador que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades     Estamos orgullosos de fomentar un lugar de trabajo libre de discriminación. La diversidad de experiencias, perspectivas y antecedentes crean un mejor ambiente de trabajo y mejores productos. Cualquiera que sea su identidad, le daremos a su solicitud una consideración justa.

Title: Técnico/a de laboratorio químico
Description: En Classgap estamos buscando técnicos de laboratorio para que compartan sus conocimientos dando clases particulares online de química.     ¿Te gustaría ganar un dinero extra?     Si tienes conocimiento de química, empieza a dar clases online y ayuda a los alumnos a alcanzar sus metas. No se requiere experiencia previa como profesor pero sí mucha motivación. Inscríbete ahora y empieza a generar ingresos en 48h.     VENTAJAS:     Flexibilidad horaria Posibilidad de teletrabajo / en remoto Podrás establecer el precio de tus clases
