Title: Consultor Selección RRHH
Description: Profesional con formación en Psicología con experiencia en gestión de procesos de selección de clientes en diferentes tipos de perfiles.     Conocimientos de evaluación de soft skills     Iniciativa e imaginación para entrentarse a nuevos retos     Tareas     Gestión de clientes     Gestión de candidatos     Assessment de candidatos y orientación profesional en skills a los mismos     Entrevistas de evaluación y de orientación     Briefing con clientes     Identificación de perfiles     Reconocimiento de skills e identificación de mapas de Talento     Requisitos     Psicología     C1 Inglés     Experiencia en RRHH     Beneficios     Incorporación a un proyecto innovador en RRHH     Herramientas y tecnología líderes en gestión de Talento     Equipo dinámico y en continuo aprendizaje     Metodlogías agiles en el día día de la actividad     100% remoto     Flexibilidad     Plan de comisiones muy atractivo por cumplimiento de objetivos

Title: Freelance Recruiter
Description: IntRec is an innovative global employee recruitment assessment service provider with operations currently in Poland, the United Kingdom, and Spain. We help companies hire smarter and better using AI Recruitment solutions.     We are looking for experienced recruitment professionals to work as Freelance Recruiters on a full-time or part-time basis, with excellent promotion and earning potential based on commission. You have the option of working from home or from our offices.     We are looking for ambitious people who are interested in recruiting.     Prior recruitment experience is preferred in the Sales, SSC, and BPO sectors, but other recruitment experiences are acceptable.     Role And Responsibilities     Manage full-cycle recruitment. Source, screen, schedule, conduct interviews, and process all prospective candidates. Source jobs offers from companies and hiring managers. Conduct final video interviews with candidates. Actively source candidates for open positions/roles using all possible recruitment methods – web portals, postings, social networks, databases, referrals, and contacts.     Required Skills     Manage hiring managers' expectations. Capable of communicating effectively at all levels. Capable of working successfully in both a team and independently. A proactive and hands-on approach to work. Collaborate with hiring managers to collect requirements and create effective recruiting strategies.     Required Experience     Minimum of 1-3 years of recruiting experience. Sale, BPO or SSC recruitment experience preferred. Extensive sourcing experience using social networks, research, and personal network. Fluency in both Spanish and English. A good working knowledge of Microsoft Office.     What You Get From IntRec     We will provide our AI Recruitment solution. Our software enables the automation of Personality analysis, Aptitude and skills testing, competency analysis, and structured video interviews. All recruitment back-office support: contracts, billing, and legal support. Training on how to use our IntRec.     This is an entrepreneurial position. In this position, you can use your own initiative to make a difference and achieve your financial and personal goals. Additionally, you can expect a highly motivated team spirit in a work culture influenced by individuality and the appreciation of each person’s desire to be successful. IntRec is a startup with a relatively flat hierarchy and an emphasis on simply having fun.     You can expect a very competitive compensation model. As a result, good performance is directly reflected in the monthly commissions that you can earn at IntRec.     Contact / Application     If you meet the desired requirements and are interested in being a part of the IntRec teams, please simply submit your details and upload your CV online, indicating your earliest possible start date.     Thanks a lot for your time and we look forward to receiving your application!     Your IntRec Team

Title: Sales Development Representative
Description: Canonical es una empresa global que prioriza el trabajo remoto, es la editora de Ubuntu y soluciones empresariales de código abierto para la nube, desarrolladores, IoT e IA. Ubuntu es la distribución de Linux de más rápido crecimiento y se ubica como el sistema operativo número uno en la nube.     En asociación con Google, Amazon, IBM y Microsoft, Canonical ayuda a las empresas a ser más ágiles, productivas y a adoptar nuevas tecnologías más rápidamente. Ejemplos de éxito de los clientes incluyen IA, Blockchain, IoT, robótica avanzada y vehículos autónomos, donde Ubuntu es la plataforma de desarrollo preferida.     El papel de un representante de desarrollo de ventas en Canonical     Canonical es rentable y está creciendo. Consideramos que nuestra organización de desarrollo de ventas es la mejor academia de ventas de tecnología del mercado y, como tal, seleccionamos candidatos excepcionales y ambiciosos para unirse a nuestro equipo. Disfrutarás de este papel si eres organizado, persistente, carismático y trabajador. Deberás estar interesado en la tecnología y sus implicaciones comerciales. En este puesto, colaborarás con un equipo regional de ventas y marketing, y tu objetivo principal es encontrar proyectos de clientes que se ajusten a nuestras líneas de productos y difundir el buen nombre de Canonical en múltiples industrias y geografías diferentes.     Haz clic AQUÍ para ver a nuestro equipo SDR discutir su papel en Canonical     Cómo será tu día     Manejar las consultas entrantes de los clientes a través de correo electrónico, teléfono y chat. Ejecutar campañas salientes de ventas y marketing. Viajar a eventos y conferencias en todo el mundo, presentar en stands e impulsar oportunidades de marketing y ventas cara a cara. Colaborar entre múltiples equipos y partes interesadas de alto nivel para impulsar resultados. Trabajar directamente con marketing en campañas. Investigar información sobre clientes potenciales. Generar un pipeline de varios millones Identificar perspectivas y tendencias del mercado. Ayudar a definir los procesos y políticas del equipo. Servir de enlace con clientes nuevos y existentes, organizando y asistiendo a reuniones mientras mapea activamente cuentas para identificar nuevas oportunidades. Crear, actualizar, mantener y fomentar con precisión clientes potenciales en oportunidades globales.     Lo que buscamos en ti     Excelentes resultados académicos en la escuela y la universidad. Pasión por los negocios y la tecnología. Compromiso con el aprendizaje y la mejora continua: curioso, flexible, científico. Resolución creativa de problemas y colaboración entre equipos. Habilidades de comunicación verbal y escrita. Impulsado por resultados con un espíritu de superación Persistencia y perseverancia     Que te ofrecemos     Tu salario base dependerá de varios factores, incluida su ubicación geográfica, nivel de experiencia, conocimientos y habilidades. Además de los beneficios anteriores, ciertos roles también son elegibles para beneficios y recompensas adicionales, incluidas bonificaciones anuales e incentivos de ventas basados en los ingresos o la utilización. Nuestra filosofía de compensación es garantizar la equidad en toda nuestra fuerza laboral global.     Además de un salario base competitivo, brindamos a todos los miembros del equipo beneficios adicionales que reflejan nuestros valores e ideales. Ten en cuenta que pueden aplicarse beneficios adicionales según el lugar de trabajo y, para obtener más información al respecto, consulte a su socio de talento.     Presupuesto de aprendizaje y desarrollo personal de 2000 USD al año. Revisión anual de compensación Recompensas de reconocimiento Vacaciones anuales Licencia parental Programa de asistencia al empleado Oportunidad de viajar a nuevas ubicaciones para conocer colegas en "sprints" Priority Pass para viajes y mejoras de viaje para eventos de empresa de larga distancia     Canonical es un empleador que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades     Estamos orgullosos de fomentar un lugar de trabajo libre de discriminación. La diversidad de experiencias, perspectivas y antecedentes crean un mejor ambiente de trabajo y mejores productos. Cualquiera que sea su identidad, le daremos a su solicitud una consideración justa.

Title: International Regional Manager - Spain
Description: Massive Bio is a rapidly growing health-tech startup founded in 2015 to provide every cancer patient with access to clinical trials regardless of their location or financial stability. Our proprietary patient recruitment and enrollment enablement solution for oncology clinical trials solves every friction point in traditional clinical trial enrollment. Privately held and headquartered in NY City, our passionate changemaker team is looking for an International Regional Manager to join our team in Spain. As a member of the business development team, the Regional Manager will be key to focus on Massive Bio's clinical trial enrollment services and the development of Massive Bio's growth efforts in all markets. The ideal candidate will have experience in Biotech/Pharma and the healthcare environment.     Reporting to the Director of International Partnerships, you will:     Handpick your dream team! Partner strategically with top-tier physicians, state-of-the-art hospitals, innovative CROs, and trailblazing health systems. Make them part of Massive Bio's elite provider network. Empower and supercharge our partners, zealous patient advocates, and provider engagement teams. Analyze, optimize, and reinvent for unparalleled success. Be the driving force behind skyrocketing international enrollment rates. Every day is an opportunity to make a difference. Seize opportunities to mingle with physicians and providers, constantly broadening our influential network. Command the P&Ls with finesse, maximizing profits and minimizing losses across diverse terrains. Become the compass for our marketing teams, guiding them with continuous feedback and razor-sharp strategic plans. Push the boundaries! Contribute to Massive Bio’s trailblazing initiatives. Spot the goldmines and sprint towards unmatched growth opportunities, ensuring a stellar ROI.     Candidate Profile:     BS/BA degree or equivalent experience. 5+ years’ experience in channel partnership development or business development in oncology/hematology healthcare tech, healthcare, or pharma companies. Exceptional relationship-building skills. Fluent in English and native in the local language. Preferably, familiarity with medical terminology and health care systems. Able to adapt to situations quickly, with a start-up mindset. Flexible in traveling internationally, 50%+ travel. Excellent overall communication skills. Thrive in a fast-paced environment. Proactive, passionate about client work, detail and quality oriented, comfortable with ambiguity, data-driven, and growth mindset. Living in Spain. Candidate who work permit in Spain.     Powered by JazzHR     OaLvu62tvV

Title: Recruitment Manager
Description: IntRec is an innovative global employee recruitment assessment service provider with operations currently in Poland, the United Kingdom, and Spain. We help companies hire smarter and better using AI Recruitment solutions     Why join IntRec?     Being part of a modern company that is the future of recruitment - our mission is to improve recruitment intelligently. Be part of the "Future of Works"—join the company that is creating a modern hiring method. Work from wherever you want in a successful multicultural start-up— opportunity to join an early-stage tech startup.     As part of our growth strategy, we are seeking to hire a Recruitment Manager for Spain     Job Requirements     A minimum 5 years of recruiting experience preferred Ability to communicate with executives at the mid-level, senior-level, or C-level. Ability to articulate the value of Intelligent Recruitment methods passionately and clearly Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing, in English and Spanish. Demonstrated ability to establish effective and cooperative working relationships built on trust Excellent organizational and time management skills Comfortable making decisions independently Working knowledge of applicant tracking systems Proficient in Microsoft Office Working knowledge of interview techniques and applicant screening methods and ability to learn new recruitment methods Understanding of employment laws and regulations Familiar with a wide variety of sourcing methods A team-player attitude with a desire to improve internal processes beyond your day-to-day tasks. A positive, can-do attitude     Nice To Have     Own client database Team management experience     Do you want to create a new story of intelligent recruitment with us? Apply now!     Benefits     A competitive base salary (20–25k/year) plus a bonus Remote work (and the possibility to meet with the team at various team-building activities) Opportunities for Growth, Promotions, and Development (we’re a start-up company—things happen fast!) Work based on an employment contract od B2B cooperation All tools necessary for the work Flexible working hours Work with an international team. Being part of a team that has a real impact on shaping the recruitment industry     Responsibilities     Comprehensive management of recruitment processes Screen candidates by reviewing resumes and job applications and performing phone screenings. Take ownership of the candidate experience by designing and managing job postings, job descriptions, and position requirements. Perform reference checks as needed. Facilitate the offer process by extending the offer and negotiating employment terms. Oversee the onboarding and new hire process. Stay abreast of recruiting trends and best practices. Manage the overall interview, selection, and closing processes. Cooperation with the Business Development Department in the preparation of cooperation offers Building positive relationships with clients Ensure all screening, hiring, and selection are done in accordance with employment laws and regulations.

Title: Copywriter (Core)
Description: About Revolut  People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of aweso﻿me products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 30+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.  As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 6000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love t﻿urning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.﻿  About The Role  Communication is our middle name. We love it – and we hope you do too! 😍  We’re looking for a passionate writer who knows just what to say to make customers actually want to open their emails. You’re a master of marketing. You’re an eagle-eyed editor. You can talk the talk in our tone of voice. You’re a pro at working with all types of people from all different places, to ensure customers have seamless experiences across the Revolut brand. 🌟  From brand, through people, to product, our Copywriting team defines our tone of voice and strategic messaging, delivering A-game copy that will make customers so excited they can’t wait to get their next email ✍️  If your hand is waving frenetically, then we want you on our Dream Team! 👋  Intrigued? As you should be! Apply below for more info 👇  What You’ll Be Doing  Developing compelling narratives about Revolut and our products Producing best-in-class comms across a variety of channels Editing and proofreading copy from around the company to ensure accuracy and adherence to our style guide and TOV Working closely with product, product marketing, and design teams to create stand-out content that ‘wow’ our customers   What You'll Need  Native level of English writing, speaking, and editing skills 2+ years of experience in b2c marketing, advertising, or content creation The ability to write for different audiences and channels A flexible, self-starter mindset — can manage workload, processes, and priorities independently Ability to work well with a variety of stakeholders, from legal to localisation   Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.  Refer to our Data Privacy Statement for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.
Industry: Servicios de TI y consultoría de TI, Desarrollo de software y Servicios financieros

Title: Training Manager, CO2
Description: Energy Recovery (NASDAQ: ERII) creates technologies that solve complex challenges for industrial fluid-flow markets worldwide. Building on our pressure exchanger technology platform, we design and manufacture solutions that make industrial processes more efficient and sustainable. What began as a game-changing invention for desalination has grown into a global business advancing the environmental sustainability of customers’ operations in multiple industries. Headquartered in the San Francisco Bay Area, Energy Recovery has manufacturing, research and development facilities across California and Texas with sales and on-site technical support available globally. For more information, please visit www.energyrecovery.com.     Job Summary:     Energy Recovery, Inc. is seeking a qualified candidate for an immediate full-time job opening for the position of Training Manager, CO2. This position is within the CO2 Business unit and reports directly to the Senior Director, Product Management, CO2.     The Training Manager is responsible for creating a cohesive workforce that understands how to work efficiently and meet company goals. The primary responsibility of the position is to train internal and external stakeholders on company’s CO2 products. This includes building training materials in collaboration with multiple departments of the organization, working collaboratively multiple trade partners to ensure smooth delivery of the training program and delivering the training material and courses to the internal and stakeholders. The Training Manager is expected to seek continuous feedback from the training recipients and will be responsible for continuous improvement of the training material. The Training Manager is required to coordinate with other trainers within the organization and ensure smooth functioning of the Training group.We are looking for a high-caliber candidate who enjoys working hard on important projects, in highly collaborative teams, and who has a proven record of achieving results.     A strong candidate will be an experienced Field Services CO2 operator with strong understanding of skill sets necessary to make a commercial and industrial CO2 system function. Along with technical skills, excellent communication skills, and meticulous attention to detail is desired. The exceptional candidate should be self-driven, motivated and seek for new ways to improve the training efficiency.     Major Duties & Responsibilities:     Assess current training materials and identify strategy to improve training materials Work collaboratively with multiple departments to develop optimal training material Keep training material up to date conforming to the new product development Work with industry partners to tailor training material that suits the need to each individual business partner Ensure scheduling of regular training sessions Ensure smooth delivery of training materials in the training sessions Coordinate with other trainers for smooth functioning of the training division Oversee in-house and external training Evaluate the effectiveness of training courses and make adjustments when necessary Provide summary reports to management, outlining the impact of training on employee skills and corporate goals All other projects and duties as assigned   Required Knowledge and Skills     B.S. or higher in engineering or technical field is desired. However, candidates with strong hands-on field experience will be prioritized 5-8 years of Field Services experience in Refrigeration and/ or Heat Pump Industry is required Familiarity with refrigeration system architecture and design methodology is strongly desired Knowledge of Controls Systems of commercial and industrial refrigeration systems is strongly desired 3+ years of experience as a trainer/ coach Proven success in utilizing and implementing instructional design theory Familiar with both traditional and modern job training methods, trends and techniques Outstanding communication and organizational skills Strong customer-centric mindset – understanding customer’s requirements and ability to think like a customer is required Ability to adapt to a dynamic environment Skilled in customer/stakeholder relationship management, business planning, teamwork, and execution Fluency in spoken and written English is required. Knowledge to carry on business in either of French, German and/ or Spanish is additional bonus Valid Passport and ability to travel internationally Basic time management skills and knowledge of business software platforms (Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint etc.) Availability to travel up to 50% of the time (domestic and international)   We are an EOE/AA employer committed to workforce diversity.     No recruiters or phone calls.
Industry: Transporte, logística, cadena de suministro y almacenamiento

Title: Key Account Manager (muebles diseño)
Description: Responsable sector empresa (contrucción y reformas)     Somos una consultoría de selección especializada en retail, wholesale & eCommerce que trabaja con las mejores empresas del sector.     Estamos colaborando con uno de nuestros clientes en la búsqueda de un perfil de Key Account Manager para Madrid aunque llevará varias zonas de España y de Portugal.     Trabajarás a nivel nacional principalmente para conseguir nuevos clientes, que compren los productos asesorándoles y realizando presupuestación, seguimiento, fidelización pero principalmente prospección y búsqueda de nuevas oportunidades.     Participar en nuestros eventos de ventas internacionales, reuniones y ferias comerciales, así como ser proactivo/a para la introducción de nuevos productos en el mercado.     ¿QUÉ REQUISITOS SE SOLICITAN?     Que ofrecemos?     Retribución acorde a las responsabilidades >30K Variables en funcion de objetivos. Aprox 10% Mutua médica (75%) Coche de empresa y gastos Posición indefinida Empresa sólida, multinacional y referente en el sector. Inicialmente teletrabajo 100%     Requisitos para el puesto:     Experiencia como KAM más de 3 años. Imprescindible experiencia en el sector solicitado. Nivel de inglés fluido Experiencia y contactos con el mundo de interiorismo, muebles, decoración, etc. Carnet de conducir.     Si crees que tienes el perfil, ¡inscríbete!

Title: Frontend Developer - (100% Teletrabajo)
Description: En Digital Preventor buscamos sumar a nuestro equipo un desarrollador frontend. Si eres apasionado por crear interfaces web interactivas y visualmente atractivas y posees un sólido conocimiento de HTML CSS y JavaScript ¡nos encantaría conocerte!     Responsabilidades y requisitos     Colaborar estrechamente con el equipo de diseño para traducir los conceptos visuales en soluciones técnicas viables. Conocimientos de UX/UI para crear junto con ellos interfaces intuitivas y agradables para los usuarios. Utilizar HTML CSS y JavaScript para estructurar el contenido de las páginas de manera semántica y accesible y crear interfaces atractivas dinámicas y coherentes. Conocimiento profundo de preprocesadores de CSS como SASS y LESS. Experiencia demostrable en el desarrollo de aplicaciones web utilizando TypeScript y Angular para construir componentes módulos servicios directivas y enrutamiento en aplicaciones web complejas. Habilidad para crear interfaces web responsive que funcionen sin problemas en una variedad de dispositivos y tamaños de pantalla. Capacidad para optimizar el rendimiento de aplicaciones web para una carga rápida y una experiencia eficiente. Familiaridad con herramientas de desarrollo web como Visual Studio Code y capacidades de depuración. Saber optimizar el rendimiento de las aplicaciones web incluida la carga rápida de páginas y la eficiencia en el consumo de recursos. Comprensión de conceptos básicos de HTTP y experiencia en el consumo de APIs. Familiaridad con sistemas de control de versiones especialmente Git para colaborar con otros miembros del equipo y mantener un flujo de trabajo organizado.     Experiencia en integración continua (CI) y familiaridad con herramientas como Jenkins Travis etc.     Conocimiento de .NET Core y SQL para comprender el backend.     Pasión por mantenerse al día con las últimas tendencias y tecnologías frontend.     Te ofrecemos un entorno de trabajo colaborativo donde podrás contribuir al desarrollo de proyectos y mejorar tus habilidades en un equipo diverso y apasionado. Si cumples con estos requisitos y estás listo para ser parte de nuestro equipo ¡esperamos tu solicitud!     HTML, CSS, JavaScript, CSS ,SASS, LESS , Angular, TypeScript,     a8f61d6942cd235a9349
Industry: Servicios de TI y consultoría de TI

Title: Especialista No Code
Description: We are hiring!     Estamos buscando a una persona apasionada por el diseño y desarrollo de Soluciones No Code.     Esta persona será el referente en Kelea en la aplicación práctica de este tipo de herramientas tanto para su uso en nuestros proyectos de consultoría como aplicaciones internas.     Como especialista su responsabilidad principal será mantenerse actualizado sobre tendencias digitales y herramientas aplicables a nuestro negocio y organización.     Requisitos:     ¿Qué experiencia y formación necesitamos que aporte esta persona?     Experiencia previa en el diseño y desarrollo de soluciones No Code utilizando plataformas como Flutterflow, AppSheet, Airtable, Bubble, etc. Conocimiento de metodologías y enfoques ágiles de trabajo, especialmente en el ámbito de desarrollo de software. Capacidad para comprender y analizar las necesidades de negocio y traducirlas en soluciones técnicas No Code. Habilidades sólidas de resolución de problemas y pensamiento analítico. Experiencia en integración de sistemas y APIs, así como en la creación de flujos de trabajo automatizados (ej. Zapier, Make, Power Automate…) Habilidades de comunicación verbal y escrita para interactuar externa e internamente. Conocimiento general de tecnologías y tendencias de transformación digital.     Suma puntos:     Experiencia previa en puesto similar Experiencia específica con Smartsheet Conocimientos sobre UI/UX     ¿Por qué Kelea?     Estas son algunas de las cosas que visibilizan nuestro foco en las personas:     ◼ Tenemos una estructura plana basada en círculos donde los líderes tienen una concepción de líder y no de jefe.     ◼ Bolsa de formación. Tendrás una bolsa de formación de 2.000 € que se gestiona de forma conjunta y que te ayudará a desarrollarte profesionalmente incorporando nuevos conocimientos que te ayudarán a asumir nuevas responsabilidades (formaciones, certificaciones, eventos, etc).     ◼ Plan de mentoring, para que puedas apoyarte en un compañero con experiencia desde tu llegada al equipo.     ◼ 24 días de vacaciones laborales: 22 días que podrás distribuir como tú quieras coordinándote en tu proyecto + 24 y 31 de diciembre (y si como en este año 2023 caen en día no laboral, no te preocupes que no los vas a perder, tendrás libre el día anterior hábil 😉).     ◼ Jornada intensiva de 8h a 15h en verano (julio y agosto) y en Navidades (del 26 de diciembre al 5 de enero).     ◼ Tenemos un modelo de Profit Sharing, repartiendo entre el grupo parte de los beneficios de la compañía. Lo que conseguimos lo conseguimos en equipo.     ◼ Un kit de teletrabajo para que puedas trabajar desde donde tú quieras.     ◼ Participarás activamente en la estrategia de Kelea. Cada 6 meses nos reunimos presencialmente para trabajar en nuestra estrategia.     ◼Creemos en la fuerza de la inteligencia colectiva por encima de la individual.     ¿Te apetece conocernos?

Title: Profesor de Español para Extranjeros
Description: En Tusclasesparticulares, portal líder de Educación en España, necesitamos profesores/as para dar clases particulares de español.     ¿Te gustaría ganar hasta 450€/semana dando clases este verano? ¡Te estamos esperando!     Tareas     > Evaluar el nivel de conocimiento del estudiante     > Preparar las clases según el nivel del estudiante     Requisitos     > No se requiere experiencia previa como profesor     > Compromiso con los estudiantes     > Nivel elevado de español     Beneficios     > Flexibilidad horaria     > Posibilidad de teletrabajo / trabajo desde casa     > Salario: 15€ a 30€/hora     ¿A qué esperas para apuntarte?

Title: Sales Development Representative
Description: Canonical es una empresa global que prioriza el trabajo remoto, es la editora de Ubuntu y soluciones empresariales de código abierto para la nube, desarrolladores, IoT e IA. Ubuntu es la distribución de Linux de más rápido crecimiento y se ubica como el sistema operativo número uno en la nube.     En asociación con Google, Amazon, IBM y Microsoft, Canonical ayuda a las empresas a ser más ágiles, productivas y a adoptar nuevas tecnologías más rápidamente. Ejemplos de éxito de los clientes incluyen IA, Blockchain, IoT, robótica avanzada y vehículos autónomos, donde Ubuntu es la plataforma de desarrollo preferida.     El papel de un representante de desarrollo de ventas en Canonical     Canonical es rentable y está creciendo. Consideramos que nuestra organización de desarrollo de ventas es la mejor academia de ventas de tecnología del mercado y, como tal, seleccionamos candidatos excepcionales y ambiciosos para unirse a nuestro equipo. Disfrutarás de este papel si eres organizado, persistente, carismático y trabajador. Deberás estar interesado en la tecnología y sus implicaciones comerciales. En este puesto, colaborarás con un equipo regional de ventas y marketing, y tu objetivo principal es encontrar proyectos de clientes que se ajusten a nuestras líneas de productos y difundir el buen nombre de Canonical en múltiples industrias y geografías diferentes.     Haz clic AQUÍ para ver a nuestro equipo SDR discutir su papel en Canonical     Cómo será tu día     Manejar las consultas entrantes de los clientes a través de correo electrónico, teléfono y chat. Ejecutar campañas salientes de ventas y marketing. Viajar a eventos y conferencias en todo el mundo, presentar en stands e impulsar oportunidades de marketing y ventas cara a cara. Colaborar entre múltiples equipos y partes interesadas de alto nivel para impulsar resultados. Trabajar directamente con marketing en campañas. Investigar información sobre clientes potenciales. Generar un pipeline de varios millones Identificar perspectivas y tendencias del mercado. Ayudar a definir los procesos y políticas del equipo. Servir de enlace con clientes nuevos y existentes, organizando y asistiendo a reuniones mientras mapea activamente cuentas para identificar nuevas oportunidades. Crear, actualizar, mantener y fomentar con precisión clientes potenciales en oportunidades globales.     Lo que buscamos en ti     Excelentes resultados académicos en la escuela y la universidad. Pasión por los negocios y la tecnología. Compromiso con el aprendizaje y la mejora continua: curioso, flexible, científico. Resolución creativa de problemas y colaboración entre equipos. Habilidades de comunicación verbal y escrita. Impulsado por resultados con un espíritu de superación Persistencia y perseverancia     Que te ofrecemos     Tu salario base dependerá de varios factores, incluida su ubicación geográfica, nivel de experiencia, conocimientos y habilidades. Además de los beneficios anteriores, ciertos roles también son elegibles para beneficios y recompensas adicionales, incluidas bonificaciones anuales e incentivos de ventas basados en los ingresos o la utilización. Nuestra filosofía de compensación es garantizar la equidad en toda nuestra fuerza laboral global.     Además de un salario base competitivo, brindamos a todos los miembros del equipo beneficios adicionales que reflejan nuestros valores e ideales. Ten en cuenta que pueden aplicarse beneficios adicionales según el lugar de trabajo y, para obtener más información al respecto, consulte a su socio de talento.     Presupuesto de aprendizaje y desarrollo personal de 2000 USD al año. Revisión anual de compensación Recompensas de reconocimiento Vacaciones anuales Licencia parental Programa de asistencia al empleado Oportunidad de viajar a nuevas ubicaciones para conocer colegas en "sprints" Priority Pass para viajes y mejoras de viaje para eventos de empresa de larga distancia     Canonical es un empleador que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades     Estamos orgullosos de fomentar un lugar de trabajo libre de discriminación. La diversidad de experiencias, perspectivas y antecedentes crean un mejor ambiente de trabajo y mejores productos. Cualquiera que sea su identidad, le daremos a su solicitud una consideración justa.

Title: Customer Success Specialist (Italian)
Description: Who we are     Motive Commerce Search is a plug & play search solution designed to deliver exceptional experiences for shoppers and shop owners alike. The easy to install plugin - available on Prestashop and WooCommerce - is built on technology developed by our sister company, Empathy.co, which works with some of the world’s biggest brands.     Its no-code design lets shop owners effortlessly customise their search while providing powerful backend tools to improve the shopping experience. Motive Commerce Search delivers guaranteed trust thanks to its tracker and cookie-free technology, as well as transparent pricing with no surprises.     Your mission     As a Customer Success Specialist at Motive, you'll be the go-to source for delivering exceptional support to our clients, ensuring their questions are answered, concerns are resolved, and unique needs are understood. Your role is pivotal in nurturing strong client relationships and maximising their satisfaction with our products and services. Collaborating closely with various departments, you'll champion the client experience by offering proactive support, addressing inquiries, and facilitating clear communication between clients and our internal teams.     What you’ll do     Understand customer needs and requirements to provide exceptional first-line support for customer inquiries about our services. Collaborate directly with the Growth team to deliver comprehensive solution support, contributing to the growth and profitability of the organisation. Handle and manage customer tickets, ensuring efficient and effective issue resolution. Initiate proactive calls to customers who may not be reachable by email or require extra assistance, enhancing customer satisfaction. Take a proactive approach to monitor and assist clients in the trial phase, identifying opportunities to enhance their perception of value. Monitor the status of paying customers to identify potential risks of attrition and take necessary measures to prevent it. Establish a strong feedback loop with Sales and Product teams, contributing to continuous improvement and innovation.     What you’ll bring     Language Proficiency: Native proficiency in Italian, accompanied by fluent English skills, and additional value given to proficiency in at least one other European language (German, French, or Spanish). Prior experience in a client-facing capacity and familiarity with ticket-handling tools. A genuine passion for customer success, committed to ensuring customer satisfaction and driving growth. Exceptional attention to detail and adept at managing multiple projects concurrently. Organised and methodical approach, with the ability to ensure timely delivery and meet client deadlines. Outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal, alongside strong analytical capabilities. Proactive in seeking opportunities to enhance customer satisfaction and build lasting relationships.     What’s in it for you     Being part of a team with a forward-looking, international mindset and Agile working practises. Remote work contract with all essential equipment to carry it out and set up a home workspace (as well as an awesome welcome pack). Flexible 36-hour workweek to enhance work-life balance. Attractive salary and very competitive benefit package (private medical insurance, private pension plan, online functional training, English lessons, flexible remuneration, etc.). Personal Training Budget and unlimited growth opportunities. Up to 6 training days available per year to attend courses and events. Unlimited certification possibilities, with certification costs covered by Empathy. A range of employee events throughout the year, including team building activities, Sashimi sessions, and Kick-off events. Eligibility to participate in our Empathy Stock Option Plan and Employment Pension Plan. Opportunities to shape the tech community within and outside the company, through mentoring and knowledge-sharing. Unlimited free books to expand your knowledge and foster creativity and self development. The chance to work with cutting-edge technologies and expand your skill set. And most importantly: an amazing working atmosphere and team culture.     Our commitment     At Empathy and Motive, we put people first. For that reason, we are strong supporters of diversity and inclusion. We believe that by providing a fair and diverse workplace, we encourage the atmosphere of trust, understanding and joy that defines us.     We are fully committed to offering equal opportunities, fighting against discrimination every day. We strictly avoid any type of distinction, exclusion, restriction, or preference that could possibly be considered in any way subjective, irrational or disproportional.

Title: E-commerce Operations Manager
Description: 👋 What’s The Company Like?**     Company Size:     20-30 employees     **🙌 Intro**     Join a team and brand you can feel good about that is in the top 1% of the top 1% (and growing ) of Ecommerce DTC brands. If you’ve led teams with effective methodologies, have owned and managed P&L’s and have a passion for supply chain and other ops, this is for you.     Together we: Serve US and other English speaking customers Champion offering peace of mind and safety for** our consumers and their families in emergency fire situations Find and welcome the right people     **Our Values**     ❤️ We…     Continually improve. We are committed to learn from past results and continuously improve Fun & Friendly. We have a fast-paced, fun and friendly environment Integrity. Acting with strong ethics Communication. Everyone understands that communication is top priority and nobody is afraid to ask questions or speak up Honesty. Acting in a transparent, trustworthy manner Accountability. Accepting responsibility for your actions (and inactions) to build trust Promise to Customers. Staying true to the words we speak and the bonds we make Teamwork. Creating something greater than ourselves as individuals Quality. Maintaining the highest standards     **🔎 Our Take On the Company**     We have great products, provide a wonderful customer experience (I mean, have you seen our reviews?) and work hard to learn from and improve on yesterday. Come learn our sauce and cook with us to make it even better.     Requirements     **💻 What We Want You To Do**     Understand business vision from CEO’s and build team lead OKRs that align with vision and quarterly objectives Work closely with the marketing manager to plan and execute supply chain operations that serve customer & product demand. Provide inventory, cost and delivery information so marketing can make decisions Drive and manage operations (Supply Chain, Customer Service and Accounting departments): Understand business vision and build OKRs for managers/leads (supply chain, customer service, accounting) that are congruent with yours and help them achieve theirs Build SOPs, frameworks and processes for supply chain, customer service and accounting Work with other managers and leaders to drive execution and remove roadblocks     **🎯 Job Score Card**     Your performance will be measured against these Objective Key Results (OKRs):     Build and monitor OKRs for direct reports (supply chain, customer service and accounting) Lead weekly meetings with direct reports to see what the team is working on and remove roadblocks Oversee monthly inventory ordering plan based on inputs from marketing and current inventory Oversee competitive cost and payment terms with acceptable quality from suppliers Evaluate and approve logistic providers and routing decisions and strategies Review and approve company expenditures Network with other E-Commerce Ops Managers Manage the payroll and invoicing processes with the accounting department Creating, optimizing, implementing and helping maintain company manuals, policies, procedures and best practices Drive and manage ongoing projects to ensure timely completion Creating monthly, quarterly and yearly reports and presentations for CEO’s Creating, systemising and implementing all repeatable tasks in clear SOPs Work with the marketing manager to build dashboards and processes that improve marketing team efficiencies     Benefits     🤑 Salary and Benefits**: Fully remote position. Work from the comfort of your home, the coziness of a coffee shop or anywhere in-between Monthly salary paid once or twice a month. Salary paid in USD and based on experience and skill End of year bonus Wellness & workspace budget of 1000 dollars per year. This budget can be used for: health insurance, gym subscription, audiobooks or hardware for your computer set-up Flexible working schedule     **⏰ Working Hours**     You will be required to coordinate with the rest of the team for at least 5 hours per day in the EST time zone. For the rest of the schedule you can login earlier or later depending on your preference.     Working/Company Time Zone: EST time zone     **📝 Our Interview Process**     Click Apply You might be asked to complete a short video or questionnaire 1-on-1 video interview with HR 1-on-1 video interview with Manager     🚨 **Disclaimer**     Let’s be honest. You’re more than interested in this job if you’ve made it this far. So, one last thing you should know before you apply. What we’re actually looking for is just great skilled people who know how to be human when working in a team.     So if you’re a genuinely great person, considerate towards others, flexible, ready to grow and if your skills are a match, we’d love to get to know you better. Apply right now!
Function: Gestión y Tecnología de la información

Title: Product Designer
Description: Remofirst empowers employers to be free from geographical boundaries when accessing talent, allowing employees to pursue opportunities wherever they may exist. We are on a mission to be the FIRST to truly revolutionise the industry and be a generational company.     Our platform offers a full-range people management tool, employee benefits like health insurance, and financial benefits, and enabling clients to hire anyone from anywhere with one click. Remofirst manages employees and contractors for Fortune 500 companies (e.g., Microsoft, Mastercard) and the best startups worldwide (e.g., TransferGo).     We are a small but strong team of 50 people (and growing) hyper-focussed on delivering a world-class platform and unparalleled service with our industry-leading partnerships. To help accelerate our growth and pace of delivery, we are looking for talented Product Designers to help spearhead the overall look and feel of our features and services.     As a Product Designer, you will play a key role in designing effective and intuitive interfaces by understanding stakeholder needs, conducting research, and translating insights into design that our customers will love to use. Your responsibilities will include creating wireframes, mockups, and designs, developing prototypes, testing them with our customers, defining optimal navigation and interactions, ensuring design consistency with branding, usability, accessibility, and performance requirements.     What you'll be doing:     User and Business Research and Analysis: Conduct research and analyze user and business needs to create effective interfaces Gather and interpret user feedback and data to inform design decisions Collaborate with stakeholders to understand project objectives and target audience Wireframing, Layout, and Design: Create wireframes, layouts, and designs that meet user requirements and business goals Adapt designs for various devices and screen sizes Ensure design adherence to UX/UI principles and best practices Prototyping and User Testing: Develop interactive prototypes to test and validate design concepts with users Conduct usability testing and gather feedback to refine designs Analyze user data and incorporate insights into design iterations Navigation and Interaction Design: Define optimal navigation flows and interactions for websites and applications Ensure seamless user experiences by considering information architecture and user journeys Design Consistency and Technical Requirements: Maintain design consistency and adhere to technical requirements during the development process Collaborate with developers and product managers to ensure design feasibility and implementation      What you’ll need:     Minimum of 3 years of professional experience as a Product Designer, with a strong portfolio showcasing user-centered designs and successful projects Design Skills: Proficiency in Figma or similar design tools. Deep understanding of UX/UI design principles and the ability to create high-quality user interfaces Device Adaptation and Trends: Experience in adapting designs for various devices. Knowledge of UX/UI design trends and a strong desire to learn and grow in this field User Research and Analytical Skills: Strong analytical skills, including conducting user research and analyzing data. Ability to gather insights and apply them to design solutions   How you’ll work:     English at an Upper-Intermediate level or above is a must Adept at cross-cultural communication: Being a completely remote company, we work with people from different cultures across different time zones. You will need to have a strong aptitude for proactive cross-cultural communication Systematic and Strong Time Management: We have lots to achieve together as a team, and at times, you will need to be able to manage your time and priorities for yourself and by yourself Knack for Design Thinking: Our customers are at the heart of what we do. You will be expected to have a strong and empathetic approach to design thinking to deliver a stellar experience that our customers love to use Hyperlogical Problem-Solving: We’re moving and growing at a fast pace, and that means being involved in solving complex problems. You will need to demonstrate a strong knack for first principles, a hyper-logical approach to solving problems and cutting through complexity   Why work at Remofirst?﻿     Startup environment. Remofirst is an early-stage start-up. You have a voice and can influence and grow rapidly Build & Scale From Scratch. Experience hyper-growth scale and help us build a great team of professionals worldwide that can help us achieve this ambitious vision. Work for a Market Leader. Scale a project that counts market-leading companies like Microsoft, Mastercard, and more as happy customers. Compensation and perks are great! Competitive compensation. Work equipment of your choice 100% remote work. Unlimited PTO Culture. We lead with respect, kindness, and the right to fail. We value hard yet smart work. Diversity and inclusion are part of our DNA. As we grow and evolve, we welcome your input to help us define our culture further.

Title: INGENIERO/A JUNIOR DE PROYECTOS ELÉCTRICOS Y ENERGÍAS RENOVABLES SIN EXPERIENCIA at OKTALENT
Description: ¿Eres ingeniero/a y estás buscando uno de tus primeros proyectos profesionales en el mundo de la ingeniería y Energía? ¿Estás interesad(at) en un proyecto remoto y/o híbrido? ¡Pon atención porque lo tenemos!     OKTALENT, consultora de Recursos Humanos, busca 10 INGENIEROS/AS en REMOTO y/o HÍBRIDO para un importante grupo empresarial que ofrece servicios de ingeniería de alta calidad en varias áreas de conocimientos para los sectores de energía, telecomunicaciones, medio ambiente y arquitectura. Con sede en Canarias, Málaga, Córdoba y Zaragoza formarás parte dentro de la empresa del grupo especializada en proyectos del sector energético y telecomunicaciones y está buscando cubrir 10 posiciones de ingeniero/a junior para la división de optimización y Digitalización.     La empresa se caracteriza por contar con un equipo de trabajo dinámico y ágil, realizando cada proyecto con gran dedicación y efectividad. ¿Te gustaría unirte a su equipo?     Tareas     Apoyo en la realización y delineación de planos. Apoyo en la realización de cálculos de proyectos de baja y media tensión. Colaboración en la redacción de memorias.      Requisitos     Grado en ingeniería eléctrica, mecánica, recursos energéticos o similar.      Requisitos Valorables     Conocimientos de AutoCAD y Excel. Conocimientos del paquete office. Disponibilidad de incorporación a jornada completa en modalidad de Teletrabajo a finales de Septiembre.      Beneficios     Participación en proyectos de envergadura, con carácter nacional e internacional. Teletrabajo o Híbrido. Tu eliges. Plan de carrera y plan de formación interno. Formarás parte de un equipo joven y multidisciplinar conformado por técnicos de diferentes especialidades. Jornada intensiva durante los meses de verano, de 8 a 15. Jornada intensiva también los meses de semana santa y navidad. Reparto de bonus anuales en función de la consecución de objetivos económicos.

Title: Webdesigner - Full Remote
Description: About the role:     We are on the hunt for a skilled Web Developer to join our marketing team. We seek someone who not only crafts and implements exceptional websites but also has outstanding web design skills. The chosen candidate will play a crucial role in conceptualizing and bringing to life creative ideas, ensuring that our digital presence is both visually compelling and functionally seamless. This is a unique opportunity to contribute to a distributed cloud solution that challenges the status quo and advocates for digital privacy.     Start date & location: immediate, remote     Main responsibilities:     Web development and design: Design and develop new pages for our website, such as our Unique Selling Proposition (USP) pages, commercial onboarding funnel, and support domain. We are heavily focusing on our website, and your expertise in frontend web and web design will be vital. Collaboration: Partner with our copywriter, motion graphic designer, and UX designer to implement changes and improvements to our website. Your collaboration skills and creative solutions will be essential. Webflow Management: Delve into our Webflow setup and CSS details, aiming to refine and enhance it while integrating your designs. Project Leadership: Spearhead an initiative to make our marketing team more autonomous, minimizing dependencies on engineering. Oversee website updates and champion our online presence enhancement.     What you will be expected to do:     Conceptualize and design creative website ideas that resonate with our brand identity. Create, implement, and maintain web design elements and templates to support multi-media marketing objectives. Design visual elements to boost our online presence. Ensure smooth and efficient implementation on Webflow. Test and improve website designs for top performance. Uphold design guidelines, standards, and best practices. Engage with various content management systems. Convey design ideas using user flows, process flows, site maps, and wireframes. Integrate features and functionalities into websites. Design sample pages, including color and font selection. Plan design strategies and showcase website structures. Use web optimization techniques to enhance web presence and drive traffic.     Required Qualifications:     Extensive web development experience. Proficiency in Figma, Webflow, and Miro. Excellent web design skills. Knowledge in front-end development languages such as HTML, CSS, JQuery, and JavaScript. Solid understanding of content management systems. Strong grasp of design fundamentals like layout, balance, and composition, coupled with attention to detail. Comprehensive understanding of SEO and UX/UI principles. Familiarity with cross-browser compatibility issues. Up-to-date with global web protocols, standards, and technologies. A creative perspective open to new ideas. Ability to juggle multiple projects and collaborate with various teams. Excellent interpersonal communication skills. An independent, creative, flexible mindset with ownership of one's work.     Bonus points if you:     Possess a standout creative portfolio. Master graphic design software, especially Adobe Photoshop and Adobe Illustrator. Have experience designing for social media and mobile platforms. Are adept at working in a fast-paced Agile setting. Can adapt and devise elegant solutions to complex issues.
Industry: Servicios de TI y consultoría de TI

Title: Head of Global Partnerships (Hotel Parterns)
Description: Emerging Travel Group is excited to present a unique career opportunity for a strategic and visionary leader to join our team as the Head of Global Partnerships to be responsible for driving growth, enhancing our customer experience, and expanding our global footprint.     Emerging Travel Group is at the forefront of revolutionizing the travel and hospitality industry, connecting travelers with a diverse array of accommodations across the globe. Driven by innovation and exceptional customer experiences, we empower travelers to explore, book, and savor their journeys like never before.     This is a fully remote position for people within the European time zone.     Requirements     Proven experience in building and leading successful Direct Supply teams in global companies from the travel industry, demonstrating the ability to drive rapid expansion, particularly in international markets Exceptional organizational, leadership, and sales skills Strong communication and analytical abilities Expert multitasking and prioritization capabilities Highly collaborative team player adept at cross-departmental interaction In-depth industry experience with a profound understanding of hotel terminology and performance     Responsibilities:     As the Head of Direct Supply at Emerging Travel Group, you will be an instrumental leader in shaping our approach to inventory acquisition, supply management, and relationship building with partner hotels. Your role will be pivotal in driving growth, enhancing our customer experience, and expanding our global footprint.     Long-/Mid-/Short-term Goals:     Drive an increase in direct contract partnerships to expand our high-margin supply Maintain a balanced approach that aligns with both customer interests and hotel partnerships Cultivate a strong, experienced, and agile Direct Supply team ready for growth and increased responsibilities Streamline acquisition processes for scalability and cost efficiency Enhance the efficiency and impact of existing inventory management strategies     Key Responsibilities:     Strategy Development for International Growth: Formulate a cohesive Direct Supply strategy aligning customer demand with ETG's goals, identifying and addressing growth bottlenecks Prioritize rapid expansion of international direct supply to increase the number of properties and the share of Direct Supply in global markets Stay ahead of industry trends, adapt supply strategies based on market insights Ensure continuous communication of the strategy to stakeholders, obtaining buy-in and alignment Data-Driven Decision Making: Utilize data analytics, identify strengths and weaknesses, and prioritize tasks based on data insights Acquisition and Management: Develop marketing channels to attract Title: Sales Agent (Night Shift)
Description: What is Exoticca?     Exoticca is a company that started in 2013 by professionals specialized in the creation and online distribution of trips. Our mission is to offer our clients the possibility to visit the most beautiful and stimulating places on our planet, though the best holiday packages, at unbelievable prices. We are a highly ambitious and well-funded start-up, backed by top national and international investors that have also participated in the growth of other success stories, such as Glovo, SinDelantal.com, or Idealista, among others.     At Exoticca we are looking for people who want to offer their best to create unforgettable experiences for our customers. We are a young, dynamic, multicultural team in rapid international growth, seeking new partners to help us create the best and most forward-thinking travel company of our generation.     What are we proposing?     We’re looking for experienced telesales professionals to join our team as a “Sales Agent”, at one of today´s fastest-growing travel companies. You’ll be exclusively working on the night shift (22:00-07:00) handling English and Spanish calls primarily from the North American market.     This is an exciting opportunity to utilize your sales skills in exchange for a highly competitive salary and generous commission!     Be a part of a team where you will:     Handle requests from customers who have expressed interest in the Exoticca products, identify their needs, make recommendations, and review the benefits of an Exoticca experience Apply best practices to identify consumers’ budget, timeline, and decision-making processes with a high-end delivery Deal with occurring requests, complaints, reviews or refunds. Demonstrate strong knowledge of our products and packages Maintain operation integrity by following policies and procedures Maintain individual goals and achieve company targets     Requirements     Previous sales experience and a proven track record of success Ability to interact, communicate and negotiate effectively. A can-do spirit: you are coachable, highly motivated and driven to succeed High flexibility and schedule adaptation: you can work polyvalent schedules, including evenings, weekends, and holidays. As a Travel Agent, you'll work on rotating shifts to cover our US & CA markets mostly Fluency in English; we have a special interest in multilingual talents, mainly in the markets we operate: Germany, France, Spain, Mexico, UK, US, CA, etc.…     Preferred Qualifications:     Previous contact center experience in the Travel industry (2 years) Degree in Hospitality, Travel, Tourism or any relevant field. Knowledge of Salesforce, Amadeus or other CRM's Sound knowledge of travel trends We're also looking for native German speakers     Benefits     Competitive compensation package Highly ambitious commissioning plan Additionally, we propose the use of flexible compensation management for diet, transportation, private health insurance with Cobee Travel packages at reduced prices! Unlimited coffee, team lunches, English/Spanish lesson, bi-annual company parties, afterworks Referral bonus, if you bring people as talented as you And last but not least, becoming part of a fun and motivated multicultural team at an agile and rapid growing organization!     Exoticca is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusiveness are our core. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under European, country, or local law.     Remote

Title: Head of Marketing
Description: Are you passionate about revolutionizing the field of psychology?     Unobravo is leading the way in Italy with their innovative e-mental care startup, and has provided exceptional online psychotherapy services to over 150,000 people and conducted over 1,6 million therapy sessions with a team of 3,500 therapists. As part of their international expansion efforts to become the European leader in e-mental care and well being, Unobravo has initiated operations in Spain under the brand Buencoco.     Our goals at Buencoco are ambitious too: we want to be the point of reference for people who want to improve their mental health or need help coping with mental care challenges, and grow to be the indisputable leader in high quality online psychotherapy in Spain.     This is a young company with drive, energy, and determination to change the way we view psychology and address the stigma surrounding mental health issues.     We are seeking a highly skilled Head of Marketing to join our Spanish team, with the purpose of growing Buencoco as fast as possible in Spain. You will lead the Local Marketing team, whilst collaborating with Central teams such as Marketing, Data and Product. You will be responsible to hire great talent and be a natural problem solver that gets a fantastic brand like Buencoco to new heights.     If you have a "think-outside-the-box" mentality and believe in the power of teamwork to generate exceptional ideas, Unobravo Spain is the ideal company for you to unleash your potential.     As a Head of Marketing for Spain you will:     Define and execute local marketing strategies to grow Buencoco brand awareness, conversion and retention. Manage the Spanish marketing squad composed of local-led activities related to campaign management, brand partnerships, PR, organic social media and influencer marketing as well as central-led activities (Paid Media, CRM, Organic, etc) to ensure reaching country growth targets. Identify and prioritize local growth opportunities as well as solve execution challenges through clear and concise communication and good business case methodology. Close monitoring of performance indicators (KPIs) to track progress and make data-driven decisions to grow further. Define and execute the country budget in collaboration with the global CMO and Buencoco’s Country Manager. Hire and grow top talent in the Spanish marketing team. Appoint and manage local agencies / freelancers on a need basis whilst ensuring alignment with Central teams. Close collaboration with Local teams (Supply Acquisition, Customer success) as well as Central teams (Marketing, Product)     You bring:     Min 5+ years experience in a similar role. Strong understanding branding channels, campaign management as well as ability to interact with performance marketing teams. Hands-on attitude, a lot needs to be created from the ground up, builder mindset. Analytical mindset and ability to interpret data and translate insights into actionable strategies. Able to define hypotheses, run experiments independently and share results broadly across teams. Leadership skills, mentoring team members and keep motivation high Hiring experience, able to dissect and identify the right qualities of high performing team members. Good communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams and capacity to work well on matrix-reporting organizations. Ability to adapt to a fast-paced, ever-changing environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Ideally, you have experience or are highly familiar with marketplace-like ecosystems, where growth on the demand and supply sides is well managed and balanced     We offer you:     A very competitive salary and performance based bonus based on experience Work from anywhere you want… as long as you can make yourself available when needed to your colleagues and Buencoco’s team members Restaurant tickets and private health insurance, as well as incredible discounts on therapy with highly qualified professionals Training and learning budget to help your professional development at Buencoco and Unobravo True opportunities for growth at one of the most promising e-health startups in the space, backed by strong and experienced investors including Insight Partners, a global venture capital and private equity firm that invests in high-growth businesses on their way to becoming leaders in their space

Title: Social Media & Sales Assistant for a Business Consulting Company
Description: Hello, Social Media & Sales admins!     My name is Noor and I am the COO at Impact School - We work with entrepreneurs to scale their businesses and make a positive impact on the clients they serve. Our goal when we work with any of our clients is to help them build the biggest, most profitable business that they possibly can - and by extension help them have a larger impact on their clients and the world around them.     We are looking to hire a motivated Junior Social Media & Sales Assistant who can deliver on tasks consistently, ensuring that the social media content is posted and the pipelines are managed daily so that leads are being stayed on top of, allowing the company to enroll more members and make a greater impact.     This is a full-time remote position.     Requirements     We are looking for a Junior Social Media & Sales Assistant specifically with these requirements:     Has excellent English communication skills Has at least 2+ years of experience as a Social Media Assistant or similar role Excellent knowledge of social media platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, and Twitter Bachelor’s degree in Digital Marketing or a related field Has experience with heavy bulk of message and social outreach Has experience doing high volume of outbound messaging Knowledgeable with using CRMs Tech savvy - computer literate and comfortable working completely virtually Good, stable and reliable internet connection Able to follow clear instructions and execute seamlessly under time constraints     Your responsibilities will include (but are not limited to):     Copying and pasting the content onto Instagram, Instagram stories, personal Fb, personal Fb stories, LinkedIn, tweethunter Copying and pasting 2x top of funnel posts into all 14 fb group twice per week (28 postings total) Keeping an eye on dms and getting all dms to either the MOF or BOF optin page (or live training in the future) and doing outreach on everyone who comments on any post delivering them the MOF training or the latest podcast if they’ve already had the freebie before (and if we are doing a live training, inviting them to that Sending a link to a prospect, noting them down and putting them on a hitlist and continuing to follow up until their name pops into the crm which is when the setters jump in Checking FB notifications once per day and outreach on any interest or intent based leads Sending links to leads who type “ACCESS,” “RESULTS” or another keyword and then following up with them authentically until you see them sign up in MyScaleSystems Checking the crm everyday to make sure the setters are on top of the 2 lists they need to be checking and communicating with their manager if not Doing 100 outreach per day (if there haven’t been 100 comments, make up for it by doing additional outreach on followers) Fb group + friend requests accepting // LinkedIn connection requests accepting Pre call follow up (and if the call happens on weekend or Monday morning, doing it Friday) Sending links to the VSL page when someone comments or DMs INFO on social media platforms Making sure “conversations” tab in GHL is at 0 daily Checking hit list daily and appropriate follow up Follow up using the standard operating procedure with mastermind applicants to ensure they book a call with us once they have filled out their application Outbound messaging (50 reached out to per day)     Benefits     Completely remote Potential to grow a team and move into a leadership role Consistent support from team members. We pride ourselves on working WITH each other and giving as much support as is asked     This Position Is Perfect For You If…     You're an Excellent Communicator     You have excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal skills that allow you to explain complex topics in simple ways. You are able to clearly get your point across and get all stakeholders aligned on a common goal.     You're Analytical and Detail-Oriented.     Capable of carrying out a given task with all details necessary to get the task done well. You’re obsessed with metrics and understanding what are the key drivers of metrics.     You’re a Self-Starter.     We’re looking for someone who gets the job done and delivers on time. You are self-directed, and self-motivated, and don’t need someone to look over your shoulder or hold your hand. You have the ability to motivate yourself and also motivate a team in a positive way to get results.     What we do:     Please check us out to get an understanding of a few of the exciting brands you’ll be involved with:     https://www.impact-school.com/     Our hiring process is made up of four parts, so please be aware that you will need to dedicate time for a questionnaire, a video, and two 1-on-1 interviews.     Thank you for taking the time to consider this position. I look forward to hearing from you soon!     Noor

Title: Delegado/a de ventas de Oncología (Galicia)
Description: En Palex necesitamos incorporar un Delegado/a de Ventas para la División de Oncología, con residencia en A Coruña/Santiago o alrededores.     La persona escogida se incorporará a una división y a una empresa en pleno crecimiento, dentro del área terapéutica de oncología con un fuerte enfoque en la medicina genómica y de precisión.     Sus principales responsabilidades serán las siguientes:     Servir de referente científico para la comunidad médica en la especialidad de oncología de precisión y fomentar una comunicación fluida entre ésta y la organización. Realización y cumplimiento del plan estratégico para el territorio asignado. Establecer relaciones con los KOLS/KDMs/HCPs. Fomentar una colaboración efectiva y transversal en la división de oncología. Conocimiento en profundidad de los productos del portafolio de oncología para la correcta transmisión de la información a los KDMs, incluyendo presentaciones dirigidas a HCPs remarcando las características, beneficios y uso del producto. Identificar licitaciones y concursos de su territorio.     La persona que buscamos, tendrá que aportar formación Universitaria en Ciencias de la Salud (medicina, veterinaria, farmacia, biociencias, etc...), requisito necesario por la tecnicidad de los productos.     También será necesaria la experiencia de mínimo 2 años en posiciones similares, en la industria farma/medtech, llevando productos/tecnologías complejas y de alto componente científico.     Alto nivel de inglés (B2/C1) y conocimientos intermedios de Office (PPT, excel, word...)     Se valorará la experiencia previa en el área del Diagnóstico in Vitro y/o Oncología (tumores ginecológicos, digestivos y urológicos).     Buscamos a una persona proactiva y autónoma, orientada a resultados y a la mejora contínua, con buenas habilidades comunicativas y de negociación.     En Palex ofrecemos contrato indefinido, un proyecto profesional sólido, salario compuesto de fijo y variable, vehículo de empresa, posibilidades de promoción interna y desarrollo profesional y acceso a una gran variedad de beneficios sociales.

Title: Senior Product Owner
Description: Remofirst empowers employers to be free from geographical boundaries when accessing talent, allowing employees to pursue opportunities wherever they may exist. We are on a mission to be the FIRST to truly revolutionise the industry and be a generational company.     Our platform offers a full-range people management tool, employee benefits like health insurance, and financial benefits, and enables clients to hire anyone from anywhere with one click. Remofirst manages employees and contractors for Fortune 500 companies and the best startups worldwide.     We are a small but strong team of 50 people (and growing) hyper-focussed on delivering a world-class platform and unparalleled service with our industry-leading partnerships. To help accelerate our growth and pace of delivery, we are looking for talented Product Owners to take charge of our various product lines from discovery to delivery.     As a Product Owner, you’ll have sole responsibility for your product line and your team. You’ll have ownership of the whole end-to-end process - from discovery to delivery. We want you to have the autonomy to deliver what you think is best for our customers.     What you'll be doing:     You will be owning a whole product/service line within Remofirst (this can be within Health Insurance, Finance & Payroll Operations, Onboarding, etc.) You will be responsible for managing product and services scoping, designing, operationalisation and delivery whilst working cross-functionally across the company to ensure we ship product smarter and faster You will be managing a team of front-end and back-end developers, UX/UI designers, and QA; whilst working closely with Sales, Customer Success and the Leadership team to ensure the product roadmap and delivery is in line with the Company’s goals You will be involved in speaking with our customers and finding out what they want in a world-class product   What you’ll need:     Outstanding clear communication skills Minimum of 3-5 years of professional experience as a Product Owner/Manager at a high-growth tech startup, with demonstration of strong impact in B2B companies, although, we will consider candidates with B2C experience as well Experience in managing a cross-functional and cross-cultural product squad Strong understanding of product management processes, project management frameworks High analytical, data-driven, with a pulse on trends in the working remotely Readiness to provide insight and deliver measurable results for sophisticated products under ambiguous situations in a fast-paced environment   How you’ll work:     Adept at cross-cultural communication: Being a completely remote company, we’re working with people from different cultures across different time-zones. You will need to have a strong aptitude for proactive cross-cultural communication Systematic and Strong Time Management: We have lots to achieve together as a team, and at times, you will need to be able to manage your time and priorities for yourself, and by yourself Knack for Product Thinking: Our customers are at the heart of what we do. You will be expected to have a strong and empathetic approach to deliver a stellar experience that our customers love to use Hyperlogical Problem-Solving: We’re moving and growing at a fast-pace, and that means being involved in solving complex problems. You will need to demonstrate a strong knack for first-principles, hyper-logical approach to solving problems and cutting through complexity. Stakeholder Management: You’ll be working closely with the company’s leadership, managing your team’s roadmaps, goals, performance and driving maximum impact internally and externally Leadership: You’ll have a team of engineers, designers, and QA; and own the full end-to-end process of discovery, scoping, cross-functional management, and ultimate delivery of the product line   Why work at Remofirst?﻿     Startup environment. Remofirst is an early-stage start-up. You have a voice and can influence and grow rapidly Build & Scale From Scratch. Experience hyper-growth scale and help us build a great team of professionals worldwide that can help us achieve this ambitious vision. Work for a Market Leader. Scale a project that counts market-leading companies like Microsoft, Mastercard, and more as happy customers. Compensation and perks are great! Competitive compensation. Work equipment of your choice 100% remote work. Unlimited PTO Culture. We lead with respect, kindness, and the right to fail. We value hard yet smart work. Diversity and inclusion are part of our DNA.
