Title: ELT Project Manager
Description: At Kids&Us, we are passionate about learning and leaders in teaching English to children from 1 year old! Our purpose is to empower the development of new generations through meaningful English learning.     More than 160,000 children learn English in our more than 500 schools in 10 countries. We are a community of more than 6,500 professionals, and we continue to grow, always looking for new talent to join our great team.     We are currently looking for an ELT Project Manager for our product department in our headquarters in Manresa (Barcelona), are you up for this new challenge?     Your main mission will be to guarantee the quality of our method, always offering the best possible learning experience to our students.     As an ELT Project Manager, you will be responsible for:     Developing content and didactic material for English learning, adapted for various ages and levels, following the Kids&Us methodology. Being part of transversal work teams, communicating regularly with the different professional profiles involved. Participating in the creation and development of innovative learning solutions for courses and other products based on the Kids&Us methodology.     What skills and attitudes are we looking for?     Degree in the field of education and/or linguistics (Pedagogy, English Studies, Education Sciences, etc.) PM experience, especially in the educational / editorial field. C2 or native English level. Advanced Microsoft Office skills.     Valuable:     Experience in writing teaching materials for language learning. Advanced Spanish level.     And what does Kids&Us offer you?     A permanent contract that will give you stability and confidence in your professional career. Remote work, with occasional travel to Manresa where we have our headquarters. Flexible schedule from Monday to Thursday. Intensive schedule on Fridays and summer months. English classes so you can continue to improve your level and enhance your language skills. Celebrate your birthday with a day off! We want you to enjoy your special day. If you have children, you can benefit from a 50% discount on Kids&Us courses for them. We want your whole family to be part of our community. In addition, you will have access to exclusive discounts on other Kids&Us activities and products, so you can enjoy everything we have to offer.     If you think Kids&Us is the company you would like to be part of, we look forward to hearing from you!     Kids&Us is a diverse company, and we are committed to attracting qualified candidates who also embrace and value diversity and inclusion. At Kids&Us we offer equal opportunities. We do not accept discrimination or harassment of any kind. We accept the uniqueness of each person and encourage them to be their true selves.     Informative clause: Responsible for processing: Kids&Us English, S.L. address at Avenida Tudela, 12, 08242 Manresa (Barcelona). Purpose: management of CVs, profiles, and professional applications. Addressees: Kids&Us English, S.L. and its network of schools and franchises. Rights: you have the right of access, rectification, deletion, opposition, limitation of processing, data portability, not to be subject to automated individual decisions, and revocation. To exercise the aforementioned rights, as well as for any query related to the processing of your data, you may contact the data controller at the email info@kidsandus.com.     For more information go to https://www.kidsandus.es/es/footer/politica-de-privacidad

Title: Autor/a de contenidos eLearning
Description: Buscamos personas apasionadas, comprometidas, con vocación docente y con ganas de compartir su talento.     En ADR Formación desarrollamos proyectos de formación e-learning para nuestros clientes desde hace 25 años. Para ello, utilizamos una plataforma de formación on line de desarrollo y diseños propios en la que priman la sencillez y diferenciación.     Además, ofrecemos un amplio catálogo de cursos creados a través de nuestra Red de Talento conformada por expertos de diversas materias.     Tú, como experto/a en tu especialidad, desarrollarás y tutorizarás un curso profesional y atractivo, formando así parte de la gran familia de profesionales de la formación e-learning. Y no te preocupes ya ponemos a tu disposición un completo programa de formación e-learning para los autores de contenidos dividido en dos cursos.     Nuestros Expertos, haciendo uso de nuestra tecnología, desarrollan cursos de calidad que posteriormente se imparten con nuestra plataforma.     ¿Cuál es el proceso?     En nuestro modelo de trabajo ADR Formación se encarga de la comercialización del curso en diversas modalidades. El autor cobrará siempre el 40% de lo que ADR Formación facture por la venta del curso. Este aspecto se formaliza a través de la firma de un acuerdo marco o CONTRATO MERCANTIL.     Nuestros cursos los desarrollan expertos que son los propietarios de los contenidos y los registran a su nombre por lo que no existe exclusividad.     Las herramientas se explican en dos cursos gratuitos. Se trata de un programa de formación e-learning para autores de contenidos. A través de los cursos aprenderás la metodología propia del formato online, tendrás acceso a una avanzada herramienta de autor para generar tu propio curso y contarás con el apoyo de nuestro equipo, para orientarte pedagógicamente y ayudarte en el desarrollo de tu proyecto. Al completar la formación obtendrás los diplomas acreditativos, que certificarán tu aptitud para generar contenidos online. Además, si demuestras que eres un verdadero experto capaz de generar contenidos de calidad, tendrás la oportunidad de formar parte de nuestra Red de Talento convirtiéndote en autor y tutor de cursos on-line.      ¿A qué esperas para formar parte de la Red de Talento?     Tareas     Desarrollar y tutorizar cursos de formación.     Requisitos     Pasión docente, y experiencia o formación específica en el curso a desarrollar.

Title: Customer Success Manager (Spain)
Description: About Carrot:     Carrot Fertility is the leading global fertility care platform, serving people of every age, race, income, sex, sexual orientation, gender, marital status, and geography. Trusted by hundreds of multinational employers, health plans, and health systems, Carrot's comprehensive clinical program delivers industry-leading cost savings for employers and award-winning experiences for millions of people worldwide. Whether there is a need for care through fertility preservation, male-factor infertility, pre-pregnancy, IVF, pregnancy and postpartum, adoption, gestational surrogacy, or menopause, Carrot supports members and their families through many of the most memorable and meaningful moments of their lives. With Carrot, you can pursue your possible.     The Role:     Carrot is seeking a Customer Success Manager to support new and existing Carrot customers, helping to drive retention, increase member engagement, and maintain high levels of customer satisfaction. The Customer Success Manager acts as a trusted advisor to HR benefits leaders, helps communicate the value of the Carrot product, and responds to customer needs, questions and requests.     Our Customer Success Managers:     Proactively engage with customers to understand their needs, challenges, and objectives. Serve as the primary point of contact for your assigned accounts, fostering trust and confidence in our partnership. From onboarding through the full customer lifecycle Develop a deep understanding of the customer's business and industry to provide tailored solutions and advice. Work closely with customers to create and execute a success plan that aligns with their business objectives and maximizes the value they receive from our solutions. Act as a customer advocate within the company, representing their feedback and needs to relevant teams. Ensure timely resolution of customer issues, working closely across Carrot teams. Provide education and resources to customers to enable them to effectively use our products/services. Conduct regular check-ins to ensure customers are leveraging the full capabilities of our offerings.     Minimum Qualifications:     3+ years of professional experience in a Customer Success, Account Management, or Project Management role, ideally in a high-growth, start-up environment Enthusiasm for Carrot Fertility's mission and eagerness to become a part of our collaborative, friendly, and dynamic team Detail-oriented with strong analytical, writing, and communication skills Must be able to develop and grow relationships with customers Track record of high customer satisfaction Experience working with full lifecycle of customer success Fluency in written and spoken English     Preferred Qualifications:     Experience with Salesforce or other CRM Some familiarity with Carrot's buyers (HR benefits leaders) is preferred, but not required Comfortable working in an fast paced environment; organized, diligent, and self-motivated Process-oriented with an automation/efficiency mindset; experience developing best practices, creating scalable systems and automating routine processes Ability to adopt a continuous improvement mindset and actively contribute to the processes and procedures of the Customer Success team     Compensation:     Carrot is committed to providing a competitive and holistic Total Rewards package designed to support our employees in all aspects of their life inside and outside of work, including health and wellness benefits, short- and long-term incentives, parental leave, family-forming resources, and a competitive compensation package. Actual compensation is commensurate with experience and confirmed job-related skills.     Why Carrot?     Carrot has received national and international recognition for its pioneering work, including Best Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion Product from the Anthem Awards, Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies, CNBC's 100 Barrier Breaking Startups, and more. Carrot is regularly featured in media reporting on issues related to the future of work, women in leadership, healthcare innovation and diversity, equity, and inclusion, including MSNBC, The Economist, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, CNBC, National Public Radio, Harvard Business Review, and more.     Carrot is a remote-first company with teams in more than 40 states across the United States and dozens of countries around the world. It has received numerous workplace awards, including Fortune's Best Workplaces in Healthcare, Quartz's Best Companies for Remote Workers, and Great Place to Work and Age-Friendly Employer certifications. Learn more at carrotfertility.com.

Title: Project Manager - Development (Spanish & English speaking) (m/f/d)
Description: About Numa     numa is a hospitality brand offering uniquely designed apartments for the modern traveller. We develop and operate a new category of lifestyle apartments whether it is for your weekend city trip, business travel or temporary home. Our uniquely designed apartments are located in the most exciting neighbourhoods and cities, that will make you feel like a local. numa offers you a consistent quality and guest experience no matter where your next trip will take you. To achieve our mission, we are building a proprietary technology and data platform connecting hospitality services, real estate and guest experiences.     About The Role     Your mission     Due Diligence     Working within the project management team (alongside design and real estate) you will be an integral part of our company, shaping project delivery processes and ensuring exceptional execution. Overseeing design, planning and delivery for our refurbishment and development projects - your tasks will include:     Evaluation of the potential new properties Technical DD Analysing existing plans and reports - architecture, fire safety, MEP, ICT, etc Feasibility of implementing Numa standards - design, finishes, FFE, MEP, ICT, etc Budget forecasting and timeline estimations Lease contract and vendor contract negotiations     Planning And Execution     Execution of projects by applying project management tools and techniques External coordination - main point of contact for developers, planning teams, contractors, vendors Managing interfaces, scope changes and progress with external contractors or landlord’s developers and representatives. Running regular meetings and preparing meeting minutes and reports Internal coordination - leading coordination between the design, procurement, finance, operations, distribution, revenue, legal, etc Running weekly meetings and managing internal tasks and teams following the standard Numa process. Managing interdependencies, conflicts and priorities Timeline setup, monitoring and updating, control Budget set up, monitoring and updates, additional costs reports, red flags. Ensuring projects will meet financial targets, tracking the scope and payments Monitoring lease contract execution and alignment with Accurate and timely reporting of project performance to senior management Construction site walkthroughs, checking the quality and Numa standards implementation Organising and managing the snagging process and the final handover to Numa     Launch     Developing strategy and comprehensive plan for the launch (launch dates, local launch requirements, operational set-up) Coordination of all departments involved in the launching process (operations, distribution, legal, finance, revenue,…) Managing deliveries, installations and distribution of FFE/OSE, signage, collaterals, etc Final snagging and handover to operation teams Quality assurance     Post Launch     Identifying and implementing workflow improvements, both in content and tech. Run lessons learnt / post launch analysis and implement best-practises to maximise process efficiency Identifying time and cost saving opportunities for upcoming projects     About You     Your profile:     University degree in engineering, architecture, construction, real estate, business management, or similar Experience from relevant fields of work - architecture, real-estate, construction, engineering, etc. Ideally experience working in the similar company, or for a developer Ability to build and maintain good relationships with external parties Excellent stakeholder management and strong communication skills Well-developed technical and creative skills, thinking outside conventional solutions A good eye for detail Ability to work under pressure and on multiple projects at the same time Advanced knowledge in various PM tools (Google Suit, Asana, Notion, etc) Planning and construction norms, regulations and contract law knowledge Fluency in English & Spanish is a requirement Fluency in other European languages is a plus     About Our Offer     Join an agile work environment with flat hierarchies where your ideas make an impact from the very beginning Build your own success story based on what you do well and how you want to grow Earn a competitive salary Make the most of our flexible working hours and work from home flexibility Choose the tools you work with from our selection of office equipment and software Maintain and improve your mental wellness with a monthly Calm subscription on us Elevate your fitness with a free Gympass subscription or monthly gym stipend Get to know your internationally diverse team during our events and retreats We want you to understand our product so upon your start, you'll get to spend a night at your nearest numa stay! numa values the diversity of the people it hires and serves. Diversity at our company means fostering a workplace in which individual differences are recognized, appreciated, respected and responded to in ways that fully develop and utilize each person’s talents and strengths. We therefore welcome applications from people of all races, ethnicities, disability statuses, ages, religions, gender identities, and sexual orientations.     For more information on the processing of your personal data, please see our Privacy Notice .     Apply for this position     Apply for this position

Title: Data Analyst Payments (Full remote within Spain)
Description: We’re looking for a Data Analyst Payments.     If you are a highly-motivated individual with a genuine interest in technology and passion to deliver cutting-edge products, we have the perfect job for you!     A Little Bit About Us     Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 500 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe.     How Will You Make a Difference     Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports and logical conclusions Work with management to prioritize data-driven business initiatives and information needs to improve company decision making and performance Locate and define new process improvement opportunities Understand business needs in order to develop innovative solutions for operational and strategic changes Preparing reports for the management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data Preparing final analysis reports for the stakeholders to understand the data-analysis steps, enabling them to take important decisions based on various facts and trends. Data responsabile for one or more team’s projects towards the creation and evaluation of new hypotheses     Requirements     What will make you stand out from the crowd:     Have a minimum of 2 years experience working as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages (Excel, SPSS, Python, Knime, SAS etc). Having experience using SQL is also a plus Knowledge of visualization tools and experience using reporting tools (Qlik, Power BI, Tableau, etc) Ability to identify continuous improvement measures and communicate effectively at all levels of the organization and to work as part of a team Attention to detail, organizational and analytical skills and ability to prioritize multiple concurrent projects while still delivering timely and accurate results Dynamic, proactive and results oriented person and flexible to changing environment and eager to learn A Bachelor’s or Master’s in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, Information Management, Statistics or related field Knowledge and experience in payment technologies is a plus     Benefits     Perks of being one of us:     Top-notch private health insurance — includes dental and psychological services Full-time, permanent contract Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas’ Eve and New Year’s Eve off Remote work OR come into the office if you prefer! Flextime (7 – 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 – 7:30 p.m) Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!) Enhanced career path designed just for you External training budget Other: ticket restaurant, nursery tickets Budget for team-building activities We celebrate all company landmarks And when you come into the office, you’ll get free coffee and snacks, fresh fruit, and can enjoy our game room and the cool terrace overlooking the Mediterranean     Sounds good? Apply now! We’re looking forward to getting to know you.     Location     Our exceptional offices are in Barcelona's Blue Building, right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and will be able to take part in our game competitions.     We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and are committed to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment.     The personal data you provide will be used solely to manage your candidacy for the purposes of this position. You can exercise your rights of access, rectification, or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005. Additionally, you can email us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including documentation proving your identity.

Title: Experimentation Program Manager
Description: Job Description     We are looking for strong program manager talent to join our Global Experimentation Team. We build and launch AB tests to continuously improve our online user experience across desktop and mobile devices on various eCommerce platforms.     As an Experimentation Program Manager, you will support the full lifecycle of planning, executing, and analyzing AB test campaigns on behalf of stakeholders. You will work directly with business and product leaders to understand specific business needs and opportunities to deliver innovative product features. You will identify and scope opportunities for new capabilities and collaborate with engineering, design, and business stakeholders to conduct experiments and implement winning ideas. You will manage the experimentation lifecycle through strong collaboration with engineering, design, analytics, content, and quality assurance teams to scope, build, launch and maintain experiments. You will also analyze the performance of your experiments and take actions to further improve it.     This role involves working closely with business stakeholders to facilitate their experimentation roadmap, prioritize the order of campaigns, oversee the implementation of campaigns, coordinate with the analytics team to analyze the results, and report out the results at an individual campaign basis and overall program level. The position requires outstanding communication skills, data-driven mindset, and in-depth program and project management capabilities.     The role is measured based on the AB test campaign activity and the corresponding impact those campaigns have on key business metrics (conversion rate, RPV, bounce rate, engagement metrics)     Experimentation Program Manager Responsibilities     Collaborate regularly with business, UX, and product teams to develop and maintain the experimentation strategy and roadmap for the business verticals assigned.     Define experiment requirements. This may range from new features to UI or content optimization.     Manage the entire experiment lifecycle, including strategic planning, tactical execution, and in-depth analysis and reporting.     Communicate with management and senior executives about experimentation program requirements, direction, test development and launch management, and provide metrics on performance against goals.     Analyze test results to glean relevant and actionable insights.     Integrate usability studies, research, and market analysis into experiment requirements to enhance user satisfaction.     Support solution design and integration, define user acceptance testing, and provide post implementation support to stakeholders and end-users.     Support the creation & development of product features in partnership with cross-functional stakeholders.     Stay current with the most recent trends around experimentation.     Qualifications     The ideal candidate is someone who constantly raises the bar individually and for the team, thrives under pressure, can dive deep into data and derive actionable insights, and can work with diverse stakeholders and a geographically diverse team. This candidate will utilize their charisma and business acumen to prioritize needs across multiple teams and drive business results.     Education And Experience     2-3 years of work experience in program management, project management, or A/B testing role for websites or apps.     Strong communication skills and comfort with presenting campaign results to broader internal audiences (stakeholders, executives).     Business acumen to prioritize needs across multiple stakeholders.     Experience with web analytics a plus (Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics).     Hands on experience with collaboration products like JIRA, Confluence, Smartsheet, or similar a plus.     Experience with AB testing tools a plus (Optimizely, Optimize, Target).     BA/BS in business or equivalent degree a plus.
Function: Gestión y Tecnología de la información
Industry: Servicios de TI y consultoría de TI

Title: Operations Manager-Partnership team
Description: Operations manager-partnerships team  About Us  At Browzwear, our team develops and delivers cutting-edge technology helping global fashion and apparel organizations overcome some of the most complex challenges. We continue to innovate and evolve rapidly as we enable the world’s leading companies to embark on their digital transformation journeys. Our innovative software products are used globally, leading the revolution in 2D CAD and 3D simulation for fashion.  Position Overview:  We are seeking a dynamic and highly organized individual to join our team as a Technology Partnership Administrator. In this role, you will be responsible for establishing and maintaining collaborative relationships with technology partners, managing partner programs, and ensuring the smooth execution of joint initiatives. The ideal candidate is a proactive problem solver with excellent communication skills, a strong attention to detail, and a passion for fostering successful partnerships in the technology sector.  Key Responsibilities:   Partnership Management:   Initiate, develop, and nurture partnerships with technology companies, startups, and industry stakeholders.  Collaborate with internal teams to identify potential partner opportunities aligned with our business goals.  Maintain a comprehensive database of partner contacts, agreements, and program details.  Regularly communicate with partners to share updates, insights, and opportunities for collaboration.   Program Coordination:   Design and manage partner programs, including joint marketing campaigns, co-branded initiatives, and product integrations.  Coordinate the execution of partnership activities, ensuring deadlines and deliverables are met.  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure successful program implementation and alignment with company objectives.   Relationship Building:   Cultivate strong relationships with partner representatives, fostering a sense of collaboration and trust.  Act as the main point of contact for partners, addressing inquiries, concerns, and requests promptly.  Regularly engage with partners to understand their needs and identify opportunities for mutual growth.   Performance Tracking and Reporting:   Monitor the progress and success of partner programs, tracking key performance metrics and outcomes.  Analyze data to identify trends, insights, and areas for improvement in partnership initiatives.  Generate comprehensive reports for internal stakeholders, summarizing partnership activities and impact.   Contract and Agreement Management:   Assist in the negotiation and drafting of partnership agreements, ensuring terms are clear and aligned with business objectives.  Maintain accurate records of contracts, amendments, and legal documents related to partnerships.   Market Research and Industry Insights:   Stay up-to-date with industry trends, technological advancements, and competitor activities to identify new partnership opportunities.  Share relevant market insights with internal teams to inform strategic decision-making.  Requirements:  Qualifications:   Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Technology, or related field. MBA or equivalent is a plus. Proven experience (2 years) in partnership management, business development, or related roles within the technology sector. Strong understanding of technology trends, products, and services. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal. Detail-oriented with exceptional organizational and project management abilities. Proficiency in CRM and collaboration tools. English native speaker Place of residence; Europe   Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.  Negotiation And Contract Management Experience Is Preferred.  Adaptability and willingness to take on new challenges.  Join our team as a Technology Partnership Administrator and play a vital role in shaping our collaborative ecosystem, driving innovation, and contributing to our growth in the dynamic technology landscape.
Function: Gestión y Tecnología de la información

Title: Técnico Comercial - Sector Construcción
Description: Estamos realizando un proceso de selección de un puesto de Técnico Comercial para una empresa del sector de la construcción especializada en encofrados de hormigón para la zona del campo de Gibraltar.     ¿QUÉ SE OFRECE?     Contrato indefinido Incorporación inmediata a una empresa internacional líder en el sector Salario fijo + variable entre 30.000 - 50.000 euros brutos anuales en función de la experiencia aportada por el candidato/a Pago del kilometraje a 0,30 € / kilómetro Horario flexible y teletrabajo     ¿QUÉ FUNCIONES REALIZARÁS? Búsqueda de soluciones y asesoramiento técnico ante las necesidades del cliente. Asegurar la aplicación de los procesos de aprobación de ofertas comerciales. Gestión de estrategia comercial: negociación de propuestas comerciales y cierre de ventas.     ¿QUÉ REQUISITOS DEBES CUMPLIR?     Experiencia comercial Disponibilidad para viajar por la zona Formación como Ingeniero Técnico, Arquitecto, formación profesional o similar. Coche propio Valorable conocimientos de AutoCAD

Title: Especialista en Marketing Digital
Description: Somos The Cornerstone Talent, una empresa joven gestionada por personas apasionadas por los recursos humanos y que cuentan con una amplia experiencia en selección de personal tanto a nivel nacional como internacional.     Nuestro core de negocio se basa en la búsqueda de talento a través del headhunting y selección de profesionales mediante diferentes herramientas tecnológicas punteras. Requisitos:     Experiencia en marketing digital enfocada a redes sociales, sobre todo con LinkedIn. Buena capacidad de Comunicación, fluidez en el lenguaje Buena capacidad en la gestión del tiempo, planificación y organización Habilidades en gestión y adaptación al cambio, flexibilidad Autonomía e iniciativa Capacidad analítica Tener conocimientos en idiomas también es un plus, ya que trabajamos de manera internacional.     ¿Qué ofrecemos? Horario flexible.     ¡Y mucho, mucho más!

Title: Brand Identity Designer
Description: TOMO™ – The World Finest Luxury Water Bottle     Founded in 2020, TOMO has established itself as a leading luxury drinkware brand, which is focused on impeccable craftsmanship, outstanding design, and making the world a better place!     Calling all Brand Identity Designers! 🌟We are seeking a talented and experienced Brand Identity Designer to play a pivotal role in shaping the future of TOMO through the development of a comprehensive brand guideline aligned with our new brand strategy. In this role, you will be responsible for creating a cohesive visual identity and ensuring consistent brand messaging across all touchpoints.     Scope of Work:     Creating a new brand guideline for TOMO based on the new brand strategy.     Qualifications     Highly skilled in branding with a proven track record of developing successful brand identities Demonstrated creativity and innovation in crafting unique visual identities Previous experience working with brands of a similar style, preferably in luxury e-commerce Collaborative attitude with a strong ability to work effectively within cross-functional teams Efficient and fast execution without compromising on the quality of work Excellent communication skills to convey design rationales and concepts effectively   Kindly refrain from submitting applications through social media accounts or any other channels. Please note that we only entertain applications submitted through this platform.

Title: Business Development Representative for an SEO Agency
Description: Hello, Business Development Representatives!     My name is Benjamin and I am the CEO at Golden Web - our agency specializes in scaling Shopify brands through organic traffic and SEO. Our approach is focused on quick wins that we can leverage to quickly generate SEO results for our clients and deliver a high ROI. We primarily work with large and established Shopify brands but also support eCom stores built on WooCommerce.     We are looking to hire a motivated, Business Development Representative who is very charismatic and at the same time has very good existing SEO knowledge. We need a subject matter expert who can identify our client’s technical SEO issues and propose the best solution for them. This candidate must also be proactive in building relationships, conduct outreach to generate new sales at the same time close sales at a higher rate.     This is a full-time remote position.     Requirements     We are looking for a Business Development Representative specifically with these requirements:     Confident and excellent communication skills Has at least 3+ years of experience in sales or Business Development role Has at least 3+ years of SEO experience Has at least 3+ years of experience working in an SEO - focused Agency Has at least 2+ years of Ecommerce or Shopify experience Has experience creating and executing SEO strategies for clients Has experience with managing sales funnels, leads, and client prospects Has experience with growing revenues and hitting sales targets     Nice to Have:     Setting experience via Direct Messages     Your responsibilities will include (but are not limited to):     Doing sales calls w/ all leads Coordinating with the operations team to set up new clients for success Following up using automation & phone call if no reply after 3 email follow-ups Facebook/Linkedin outreach to everyone who liked the post, commented, and viewed the story Working with a lead gen coach - to target 5-10 big fish, and follow-up for months until they close Creating and improving existing sales resources     Benefits     Growth Opportunities/Perks:     Fully remote and flexible time schedule Potential commission structure Paid sick and vacation leaves Paid holidays Mentorship with an experienced SEO professional     This Position Is Perfect For You If…     You’re an Excellent Sales Communicator.     We do not expect you to change our customers’ minds or be a pushy sales type. You communicate information effectively while casting our clients in a favorable light. You are able to clearly get your point across and get all stakeholders aligned on a common goal.     You're an Analytical and Detailed-Oriented Problem Solver.     You have strong analytical skills and a detailed approach to problem-solving. You have sharp attention to detail and can spot inefficiencies in strategies and find creative solutions based on your analysis and observations.     You're a Self-Starter.     We're looking for someone who gets the job done and delivers on time. Ideally, you are self-directed, self-motivated, and don’t need someone to look over your shoulder or hold your hand. You have the ability to motivate yourself and be part of a motivated team in a positive way to get the results.     What we do:     Please check us out to get an understanding of the service we deliver:     https://goldenweb.net/     Our hiring process is made up of five parts, so please be aware that you will need to dedicate time for a questionnaire, a video, two 1-on-1 interviews, and a test project.     Thank you for taking the time to consider this position. I look forward to hearing from you soon!     Benjamin

Title: Front-end Developer Junior España
Description: Únete a Alegra, el lugar en donde tu talento crece y crea superpoderes.     En Alegra contamos con un equipo de más de 300 personas trabajando 100% remoto con una cultura única, prendida y dinámica que está revolucionando cómo las Pymes gestionan sus finanzas con un ecosistema de soluciones digitales en la nube disponible en más de 12 países en Latam, U.S.A, España y África y ¡vamos por más! 🚀     Justo en este 2023, celebramos 10 años de dar más tiempo y tranquilidad, y de ser un 10 como lugar para trabajar, tenemos el reto de expandirnos hacia otros países, crecer nuestras soluciones y crear nuevos productos.     Funciones del cargo     Desarrollarás soluciones para mejorar nuestros productos a nivel Latam, U.S.A, España y África, aportando no solamente código, sino también todo tu conocimiento para encontrar la mejor solución para nuestros usuarios.     Buscamos personas curiosas, sin miedo a explorar nuevas tecnologías, buenas prácticas y tendencias con capacidad para introducirlas en una plataforma que ya usan millones de usuarios.     Trabajarás usando metodologías ágiles como Scrum y buenas prácticas basadas en los modelos de sillicon valley con un equipo de ingeniería de 5 estrellas compuesto por diferentes perfiles de los que podrás aprender y crecer en lo personal y profesional.     Requerimientos del cargo     Conocimiento sólido o experiencia profesional en ReactJs. Conocimiento o experiencia con las siguientes tecnologías: Webpack, TypeScript, Npm, JWT, GraphQL y API REST. Manejo práctico del flujo de Git. Dominio de conceptos claves de Javascript, HTML5, CSS. Conocimiento o experiencia en desarrollo de Single Page Applications. Pasión por la calidad de tu código y buenas prácticas. Aprendizaje como estilo de vida. Capacidad para trabajar en equipo y en un ambiente colaborativo. Espíritu crítico y proactividad para proponer mejoras. Capacidad de escucha y comunicación. Capacidad para entender los requisitos del negocio y transformarlos en código. Nivel de inglés intermedio en lectura y escritura.     Opcionales     Condiciones     Trabajar desde donde quieras 100% remoto, haciendo lo que amas. ❤️ Una relación laboral estable y a largo plazo ❤️, ¡no freelance! Un salario competitivo. Compartir con un talento que trasciende fronteras.🗺️ Espacios para socializar y compartir gustos. 💡Un ambiente para experimentar, aprender de los errores y trabajar con autonomía pero con mucho compromiso y responsabilidad. Convertir la lectura en tu mejor aliada para aprender 📚, con acceso a plataformas educativas, cursos con certificaciones, capacitaciones y una biblioteca virtual. Cobertura en salud 🩺 y dos días de cuidado al año, adicionales a tus vacaciones. Apoyo económico para llevar tu lugar de trabajo al siguiente nivel. 💪💻 Celebrar tu cumpleaños con una cena especial 🥳. Estar en un lugar que piensa en crecer mientras tú también lo haces, que te ofrece programas de bienestar y charlas de calidad de vida. 🚀
Industry: Tecnología, información e internet y Servicios y tecnologías de la información

Title: Guía Turístico Freelance Bilingüe (Persa y Español)
Description: Descripción: ¿Eres un apasionado de conectar con personas de diferentes culturas? ¿Tienes conocimientos sólidos sobre los destinos turísticos en España y dominio de la lengua persa? ¡Únete a nosotros como guía turístico freelance y comparte la belleza y riqueza de España con nuestros visitantes persahablantes!  Responsabilidades:  Liderar grupos de turistas en recorridos por diversos lugares de interés en España. Proporcionar información detallada sobre la historia, la cultura y la arquitectura de los destinos. Asegurarse de que los visitantes tengan una experiencia enriquecedora y satisfactoria. Responder preguntas y mantener un ambiente amigable y profesional.  Requisitos:  Competencia bilingüe en persa y español. Otros idiomas son un plus. Pasión por la historia y la cultura españolas. Habilidades excepcionales de comunicación y presentación. Flexibilidad para adaptarse a horarios cambiantes según la demanda. Conocimiento de primeros auxilios y seguridad turística (preferible).  Beneficios:  Remuneración competitiva según el número de tours realizados. Oportunidad de trabajar de manera independiente y creativa. Colaboración con un equipo entusiasta y dedicado. Expansión de tus conocimientos sobre España y su diversidad cultural.  Si deseas ser parte de nuestra misión de brindar experiencias turísticas memorables, ¡esperamos recibir tu CV y carta de presentación en [correo electrónico de contacto]. No pierdas la oportunidad de compartir tus conocimientos y pasión con viajeros de todo el mundo.

Title: Digital Services Sales Executive
Description: Nuvolar is looking for a SaaS Sales Executive to join our international #NuvoFamily and become a key player in developing the company's sales strategy. Imagine being part of a fast-paced company that has roots in Spain and LATAM.     With over 14+ years experience and + as an official Salesforce partner, we're proud to say that we're experts in delivering technical solutions for a large variety of complex industries such as healthcare, food and beverage and more.     Join Nuvolar and develop complex-industry IT solutions and skyrocket your career with industry pioneers!     Why us?     At Nuvolar, we are a team of around 80 talented people devoted to developing amazing software solutions. Our people are our greatest asset and one of the key reasons Nuvolar has been certified as a GREAT PLACE TO WORK. Want to hear what our employees have to say about working here? Check out how we achieved the Great Place to Work certification     The role     As a Sales Executive, you will be responsible for selling high-value solutions and services. You will plan, facilitate and conduct complex new business negotiations. This includes deal acquisition sales for consulting and professional services.     Expected Functions / Key Results:     Understand Nuvolar's mission, vision and culture. Develop Nuvolar's Software strategic plan hand in hand with our CEO & COO. Identify new business opportunities and generating new sales using existing and potential customer networks. Managing portfolio of accounts to achieve long term success. Management of customer expectations and contract compliance, addendums and amendments. Prospecting and generating leads and building long term relationships.Implement new methodologies and reach new levels of success. Represent Nuvolar at industry events (travel might be required). Drive marketing campaigns and monitor sales metrics.     Requirements:     10+ years in IT Software sales experience. 6+ years of experience pre-sales/consulting. Deep knowledge of the IT industry, SaaS and Cloud solutions. Ability to negotiate commercial contracts and maintain competitive pricing. Strong communication and persuasive skills. Have worked at a strategic level in account or relationship management with enterprise customers. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Or Multi-tasking, organised and detail oriented who can work in fast-paced environments. Bachelor's degree in a related field. Excellent level of English and Spanish.     Apart from these, it would be a plus if you have:     Strong technical background (education and/or experience). Master (MBA or similar).     Benefits     Flexible remote work policy (you can decide if you'd like to work 100% remotely or come to our offices in Barcelona) Flexible working hours Summer schedule in July and August Career path with continuous training Time off to volunteer and support any nonprofit cause you choose Day off on your birthday! Private Health Insurance Gym allowance Phantom shares options Free languages classes     Our recruitment process     1st step: Cultural fit interview     During this face-to-face interview, we want to meet the candidate and understand the expectations regarding career plan and motivation and give the candidate an overview of the role and Nuvolar's work environment. Also laying out everything we can offer you and what you can bring to our Nuvofamily so that we can succeed together!     2nd step: Technical Interview     A discussion to better understand your skills and an introduction to the other team members to give you a better idea of Nuvolar's team culture so you can meet some potential future colleagues. ;)     Want to learn more about life at Nuvolar? Take a look at our social channels:     LinkedIn | Instagram | Glassdoor | Medium     —-     If your profile fits the position, and you are excited about becoming a Nuvolad or Nuvolady, we would love to hear from you!     Nuvolar Works is an equal-opportunity employer and will not discriminate against any applicant on the basis of age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, national origin, race, or religion.

Title: Desarrollador front-end Junior (Remoto; España)
Description: En The Wise Seeker necesitamos incorporar a desarrolladores junior.     Si te interesa formar parte de un equipo de trabajo multidisciplinar, donde poder desarrollarte y poner en práctica todos tus conocimientos, ¡te damos la oportunidad!     ¿Te apuntas?     Tareas     Formar parte de un grupo de desarrolladores     Velar por el correcto funcionamiento y desarrollo del código     Participación en las dailys     Aportación de ideas, mejoras... ¡tu opinión nos importa! ;)     Requisitos     Grado/Máster en Ingeniería Software Recién licenciado o con uno/dos años de experiencia Requisito indispensable: ¡que te guste programar! Title: Corporate Brand Manager
Description: Overview     We seek to hire a Corporate Brand Manager to join the marketing team at Everty. The role is responsible for building the Everty brand, raising awareness, improving online and offline reputation, positioning Everty as a leader, and driving growth in key markets.     Creating spaces where people unwind, work, and thrive.     Everty owns, develops and manages prestigious real estate in prime global locations around the world. Our Class-A portfolio consists of commercial, industrial, and unique hospitality properties. Join our global team and grow your career now.     Responsibilities     Increasing brand awareness for Everty through a variety of channels, including online advertising, public relations, and event sponsorship. Defining and executing annual marketing campaigns for Everty and its commercial properties. Managing the budget for each property and coordinating tactical actions in agreement with key stakeholders. Analyzing Everty's brand positioning and consumer insights. Shaping and communicating Everty's vision and mission. Implementing a corporate content strategy and tactics. Translating brand elements into plans and go-to-market strategies. Monitoring market trends, researching consumer markets, and tracking competitor activity. Developing custom marketing and advertising strategies for Everty and its commercial/industrial portfolio. Creating designs/layouts of media outlets, writing pitches and blog posts to various audiences. Managing relationships with influencer journalists or other relevant parties to ensure brand consistency across multiple channels. Focusing on finding new business leads from corporate social media sites as well as other marketing channels. Identifying and executing the promotional materials of the brand and commercial/industrial portfolio, both offline (presence in retail, brochures, sales kit, advertorials, merchandising, etc.) and online (Everty website, contents banners, newsletters, advertorials, etc.). Following up on the preparation of technical sheets for new and refurbished commercial and industrial properties in the Everty portfolio. Reviewing the brand. Developing an action plan and PR announcement. Budgeting for the marketing activities. Maintaining the SharePoint marketing and comms materials and files. Updating the naming conventions and establishing clear paths for all users to navigate easily. Collaborating in developing processes and project management procedures (e.g., researching software solutions, cooperating with the design team to create an artwork for internal procedures announcements).     Qualifications     Masters or bachelors degree in relevant field. 3 to 4 years of minimum experience in a similar role. Proven ability to communicate effectively with a variety of audiences, both verbally and in writing. Ability to work independently and as part of a team, and to adapt to changing priorities and deadlines. Ability to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively, even under pressure. Ability to think critically and creatively to develop and execute plans. Ability to work efficiently and effectively under pressure, and to meet deadlines. Experience in the real estate sector, preferably in marketing or communications. Proven ability to write and edit clear, concise, and persuasive copy in English.

Title: Engineering Manager
Description: TechBiz Global is a leading IT recruitment company. We provide IT recruitment, outstaffing, outsourcing, software development, and different consulting services with a primary focus on making our partners achieve their business goals successfully.     At TechBiz Global, we celebrate diversity and are promoting an inclusive environment. Our clients and partners are located around the world.     We are looking for an experienced Engineering Manger to join our growing technology team.     In this position you will lead two to three cross functional product teams and report directly to our CTO/CDO. Also you will provide technical direction, coaching and ongoing leadership for your teams on site in Berlin and remotely.     The Role     You Will Be Responsible For     You are an active part of the Technology Leadership team setting the technical direction, encouraging the team to innovate and invent; You lead several Team Leads as your direct reporting line towards success of their agile squads; You work together with our Product Management Team translating product and business vision into technical language; You remove obstacles, connect people, align with stakeholders, lead your team by example and measure the health of your teams; You are the focal point of contact for some of our external partners and providers - e.g. Penetration testing providers, AWS, Banks, Insurance Companies; You assure the best engineering quality, design principles and best practices are followed and considered - e.g. Clean Code, SOLID; You build and grow your engineering teams by driving the entire hiring process, coaching and mentoring; You are a key member of our technical guilds, including architecture guild, which is the place where professional assessments and approvals of new architectures are made.     Ideal Profile     You have been leading a cross functional team as Engineering manager and have experience managing managers for at least 3 years You are an experienced software engineer for 5+ years developing high performance, stable, and scalable software You can lead development from initial concept through production and understand technological concepts, as well as be hands on on some topics when needed Your engineering experience is based specially on backend and infrastructure technologies - Java and AWS You love to work with people as well as technology and know that mentoring, motivating and inspiring people creates an engaged, fun, and productive team You truly believe in and are a master of agile methodologies You recognize and promote the importance of having a good monitoring and alerting system You highly value quality of software and believe on test automation You have a strong capability and knowledge of designing, discussing and reviewing multiple types of architectures - e.g. microservices, serverless, event-driven systems     You are familiar and have experience with majority of our technological stack:     Back End: Java, Spring, Hibernate, PostgreSQL Front End: TypeScript, ReactJS, Redux, SASS Testing: Selenium, Serenity, JUnit, Mockito, Jest, Mocha Build and Deploy: Jenkins, Git, npm, Maven Infrastructure: AWS, Terraform, CloudFormation, EKS, MSK, Istio Agile Methodologies: Scrum, Kanban     What's on Offer?     Leadership Role Great work environment Work within a company with a solid track record of success
Industry: Servicios de información, Desarrollo de software y Seguros

Title: Corporate Partnership Intern - Italy
Description: If a big part of why this job offer excites you is a feeling of deep connection with our purpose, then you've come to the right place :)  Are you passionate about developing business strategies? Are you excited about creating partnerships and new business opportunities with companies to promote the company's success? Do you want to have a real impact on the emotional well-being of thousands of people? Then we want you on our team!  At TherapySide, we have a challenge set for you: to make online therapy accessible to people all over the world. There will be no shortage of challenges or opportunities for growth; we want you to grow with us, master new tools, and fully display your potential.  If this sounds like you, read on!  About Us  In one sentence, we are a digital startup with a purpose. What is it? To provide access to quality psychological support.  What does this mean? That we are not looking to help more people to grow, but to grow to help more people (it may sound weird, but for us nuances are very important).  How do we achieve this? By combining people and technology to remove the barriers that separate people from psychological support: stigma, lack of knowledge, mistrust, socioeconomic conditions, etc....  To do this, we have formed an exceptional team of people who believe that communication, data, innovation, ownership and doing things right can help to fulfill that which unites us most, our common purpose.  You are the person we are looking for if...   A strong passion for the field of mental health and an interest in innovation in the field of online psychology. Excellent communication and negotiation skills, with a flair for building and maintaining strong interpersonal relationships. Excellent research and analysis skills to identify and evaluate partnership opportunities. Ability to work independently and as part of a team, demonstrating flexibility and adaptability. Strong results orientation and ability to solve problems creatively. You have a native level of Italian and business fluency in English and/or Spanish (written and spoken). Like the idea of challenging yourself and making a real-world impact You are (very) attracted to the idea of having a real impact on society. You identify with our values   What will your day-to-day life be like?   Identify and analyze potential corporate partners that can contribute to TherapySide's mission and expand the reach of our services. Conduct market research to identify opportunities and trends in the mental health and online psychology industry. Collaborate with the corporate partnerships team to develop customised collaboration proposals and innovative solutions for potential partners. Participate in meetings and negotiations with existing and potential corporate partners to establish and maintain long-term relationships. Contribute to the development of marketing and communication strategies to promote corporate partnerships and increase TherapySide's visibility.   Our culture   We believe in the value of ideas over hierarchies. We don't like bureaucracy either: we prefer ownership and agility. We have a clear ambition: to provide access to quality emotional well-being. Passion and empathy are in our DNA We are convinced that a good work-life balance drives high productivity: quality rather than quantity. We embrace diversity, we really do (+7 nationalities and +50% women)   What do we offer?   Hybrid location policy (also open to fully remote candidates) Flexible schedule Unlimited access to therapy Health insurance Opportunities for professional growth and development in a constantly evolving company A young, dynamic, creative and collaborative work environment where your ideas and talent will be valued and appreciated Friday snacks and drinks together at the office   En Therapyside podrás encontrar mucha diversidad (diferentes orígenes, formación, experiencia, intereses, etc.), pero algo que nos une es una mentalidad curiosa, el afán de superación y, sobre todo, el compromiso con tener un impacto positivo en nuestra sociedad  Estamos en continuo crecimiento, por lo que buscamos personas con iniciativa que nos ayuden a mejorar y también a disfrutar del camino

Title: Social Media & Content Manager
Description: At SWATI, we celebrate style and beauty in all its forms. Not only do we provide our customers with exceptional beauty solutions, but we encourage people to express who they are. As an official partner of Sephora, Douglas, Kicks, and Nykaa, we are proud to offer our products to people all over the world, including over a million followers on our platforms.     We are a Swedish-based company with Scandinavian values. Equality, empowerment, and self-expression are at the heart of everything we do — and you are a part of it. When it comes to our team, we follow through on our mission. That’s why we work so hard to foster a work environment that is truly exceptional. As a team, we value collaboration, creativity, and growth. As part of SWATI, you’ll be joining a place where your ideas are valued, your voice is heard, and your contributions have a real impact.     About The Role     The Social Media & Content Manager at SWATI is responsible for creating, curating, and executing compelling social media and content creation strategies, with a specific focus on our beauty solutions and cosmetics. This position requires a combination of creativity, analytical thinking, meticulous planning, and flawless execution as it pertains to all of SWATI’s social media and content management.     The Social Media & Content Manager will oversee the management of social media assets across platforms such as Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube while working closely with the founder, Swati Verma, and internal design teams to create captivating content that aligns with SWATI’s brand identity.     Responsibilities generally include creating and publishing SWATI’s content manually or using a scheduling tool (such as Later.com), compiling reports on the results of our social media and content creation efforts, managing our brand’s online presence and communities, providing analytical insights, maintaining excellent organizational and time management skills, and generally working to drive SWATI’s online presence with thoughtful, trendy, and engaging content for our customers.     General Responsibilities     The responsibilities of our Social Media & Content Manager include, but are not limited to:     Managing and optimizing SWATI’s yearly content calendar for social media and our websites Managing all our social media marketing campaigns, including planning, execution, tracking of results, and providing regular reports on the outcomes of marketing campaigns Taking responsibility for the profitable growth and sales strategies for social media marketing Consistently and effectively using scheduling and organizational tools to ensure that social media and related content are published on time and accessible on platforms used by our customers Maintaining a deep understanding of SWATI’s content calendar and social media presence to ensure that relevant content is posted at appropriate times Ensuring that all our social media accounts are functioning optimally Using a guerilla warfare marketing style on our social media platform to ensure that we regularly publish fast-moving, dynamic, trendy, and highly relevant content Continuously working to find the right content and publish it in engaging ways to the right audiences on the right platform to increase SWATI’s brand awareness Managing and optimizing SWATI’s social media assets across platforms such as Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube (not an exhaustive list) Working to arrange photoshoots and other creative initiatives to generate content (including using AI and SWATI’s voiceovers to make content more engaging) Working closely with SWATI’s founder, Swati Verma (to manage her social media accounts), and collaborating with our content creators and IT experts Staying up to date on the social media strategies used by our competitors to generate and use insights that will improve SWATI’s social media efforts Ensuring that the social media strategies are aligned with SWATI’s brand identity Taking responsibility for managing our online communities to drive growth and engagement, while ensuring that our audience is getting the content they need Collaborating with the founder and internal design teams to create compelling, appealing content Acting as the primary point of contact for content-related matters with internal and external vendors, with high degrees of reliability and trustworthiness Driving the content idea creation and creative work with the internal design team and freelancers Analyzing and reporting on the performance of social media campaigns and content initiatives Staying up-to-date with industry trends and best practices to ensure SWATI remains at the forefront of social media marketing in the beauty and cosmetics industry     Overall, the Social Media & Content Manager will play a pivotal role in driving the success of SWATI's social media and content creation strategies (whether internal or external), contributing to the company's growth and the achievement of the company’s sales goals.     Requirements     Position specifications:     The Social Media & Content Manager position includes committing to the following:     Full-time commitment while meeting our general availability for office hours (11:00AM - 8:00PM Gulf Standard Time) Consistently maintain a record of 160 tracked hours per month Fixed-rate monthly salary paid in USD Receive contractor status after signing our non-disclosure agreement Committing to a 45-day notice period after 3 months About You:     The Social Media & Content Manager is a highly creative, analytical, detail-oriented, and possesses excellent communication skills. You possess an open-minded and creative personality and have a firm grasp of current trends and best practices when it comes to online content and user-generated content (UGC). In addition, you need to be able to fit into a fast-moving, dynamic environment with a fast workflow that requires you to know what SWATI’s competitors are doing on social media while staying on top of current trends. You should be able to manage multiple projects and platforms simultaneously, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and display strong organizational and time management skills. You should be able to work autonomously with high levels of reliability, transparency, and trust.     You should also feel comfortable working in a remote environment. Availability and consistency are highly important factors for us, so the Social Media & Content Manager should display these qualities when it comes to workload commitments and general availability during office hours.     Key Requirements:     The Social Media & Content Manager position has the following key requirements:     Any professional experience in a similar role is an advantage Any experience in the beauty and cosmetics industry is highly desirable Any previous sales experiences or professional sales skills acquired during training Working experience with Google Analytics, Klaviyo, Shopify, Slack, Google Workspace, as well as social media platforms (including Instagram, YouTube, TikTok, and Snapchat) Working experience with scheduling apps such as Later.com or similar tools for efficient social media content planning and publishing, and booking studios for coordinated content creation Ability to create, execute, and publish different types of content (such as short, dynamic and longer form content depending on the platform it will be published on) Have a good knowledge of how to use tools like ChatGPT, social media scheduling tools (such as Later.com), Photoshop, and other related tools to improve our social media content Ability to work with large social media accounts (with thousands of followers) and ensure that the content we publish has an impact on our audiences Ability to follow a dynamic workflow and take charge of a company’s entire social media strategy A deep understanding of the beauty and cosmetics industry and related social media strategies, best practices, and the day-to-day logistics of social media and content management Ability to take charge of all planning and execution as it relates to social media and other content Familiarity with working autonomously and managing your own time independently and effectively (remote work experience is a plus) Must have a stable internet connection and a laptop or PC, as well as be able to attend virtual video conferences Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. You must be fluent in English, although English doesn't have to be your native language Being open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism and improving on it, as well as giving feedback of a similar nature productively to your team Must be available and responsive during SWATI’s office hours (which are from 11:00 AM to 8:00 PM Gulf Standard Time) Must be able to consistently work full-time

Title: Profesor/a Particular - 15 a 30€/h - Trabajo de Verano
Description: Se busca profesores/as particulares para brindar clases en distintas materias a estudiantes de diferentes niveles educativos (primaria, secundaria, bachillerato o universidad).     Necesitamos profesores de:     Idiomas: inglés, francés, alemán, ruso, chino, árabe, portugués, japonés… Ciencias: matemáticas, biología, química, física, estadística, contabilidad, etc... Humanidades: literatura, filosofía, historia, etc... Ciencias sociales: derecho, sociología, psicología, pedagogía... Arte y materias artísticas: historia del arte, fotografía, dibujo, pintura, arte contemporáneo, cine y audiovisual… Tecnología: informática, diseño gráfico, dibujo técnico, photoshop, programación...      Tareas     > Evaluar el nivel de conocimiento del estudiante     > Preparar las clases según el nivel del estudiante     Requisitos     > No se requiere experiencia previa como profesor     > Compromiso con los estudiantes     Beneficios     > Flexibilidad horaria     > Posibilidad de teletrabajo / trabajo desde casa     > Salario: 15€ a 30€/hora     ¿A qué esperas para apuntarte?

Title: Sales Team Manager (relocate to New Zealand)
Description: We are currently seeking for an experienced Team Manager to manage a team of B2B Sales Representatives working alongside with our tech partners. You will need to be open to relocate to New Zealand for this role*     Key Responsibilities:  Manage, train and develop a team of B2B Sales Development Representatives. Drive overall performance & recruitment of your team. Work closely with the leadership team (EIMS and our partner's end) to develop strategic objectives to enhance your clients ROI. Contribute to any cultural events planning. Manage and create any incentives for the team. Execute sales planning tools and ideas with your team.     We offer:  OTE package of up to NZ $125,000 pa (combination of base and bonuses) Unbeatable Career progression to step up to an Operations Manager and beyond. Watch the success story of our VP of Global Operations, Claudette Fowler: https://youtu.be/ULShKbMAnnQ The choice to work on up to 12 public holidays in a year. For instances where you have selected to work on any public holidays, you will be entitled for "Days in Lieu" + "A time and a half pay worked on that specific day"     **If/ Once successful, you will be required to complete your training remotely before moving to New Zealand. Relocation costs will be covered by EIMS.     Feel free to also check out our EIMS Instagram page "eimsbiz" to experience and dive into the culture we have in each our offices around the world!     To be successful, you will need  2+ years of directly leading teams of Lead generation/ B2B sales development reps or similar. Strong written & communications skills in English. Proven skills in Coaching, Training & Development a team.     How to apply?  To learn more, please contact me directly via LinkedIn or submit your CV via our job ad, or www.eims.biz/careers.
Industry: Servicios de TI y consultoría de TI

Title: Back-end Developer Junior España
Description: Únete a Alegra, el lugar en donde tu talento crece y crea superpoderes.     En Alegra contamos con un equipo de más de 300 personas trabajando 100% remoto con una cultura única, prendida y dinámica que está revolucionando cómo las Pymes gestionan sus finanzas con un ecosistema de soluciones digitales en la nube disponible en más de 12 países en Latam, U.S.A, España y África y ¡vamos por más! 🚀     Justo en este 2023, celebramos 10 años de dar más tiempo y tranquilidad, y de ser un 10 como lugar para trabajar, tenemos el reto de expandirnos hacia otros países, crecer nuestras soluciones y crear nuevos productos.     Funciones del cargo     Desarrollarás soluciones para mejorar nuestros productos a nivel Latam, U.S.A, España y África, aportando no solamente código, sino también todo tu conocimiento para encontrar la mejor solución para nuestros usuarios.     Buscamos personas curiosas, sin miedo a explorar nuevas tecnologías, buenas prácticas y tendencias con capacidad para introducirlas en una plataforma que ya usan millones de usuarios.     Contribuirás en el desarrollo de la arquitectura interna de nuestras aplicaciones vinculado a todo el contenido (formularios, mapas, bases de datos, etc.). Analizando problemas complejos y encontrando soluciones innovadoras. Esperamos que te anticipes a posibles problemas que puedan surgir en la integración de elementos, diseñando todas las soluciones necesarias para que el usuario final no tenga ningún inconveniente al utilizarlas y una comunicación constante con tu equipo y áreas implicadas en el proyecto.     Trabajarás usando metodologías ágiles como Scrum y buenas prácticas basadas en los modelos de Sillicon Valley con un equipo de ingeniería de 5 estrellas compuesto por diferentes perfiles de los que podrás aprender y crecer en lo personal y profesional.     Requerimientos del cargo     Conocimiento y experiencia trabajando con PHP y Framework como Laravel. Experiencia en el desarrollo de Web Services y diseño de APIs REST. Experiencia y conocimiento en la configuración y utilizaciones de contenedores Docker y patrones de diseño. Experiencia con el uso de bases de datos relacionales. Apliques y tengas claro los conceptos claves de MySql, PHP y Microservicios. Pasión por la calidad de tu código y buenas prácticas Aprendizaje como estilo de vida. Capacidad para trabajar en equipo y en un ambiente colaborativo Espíritu crítico y proactividad para proponer mejoras. Capacidad de escucha y comunicación. Capacidad para entender los requisitos del negocio y transformarlos en código. Nivel de inglés intermedio en lectura y escritura.     Opcionales     Condiciones     Trabajar desde donde quieras 100% remoto, haciendo lo que amas. ❤️ Una relación laboral estable y a largo plazo ❤️, ¡no freelance! Un salario competitivo. Compartir con un talento que trasciende fronteras.🗺️ Espacios para socializar y compartir gustos. 💡Un ambiente para experimentar, aprender de los errores y trabajar con autonomía pero con mucho compromiso y responsabilidad. Convertir la lectura en tu mejor aliada para aprender 📚, con acceso a plataformas educativas, cursos con certificaciones, capacitaciones y una biblioteca virtual. Cobertura en salud 🩺 y dos días de cuidado al año, adicionales a tus vacaciones. Apoyo económico para llevar tu lugar de trabajo al siguiente nivel. 💪💻 Celebrar tu cumpleaños con una cena especial 🥳. Estar en un lugar que piensa en crecer mientras tú también lo haces, que te ofrece programas de bienestar y charlas de calidad de vida.
Industry: Tecnología, información e internet y Servicios y tecnologías de la información

Title: AV Technician - Freelance -Barcelona
Description: Since 2008, Crunchy Tech has been on a mission to transform the way businesses activate their physical spaces to reach customers and drive collaboration. Today, our award-winning, full-service model has helped more than 500 clients design, implement, scale, and manage high-performance audiovisual experiences from the front lobby to the back office and everywhere in between.     PURPOSE OF POSITION:     We are currently sourcing new AV contractors in your area and would love to add you to our list for new installations and/or service calls. If you are interested, please fill out the form below so we can add you into resource view for our project managers and they will reach out when there is an open AV installation or support call in your area.     Contractors could be asked to set up and install equipment such as:     Sound speakers, Microphones. Amplifiers Electric & non electric video projection screens, Projectors Video monitors Recording equipment Running, terminating, testing & connecting wires and cables Sound and mixing boards for events and functions such as concerts, sports events, meetings, conventions & presentations Control Systems, i.e. Crestron Digital Signal Processing, i.e. Peavey Media Matrix, BSS Soundweb, Rane Video Distribution, i.e. HD over IP, AV over Cat5, HDBaseT Set up and wire racks. Monitor sound feeds to ensure quality. Ensure equipment is installed according to designated layout, i.e. PDF and DWG plans & callouts. Test and resolve equipment issues. Diagnose and correct media system problems. Coordinate audio feeds with television images. Send in equipment for repairs as needed. Switch video input sources from one source to another. Clean audio and video equipment and store properly.     Requirements     To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.     EXPERIENCE:     Experience in Audio Video hardware, software, network troubleshooting, basic to intermediate operating system functionality or equivalent training and/or education is necessary. Operating systems include: Windows, OS X, iOS & Android. This position also requires basic to intermediate functionality or equivalent training and/or education in Control Systems and Digital Signal Processing including but not limited to: Crestron Control Systems, QSC, BSS, and other Processing. Certifications held in any of the aforementioned systems will be highly regarded.     COMMUNICATION SKILLS:     Customer interactions must be handled with diplomacy and tact. Individual must be able to gauge the customers technical abilty and communicate with them in appropriate technical or non-technical language in a non-condescending manner.     DECISION MAKING/JUDGEMENT:     This position involves projects and/or assignments requiring considerable decision-making authority regarding procedures, plans, and schedules. Although there are sometimes problem-solving guidelines for particular problems, there may be no existing procedures or instructions for those problems. The technician may be on their own in solving problems and determining satisfactory solutions. Ability to work independently and in a team setting is imperative.
Industry: Servicios de TI y consultoría de TI

Title: Book Cover Illustrator (Europe)
Description: Tales is creating a modern publishing platform. We connect writers to data, upgrade their monetization, and give them the tools to create books, games, comics, and more. Join us and together we’ll connect storytellers with consumers, cut out the gatekeepers, and build the next Netflix powered by creators in the process.  Here are some of the things you may be helping the executive team with:  Creating book covers for our top stories Upleveling static and video assets to be used in our asset library. Composing graphics to introduce new features, events, and storytellers at Tales.   We're looking for individuals with:  Must be a master in Photoshop with exceptional painting skills. Strong sense of color, dramatic lighting, layout, and graphical design. Can sketch unique concepts and render them with a high level of finish. Ability to combine assets using photo-bashing techniques. Artistic and creative sensibilities to be your own art director.   You might be the right one if:  You learn faster than others, you’re tenacious, and you will always figure out a way to deliver. “Not in my job description” is not in your vocabulary. Obstacles are simply learning opportunities and failure is always on the path to progress. You have flawless, native English ability.  We're looking for a special individual to invest in a long-term relationship with.
