In addition, you need to be able to fit into a fast-moving, dynamic environment with a fast workflow that requires you to know what SWATI’s competitors are doing on social media while staying on top of current trends. You should be able to manage multiple projects and platforms simultaneously, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and display strong organizational and time management skills. You should be able to work autonomously with high levels of reliability, transparency, and trust.     You should also feel comfortable working in a remote environment. Availability and consistency are highly important factors for us, so the Social Media & Content Manager should display these qualities when it comes to workload commitments and general availability during office hours.     Key Requirements:     The Social Media & Content Manager position has the following key requirements:     Any professional experience in a similar role is an advantage Any experience in the beauty and cosmetics industry is highly desirable Any previous sales experiences or professional sales skills acquired during training Working experience with Google Analytics, Klaviyo, Shopify, Slack, Google Workspace, as well as social media platforms (including Instagram, YouTube, TikTok, and Snapchat) Working experience with scheduling apps such as Later.com or similar tools for efficient social media content planning and publishing, and booking studios for coordinated content creation Ability to create, execute, and publish different types of content (such as short, dynamic and longer form content depending on the platform it will be published on) Have a good knowledge of how to use tools like ChatGPT, social media scheduling tools (such as Later.com), Photoshop, and other related tools to improve our social media content Ability to work with large social media accounts (with thousands of followers) and ensure that the content we publish has an impact on our audiences Ability to follow a dynamic workflow and take charge of a company’s entire social media strategy A deep understanding of the beauty and cosmetics industry and related social media strategies, best practices, and the day-to-day logistics of social media and content management Ability to take charge of all planning and execution as it relates to social media and other content Familiarity with working autonomously and managing your own time independently and effectively (remote work experience is a plus) Must have a stable internet connection and a laptop or PC, as well as be able to attend virtual video conferences Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. You must be fluent in English, although English doesn't have to be your native language Being open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism and improving on it, as well as giving feedback of a similar nature productively to your team Must be available and responsive during SWATI’s office hours (which are from 11:00 AM to 8:00 PM Gulf Standard Time) Must be able to consistently work full-time

Title: Account Manager (relocate to New Zealand)
Description: We are currently seeking for an experienced Account Manager to manage the relationship between EIMS and our tech clients. You will need to be open to relocate to New Zealand for this role*     Key Responsibilities     Key point of contact between the client and EIMS. Manage a portfolio of technology clients with a total revenue of up to $3M/year across multiple clients (1 to 3 key clients). Delivering B2B lead generation and end - to - end sales campaigns across the tech space. Lead sales and alignment meetings between EIMS and our clients to ensure ROI optimisation. Review operational data and make strategic decisions about campaign direction. Delivery of Quarterly Business Reviews Seek opportunities for growing the accounts and revenue by selling additional services and/or entering new FOPs     Steep progression to Senior Account Manager & Client Services Director (managing a team of Account Managers) within 1-3 years! Watch Claudette's story here:  https://youtu.be/ULShKbMAnnQ     To be successful, you will need     2+ years’ as Account Manager, where your role was to directly manage at least 2 key clients. 2+ years' utilising the following skills: Commercial acronym, delivering complex commercial messages, negotiation skills, quarterly business reviews, running sales and marketing campaigns across the tech space. Able to relocate or have the intention to relocate to Auckland, New Zealand for this role.     **If/ Once successful, you will be required to complete your training remotely before moving to New Zealand. Relocation costs will be covered by EIMS.     To learn more, please contact Minyi (mywong@eims.biz) or apply directly here!
Function: Gestión y Tecnología de la información
Industry: Servicios de TI y consultoría de TI

Title: Security Guard
Description: The Security Guard is responsible for the control of entry to the ship during Gangway Operations and the screening process as described in the Security Manual in SQM. Actual times to be detailed by ships routines.     The Security Guard will patrol the ship during the night time hours and implement the Master’s Rules and Regulations. He/she is under the supervision of the Watch keeping Officer while acting as a Response Guard or while on the ship's safety rounds. The Chief Officer Safety and/or Security Officer/Deputy Security Officer and Security Supervisor will be on call to assist him/her should an  occasion arise.  QUALIFICATIONS  Candidates are required to have four (4) years experience in at least one of the following areas; Army /Maritime/Aviation/Police or Hotel Security environment. The Security Guard should have experience in physical security with special emphasis on access control, security screening methods, security screening equipment operation and training ability (x-ray, metal detector, explosives/narcotics detection). The Security Guard must have the ability to operate in a multinational environment. Organizational skills combined with literacy and basic knowledge of computers is preferred for this position. He will hold the STCW 95 required Basic Safety Training. They will be thoroughly versed in, and familiar with, the operation and handling of all related security screening and emergency equipment used on board the ship. He should have prior knowledge  of the ISPS code.  LANGUAGE REQUIREMENTS  Ability to speak English clearly, distinctly and cordially with guests. Ability to read and write English in order to understand and interpret written procedures. This includes the ability to give and receive instructions in written and verbal forms and to effectively present information and respond to questions from guests, supervisors and co-workers. Ability to speak additional languages such as Spanish, French, Italian, Portuguese, German or any other language is preferred.

Title: Growth Marketing Manager - Spain
Description: Join The Team Redefining How The World Experiences Design.     Hey, g'day, mabuhay, kia ora,你好, hallo, vítejte!     Thanks for stopping by. We know job hunting can be a little time consuming and you're probably keen to find out what's on offer, so we'll get straight to the point.     What You’d Be Doing In This Role     As Canva scales change continues to be part of our DNA. But we like to think that's all part of the fun. So this will give you the flavour of the type of things you'll be working on when you start, but this will likely evolve.     About The Team     Canva’s International Marketing group is a diverse and distributed team of marketers who drive user growth, brand awareness, and affinity in our 13 priority markets. In this position, you will report to the Head of Marketing for Europe and will partner closely with leads across the Intl group as well as the central Growth Marketing (GroMar), Brand, Organic Social & Content, Product Growth, PR, and Creative to build and implement a comprehensive growth marketing strategy for Spain across paid and some organic channels.     What We're Looking For     We are looking for someone who lives and breathes growth marketing and has first-hand experience in high-growth tech companies in Spain.     You will be enthusiastic about user acquisition through leveraging marketing channels - with strong experience in Paid Social (Facebook, YouTube) and Ad Creatives. You will bring a deep understanding of the market gained through first-hand experience and a local professional network. This role will cover a wide range of responsibilities - building strategy, leading execution, collaborating with multi-channel teams, and reporting on progress. You will ultimately own Spain’s key growth metrics (primarily MAUs) and strong contribution to revenue and profitability goals.     We move fast here at Canva, and in this role, we are looking for someone who takes initiative and loves nothing more than to create a measurable impact and get work done. You will be enthusiastic about embracing the different opportunities & challenges that come with working across hypergrowth, global company. You’re who we want to be working with if you’re great at strategizing, juggling projects (and moving them rapidly along), and collaborating across functions and timezones.     About The Role     Strategy - Build and constantly iterate on the country's growth strategy based on local market insights Be the market expert for Canva - Be the country expert and primary point of contact for all growth marketing activities in the country. Collaboration - Collaborate with the central marketing and product teams for all growth activities relating to the country Goal setting & measurement - Set short and long-term goals, measure success, report and iterate across marketing channels to ensure incremental growth. Create an impact - Ensure that the country-level goals are achieved within the defined budgets and guardrails Share our wins & learnings - Communicate accurate and timely weekly reports on the performance of your marketing initiatives to the global team & other stakeholders. Be a team player - Involvement with other global marketing and growth activities as needed.     About You     6+ years of experience as a growth marketer with exposure to both paid and organic channels. Strong experience of strategising, building, optimising and scaling Paid Social (Facebook, YouTube, TikTok etc.) and Ad Creatives. Deep understanding of the Spanish market through first-hand experience in high-growth consumer-focused technology companies preferably in the technology space. Comfort in leading a multi-channel growth strategy and marketing plan across paid marketing, organic social, brand, partnerships, PR, lifecycle, affiliate, and product growth. Deep understanding of the fundamentals of multi-channel marketing: ROAS, payback model, incrementality, retention, attribution, etc. Ability to make decisions under ambiguity with an experimental and learning mindset. Experience in working cross-functionally and effectively with multiple partners in different time zones. Skills and experience in planning and managing budgets of $1M+ in an efficient and productive manner with a focus on key priorities and spending principles. A strong desire to execute, drive impact and demonstrate urgency with projects big and small. A self-leader who can work independently in a fast-changing environment with evolving priorities while multiple teams rely on you. Full proficiency in Spanish is required for this position.     What's in it for you?     Achieving our crazy big goals motivates us to work hard - and we do - but you'll experience lots of moments of magic, connectivity and fun woven throughout life at Canva, too. We also offer a stack of benefits to set you up for every success in and outside of work.     Here's a Taste Of What's On Offer     Equity packages - we want our success to be yours too Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents & carers An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance to support your wellbeing, social connection, office setup & more Flexible leave options that empower you to be a force for good, take time to recharge and supports you personally     Check out lifeatcanva.com for more info.     Other Stuff To Know     We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.     Please note that interviews are conducted virtually.

Title: Analista bancario
Description: Malthus Darwin es una empresa de Consultoría, especializada en la búsqueda, selección y evaluación de perfiles IT. Nuestro principal objetivo es proporcionar los mejores recursos humanos a nuestros clientes con la mayor rapidez y la máxima eficacia ofreciendo siempre un servicio de calidad.     Actualmente precisamos incorporar un perfil de Analista funcional Banca para trabajar en sector bancario. Se trata de un perfil mixto (técnio y funcional).     Jornada completa, contrato indefinido. 100% teletrabajo.     REQUISITOS:  Se necesita tener experiencia en Riesgo de Admisión pero también en Delivery Inglés B2 o superior Conocimientos técnicos y funcionales        *Rango salarial: 28.000€ brutos anuales     Si quieres afrontar un nuevo reto laboral y tu perfil encaja con el puesto, envía tu solicitud y te contactaremos!     O si lo prefieres, escríbeme a ccontreras@malthusdarwin.es.
